row.Sentences: My MBP 2010 has come back to life!!
It slowed down to a crawl with Yosemite but El Capitan is responsive and snappy with every click.
Anyone with an older computer should upgrade especially if you are running Maverick or Yosemite which are just dreadfully slow compared to the the current version.
Best OSX in terms of speed since Snow Leopard.

row.Title: Dont take the slow road to OS X

row.Sentences: I must concur after being a mac fan for many years, this latest upgrade has ground my old iMac to a crawl - emails take 5 minutes to load or send, safari is much slower, itunes and photos are just painful to work with from a speed point of view.
If you can avoid this version until they address the issue, please do so.
PS I normally dont leave comments so it shows I am really frustrated.
Clean Installed on my early 2009 macbook after putting in a new hard drive and upgrading RAM.
Seems to run great, no issues.
Also downloaded the new microsoft office and have had no glitches, smooth sailing.
Initial loading time isn't mind-blowing given my ancient laptop, but I'm very pleased with the performance.
Certainly a lot better than my old ailing HDD with snow leopard was.
I've been trying to download this for the past two days (because Australian internet isnt that good) and when it finally finished downloading this morning, it said that it had failed.
So I went to the app store to try and continue it but it just started again from the start!
How do I fix this because at the moment im stuck on Mavericks and am having some issues on it that seem to be fixed in El Capitan, which I cant get to.
I dont fancy trying to spend another two days to re download it unless I know for sure its going to work so if anyone could help me out that would be great!
FYI im running on a iMac 27inch late 2009, Mavericks 10.9.5

row.Title: worth it after a lengthy download

row.Sentences: I have a 2011 MacBook Pro which was running snow leaopard and I finally took the plunge to do a full system update.
Previous running systems received very poor reviews and I was a little nervous about this.
But it actually is a GREAT upgrade!
Whilst some people have complained about the massive speed change (being much slower) I have not experienced this!
I can definately recommond this upgrade, especially if you have been a little lazy and haven't done a system upgrade in a while.
My external hard drive is compatible with mac software and I had to purchase a new one because my old one wasn't.
This new hard drive worked perfectly with the old OS but right after I updated to El Capitan, it stopped working and I can't write to it anymore!
I can't be expected to purchase a new external hard drive every time I update my mac.

row.Title: It is Alright
row.Topic: Download, Feature, Installation, Mail, Performance, Safari, Speed, Spotlight

row.Sentences: It is an amazing update with great features that everything much easier like Split View,Window Management and new multi touch gestures like swiping to delete in the notes or mail application with some design improvements like the overhaul in the notes app making it look like IOS 9 which also adds more powerful text-processing capabilities like in the Reminders Application.

The Wifi Connection On my computer has improved by a great deal after getting this update because before on Yosemite the wifi kept randomly graying out every time and my computer was always crashing but this update improved it alot.
My Computer Was Really Fast when i first got into my mac after this update finished installing it was the fastest it has ever been since Mountain Lion.
The New San Francisco Font also looks really good because it is so much more readable than Helvetica Neue on Yosemite so reading things like articles on webpages has been much easier.
I noticed a massive improvement in performance while playing games and it improves the capabilities of GPGPU programming by introducing compute shaders.
I really like it that in the apple maps app it shows public transit information like in IOS 9 which was what Yosemite Lacked.
It is very cool that safari lets users pin tabs for frequently accessed websites to the tab bar like in Firefox and Google Chrome whilst also being able to mute tabs playing audio.
Spotlight also is alot more useful than before as it is more intelligent with more contextual information such as the weather,stocks, news and sports scores.
I like it that it is able to process queries in natural language.
This Update Turned my Mid 2012 13 Inch Macbook Pro into an awesome machine.

But this update is by no means perfect as i ran into alot of problems as well as installing this update was a pain because it took so long to install i was really frustrated with how long it took to even download from the app store i had to start all over again then when i finally got to the install screen it was stuck then after i shut it down and restarted it just froze and shut down again then i had to wipe my computer and downgrade back to lion then reinstall el capitan which took 12 hours till it finally installed and then once i set it up i noticed i was still crashing alot.
It Takes a really long time to open apps and the internet browser constantly freezes every time and i have had to restart my compuer every day because of this.
Email doesn't display properly.
This Update is not very stable either and the download size of this update is way too big 6 GB i highly recommend that Apple doesn't make the upgrades take up lots of space..
If you're still on 10.9 stay there - El Cap is still buggy as of 27Nov and as usual Apple seem to have released it before it was ready for prime time.
Problems range from not being able to delete emails from a IMAP inbox, to extremely flakey dictation results, to removal of functionality when previewing groups of images in Finder.
As a graphic designer, I need my MAC, I can't afford to have it in the shop because I stupidly decided to upgrade the system.
I heard and read horrific things about this update, so avoided it until I couldn't resisit anymore - it's the best thing I ever did - thanks so much, I am so pleased I upgraded, cheers to that!
First download to so called upgrade resulted in my MacBookPro8.2 being unable to connect to the internet for longer than sub minute times.
The Apple advice to alleviate this was exceedingly long and complicated so I sought to use my time machine to 8 or so days before when there were no such problems with Yosemite.
The system would not allow it and 4 full days were lost trying to reload my computer from my fastidious back ups.

Ultimately I had to start from scratch and of course El Corporal as I see it works EXCEPT MY 1.1 TB OF ITUNES MUSIC AND MEDIA HAS TO BE HAND LOADED AND WHERE ARE MY RATINGS FOR HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF SONGS!??
ABSOLUTELY LIVERED!!!!!

row.Title: is there a zero star rating option?

row.Sentences: Sorry Apple, but you have really dropped the ball on this release.
Upgraded to El-Capitan from Yosemite on the latest 15" MacBook Pro.
Being a DJ and producer, I rely on my Mac for a lot of my production and as a part of my live performance settup.
After upgrade, none of my midi controllers were working with my software (Traktor/Ableton/Maschine).
Had to downgrade to Yosemite and reinstall each and every single one of my software.
After reading this update had improved performance for other people's old Macbook Pros, I upgraded.. and was pleasantly surprised!
Where before I could hardly use the thing, this has made it work almost as well as when I first bought it.
Thanks Apple!..
For the love of god don't go back to creating new OSs which slow down old machines/devices.
That reason alone made me switch from iphone to android.... and almost mac to PC.

row.Title: Now my Mac crashes 20 - 30 times a day!

row.Sentences: Frustrating to say the least.
Constantly crashing and I've never had that problem before this install.
I like to stream music and videos from my Mac to my Apple TV, but due to all the crashes, it's not worth my while persisting.
I've been all Apple for five years now, but am seriously going back to Microsoft when my Mac needs to be replaced.
so i upgraded to el capitan and so many things stop working or dont work properly effecting my business and my earnings.
what ive lost in a week could've paid for another computer.
my external HDD automatically became NTFS out of only apple know what.
my video editing programs like Davinci Resolve stopped working properly and keep crashing.
overall, my FCP X rendering time for the same length clip in the same video codec doubled.the computer initially coudnt even locate the nvidia graphics card and did so after manual configuration.
I am ready to bite the bullet and buy a powerful PC.
I think gone are the days of great Macs.
they left with Steve.... whoever is running the show now is utterly useless.

row.Title: Don't play Russian roulette with your Mac!

row.Sentences: The evidence is in: clearly it works for some.
For others like me, it's been diabolical!
I have a late 2012 iMac.
It's always been a pleasure to use - not a single problem with any Apple upgrade.
So, with confidence, I jumped right in to El Capitan.
Disaster would be an understatement!
El Capitan has rendered my iMac a lemon - there are far too many problems to list here.
I've spent hours implementing all the recommended fixes.
Extremely frustrating as I use this iMac for work.
For what it's worth, here's my suggestion: wait until Apple release a few more patches.
They are planning to do that aren't they?
Apart from the good features, the updates and fixes since the first version were worth waiting for.
I'd now recommend updgrading to El Capitan.

row.Title: Total frustration - Had to go back to Yosemite

row.Sentences: Both my Macbook Air (brand new Nov 2015) and my 1 year old Mac Book Pro retina went to less then 3 hours on battery.
Plus many programs, Evernote worst, started using constant high CPU utilisation.
The office (brand new) iMac 27-inch 5K Retina is constantly showing the colour wheel and has to be hard reset at least 4 times a day.
We are stuck with this as it can't be downgraded to Yosemite.
DO NOT UPGRADE best to wait and see if Apple can fix these issues.
-Very intelligent engineering (of course, it takes a bit of time to get used to it)-Excellent for multi device integration -Turned my 2012 Mac Pro (desktop) into an awesome machine
The download interupted twice, but evenyually completed.
When the extended loading process had finished I found Mail no longer worked.
Searching the Web, I found a page which had been put up by Apple giving complex instructions as to how to recover from the, apparently, not infrequent failure.
This did not work despite following the instructions.
Good job there is Thunderbird.
So far I have not come across any feature which I regard as being an improvement.
Perhaps there is some convergence with IOS, but that isn't relevant to my interests.
The overall impact is that having degraded my iMac, I will not be installing it on my MacBook Pro.
It is hard to see how Apple will feature in my long term plans
After the initial hype had calmed down i decided to update from Yosamite to El Crapitan ( No i didn't spell it wrong ).
What a mistake.... why release a OS with still so many bugs.
Since i upgraded to this OS there has been so many issues i had to work around with the biggest being the freezing for no apparent reason.

It happens anytime it feels like it........ just stops ..... especially when video is involved - Watch a movie ...... freezes ..... edit a movie........ freezes......... use photoshop ........ freezes, the freezing usually happens around 10-15mins into using an app.
Now i have to figure out how to downgrade back to Yosamite.
Thanks Apple i moved over to a Mac to get away from this sort of rubish from Microsoft.
After upgraded the OS is very slow, wast my lot of time.
and can't move the files frome iMac to USB connected Hard disk.
I have a 2010 MacBook Pro and this has been the smoothes installation since snow leopard.
I love it I am once again so happy with the way my apple mac runs.
Mavericks and Mountain lion weren't too bad and I must admit I feared upgrading since yosmite was a disaster for me.
But El Capitan has brought apple back to 1st for computer technology.
Thanks to the team at Apple.
Steve Jobs would be proud of you on this one!!!!

row.Title: Did Apple copy and pasted Windows Vista code?
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Performance, Safari

row.Sentences: What a piece of junk.
This is NOT why I use Apple products.
Now running 10.11.1 and am still having issues with Mail working properly (several issues).
Safari often stops loading (while Chrome works flawlessly)iCloud documants is a mess.
several Pages and Numbers files just refuse tp open.
But biggest annoyance, and introduced with El Capitan is that the Photos App opens uninvited everytime I insert a memory card.
If I set that card not to open Photos (setting is confusingly in both the Photos App, and Camera capture App, the setting is erased once the card is formatted in a Canon camera.
Why in 2015 I can't choose my own freaking software to open my images with.
I am a professioanla photographer and I don't like this dumbing down of software, and automating stuff for the lowest common denomintor.
Apple has become too big.
It's time for some new genius to come up with a new computer system to recapture the graphics/photo/arts/video crowd.
I had to wipe my mac and downgrade back to Yosmite.
I have a 2015 MacBook pro and it has huge issues with El Capitan.
I was unable to access my NAS, log into my router and would find myself constantly having to turn my wifi on and off again to simply get an internet connection.
Do not upgrade to el capitan till they have fixed the huge number of serious flaws.

row.Title: costly problem so far no solution

row.Sentences: after hours of downloading followed by hours trying to get my email account back up, it still will not allow me to re set my preferred mail account, fortunately I have an ipad where I can download and send my mail.
I eventually got a local computer tech to try and help via my internet provider which confirmed that the problem was with the upgrade.
So, I have to agree with others who have commented regarding mail problems after upgrade, I am just so sorry I did not read the reviews before doing the latest upgrade.
Just installed and actually opporates a little smoother than before.
Not a huge change but all good so far.
Took a while to download the 6.15 GB, then took 35 minutes to load, took forever opening iTunes for the first time.
Mail used to be pretty straight forward in Maverick.
"New message", title / subject, content, then click "Address Book".
Well guess what they took away or perhaps they hid it really well, the "Address Book".
I also think it hasn't made one bit of difference to opening or closing apps.
Why did I bother.
El Capitan still has many laps to do.
MAIL keeps crashing.
Wheel of death appears across many programs.
Need to force quit applications.
I bought a 2015 Macbook Pro primarily to record music with Garage Band.
With the new OS X, my AudioBox is now no longer compatible with the software, therefore giving me absolutely no practical use for my Mac.
I sat for about an hour receiving electric shocks and getting frustrated wondering why the hell my AudioBox was no longer being detected by my Mac.
Turns out it's El Capitan.
I haven't regretted doing something this much in a ong time.

row.Title: Most problems EVER with an Apple OS upgrade!
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Office, Performance, Safari, Speed

row.Sentences: El Capitan rendered my 2011 iMac close to useless almost immediately after installation.
(1) Microsoft Word froze and crashed ad nausea - it even changed text in a Doc to Chinese (and not back to English) for an important paper I was writing.
Seems better now, but still slow, slow, slow.
Slow to almost dead.
Also, curser can't select items in the program on occasion and I have to click the Mail icon in the dock to get it working again.
(3) Safari grinds to a halt.
Search bar works some of the time.
Other times, I have to go to Google directly and search there.
Tried clearing cookies, history, cache "but still unstable and slow, slow, slow!
(4) My printer is no longer recognised " updated driver, but to no avail.
Bought a new printer.
(4) Everything is unstable, buggy and slow!
Install at your own peril or if like to watch the spinning beach ball of doom for entertainment.
I downloaded and installed El Capitan without incident, which is always nice.
But, along with the too-frequent app crashes, El Capitan is not quicker and seems to have created more problems than it has solved.
At times it is just unusable and in the last 24 hours I've had to restart four times.
Apple has always been good at fixing problems so I look forward to an update soon.
I upgraded to El Capitan on my iMac as they say its best to update and ended up losing all my mail.
And then I had an update for iPhotos but I don't have iPhotos I have Photos and it keeps telling me to update iPhotos but when i go to update to it says its not available in Australia!!!???
Whats going on?Dont upgrade ......
When a photo app is made mandatory it is only fair that criticism of the operating system includes that compulsory app especially if it prevents you from using better software.
If you want any control of what app downloads your photographs, where you want to store them, and in what format, just forget it.
Photos is now a mandatory part of the operating system.
That would be fine if you could just easily turn it OFF, but you can't.
Don't want it to open your entire collection whenever a card reader is connected....bad luck, it is going to hog your computer until it opens or you shut it down in a forced shutdown.
If you have a large photo library, say over 100K like I do, that is going to take a long time.
All it takes is allowing a little consumer choice.
El Capitan is the Windows Vista of the fruit store I am afraid.

row.Title: Possibly the best version of OS X I've installed on my MacBook Pro

row.Sentences: I have a MacBook Pro mid-2010, and with El Capitan it runs like new.
I use this computer mainly for software development and with El Capitan everything seems to run faster.
Very happy with this upgrade.
Possibly the best since I bought this machine.

row.Title: Many issues
row.Topic: El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Safari, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I have a brand new 2015 MBP retina 13" and ever since upgrading from Yosemite I've had WiFi drop outs and sometimes it won't work at all.
Never had WiFi issues with any Macs before El Capitan.
Very unhappy and I now know to never upgrade on launch day because of bugs!
Apple has not tested this release properly, especially since my new MBP even has issues.
This WiFi issue I have reported to Apple, and better be fixed in the .2 release as I have been using the thunderbolt ethernet adaptor quite a bit since.
There are quite a few UI glitches with Finder since upgrading, come across some Safari issues (while Chrome works fine).
I have noticed randomly at times system performance will become slow, switching windows and scrolling will also become slow, then after about 15 seconds it'll be fine.
Been using Apple for over 10 years, I'm becoming worried because of these bug riddles releases (Yosemite, iOS 8, now 9 too and El Capitan!
)So I will be careful when upgrading from now on, thanks a lot Apple!
Downloaded to imac 2.7 GHz Intel Core i5.
System has slowed down to a crawl.
Takes 4 times as long to start up and programs hang for a while when opening.
Needs serious rework.
Don't see any benefits, only made things much slower.
I loved my Mac Book Pro when i got it in 2012 where i shifted from Windows.
The Amazing feel which i had in my first use is missing with the upgrade to OS X EI Capitan.

Issues i am facing:- Very slow response when i open any app from dock(lot of lag compared to older version).- connecting to itunes store is also very slow.- when i am type something in spotlight or web, there is a lag in display.
If there is way to go back to my previous version before upgrade, i would love to do.. :)ThanksPraveen
CANNOT BOOT with infinite rebooting after upgrading from either Maverick or Yosemite (2nd generation unibody 13" Macbook Pro and 1 generation before the force touched 15" Macbook Pro)
If you like seeing the wheel of death every 5 minutes then this is the operating system for you.
I cant see any reason el capitan is worth upgrading to.
Apple need to do a hefty update on it.

row.Title: Got my Mac back!!
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Speed, Yosemite

row.Sentences: Got my good ol' 2010 MacBook Pro back from its death bed!
With every release of OS X since Lion my Mac would become slower and slower, this is with formatting with every new release ensuring a clean start every time.
Yosemite was the absolute worst - every mouse click was faced with a super annoying delay that made my computer near unusuable.
Enter El Capitan.
Keeping in mind this is a 5 year old computer with a C2D processor and a traditional hard disk drive, performance is great.
Compared to Yosemeite, it's a massive improvement, I can now use my computer with accepatalbe speeds.
So Good job Apple for optimizing the system.
On the negative note I will say there hasn't been any new ground-breaking feature in any OS X release since Snow Leopard except maybe Lion which brought much needed under-the-hood improvements.
We need Apple to be bold and innovative again on the Mac side, even iOS has been boring for a few years now.
After upgrade to El Capitan my audio DAC is not able to work, no audio only the poping noise.
Hi - I've updated to this version and unfortunately the project I have been working on for the last year in i-Movie is now no longer able to be viewed.
All pictures in my timeline come up as a black screen in the preview box and if I try to export the project to a video format - Still no pictures.
Are Apple trying to fix this bug??
Happy to give more details about this issue if Apple wish to contact me.
What the hell are you FOOLS doing.
iTUNES has never been so useless - why on earth change it years ago when it was working just fine.
Some EGOTISTICAL prat wants his name on it I bet.
EL CAPITAN is making my MAC SO SLOW - and has now made my Adobe CC unworkable.
Really dumb.
Thank you, I now have to get back money because of you lot.
Mail is broken in El Capitan.
For such a critical application there is no excuse for Apple to release buggy code in mail.
Often it will not allow you to open a message although you can still select messages.
Or it won't download messsages until you restart mail.
Totally unacceptable and given it's November at the time of writing, this these sorts of issues should have been solved by now.
Apple really dropping the ball here.
Gone are the days of it "just works".
Very limited other improvements can be "seen'.
About the only useful function was the ability to update contacts through mail when it detects new contact info....that's of course when mail is actually working.
Stay clear, stay on Yosemite if mail is important to you.
It seems now that most things I will right click on now just makes the computer freeze...... Too much for a new Macbook to handle.
I should of stayed with Windows
Computer crashes all the time.
Email often doesn't display properly, and safari also crashes.
Now I'm just trying to have my TV to mirror my computer via apple TV and it just doesn't work.

row.Title: Pretty solid update, but still a few issues here and there

row.Sentences: I clean installed it on all my Macs and they run much better now.
Things still hang up occasionally and there is still a bit more polish needed.
One major issue I've noticed is that Calendar crashes when I attempt to make a new calendar.
Updated the first one, seemed ok so did my work one and my wife's etc.
update takes about an hour each so just allow for that.
Not really that much to get excited about , personally I still hate the Photos app with a over 80gb of images in one library, iPhoto did a better job of managing them and making them accessible.
Geo tagging, smart folders etc.
But release 10.11.1 is buggy as hell.
on all devices we have had multiple application crashes and having to reboot almost daily.
Also had issues with websites freezing, flash saying its not installed when it is or other apps saying they are corrupted and needing to be re downloaded from the app store.
For the lack of tangible improvement I would hold off a few more weeks before upgrading.

row.Title: Says it downloaded, but wont install

row.Sentences: Waste of 6GB download limit.
Downloaded, but wont install on my Mac Mini....what a waste!
Having downloaded 5 days I notice no discernable differance, still slow, rainbow spinning wheel appears at the opening of most Apps.
Seems like a non event upgrade?.

row.Title: Slow, Slow, Slow with beach ball feature

row.Sentences: Installed El Capitan on my MacBook Air and all was fine.
Then I made the mistake of installing it on my mid 2010 27" iMac.
Instead of greater speed and efficiency I got super slow operation and lots of frustration watching the spinning beach ball whilst nothing happened.
The biggest problem occurs when updating or upgrading software to suit the new system.
The Installer App is just about guaranteed to crash or freeze several times, requiring a full shut down, reboot and clear the parameter RAM before it will finally work.
Even simple functions like click and drag in the finder will often hang, even worse when accessing an external drive.
I have also had the system completely freeze when simply trying to save a Word document.
When trying to eject external devices such as external hard drives, USB thumb drives and SD memory cards there is usually a failure with the screen freezing except for the spinning beach ball.
Attempts to force quit should not be taken lightly as this too will cause the finder to hang.
If you have to force quit the finder because it is not responding all the top of screen menus and desktop items go missing with only the Dock reappearing.
I am finding that I have to reboot my desktop computer at least twice a day.
sometimes more, to overcome the constant freezing and hanging of functions.

row.Title: Is Mac becoming the new PC?

row.Sentences: So did the download but now have to spend hours trying to get everything back again.
Just what a busy working parent needs, more hours in front of a screen for no added value.
Completely messed with my email.
All my sent mails have gone & I need to retrieve them for work reasons.
I am so tired of fancy upgrades that are all about speed & impressive stats but show no regard for, or understanding of, the people that actually use the technology.
Two weeks on I still can't get my mail working properly.
No sent mails available or saving no matter what I try & fix grrrrrr.....
Disappointingly, I have found this OS (10.11.1) to be the worst "upgrade" I have ever downloaded from Apple.
I waited beyond the first release and installed the update rather than the first release so I expected a little better.
It is, as many users claim, very slow indeed and has lots of bugs.
It did not wreck Mail completely but not far off.
I have spent hours rebuilding mailboxes and marking unread mails from years ago as read.
Apps such as BBEdit which took seconds to load in the past now take minutes and apps such as Photoshop, never a quick thing to load, now take many many minutes.
I installed El Capitan on a mid-2011 17" MBP as a test.
It ran Mavericks and Yoesmeite just fine.
It does not run 10.110.1 very well at all.
I'm not about to run the risk on my two Mac Pros, mainly because they have a couple of 30" monitors attached and I can't work if they don't run the upgrade.
My recommendation would be to wait until the full version is out and not be a beta tester.... if you want to use your computer for work that is....
My external hard drive changes to "you can only read" status after installed it :( :(

row.Title: Canon Printer MP610 not working post El Capitan installation

row.Sentences: We have had multiple issues following the installation of El Capitan, including the much slower speed of our computer described by many others.
However, the most frustrating episode at present is we now have no access to our Canon MP610 printer as there is no bridging software/driver update from Canon or Apple.
Despite excellent support from Apple Support via phone, the final answer is to "wait until there is an update from Canon", i.e.
: the printer won't work until then!
We can uninstall El Capitan but will lose all saved information/work done since it's installation (not to mention the many hours it took to install in the first place)!!
Updated to El Capitan and after a couple of days of using a slow system, I finally got only spinning wheels.
Re-started 5 times; took hours to do this after a hard start.
Finally decided to abort and restored from Time Machine to OS X Yosemite (took 2 days).
I disabled startup apps and then used CleanMyMac 3 to clear out the junk and the system is now working again, but with some problems, particularly Microsoft Office.
I have had an Apple computer since Apple 2 and this is by far the worst update I have experienced.

row.Title: So it failed to download on my brand new Mac book pro

row.Sentences: I'm an unhappy customer as I attempted to download it twice on my Mac Book Pro which is less than a year old and it failed to download both times.
I'm feeling frustrated and annoyed.
i updated my MacBook Pro and now runs even slower.. Stop slowing down our older computers so we will buy new ones
Bad mistake upgrading, I trusted Apple with this but really disappointed.
I've got a new Macbook 8GB RAM and 500GB SSD.
Outlook 2010 constantly crashes, connecting to VPN is painfully slow and Remote Desktop is so slow that its unusable.
Don't need to do other testing as this is enough to "upgrade" back to Yosemite.
If it aint broke then don't fix it.
Haven't had any issues with installing or booting on either my Late 2011 MacBook Pro or 2009 MacBook.
Does seem "snappier' as advertised.
Love the new font.
But seems pretty standard.
System Integrity Protection won't allow old hardware to work, so beware if dependent on hardware without new drivers released.
its been 24 hours since i started the download its on 1gb fix the download time
This is a massive improvement!
Yosemite was sooo bad that it almost got to point that I did not want to use my Mac any longer.
This new operating system has returned the efficiency and speed that I experienced with previous operating systems.

row.Title: My itunes Folder will not open or respond after upgrade Ei Captinan

row.Sentences: My itunes folder is not working any more after upgrading to the lastest system unpgrade Ei Captinan ,it does open or respond at all .
All went excellence, however, every time I upgrade OSX to newer, it causes Mysql and php to stop working.
It is wasting my time get back on to life.
Broken mail app.
reconfigures the mail accounts which results in server problems.
spent hours on this issue and still not working properly.
WAIT for a fix in MAIL.
OR use another mail app or rely on webmail.

row.Title: Could not start my Mac!!!
row.Topic: Installation, N/A, Performance, Update, Windows, Yosemite

row.Sentences: This has been the MOST pain I have had with ANY update.
And it simpley does not work.
(as apple admits for some) My Mac would just not start up.
White screen and apple logo for ever.
I did install this on my MacBook air and it worked well.
But installing on my iMac was a waist of an entire day and now I restored Yosemite.
I really would wait a while before installing.
I callled Apple and they have really no answers.
If I can't even start my computer, I have a big problem.
Another Jony Ives look over function problem.
I have lost faith in apple and after this update (downgrade) I thin I have had enough.
I think Windows has won!
At least it works as much as it pains me to say that!
Overall, this is a solid update which refines a string operating system.
The improvements in practiical tools like Spotlight, Notes and Maps are useful and easy to use.
It seems that file sharing and networking with Windows computers is also much improved.

Mail works perfectly with 5 email accounts across a range of providers (this was glitchy on Yosemite) - and I've expereienced no significant 3rd party application issues (other than the MS Office problems which were fixed a cople of weeks ago).
The only continuing irritation is that "Instant Hotspot" is no longer working.
That said, there were some initial slowdowns immediately after installation due tio Spotlight reindexing the main drive.
Once this icompleted the operating system became smooth and fast.
Dont bother with this useless update.
The only thing its done for my 2015 Macbook Pro is make it slower!
Split screen is pathetic, theres really no new updates worth getting it for, i completely regret my decision.
Its an absolute piece of garbage from a comapny whose completely lost touch with its customers wants and needs.
Well done Apple you've sucked us all in again and delivered basically a virus, thats all this update is, a virus for your mac.
Overall a f*cking useless update from an out of touch company.
First install of El Capitan crashed my 2011 Macbook Pro, 2nd Install worked but now I have no access to my Gmail Imap inbox in Mail.
Had to delete my account to try reinstall and now it is telling me I can't re install the Account, as it is telling me the connection is insecure?
Possibly some kind of Keychain problem.
Seems Mail problems are widespread, well tested!

row.Title: angry
row.Topic: Download, Feature, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: Frankly I can't see the point of my having downloaded this operating system.
Everything lookes the same except the common icons have changed a little.
My computer has slowed down considerably.
I have to watch the Rainbow wheel continuously.
I have a enough hardware to run it.
I backed every thing up before the update.
Who would have guessed it would totally wipe out all my email messages 10 days later, as well as all my photos which dissapeared and them about half came back out of the ethers.
I am waiting for next glitch as I'm sure it will happen.
photos has less function than before.
I can't select multiple photos to move them to a an external file.
So I believed Apple when it said my 2009 iMac would be fine with El Capitan.
Everything is slower to respond now.
Spotlight has become useless as I can read a dictionary quicker.
I have to restart Mail on most days as it will not display the content of messages.
The one thing that I used to love about my iMac was the speed I could switch between applications but now I feel like I have gone back to using Windows.
The sooner I work out how to go back to the previous operating system the better.

row.Title: WARNING: WAIT WAIT WAIT FOR EL CAPITAN

row.Sentences: Just lost 4 days of work due to a login freeze that was unfixable....had to restore to the previous OS.
Wait until it becomes stable and the bugs are ironed out.
I have a MacBook Pro (mid 2010) with a 2.4 GHz intel core i5 processor and 4 GB memory.
This update certainly runs more efficently and smoother on this MacBook.
Yosemite was a horrible update to Mac OS X which saw a massive decrease in performance for me.
It was really laggy and it took some time to open the applications folder and other like folders.
For anybody who is running Yosemite on a newer Macbook or even an older Macbook I recommend this update because you will surely see the difference in performance.
I use this Macbook for online surfing, downloading and for steam games.
I have also seen an increase to my FPS in steam games (if anybody is wondering).
Thanks Apple for fixing the horrible OS X Yosemite to this wonderful software.

P. S: The only downside to this update was trying to intially downloading the software, the first time I tried downloading my power cut off so I lost my progress and I was stuck at "waiting' for a long time.
I decided to delete the update in my applications folder and restart.
I restarted my download and I was still at the "waiting' sign but I left my laptop open for approximately 30 minutes to 1 hour and the software was downloaded and ready to install.
lps for anybody that is having any problems with downloading the update.
freezes during install, no matter how many times I try.
Fresh install also freezes.
Rendered Outlook for Mac 2011 useless.
Microsoft and Apple have known about this since September 2015 but have done very little about it.
My _SIX_ year old iMac received this update with any problem at all.
Good to see Apple concentrating on refinement & stability in this release.

row.Title: Looking forward to the split view..BUT THEN.

row.Sentences: I was really looking forward to the split screen view (al la windows) but it is limited to apps that "allow full screen mode" so this cuts out Word, Excel, FileZilla, Photoshop etc.
Come on, if you're going to copy a feature, just copy it.
Download took well over 1hr with good internet speed.
Now my iMac feels like it's on a strong dose of morphine.
I get the 'spinning beachball of death' for nearly every action I attempt to take.
I've done about 3hrs work in my normal 12hr day.
I'm switching back to the earlier version.
There will be some problems if you install some three part software.
I been having the yosomite version since it came out.
Never had any problem with it or notice anything as I said I am not a teck guy.
So I don't notice lots of difference or change unless it is really major.
Well I gotta say this new capitan is pretty good.
Love the new look and new design.
There's no harm in trying to download this.
I'm satisfy with this new version.

row.Title: Mac runs a lot better BUT!!!

row.Sentences: Installation of this system was smooth!

My macbook pro feels like it was running smoother, which is great since it started to lag on me with the previous OS, however since upgrading to El Captian, my mac has begun freezing at random points which is then followed by shutting down?
It manages to save my work progress before shutting down, however its becoming a bit annoying?Is anyone else experience similar issues?

row.Title: Techinally? Good. User Experience? Average at best.

row.Sentences: Installed this on my MacBook Pro (about 5 years old) and have had no issues with it so far.
I did read that people were having some difficulties with it so I decided to clean up my computer before upgrading.
If that helped prevent issues that other people are having or not I am unsure but none the less it has been fine to use.
That being said the UX experience has been a little disappointing.
I was expecting a different and more pleasurable experience, however it has been quite average with very few good features.
Really hoping that with the next update we see something that it different and outside of the box.
I'm also not sure what the fuss is about?
Downloaded, installed, job done and everything just works faster.
Loving the split screen feature especially when using a 24" wide screen.
My Macbook is an early 2011 model with 16GB RAM and 250Gb SSD drive so perhaps that does help.
I simply upgraded, no new fresh install or anything and will say again, everything works great!

row.Title: Good update
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Office, Outlook, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I was too scared to upgrade to Yosemite because of all the horrible reviews, and a few people I knew had a myriad of issues.
I waited a couple of weeks after El Capitan was released to see the reviews, jumped on the bandwagon, and am pretty happy with the result!

Obviously it looks different because I was coming off Mavericks, and while I don't like the way Apple is going with their looks, especially on the iPhone, I got used to it pretty quickly and like it a lot.

There are only three "complaints" I have.... One, that to expand a window to full screen you have to use the green maximise button on the left side of the window, instead of the arrows opposite each other in the top right hand corner of the window.
I am very used to using that and it annoys me every time I change between full screen and minimize.
The second thing I noticed is that my predicted battery life if I unplug the charger at 100% is about 4.5 hours, which is a huge decrease from my previous 8-9 hours....

However, it seems to decrease more slowly when I'm doing normal things (safari, word) than before, and I'm pretty sure I've gotten a couple of hours between 60% and 40%, so I don't think the predicted battery life is accurate.
The battery goes pretty quickly in the last 15%, but it's always done that.

Lastly, I had to upgrade from Microsoft Office 2011 to 2016 to use split screens (which is INCREDIBLY handy for writing essays/lab reports with research open one side and my report on the other), but I got 2016 free through my university, and it will expire after I finish my degree.
So when I graduate I will have to buy 2016 (or the next version), or somehow downgrade to 2011.
Like I said, "complaints".... Again, I upgraded straight from Mavericks so a lot of changes I'm seeing now (like the battery life) were introduced with Yosemite and aren't new to a lot of users.
I wouldn't recommend upgrading, but only because I'm pretty cautious about these things, and the reviews have been mixed.
I don't use outlook (I had major problems with it on Mountain Lion and haven't tried since) so I can't comment on that.
Just take this as encouragement if you are going to upgrade.
It isnt compatible with my MYOB software, now I cannot send attachments automatically, a real pain.
Also Messages on my Imac are not working correctly, keeps loosing peoples names.
Another glitch some emails after reading still show up as unread, another pain.
I did a clean install from a usb stick not just an upgrade.
I am having an issue with movies not playing in iTunes, I get the spinning wheel and sometimes after a few minutes the movie starts playing.
There are a lot of comments from others in forums about the same issue with many suggestions that dont seem to work.
Rebooting, force quitting and restarting, stopping and starting download of partially downloaded movies, deleteing and redownloading - none of these have worked.
There have also been some random crashes where the machine (15" macbook retina) just reboots without warning.
So generally I would say that the features are go largely unnoticed but the issues are a problem so stay with Mavericks until apple resolve these issue in the next months.
The split view feature is great.
Needs to be compatible with more apps.
looks good though.
My Fuji Xerox printer does not work after upgrading to EI Capitan, keeps saying "printer filter failed" where before updating, everything was working perfecly fine..... please fix this issue asap!
I had no problems so far ever since I have updated to OSX EI Capitan.
My system is running nice and smooth as before.
Good job, Apple !

I have tried installing El Capitan twice now and while it does install fine and run fine initial, within a few days of the first install and a few hours of the second my Mac wont reboot and freezes at the apple logo screen and disables the front of the two USB ports.
I have had to roll back to Yosemite and will not be trying to install El Capitan again in the forseable future.
Real step backwards for me.
Mail completely stuffed up and if I was someone with less technical abilities I would have lost all of my mail back from 2010 easily.
Good thing they redesigned the beach ball as I see a lot of it now.
Computer (relatively new mac mini with 16GB of Apple RAM) slower as well.
Just as I have no where else to vent Photos is an utter utter joke.

If anyone from Apple is reading this, go ahead and think about thw workflow a pensioner or someone would need to go through to take a pictire of something on their iPhone then get the original high res version of that posted to ebay to sell an item.
It looks terrible and it is terrible in every sense, I hate it so much.
I've been raving about Apple products for years but so many things are terrible these days.
"It just works' truly needs to be abandoned as it is a falsehood.

row.Title: Do i need to buy a new mac?!??!

row.Sentences: I have a macbook OS X version 10.6.8, if i download this app will I be able to connect my iphone 6 with itunes and other programs??
As is tells me my software cannot update, so this means i cannot update the new version of itunes..
Someone please help.. Wanna know if i have to buy a new mac!!?!?!??
I installed this on my 2011 mini mac a couple of days ago and my computer is now effectively useless.
If I have 2 things open at the same time it hangs, Firefox wont work, nothing loads in anything like a reasonable time and mail crashes constantly.
The worst software I have ever installed.
I have a late 2011 macbook pro and it has been very slow on everything even with i7 processor.
I changed my hard drive to an SSD just before Yosemite came out and it improved my mac alot with mavericks still running.
Yosemite just made my computer slow again, the battery drained, my fan would sometimes just keep spinning and the battery would drain 5% in 2 minutes and it was just terrible.
I upgraded to El Capitan and hoped for a better performance and i have just recived that.
Upgrading to El Capitan was the right move.
The battery doesnt drain as fast and is 100 times better than yosemite, i see a bit of improvement of the opening of apps and speed with not much fan usage anymore (only if your playing games).
El Captian is a very good upgrade from Yosemite and highly recommend you upgrade.
I have been a MAC user for yonkers since 1987.
I always loved the "easy', non-convoluted operating system of Macintosh.
So far, I've had three iMacs and recently bought a MacBook Air.... and upgraded all the Mac OS X programs.
My disappointment began with Yosemite.
After I upgraded my iMac G5 to Yosemite, I lost most of my files in my "Mail"!
Lucky that, I always print a hard copy for my B&B business.
Otherwise, everything would be lost - KAPUTT!
I am not a computer savvy but know as much what to do to operate what I need to do.
Since Apple sends you updates of what's the latest, I oblige because they MUST know what they are doing.
Today, I have just received an update - 'OS X El Capitan'.
I thought, if this is the "newest, latest" version of OS X, it must be good!
(I NEVER LIKED YOSEMITE.
It lost some of my files that I can't recover.
One day it's there, next day, it's gone!
I don't know where and I can't afford that in my B&B business!
So, you can imagine my "thrill' to see an update "El Capitan'.
However, reading through the users' comments (while waiting completion of the updrade), majority of users are not pleased with 'El Capitan'.
So, I am not sure if I want to update.
(Mind you, I already clicked on the "download" but there was no sign of the "wheel' twirling or a "blue line' crossing the parameters (like it used to).
After half an hour, comes a box that says "Cannot connect, Try again later."
Gee, I don't think I want to upgrade to the 'El Capitan' anymore.
I agree, Apple Macintosh has lost the plot.
There's too much "upgrade" that they can't remember which ones work better that they need to maintain.
I like El Capitain and overall it seems to be a stable version of MAC OSX.
Still there are lots of annoying things happening.
First of all it corrupted lots of my images while importing with my Lexar Card Reader (changed the card reader and it was all fine).

The most annoying thing is the automatic import dialogue with Photos when you insert an CF or SD card (Please let us disable that for the Photos App .... and not on a device basis as we have hundrets of cards and format them constantly.)
I can't even deinstall that stupid photos app.
random song pausing, keyboard shortcuts not always working.
Seems to be an ok update, nothing special.
Hopefully some patches come out shortly.
Downloaded easily to my Mac, installed with no issues, and the speed issues from Yosemite have disappeared.
Highly recommended.
I wish I could actually write a review but this version won't even download on my laptop...
Aside from all the wonderful praise El Capitan is receiving, I have not been able to open Outlook since installing.
I have the spinning wheel of death - which the longest I have had the patience to wait is 20 minutes (and still nothing).
Right click and all I see is "Application not Responding' .... obviously.
I can still receive my emails through my phone but that isn't the optimal way to be viewing and responding to the constant stream of emails I receive.
Looking at other feedback I am not the only one experiencing this problem.
This needs to be rectified immediately.
I was so happy after i updated to EI Capitan on my mac mini before my work trip, however, when I came back, the computer was stuck in the apply loading screen, the bar just not loading at all!!!

what the .... so i reinstall again, the same problem happen again after i shut down the computer and turn it on, or simply choose restart, it just stuck in the loading screen, waiting for hours, still not loading!!
!please some body help, not i am so fraid to turn off the computer,very very disappointing
This operating system wasted 3 days of my life that I'll never get back.
I installed it and it locked up most of my applications and made my computer slow down to a halt.

I had to erase my hard drive and tried reinstalling it.... the second time around along with the previous issues, it sent my emails haywire, changed my settings and sent old emails of mine to random contacts spamming them.
Cheers for that, I could have spent that time actually getting some paid work done so I can support my family....instead I've had to mop up the mess it left behind.

Just upgrade my imac 2009 with brand new SSD 120GB, the machine run like fly with 10.6.8 , however when i try to update to 10.11 , everything is intall but the 10.11 could not open, it stuck just after restart ... Can someone tell me why
I installed this 2 days ago, and have had to force restart my macbook 3 times because it's frozen when i've gone to save my work (awesome!
), and safari only seems to work 50% of the time, the other 50% of the time it won't load anything.
I should know by now never to be the guniea pig for these software releases.
This totally messed with my Gmail access through the Apple Mail app.
Have been accessing via POP for years with no problem at all.
Then it started working again for a while.
Then it stopped working.
Now it's trying to download thousands of old gmail messages.
Hoping something gets fixed real soon!
That experience is kind of spoiling the enjoyment of other good features...
I'm not a massive fan of this new El Capitan.
Mainly because it makes my Wacom Tablet mostly useless.
It worked fine on Yosemite, however I can't download it again because it's too old to install now.
I hope that this gets fixed because I don't wish for my roughly 600$ device to be only a fancy drink mat.
Be very careful of this update as it has rendered my Outlook useless!
I installed the upgrade the other day onto a one year old iMac and it is so full of bugs.
Things are working more slowly, Mail is playing up badly, various apps keep freezing.
I truly wish I had not installed it or had paid attention to the reviews first.
I can see no real improvement, just problems.

row.Title: I changed my mind. It's dumbed down Disk Util is a problem

row.Sentences: Take a look at disk utilities and be warned, they are less, much less than what we had in Yosemite and earlier.
Boot disks unable to delete partitions, unable to format and dismount drives.
The Yosemite version still works from a USB boot disk, but the El Capitan has problems.
The running is OK otherwise.
Battery life on a MBP non retina, 2012 is 8 hours depending on the apps open.
But HD problems with formatting and partitioning from a previously top act software is a big issue.
I have an early 2008 iMac with OS X Yosemite Version 10.10.5 operating.

I've had a different experience with each operating system over the years and although I haven't had any problems with Yosemite, my computer did become increasingly slower, particularly when using Photos.
I appreciate I have an early 2008 iMac and perhaps should have left it at operating system Lion or Leopard or something.
However, since I've read here that peoples Macs have improved with El Capitan, I'd thought I'd give upgrade from Yosemite a go.
I've come this far haven't I with my old trusty Mac?
I pressed the El Capitan Download button via the App Store, entered my Apple ID password, the Download button changed to Downloading... but nothing happened and that's how far I got.

Other than the "Downloading" button there is no indication that it is actually downloading anything as my iMac is making no sound whatsoever and there's no moving circle thing or percentage downloaded bar to be seen anywhere.
I've been trying to download it for some days only to pause everlastingly without downloading the software from apple store.
If you have suggestion to totally halt the pause mode, please reply leave comments to my review.
Works well on my 12 month old MacBook Pro AND really well on my old 2009 MBP as well.
I did have a minor issue with all my mail disappearing, but just rebuildt the mailbox and all was good.
All these people complaining need a little reality check.
I also use my computer in an enterprise environment though a proxy with very little issues.
Keep up the good work!
My goodness, my Mac had been getting slower and slower, taking forever to open apps and programs.
I was a bit hesitant, but upgraded to El Capitan this evening and have seen a huge improvement in speed.
I am yet to look at any other new features, but the speed improvement alone has made me happy.
I rated this update very poorly because:1.
This noticeably slowed my laptop rather than sped it up (newer iMac managed better but this goes against what other users have found with older computers)2.
Rendered iPhoto unusable - new version not available in Australian storesSome positives:1.
Great new intuitive shortcuts and changes visually look good2.
It's freeGiven the choice again however I would stay with Yosemite until above issues addressed

row.Title: Steve Jobs would backflipping in his grave.

row.Sentences: Wow from install my keyboard didn't making this install so painful its unfunny.
This also seems to be a problem that Apple are perfectly aware of but still realeased El Crapotain anyhow.
Seriously?UPDATE!
Even worse than I thought now I can't play sounds through my display, well done Apple!
Absolute rubbish!!
Apple can't even get the install right.

row.Title: Broken App store and Java Runtime very unhappy

row.Sentences: Install went though OK BUT.
My Imac can nolonger run Microchip MPlabx (java) :(My daughters Mac Air can no longer login to Itunes or App store going to be fun downloadin the update.
Also broke boot camp - so I cant even boot in windoze and run my development apps from their.
If your thinking of downloading it - Dont - Wait till there is an update.

As others have said Apple is realy dropping the ball - Buggy updates make for unhappy usersPoor form Tim Cook now the update is out somethings now work but still not good enoughthought i had mistakenly installed windoze 10 instead of OS X El CRAPitan
Its says that it will take 2 days

row.Title: No More Glitches! Yet no Dashboard Apps!

row.Sentences: I am so happy with El Capitan.
I hated Yosemite.
It made my screen glitch up in certain programs but El Capitan has fixed all that!
I am not happy however with the dashboard apps being taken away.
I loved having countdown timers on my dashboard and I'm not a big fan of how Mail is set up either.
Otherwise my dear 2011 MacBook Pro is working as if it were just out of the box.
after installing El Capitan I was expecting Speedy Gonzales and got Stuck with Cousin Slow Poke
Switched my Late 2011 Macbook Pro over a couple of days ago.
After reading the reviews, I was hesitant but wanted to take the risk early and revert back to Yosemite if I needed to.
I can report that I am relieved and delighted to find that not only is everything working normally, but the whole thing is a lot faster and zippier to.

For people who read this review and are considering up-grading, it is important to add that my machine is also running with:12 Gb RAM, a 240 GB SSD, and a1 TB Seagate Hybrid Drive (in the cavity left by the optical drive).
Whether or not this is influencing things, I dont know, but so far, up-grading seems to have improved it!

row.Title: OUTLOOK NOW FREEZES. ADDITIONAL OUTLOOK UPGRADE NEEDED

row.Sentences: I foolishly ignored the poor customer ratings and upgraded.
Outlook immediately started to freeze.
Searching online suggested that a Microsoft Outlook upgrade would fix.
So far so good.
Fingers crossed

row.Title: My 2008 mac pro is still current

row.Sentences: Love this OS.
Works great.
Running super stable on my 2008 mac pro with NVidia web drivers and GTX750 ti.
A few bugs here and there, nothing that 10.11.1 can't sort out.
I have always been an early adopter and this OS upgrade is no different.
I have two MacBook Pro's.
One is a new 15" Retina and the other an early 2008 17" model.
I have had no problems with the install or using ElCapitan on either machine.
Very stable and the latest 10.11.1 feels faster than before.

row.Title: El Capitan = Yosemite on Steriod
row.Topic: Airdrop, El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Office, Update

row.Sentences: Updating El Capitan is a breeze.
Mail app is working fine for me.
Wifi is not off and on anymore.
Additionally, there is no "crash error" report when using Microsoft Office 2016 mac edition.
I've noticed El Capitan is faster than Yosemite in terms of handling virtualisation.
I've installed Windows 10, Ubuntu and Kali Linux and found no problem at all.
Everything works fine.
One major issue has been noticed, AirDrop stops functioning between Macs.
It still works fine between Mac and iDevices (iPhone, iPad).
That's the only reason I give 4 stars for now.
Please fix this issue.
really quite annoying that it has "an error' with downloading!
wish it worked!
Started well enough until we discovered Image Capture no longer worked with our HP scanner.
So for the time being only a full restore back to Yosemite restored our peace!

row.Title: It's like OS X Yosemite, but worse

row.Sentences: I loved OS X Yosemite.
Everything was nice and clean, easy to aunderstand and certainly didn't screw up as often as OS X 10.11 El Capitan does.
My dual monitors no longer work after the computer is put into sleep mode, and some of the new "features" are just plain annoying, such as the mouse enlargement.
What's more, is that many of my previous applications no longer work, which is unexpected given how similar the two firmwares seem to be.

These applications include LittleSnitch and Bartender, both applications I used religously, as well as the Logitech MX Master mouse firmware, which decided to no longer allow me to scroll until I redownloaded and reconfigured it.
Overall, I just wish I stuck with Yosemite, given that actually worked most of the time.
I installed it today and it won't sign in to iCloud it jams up and I'm forced to force close it everytime.
I don't know what the problem is but it's very annoying and frustrating that a new update would carry on like this especially coming from Apple.
I note that below, there are a few people who had problems with the update, but I installed it on two Macbook Pros (one new, one 2013) and a Macbook White (2010).
If it works for some and not others, I would have to say the problems might be download corruptions or similar.
It's a nice incremental upgrade.
I'd take the 1 star reviews with a grain of salt.
I've had zero issues updating, and have noticed a marked improvement with reliability, speed and smoothness.
This upgrade is brilliant.
Safari is vastly improved.
Whilst apple does not mention improvements to voice over I can tell any blind people that voice over performance with most applications has improved.
Safari works brilliantly with voice over now.

Since updating to El Capitan bootcamp does not work properly .... won't let me remove the existing partition made and installed under yosemite .... cannot now create a windows install disc had no trouble doing this with yosemite....want to remove windows 10 and go back to windows 8 but cannot do it.
A few other minor hitches but nothing major
I installed El Capitan on my Mac Mini, and all seemd fine.
First time I tried to shutdown the shutdown process would not complete, and had to power cycle the mini.
When it restarted, the monitor was not working at all.
Tried reconnecting everything, blind rebooting the Mac Mini (which should reset SMC) but still no working monitor.
5 days now without a working system.
Approach with caution.

ever since updating my computer has become incredibly slow and can now not shut down or restart if i have logged in not only that but some features of programs that worked fine when i was using yosemite have now ran into trouble and it is slowing down my work and workflow, avoid this update at ll costs epseacially for those who use ProTools 11.

you should get it if you wish to give your mac aids because that is basically what the latest OS X isUpdate: i repaired my disk utility and no change has happened this is the worst OS X update i have come across, also i cannot log off either have to force shut down my mac now
Downloaded on 2 of my Macs and can't say that I have found any issues during download or with any other programs or apps so have installed on my last Mac.
It has definitely improved the speed compared to Yosemite and the definition is higher.
Living in Indonesia where power can go off without notice along with the internet I have never had any download problems.
While people might complain about certain issues it is always prudent to backup before downloading and checking that all programs and apps are genuine apple approved.

I do question the reason behind yearly upgrades, every 2 years would be sufficient in my opinion, then Apple at least has time to perfect the upgrade and trial over a longer period, or even release as a beta version to volunteers to get feedback.
Seriously folks whats the problem !?
Saw update, downloaded update, installed update, everything worked ?
still working just fine.
I am running a Mac Mini 2010 and a MacBook Pro 2010, all working perfectly fine, as a matter of fact the whole update experience was a non event !
just the way I like it !!
I run a Windows Virtaul machine, cost I have to.... as wll as Office, both virtually always active.. so OSX gets put through it's paces.
My reasoning is, I don't mess around with system too much, I just let it run the show, that's what it was design for.
It caused my Installer to not verify apps, such as microsoft 2016 and java.
Yosemite worked well and, after a quite a lengthy download process, El Capitan seems about the same.
I actually had to check twice that El Capitan HAD actually installed.
I couldn't see much difference on the face of it.
Some of my older applications would not function without an upgrade - e.g.
Capture One Pro.
I've moved on from that so I permanently deleted it anyway, but everything else seems okay.
The only strange thing that happens is with Mail.
Mail seems to freeze on one email not allowing opening of other emails, so sometimes I have to close the Mail program in order to enable selecting different messages.
I guess there are features with El Capitan that I don't yet use - so really I haven't noticed any significant changes from Yosemite.
It deffinitely hasn't turned my iMac into a Ferrari!!
However, I think the Mail app needs to be investigated to determine the "freezing' issue I have explained.
Now that Steve's gone, are you guys even testing major releases?
It's not all bad.... the new font seems to work.

I'm so glad Apple are finally keeping up with windows, now I can finally:- Split View my stuff- Have better gaming experiencesSo proud of you, now i can run Google Chrome and Word at the same time in the same window and view them at the same time, and I can play more games.
THANKS APPLE!

row.Title: Possibly the worst OS X Apple has ever produced.

row.Sentences: In short, it's not stable at all.
How can they make all the basic functionalities broken on the new OSX that now crashes my Macs?Waited for their first update round hoping Apple fixes the critical issues on El Capitan.
But they solely fixed the Microsfot Office crash problem instead of having a look at the sleep / wake failure problem and other critical issues such as Bluetooth re-paring problem, etc.
Please remember that we are here and loyal, beacause of your product and service quality.
What you've done here is just not right
Ive had absolutely no crashes, my CPU is running fine and no trouble with apps not functioning correctly.... What are you all on about?
Its all sweet on my end.

row.Title: Split Screen functionality is awful with third party apps

row.Sentences: The most crucial third party apps such as Microsoft Office 2016 which allow full screen mode for Word, PowerPoint and Excel, don't work when put into split screen mode.
This needs to be fixed urgently.
There is no way in hell I'm switching to the iWork application bundle because of this issue.
Agter a long download time (much longer than necessary given the size of the file) it failed to install.
Retry results in an endless vision of the spining beach ball!
However, the update has done something - rendered totally useless my very expensive Pegasus R4 raid backup.
Thanks Apple - back to my trusty old PC.

row.Title: apple is going downwards big time

row.Sentences: Running 5 macs and have to say usability out of the window, iPhoto constantly crashes under ElCaptain Photo is a horrible replacement does not even let you find your original images and show them in the finder.
Photostream is discontinued now so only option now is to upload the whole DB in the cloud (apple are you serious???
30GB images and pay you extra trough the roof).
Since the update my secondary screen plays up constantly.
DiskUtility has a horrible gui overhaul in a tiny window with no way to resize

row.Title: Stick to Yosemite if you can

row.Sentences: Crashed twice after install.
Both times had to take it to the genius bar to restore image.
And it is also slow compare to Yosemite IMO.

row.Title: Slow Download Speed and constant beachball
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: Inital Download:According to speedtest.com im averaging 10mb/s yet its estimated time to download is 15 hours.
I'm only downloading so I can update iTunes.
Only updating iTunes because I updated my phone to iOS 9 and now cant sync it with iTunes.
I am greatful that Apple offers free upgrades for thier software, but guys, why wouldnt you atlease warn me that updating to iOS 9 would mean I cant connect to my version of iTunes.
If I knew this, I would have waited untill I had a decent amount of time to dedicate to having to update all my devices.
Edit: Adding more after installingInstall:Mostly ok. Only problems were that it froze after install and inital log in.
Hard reset and was ok and didnt corrupt (thank goodness.)
Only one program was flagged "not compatible.'
It just needed to update to latest version, but I had to manually re-download it instead of software updater just automatically checking for me.
It has also reset my licence key for this program.
It has saved most of my personalised general settings, but some basic ones it did not port over.
After install:I have found that I am contstently getting beachballed with everything I do.
Everything is running a lot slower and it is really frustrating.
Even just the simple task of print took 10 mins to send a simple one page text based pdf.
I have not tried every program yet, but hopefully they all work ok and I dont have any issues.
I just hope everything stabilises and the issues are just temporary.
Fuji Zerox Docuprint M215b no longer works unable to find drivers to date.
I had no download or install problems.
However, once El Capitan is installed, it caused Word and Outlook to crash and this has not been fixed in 10.11.1.
The security system means that many printer drivers (especially the three that I use!)
for Fuji Xerox printers no longer work.
I eneded up havong to disable El Capitan's new System Integrity Protection to re-install and then re-enable it.
That is, the "upgrade" requires a reduction in system integrity just to work.
As an OS, it's great and the Safari improvements such as pinning are useful.
It's just a real pain when it stops productivity.
Upgraded my MacBook Pro (mid 2014) to EI Captain with high expectations, as new features relased with it were so attracting.
But after the upgrade, Airdrop and Handoff were totally not working, since they were working well before this upgrade, I guess that's the latest operating system's fault.

Also, I have a MacBook Air runing Yosemite and iPhone 6 running IOS 9.0.1, those practical functions are working fine between these two, I am sure that's my MacBook Pro couldn't get connected with them.
I had a look at websites, tried a lot of things to see if I could fix it without a reinstallation, but no, nothing worked it out.
So EVENTUALLY, I went back to Yosemite, and everything turned out to be absolutely fine.
Certainly, I will upgrade back to EI Captain sooner or later, but just not now, I don't like it at all at the moment.

row.Title: The performance in 3+ years old Macbook Air is very poor

row.Sentences: It is not worth it to install it.
Doing so you will end having the feeling that your Macbook Air is old.
Keep Mavericks, it is the best release so far in regards of performance.
Apple, I have been a strong supporter over the years but this release update is still bad.
On first install it took a whole day.
I had many "beach balls' This current update is still buggy and crashes when I use firefox and word.
By the way, my last review, never made it to the list.
Let's see if this one does
this update won't resume after restarting for me.....
Installed Capitan, download crashed once, but restarted fine.
A problem with iCloud mail deleting, but that seems trivial compared other disasterious reviews that I have read.
I didn't back up or disk repair prior, but it may be a good idea.
Cross your fingers and hit install.
I am on my third install of El Capitain due to crashing.

After the first crash on my late 2014 MacBook Pro - I shut down the computer and when I went to start up again, I got a black screen with the Apple symbol and a progress bar under it but the progress bar did nothing - so a trip to the genius bar where they helped me do a reinstall of El Capitain so all seemed well until thee days later and this time I did a restart due to not being able to connect with my Apple TV, and guess what?
the same thing happend again.
This time I called the support line and they helped me do another reinstall suggesting that I back everything up and wipe the hard drive and reinstall everything again!
What an absolute mess.

I have been a mac user for quite a while and I have never had any trouble with my previous macs ( I love them ) this mac is less than a year old Oh and another thing - if you use mail make sure you back up ALL of it before installing El Capitain or you will lose some, most or all of it.
Please Apple make sure the OSX is stable before you release it.
So i just got this MacBook not too long ago prob one year old now and after acouple of updates its gone slower and slower after each update.
This update is by far the most damaging to my Mac, it is as slow as dial up or a computer that was made in the 2000.
Now that i think about it any Macbook/Pc by apple isnt very duriable....it'll probably last only 1year and start to act up aswell as slow down.

I think while these people that make these macbook/pc dont think about how far will these PC/Laptop will last or maybe they do have that in mind and will only continue to make their products a tiny bit better just to make more cash like any other business.
In my personal experience, this OS failed to install on my system, because the disk cannot be repaired.
It then brought an infinite unsolvable loop - keeps saying the system cannot be installed and press restart to try again, and there is no way back.
MY ADVISE FOR POTENTIAL USERS:* Open Disk Utilities, then verify your disk, it it works then install, otherwise DONT DO IT!
Split view is causing the 2 applications to freeze, so that I'd have to force quit the two applications, I'm operating on a 2015 Macbook Pro
Hey so I'm not a mac genius but I'm pretty sure if my laptop and internet are currently running smoothly and everything works relatively quickly my download time shouldn't be "1 day and 5 hours"

row.Title: had trouble after updating this OX El

row.Sentences: My macbook is really slow after this update and even lost sound input and output device.
Really upset..

row.Title: Better wait for the next update to fix the issues

row.Sentences: It installed fine.
It looks as expected.
Some elements appear to be faster.
It uses about 10gb less HDD on my Macbook ProBut....some applications get stuck....such as Mail.
Or Evernote....and some things just seem to be slower.

row.Title: No AirDrop and Office keeps crashing!

row.Sentences: Ever since I installed this update AirDrop no longer works on my computer.
No icon apears for other devices or anything, it is completley unresponsive.
I always use this feature, so an issue as major as this that has gone unresloved for weeks has caused ALOT of frustration.
Also, Office 2016 applications have become nearly unusable due to frequent crashing.
I am a uni student, and this made me lose almost half of my assignment.
Mad does not begin to describe.
Please fix, Apple.

row.Title: Unusable -All i get is the beachball of death

row.Sentences: I can't even use my mac any more.
This isn't good enough.
Apple need to fix this immediately.
I swear ever since i installed this my chrome, miscrosoft word, powerpoint and excel have constantly been crashing.
The mail application messed up with this update.
I cannot send emails in Apple Mail from my work email, which is extremely inconvenient.
I tried everything that was suggested (including deleting the account and readding, resulting in me losing all my drafts) and nothing worked.
Really disgusting that they would release it with something that doesnt work like that...
Lured into a false sense of confidence that the upgrade would work effectively, I found multiple problems.
The primary one is that Outlook now fails to work - it hangs on every attempt to open it.
The system is also very slow and inefficient in its operation.
I strongly recommend that people re-consider any upgrade to El Capitan to avoid regret.
I wish I had never upgraded.
I really don't get the criticism I read here and would suggest doing a clean install if anyone has problems - it's dead easy to do!
I installed this over the top of Yosemite (which I clean installed a few months ago) and it works like a dream.
My imac has never been quicker or more functional.

row.Title: Slowed my computer down a lot

row.Sentences: my laptop is so slow now spotify takes forever to load and scroll through playlists even typing lags fairly annoying hope you fix it soon

row.Title: Breathed new life into an old machine
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Yosemite

row.Sentences: My elderly Mac Pro (3,1 early 2008) is much snappier since moving to 10.11.
It isn't that 10.10 was slow and I haven't really noticed any one thing that has sped up but I can certainly notice the difference overall.

In fact general Finder operations seem almost as fast as my 15,1 retina iMac running 10.10.5 (can't update until they fix the Office 2016 problem and I don't move my main machine until x.1 versions anyway).
The Mac Pro has plenty of RAM and an SSD as the boot drive which I am sure is a help in dealing with the demands of 10.11.
My only problem has been that the driver for a Caldigit USB3 / eSata PCI card caused a kernal panic.
I had suspected that it may be a problem as Caldigit had said that the card didn't work under 10.10 or 10.11.
As it worked perfectly under 10.10 I hoped that it might keep operating but no luck this time around.
Off to OWC for a new driverless USB 3 card as I have an eSata card from another vendor that has updated 10.11 drivers.
So, overall, I couldn't be happier with 10.11 on this machine.
I have had to force quite more applications in the last 2 days than in the last 2 years.
Thanks for a productivity-strangling update Apple.
Tried downloading twice now.
Gets to end of download (99%) then says error.
Its taken a whole day to get to this point.
Don't think I will bother trying again.
Time waster!
MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Late 2013)
I joined "Apple ecosystem' three years ago after having wasted my 25 years in other system.
iPhone was a stepping-stone to the Apple devices.
OS and customer service are superb, and deserve 5 starts appreciation.
Big thanks to you all!

row.Title: Should have an option to change the font size

row.Sentences: Since I upgraded to El Capitan, I am having more trouble to read the writing on the screen because the already tiny writing shrinked more comparing to Yosemite.
It'll be much better if we have an option to increase the font size so it is easier to read.
Also, El Capitan is still a bit laggy, hope to see a minor update soon!

row.Title: Great But Preview Has Many Issues

row.Sentences: This new update is excellent.
The transitions are very fast, the windows maximize and minimize very fast.
The split is amazing and exactly what I have been waiting, earlier I had to split view manually by arranging windows side-by-side.
I use the preview application a lot on my macbook.
But, since the update preview application has many bugs.
Sometimes, when you resize a preview window, the content becomes blurred and invisible, so you have to either make it smaller or larger in size.
Numerous times, I have chosen to hide the sidebar, I still have to do it for every pdf file, which is actually annoying.
Please correct this bug in the next update.

row.Title: Some features gone but no real difference

row.Sentences: Not sure if this is due to El Capitan but at times it's impossible to change from app to app.
Also, am I blind or has that screen furthest on the left (I was never too sure what it was, only knew that it was useful) gone?
The one with the clock and widgets.
Other than those two issues I haven't noticed a real difference.

row.Title: Not working with 2010 MacBook Air A1369

row.Sentences: I installed this update to my 2010 MacBook Air and after shutdown, the OS will fail to boot upon start up - hanging on the Apple logo and loading bar screen.
I performed a touch command on one of the extensions folders, via terminal in recovery, which brought the unit back to life however this was only a bandaid fix.
Upon restart, the OS failed to boot again.
I have since reverted back to an earlier Time Machine backup which works fine, confirming no hardware issues with my MBA, and will stick with Yosemite until this issue is resolved.
