Install went OK, but now it constantly reboots about 10-15 times a day for no reason.
DONT UPDATE until Aple can fix......this is the worst thing I have ever done.
People complain that its a bit buggy and things arent they way they wanted it to be.
Deal with it, the updates are coming, incase you guys have forgetten what it wa like to fork out a few hundred dollars to update windows every year.
I think we should all be grateful that these features are just added to our computers and we arent charged for it.
Thanks for keeping these updates free Apple.
I for one really appreciate it.
Updated to El Capitan and it took all day to dowload even though I have fast internet, So far I can't see much difference between El Capitan and Yosemite.
on yosemite my OSX was unstable since switching over to el capitaine has improved the whole process of my daily activities on my pc for me on my desktop mac it such an improvement

row.Title: External hardrives and Outlook 2011 not working at all

row.Sentences: I dont just complain for the sake of it but this is a bad update.
Upgraded from Mavericks and what a mistake.
Ive searched online lots and its not my error and there are no workarounds.
External drives not working in USB ports and outlook 2011 not syncing and freezes everytime render my Airbook useless.
HURRY UP AND SORT THIS OUT
I bought a Macbook Pro Retina only a month or so before El Capitan was released.
So, I have the latest gear, with the tops specs.
I have only installed a handful of programs since my purchase, and only those essential to my work.
I am very disappointed to find that my computer has slowed down considerably since El Capitan.
The start up is a lot slower, and there is considerably more wait times during use.
I am angry to find that the long-standing wifi networking problems have been completely ignored yet again, and the poor reliability of maintaining connections makes it almost unusable.
Now to wait another year or so for Apple to pay some attention to the basics.
I tried to download an it seems it managed to get most of the 6 GB, but I got a message: "an error has ocurred" and I can't download anymore...
As soon as I downloaded and installed this update my Macbook started heating up and eventuly over heating, why?.
I used to be able to play small indie games, but now it over heats to fast for me to play them
I thought by the majority of the reviews that this would be worth a try.
Despite trying everything suggested, I'm now unable to send mail and Apple have been no help at all.
None of my IMAP email accounts work now after this update.
That makes it useless for me.
After no issues with previous updates Apple have failed with this one.
when i installed the beta version the safari was soo laggy it took half an hour just to visit a website.now you cant back up new app purchases and updates to from iphone ipad to iTunes.
you have to update it direcly from iTunes.
other wise perfect.
Im unable to download El Capitan onto my 27 inch Mid 2010 3.2 i3 processor 8 GB 1333 DDR3 memory running OS X Yosemite 10.10.5.
Attempted it several times after entering my password which is accepted, it just sits there all day and night with no indication of anything happening.
My internet speed is fine all other downloads worked ok just probelms with this one.

row.Title: DO NOT upgrade if you're using Adobe CC2015

row.Sentences: I noticed that El Capitan was ready to install 3 days ago (wondering why I hadn't seen any notification before then).
So I attempted to download - it took a couple of days & several attempts.
What have I got: a fandangle new spinning beach ball - wow that's a showstopper - I mean, literally.

The apps I use all day everyday have little niggly problems that slow down production & how do I go back to Yosemite - Time Machine - & just hope that all the extra time it takes to do so won't cause any other issues - JUST DON'T DO IT until it is confirmed that your usual apps are compatible.
If you're one of these people who are silly enough to race out & get the latest Apple anything, you will pay!!
Since I downloaded El Capitan I have had nothing but problems across all of my macs.

My mail crashes, safari does not open often, Iphoto is corupted, I have never seen the rainbow animation so much in all the time I have been unusing mac and I could go on and on with the problems I am having.
I would have thought that Apple would have fixed all the problems by now.it is taking too long.
I was all set to do away with my optical drive and replace it with a secondary hdd to make a RAID and make my macbook super fast - I need it to be fast!
Then I downloaded El Cap and discovered the disk utility has been completely changed.
No RAID whatsoever!
Does Apple even realise that many professionals choose Mac for heavy load work like Audio and Video?
Why would they get of the RAID option?
I'm tired of seeing Apple slowly downgrade everything so that it can be marketed to my grandma.

row.Title: Absolute garbage, Apple is getting worse

row.Sentences: Apple has become a joke it seems.
After installing this - which took a good part of four hours - my MacBook Pro 2012 with 16GB RAM now shuts down whenever it feels like it!
The spinning wheel thingy pops up constantly and most apps take an inordinate amount of time to fire up!
When the MacBook goes to sleep, it shuts down and disconnects all external drives!
This is not what I woule expect from Apple.
I have been using Apple Macs since 1999 and this is the worst OS update ever.
This is giving me a good reason to jump ship after all these years and go back to Windows.
I haven't noticed very much change at all with this OS update, except for the problems I now get.
I've got a MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2014), and since upgrading, I now get random pauses where the whole OS freezes for a second or more, and have had several apps crash.
The crashes could maybe be the fault of the apps more than the OS, but three different apps have crashed on me and that's never happened before when I've done an OS update.

row.Title: Once again Apple launch a program before it's ready

row.Sentences: Having so many problems with my mail (microsoft outlook) since installing.
Applecare are no help, continually refer to microsoft.
Which would be fine if previous users below haven't noted ALL mail programs are hanging with this OS.
Microsoft refer back to apple.
It's an endless, frustrating loop of inaction.
Apple won't advise me how to uninstall either when this is their program.
I've been online chatting to support twice since installing it today.... And (such as it is....when chat gave it) the uninstall advice is well beyond my technical capacity.
If I ever get some help I'm happy to review this review.
I've an iMac running Yosemite (latest build) at the moment and wanted some of the new features in El Capitan.
Went into the App Store to download - over 6GB and took more than an hour.
As it was finalising the download it errored - "An Error Has Occurred" but showed as "Downloaded".
The error was hard to read as it was in red text on a scenic picture background but I think that is was it said.
I'm now not sure what state it is in.
It won't re-download and won't recover when I select the "Downloaded" button.
Not a good start......
I updated my MBP 15" and everything is still there, everything is normal and working perfectly.
I am having no problems at all which is great because the reviews scared me a little bit.
I find some things are a little faster too.
I'm glad I finally decided to upgrade.
cant download -annoying
Ever since upgrading my Outlook and mail services do not work.
Outlook loads and quickly freezes and crashes along with other mail systems.
i really like this it is amazing it has over 1billon pages of cool info

row.Title: Smooth install, so many faults
row.Topic: Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Safari, Update, Windows

row.Sentences: Installation worked fine, fast download and pretty quick install.
However since installing, I have never seen the rainbow animation occur so much!
I have a MBP 13" 2013 model with 2.8GHz processor and 8gb of ram.
Frequently apps stop running and take a significant amount of time to recover.
Safari is as useless as ever, I have tried to load pages and it literally never loads.
Internet speed is 13mbps and pages will not load.
I go onto a windows computer (connected to the same network, same distance from modem) and it works instantly.
Removing the dashboard feature without notification caused slight annoyance as I had many important notes there, (which i recovered after contacting apple support).
Apple is beggining to lose my trust rapidly, these updates are not better at all.
My computer basically useless as I cannot maintain an effective connection to the internet.
Apple need to take more time to remove these bugs and gliches before it releases new operating systems to the public.
Nothing audio related works.
Not even Itunes plays !
I wish i staied with 10.7.

row.Title: el capitan stuffs up safari, app store numerous websites and accounts had to reinstall previous, do

row.Sentences: Mr Apple please compensate for this very flawed OS, thanks.
don't install you won't be able to install apps from the app store untill next update
Downloaded - install failed - cannot re-download - cannot upgrade - cannot find a forum/link/help to resolve.
first OS stuff-up in 20years !

row.Title: wait for the bugs being fixed before install this update

row.Sentences: I've been using mac for almost 20 years.
this is the worst update ever!!!!!
by the way, I'm using MacBook Pro (early 2015) at the moment.
safari was so good, i didn't need any other browsers until this new update.
wifi does drop out occasionally.
the biggest problem i have is printing.
For major applications such as pages, safari and preview I got either blank pages or partial print out (e.g.
10pages documents, only 5 pages could be found after i click the print button).
I have to open everything in google chrome in order to print now.
especially for pages documents, i have to covert them to pdf beofre open them in google chrome.
MS outlook stopped working after upgrading
recognised as downloaded but not actually installed, still previous version???????????
?Still won't download and spends all day trying to download?????
**********Please Apple don't Microsoft me**********
I am really disappointed in this update.
Different applications are frozen constantly since the update.
The speed of my computer has also slowed down.
My computer is only 3 months old, I didn't expect it.
This OS update is just atrocious.

row.Title: This was a big mistake for business use

row.Sentences: Apps not working properly:- Mail- Dashboard - Printer setup and moreSince when Apple started releasing updates that do not work?
Wish I had not gone that path.
Disappointed with business affected.
Glitch occurred when I tried to download the update.
It got stuck and wasnt loading past a certain point.
I eventually decided to restart my computer and try again but now it is stuck as "paused".
Works perfect .
Renaming files .
nice work about time.
Iphoto nice tweaks .
Emptying trash can glitch bug now works perfect.very very happy.
Don't stick this on if you are using Adobe software, Lightroom & Photoshop have slowed down and crash frequently.
I have gone back to Yosemite for a while till it all works as it should.
Shame, was looking forwads to using it properly.

row.Title: Great New Features But Still Too Many Bugs

row.Sentences: At first this upgrade was great but after a few days my MacBook Pro Retina 13" (Late 2012) started to slow down.

Safari would not load web pages and turning the Wi-Fi off and on done nothing I had to reboot the computer and when I went to reboot it, it would then freeze so I would have to hold the power button down and force shut it down.

Then on top of that when the computer was idling or when I was just browsing basic websites on the internet it would start to heat up dramatically to the point that I would have to put something underneath it so it woudn't burn my lap.
None of this ever happened with Yosemite so I feel there are still a lot of bugs that needed to be fixed before they released it.
Apple should really look at releasing an update soon to address these issues as it is not what I expected from Apple.
This is honestly the best update I have ever done.
The boot is faster than Yosemite, but mountain lion was my fastest at 23 seconds.
I would like it if apple could push that boot speed back up.
Apart from that i <3 the black theme.
I also like how you can mulitask with two apps like Messages and Email or Messages and Safari.
I am overall very happy with El Capitan and I belive it is beter than Windows 10.
Its not that I don't like Windows 10.
Things seem to load faster on my Mac that my Windows; apart from the boot.
I had no trouble downloading (about 3 hrs) and installing(about an hour) El Capitan.. That was about a week ago.
Slowly seeing what the difference is.
However despite ALL the correct setting for sound on e-mails in and sending out, there is no longer the sound that goes with them.... and yes, the sound should be there.

Also the other problem (and on Yoesemite) was if I had an QT audio ready for use on the screen throughout the day for recording, when I came to use it, I could not stop it recording and had to use force quit.3rdly, I can not hear the Music Library royalty free tunes on Youtube.
I have to download to hear.
This happened also on Yoesemite but not on Mountain Lion.
Most likely Google/Youtube have not updated their software.
Otherwise all else I use seem ok. My Mac is Early 2008.
The download and install was fine but now my laptop continuiously frezzes up and is slower than ever!
I am having continuious interaction issues with other devics such as iPad and iPhone and intergration with any microsoft products seems to be limited at best.
I have also had it not allow me to log in requiring several restarts!
In all i would say a really poor attempt at upgrading, not exactly confidence inspriring team Apple!
Lost a lot of emails after installing.
Not happy as this is how I track up and coming bookings.
started downloading then my computer shut down and now it wont continue downloading or download anymore its stuck, just a useless button

row.Title: if you try to play game dont update

row.Sentences: MacBook Pro (Retina, 13-inch, Mid 2014) 2.6 GHz Intel Core i5 8 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 update 2weeks ago just can't play game anymore.
the fan keep working make mac HOT HOT HOT slow the game ops.
Musicians beware for the moment!
El Capitan I find is great.
However there is a serious problem yet to be addressed.
Finale crashes when certain dialogue boxes are called upon.

row.Title: Broken iMAP and POP Email accounts

row.Sentences: Lost all my emails and calendars....
Terrible experience, What a waste of time.
Not a step forward.
Upto three apps no longer work including one I bought today.
Is it OS X El Capitan or is it the App developers not keeping up with progress.
Is 11 days enough time for everyone to get the act together?

row.Title: How can you rate something that wont download

row.Sentences: I tried yesterday to download and it was at going a snail rate.
Then paused to try Sunday morning and now it's just frozen and is now totally non-responsive.
Bravo Apple, Bravo.

OK I have been a loyal Apple Mac fan for 20 years now, however I would strongly advise any one to against applying this version of the OS, my machine crashes on average 50-100 times a day and that's after avoiding any Microsoft products (it's worse if I use any M/S Office product.
I just don't have the time to down grade and reinstall every application at present otherwise I'd go back to Yosemite.

Before El Crapitan Encore and Premiere CC were working fine, now they have bugs and glitches that malfunction the video and won't allow you to export without having yellow and red glitch bars streaked throughout your footage.
It's such a pain because It's come at a time where I need Encore for DVD's most and It's really disappointing.
Please fix this asap.
This download has messed up my contacts, and email layout, also if I wish to print my contacts list it shows the print page, but is so big the controls are hidden by the dock, and cannot be used.
I cannot install this upgrade.
I have tried installing on my 2011 mac mini and my 2015 mac book pro, on both I receive a screen in the app store that simply hangs on "resume', nothing else happens.
I have been trying to upgrade for the last week, I leave this to "resume' over night, I come back in the morning nothing has changed.
I then reboot the machine and try again.
I believe on both machines the upgrade has somehow hung and cannot get itself out.
Does anyone have any advice?
Thanks Apple for this great update.
My 2015 macbook pro Retina now runs more smooth and quick.
Absolutely stuffed up all my microsoft applications (i.e.
word, excel, outlook & Skype).
They no longer work.
Thanks apple - might just move onto the new surface.
The new update is awesome i love the new things especially the new safari update.
i think it is defiantly worth getting
I have had ridiculous issues since updating.
DO NOT update if you are using microsoft office 2016.
Ive spent hours getting simple word docs to open and have had to revert to office 2011 just so I can open docs.
2011 still doesnt even work well but at least I can get my assignments done.
Mail continuously crashes and freezes.
Chrome is slow and crashes/freezes continuoulsy.
By far the worst update yet.
Wait until the bugs have been fixed before you update.
Downloading for home computer and it's been the slowest download I have ever experienced.
Also after 4 hours of download time perserverence at work, now have this update on my work's Mac and nothing exciting in this update.
Dissapointed Apple.
Please pickup your game and become the revolutionary company that you once were.
I have a 13" Early 2015 MPB with retina display that has a 3.1GHz i7 processor and 16GB of memory.
After installing El Capitan my macbook became unusable, half the time it wouldn't even start up and when I did manage to login I couldn't open any programs or even any folders!
Managed to save my computer by restoring to Yosemite but will not be upgrading again any time soon!
After download El Capitian, my personal cloud doesn't work at all,I could not open my files in my personal cloud with my macbook pro..
Ever since I updated to El Capitan my Macbook has been runing a lot slower.
If i we're you I would wait until 10.11.1 comes out.
Just downloaded El Capitan on an iMac and all emails in "Mial" have been lost.
As with other folk, years of memories, photos and financial info ahve been lost.
Waiting on Apple response for a fix with fingers crossed.
Would strongly warn against installing El Capitan until the issue is resolved.
Ill start with the positives, all of the new features including split view, the new notes app, atc are all fantastic.
The fonts are nicer and everything is good.
However, it did take me 4 days to update, and when it did update my laptop started to lag and get really hot on the bottom.
I am unable to watch internet videos without them freezing every 2 seconds and the airplay feature does not work very well.
I am able to connect to my apply tv but it keeps disconnecting.
If i had a chance, id go back to el capitan in a heartbeat.
All the contents on OS X El Capitan are good and fun to use but it wouldn't install on my work mac or my home mac.
Please, if you can, make the installation ALOT!
This is not a feature update of OS-X but is instead a release to optimise the internal workings of the operation system and it really shows.
I have a mid-2012 update Macbook Pro and the improvemens really show.
Overall my Mac now feels far more responsive and quick in every day operations.
As an added bonus I ended up with about 10gb of extra storage after the upgrade from Yosemite which was a nice surprise.
Given that the upgrade is free I think this is a no-braining upgrade.
Just be ready for an upgrade that can take a few hours to complete.
I was almost on to installing Mac OS X El Capitan on my 15 inch macbook pro from last year when the download failed but there is a big problem.
Since it had begun installing it when it failed i could no longer download it!!!!!!
I tried click it but nothing came up.
PLZ FIX THIS ISSUE as im just wasting Countless gigabytes of my internet on downloading basicly nothing.
Plus i have read so many revies on poor mail service and slow WI-FI so even if i install it sucsesfully I will still have problems until they fix them.
NOT HAPPY ONE BIT!
My word got crashed twice and l lost all my work.
El Capitano failed to perform as expected.
few updates nothing impressive.

row.Title: Love it, but having problems when connected to an External Monitor

row.Sentences: I love the added functionality and improvements on my MBP 13" i7 16GB Early 2011.
I updated from Yosemite and have been anticipating this for a very long time.

The only problem I've had since the upgrade (and first ever encounter of this problem since 10.7), is that suddenly my external monitor connected to Mini DisplayPort to VGA adapter) experiences violent screen flicker and tear as well as black screens when I select the highest resolution of 1920 x 1080 on the external display.
This never happened on previous OS X versions.
Resetting PRAM and an SMC firmware update didn't resolve the problem.
Mini DisplayPort firmware v1.0 was incompatible.
Haven't been able to find a fix on Communities either.
I hope Apple identifies the problem and fix with the next update because I'm no alone.

row.Title: Split View, Spot Light, and Productivity???

row.Sentences: It seems accustomary now that OS X has to be updated regularly and recently updates have been free; we ought not to complain much about it.
But I would prefer to pay for an update which has less issues and noticable difference.
It seems apparent that Developers at Apple hold on to something and then introduce the feature in an update like this.

Split View is a good addition but with limited functionality, since I used to resize windows it does not make that difference as hyped, spotlight is movable but Its searches are not perfectly dependable.
Mail has never functioned flawlessly, there are always some issues with mail, I just hope instead of beating around the bush developers concentrate to make Mail an error free software.

Have downloaded and all seems ok except I can't get into photos, gets to 90% and says error and have to close....trying to work out how to get into this application.....anyone else had this problem, very frustrating.....
I have tried many many times to download this from the App store with no successIf Apple were serious about their upgrades they would make this process much more reliable

row.Title: Wait until bugs in El Capital are fixed

row.Sentences: There compatibility issues with Chrome and Firefox browsers, which causes them to crash.
I have not noticed any noticible performance changes as it was advertised on my latest Mac Pro.
Quality of this update is poor.
I had to downgrade to Yosemite :(
I love this update it's faster then the previous mac update.
It loads fast which is great and it's just fast at loading apps.
It's one of the best updates.
Keep improving them Apple.
It didn't take long for me to download it either.
Keep up the great work.
:D I'm very happy with my Late 2009 mac book update to OS X El Capitan.
It's the smoothest and best update yeat as far as install and opperation after goes.

A few minor bugs but generally most people will barley notice any difference asside from a few cosmetic changes as advertised, most of the good action happened "under the hood" where most won't even notice it.
I had some duplication of IMAP email accountsbut a much improved mail experience.
The tweaks to photos are very welcome and notes has jumped into the legue of the opposition apps along with calendar updates.
All very good and smoother that the last, a step forward.

row.Title: Disappointed
row.Topic: Compatibility, Installation, N/A, Speed, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: iMac & macbook pro, botha few years old, but have always ran great, until this came out.
First tried to install it on the iMac via a USB thumbdrive install.
It went fine, however I got a "USB devices Disabled" alart and can't get rid of it.
Installed it on the macbook, it hung for 48 hours, using the same usb thumbdrive.
gave up, had to put it in target mode to format the HDD.installed 10.10 and used the update via the app store, it worked, but is very very slow.
After reinstalling 10.10 on the iMac, I updated again, this time the same issue, the USB Devices Disabled.
even with nothing pluggin in to the ports.
Apple support don't know whats going on, the forums the same.
Never had this issue before and will be going back to 10.10 this weekend.
Its a shocking update and not worth the download.
Lucky I have a 1TB 100mb/s plan
downloaded few times and failed after 3.5 gb finally after days it reached 6.8 and failed i give up useless software to try download very annoying
Why is the download speed for this update so slow?
I've been trying for 4 days straight and its downloading it at like 20KBps Max!!!
And this is on an NBN Fibre Optic Broadband connection.
Fix your servers apple!!
6 days 4 hours to download, and then after installation this OS breaks any chance of connecting to the App Store or iTunes store.
The computer just cannot connect to any Apple store, no software can be updated, nothing can be fixed.
Not ready for prime time.
An Apple user for over 20 years and this is by far the worst experience I have ever had.
Lost time, lost work, lost money, avoid this unless you are happy to spend lots of time fixing issues that Apple should have sorted in beta stages.
These issues have been reported by loads of people for months but still it makes it into the final version.
Thanks for nothing Apple.
So far it's good but it took way toooo long to download + install.
downloading took about 1 hour and 45mins plus intallation took 25mins.
Apple, please next time make big updates like this less time to run.
Thanks as well this update was really good.
I like the new stuff.
Downside......the time to download
this is taking forever to download, wasent this suppose to be a quick download?
My Fuji printer driver is disabled; a compatible driver will be released in Dec. 2015 My computer is now so very very slow.

row.Title: Easy download - however now Outlook doesnt work

row.Sentences: AGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHHAs someone who prefers to keep software up to date I downloaded el Corporal only to find that now Outlook keeps hanging.
I use outlook for work email and mail for personal and am now completely stuffed
Downloaded the update, all good, then an error came up, however, I had no option to cancel/fix or even re-download the update.
I think Apple has employed some people from the competition who have undermineded thier buisness model of great products backed by even better service.

I am no longer singing the praises of Mac as I once did, the customer service has (in my opinion subject to my experiences) gone down and the number of issues relating to OS and basic functionality has gone up.
I use to say once you go Mac you will never go back, now I say, get whatever fits, they're all much of a muchness these days...... and that makes me sad.

row.Title: The Dumbing-down' of the mac OS

row.Sentences: Downloaded great, easily made a bootable usb.
Quite a few new nifty features and looks sleek..
But.... From the bootable usb, I wanted to do a secure wipe of the hard drive using disk utility, only to find this feature has been removed.
Why?Started loading up apps to find out that java was needed when it wasn't before and Garmin apps didn't work.
Tried to secure empty trash, only to descover another feature that has been removed.

When checking out the forums, the mac people just gave the generic responce that secure empty trash is not needed when filevault is encrypting things in the background, thats all well and good for the internal hard drive but what about externals?
Apparently the reason for removing this feature was that data deleted using the secure empty trash feature was found to be recoverable, especially for USB flash storage.
Instead of fixing the problem and making it more secure, mac just decided to remove it.... RediciolousEl Capitan is locking out root privlages from various file systems.
I havn't encountered problems yet, but Its only a matter of time.
Usually only people who know what they are doing go proding around in system processes.
To put it simply El Capitan takes one step foward and two steps back.
Mac is dumbing down features to cater for the masses, insulting the intelligance of Mac users.

Mac has always been innovative enough to develop OSs that everyone can use easily, with simple features in the forefrount for everyday users, and the advanced features being harder to find and access, but present none the less.
For some reason this fundamental ethos that has been around for decades is rapidly dying.
It's a sad day for Mac
Download and installation of El Capitan took a couple of hours.
Since the installation, my password entry keeps coming up with incorrect password and only accepts it when I shut down and reboot - every time!
- so I've had to scrap my password protection.
Internet is slower.
Some difficulty with connecting into different wifi's.
Not impressed - no positive features over Yosemite that I can see, just negatives as above.
this update will remove the dashboard, mess up your emails and is pretty pointless.
all it does is make some technical things better and makes it faster to fing a window, delete emails, find a document ect.
not happy at all that there is no dashboard and all that time wasted downloading it, not to mention data usage and costs.
Update was good, everything is a lot faster - except when you log in.
Whenever i put my password in after sleep, it takes an extra 5-6 seconds to process, regardless of whether it was correct or incorrect.
Please fix this asap.

row.Title: more bugs than a hot august night !

row.Sentences: so Mail doesn't work - all my mail accounts are running through google, El Capitan has caused them to stop workingthe apple thunderbolt screen goes black and the only way to fix it is pull out the cable and plug it back init's asked me to install "java' and even though I've done it twice, it still is asking for itC'mon guys - get your act together !
I have an Airbook 2011, best machine I have ever owned .... El Capitan upgrade a complete disaster after two failed attempts to upgrade.
Persistent lock up with OSX launch at login.
Thx for ruining a complete day Apple.
This release tells me they are heading back to their old ways which led to a major drop in market share during the 90's, getting expensive and careless with their QA.
No clear support to solve or understand problem.
Beware Airbook owners, make sure you always back up (like I do) before clicking the free upgrade button.

row.Title: Wifi issues, but otherwise good
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Performance, Safari, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: Problems with wifi regularly disconnecting and then does not reconnect by itself.
Kindly fix this in the next update, Apple!
Otherwise El Capitan is awesome!
Main thing I've noticed is apps and folders all load faster.
And Safari's improved too.
Not using too much of the split screen just yet but I can see it becoming a handy feature.
The download stalls if u pause during download.
Then download error.
Then refuses to download.
2011 early MBP.
it makes everything so much better smoother.
i cant believe after 5 years my mac can still enjoy those software benefits.
thanks apple
Not much different to Yosemite except the split|view, moving the mouse back and fourth quickly makes it bigger (use if you can't find icon) and it is quicker than Yosemite
I downloaded it onto 3 of our computers and it has wrecked all 3 computers, can't get into any of my programs, just keeps freezing and goes nowhere..... would love to delete it.
I have an early 2011 MacBook Pro which is in fantastic condition as I treat it well, and it has no scratches etc.
I have never had any issues with it until I downloaded OS X El Capitan.

First of all I had issues downloading it (I always keep the OS updated, and never had any issues), and after finally successfully updating it to El Capitan, since then I have had the dreaded spinning beach ball on my screen pretty much all the time.
Also just now (which is why I am writing this review) I was just working on my mac when it just switched off!
This has NEVER happened to me before, and it is all stemming from El Capitan.
Apple, please fix this issue as it is unbearable to work with my Mac now, or let me just get back to OS Mavericks.
My Mac is a MacBook Pro, Early 2011 model, 2GH Intel Core i7, 4GB 1333 MHZ DDR.
I currently have 158 GB free as well.
Pros:Much snappier performance (Macbook Pro 2015 model)Faster browsing noticedNew notes update is excellentI like the fontCons:Takes a very long time to download!
Microsoft office incompatibility noted by some - I don't use Outlook, but Onenote is still working fine.
Update anticipated to rectify any other issues.
Verdict:Frustrating download, but worth the performance increase (noticable even on a new Macbook Pro model!)

Folks, I have installed this on an iMac at home and on the work MacBook and have nothing but trouble with Outlook and Motion hanging and crashing all over the place to the point where it is almost unusable.
My strong advice to anyone who has not yet installed this update is WAIT until the problems are resolved.
So I'm not exactly a tech nerd or anything like that but I've noticed a few things....
The font is refreshing although I prefer the other one.
I like the split screen however there are a few things that need ironing out for the next update but that's to be expected with all things that are new.
I'm not impressed however that the screen to the left (when you three finger swipe) is no longer there.
I used that quite regularly for sticky notes, the currency converter etc.
things that I required quick access to.
If there's a way I could get this back it would be much appreciated.
Overall it's a good update.

I was quiet looking forward to the release of OS 10.11 - El Capitan with the improvement to stability and performance being the main aim of this update but sadly I have been using El Capitan for two days and having a lot of issues.
This is very dissapointing after the Stability and Performance improvements promised by Apple.
I have read the reviews in this section and on the whole they seem to be positive but I am not having the same experience.
After installing OS 10.11 I started to watch a movie on my Apple TV to find my MacBook Air kept dropping the connection with my Apple TV a problem I have not had before.
I also experienced a few other cliches so reluctantly I decided to do a clean install of El Capitan.
This seemed to have fixed the problem of losing connection with my Apple TV.
Also I logged on to my MacBook Air today to find iCloud stuck uploading files to iCloud Drive another issue I have never had before.
The only way to fix this was to manually find all the files that it said were still uploading and move them out of iCloud Drive.
I have found Finder to be unstable since the upgrade as well as general operating system instability issues and getting the spinning wheel of death.
So on a personal level I have found this update to be more "buggy" than any other copy of OS X I have used over the last several years ????
?I will continue to test for a couple more days but dare I say it, if my experience with El Capitan does not improve I will be going back to Yosemite.
Also as a side note I have found iOS 9 to be more buugy than any other version of iOS to date as well but that is another review.
Do not downlod this if you run Outlook, Office 365 etc.
It has a known issue where your email freezes and you have to force quit.
MS recommend on their website that you go back to Mavericks.
How can Apple let this happen and when they know about the issue, which they are trying to fix, continue to allow customers to download it without warning them of this issue?
I lost a whole day yesterday just trying to find out what was wrong.
El Capitan is a Pig.
Do yourself a favour and wait for the issues to be corrected after the testing team ie you and me, report the issues to Apple.
Extremely disapointed that Apple have stopped to this level.
I have a lot of problems with the stability (iMac Mini i7), Adobe InDesigned 5.5 by-by.
Not even the new CC trial version.
Problems with the emails and a lot of other software.
I am in lucky situation that I have Windows PC too.
Tha mac was not free, I spendt money.
I missed one day of work with problem solving and bringing back my old PC.
Like everyone else is saying, the download speed is rediculously slow.
I am on ADSL2+ about 7mb/s, I started the download around 3 hours ago and so far have 187Mb out of 6Gb.
I'll be a skeleton before this finishes15 hours in (I just got up) and 1.5Gb.
Maybe it will finish before I die!
Lets all work it out 1.5Gb/15hr = 100Mb/hr.
So divide 6Gb by 100Mb = 60.
That means it's going to take 60 hours!
Well, in the end, 2 days!
Just ran the update and can't tell any difference?
I click download but nothing happens, the download button seems to be frozen.
Does anyone know why, please help!
OS X El Capitan is great (Highly recommend that you get it), but the systemwide font throws me off a little.
Obviously, we all will be, and we all will get used to it once we know it for a while.
However, the new features are great, for example the Mission Control is great, and the "hide menu bar' is also great.

row.Title: DO NOT UPDATE IF YOU ARE RUNNING OFFICE 2011 or 2016

row.Sentences: Check out the forums !
Outlook freezes and will not run on El Capitan.
Microsoft have yet to fix the problem.

Wait until MS confirm they have an update/patch so that Office 365/ Outlook Exchange will run seamlessly on El Capitan otherwise you will loose hours /days of productivity like I and many others have.
If you use Apple Mail, no problems.

row.Title: 7 days it takes me to install?

row.Sentences: It takes me seven days to instal this update.
This is the best Mac update yet, but there is some trouble with it.
Whenever I type in my password to get in, it takes about 5 seconds until it lets me in.
Also when updating to this new software, it took my Mac 20 hrs while on my sisters it only took a few.
Is there a reason why this is happening?
We both have the 13.3" Mac book with retina display 128GB but mine installed the software way slower.
Other than that, this is the best Mac update yet!!

row.Title: Rather disappointing
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Yosemite

row.Sentences: OK, El Capitan is not terrible, but it was an enormous & slow download - took 5 hours to download 6GB, normally my download speeds are much better than that.
Once installed I really couldn't see why the need for such a huge download.

All a bit unfriendly too, with no location given for the download on my computer & an installation process which left me wondering if it was broken because of the long stalls with very little info given.
I really think Apple need to pay a bit more attention to the end user like they used to.
I have just restored Yosemite 10.10.5 onto my Retina MBP.
Because El Capitan did something no previous OS X has done to me before.
It crashed, leaving no option but to reboot it.
Only problem was that following the normal start chime it locked up with about 1cm of "bar' completed.
Just sat there going nowhere with the underside of the MBP getting rather hot.
Switched off & tried again ..... several times - same result.
So a 3 hour restore from back up to Yosemite.
The problem it seems, was not the OS X per se, but my 3rd party VPN client (Private Internet Access) which I have since found out had some conflict with El Capitan.

I now have it all working again on Yosemite, with the VPN software updated but am reluctant to go through the huge download process again only to end up with an operating system which really was hard to see as any great improvement.
I understand that the crash resulted from 3rd party software but really I expected that a new Apple OS should be robust enough to carry on whilst telling me that there was a problem.
I think the refusal to reboot resulted from OS X wanting to join a network at an early stage of the reboot, and getting confused about *which* network.
Selecting a network after booting up would seem sensible (to me).
Upgraded and now hangs every time I open Outlook 365 for Mac.
It has stopped me from operating and now I will have to wait for a fix......help
Well, my much loved and ancient white MacBook (2010) with 2GB of RAM struggled terribly under the weight of Yosemite but it absolutely flies along with El Capitan!
Best upgrade since Snow Leopard.
If you have an older Mac, get this.

row.Title: Pretty Pointless update and ruined iMovie functionality

row.Sentences: I don't mind minor updates that El Capitan seems to be, but since the udate iMovie does not recognise that iCloud drive is turned on and support doesn't seem able to fix or help this issue.
Plus as I said, there does not seem to be any noticeable changes or major enhancements, nothing new I actually use, so- what was the point if it has now ruined my iMovie functionality???
Download and installation of upgrade was quick and painless on my early 2015 13" MAcbook Air.
All my applications worked fine afterwards, no issues.
System feels a little snappier and more responsive as well.
It's hardly an earth shattering update to look at, but it's performed really well.
I had no issues with Yosemite, but this is a welcome upgrade.

row.Title: Breaks IMAP email and no fixes available

row.Sentences: Installing this update broke my IMAP email accounts on both my home and work computers.
There doesn't seem to be any fix available.

I think there was a rewrite of how it uses IMAP which was supposed to be better and faster, but all you get are less options to configure with and so when it can't figure out the settings for itself it doesn't allow you to put them in manually any more.
The other improvements are great and simple things like opening a pdf are now much faster.
The new mission control is much easier to use and I no onger need a third party app to go split screen.
If I knew, I would have definitely waited for the next minor release because there doesn't seem to be a fix for the email issue.
The two dont mix!
Since I have installed El Capitan Mail has been crashing, launching new mail and closing unexpectedly with the usual window of code saying why.
A bit dissapointed, I think like a couple of other reviews here.
I'll be going back to Yosemite until this is well and truly figuted out.
My daughters MACbook Pro will be left on Yosmite I think, she cant afford the drama and possible unknowns which may surface.
So let the rollback from the cube begin!
Updated both a 2010 and 2013 Macbook Pro to from Yosemite to El Capitan without a hitch.
Rating this a solid 15 hamburgers and 3 tropical drinks Ps: Shout out to the Disk Utility devs, thank you!
So frustrating as I love doing my work emails on my imac and now with capitan the coloured wheel just keeps going round and round..
I have been downloading this for a couple of hours now - still telling me 3 days 21 hrs to complete.
So I hate it in that no download has ever taken so long.
have great internet connection, although it could be Turnbull's NBN??
Yosemite didn't take this long on my old Mac
So Apple tell us to update to the newest and best OS X ever.
I am sick of seeing pinwheels and failed google searches and unable to open emails.
What good is splitting the screen when this awful update cannot even handle two apps open at the same time?
Bring back Yosemite!
Worst update ever!!
GUISE IT SAYS ITS GOING TO TAKE 3 DAYS AND 8 HOURS TO DOWNLOAD!!
i LEFT THIS UPDATE TILL LAST MINUTE AND CANT AFFORD TO GO TO SCHOOL WITH A HALF UPLOADED COMPUTER.
I think my tital says it all.
ever since updating to this on my Mac nothing seems to run smoothly and it causes all my apps to crash within minutes of them being open.
DO NOT UPDATE UNTILL THIS IS FIXED AND A NEW VERSON IS LOADED!!!

row.Title: Mail menus do not work on external screen.

row.Sentences: After upgrading, one emmediate fault is that with mail open on my external monitor, none of the menus can be used.
If I drag the Mail window back to my Macbook then they work, drag back to external monitor and they stop.
Apple dropped tha ball on this one.

row.Title: MS Outlook crushes after upgrade Version 10.11

row.Sentences: Apple/Microsoft please fix this problem ASAP-VERY FRUSTRATING AND DISAPPOINTING!

row.Title: Slowest download I have ever encountered!!!

row.Sentences: This will take me 2+ days to download this "update"?!
WTF....come on.
I know most users will be bombarding the servers, but really!
This amount of time is just unjustifiable.
It had better be worth it, when I FINALLY have it installed.
wouldn't download when our MAC is less than 4 months old, not thrilled
its taking ages to download

row.Title: takes very very long to download

row.Sentences: great but the downloading really takes ages but you can still use your mac thats a plus while its downloading

row.Title: Some bugs with screenshot!! Please fix it ASAP!

row.Sentences: Screenshot bug!
I go to get a coffee, come back and my MacPro that's only 6 months old has crashed and restarted.
All of this after going against my instincts and upgrading.
Let me guess, there'll be an update to the software to fix the issue in a few weeks.
Meanwhile, why the hell is there an issue in the first place???
Try and do a better job Apple.

row.Title: Photos Corruption Music Library Gone Post Install

row.Sentences: The install on my MacBook Pro (Retina, 13-inch, Late 2013) took ages yesterday and seemed to work okay but has not.
When I connected my iPhone 5 running iOS 9.0.2 to sync some new photos, told Photos on the Mac must quit as the photo library has become corrupted.
Furthermore, when I select music in iTunes 12.3 all my music library on the Mac bar one voice memo is gone.

The photos and subset of music on my iPhone 5 are still there but not accessible on my MacBook.... Should I roll back TimeMachine to Yosemite and would that even work?A frustration encountered previously was that when you try to refresh synchronisation, the only option is to erase the iPhone not vice versa.
I regard the information on my iPhone as a better master and in this situation that would be critical!

row.Title: MS Outlook keep crashing after upgrade

row.Sentences: evrything seems ok and mac works faster than before, BUT can NO longer use MS Outlook as it keeps crashing - had to force quit.
Other office apps still works tho.
Good but otherwise very frustrating it is not stable yet.
Apple....if you're reading this, please fix the problem soon.
I coud not download that update, it is still not going it has stopped in a point two days ago.
I can not click on Pause or Resume button it says waiting.
Could anyone help me and tell me what to do please.

row.Title: Why is the download taking so long

row.Sentences: Is there any way to download the file from a browser link because I just tried to download a 188mb file through chrome and it downloaded so quickly but like other users, the OS X El Capitan download says it's going to take 2 days and 6 hours
Frankly I am unimpressed.
A massive 6 gig download, then ages to implement.
I left it for half a day to catch up, then found that none of my mail was available.
Worst of all, Apple now want to charge me to fix a problem I didnt have.
If you use pop mail accounts - WAIT till the upgrade issue is fixed.
The seeming improvements are "ho hum".
As soon as I can I am going to downgrade to the last working OS.
I really like Apple but this upgrade is not ready for public release.
Good luck with mail if you do go ahead.
Taking 3 DAYS TO DOWNLOAD and it still downloading
Upgrade to OS X El Capitan only to find my MacBook now running very slow.
The download and up grade has taken about 2 hours!
Once completed even opening this App Store took ages, let alone my internet browser!
Also I have to reload my iTunes library as I have all my music on an external drive instead of the MacBook main drive.
Further to this, now I can only allocate equailizer settings to my music one track at a time.
And cannot copy CD's I have purchased into my iTunes library!
The only thing i found different from my day to day use is split view, the new font and safari looks a bit different.
Othere than that there is seriously nothing that i have noticed.
Almost identicle to Yosemite.
I have an Optic internet connection and it speed tested at 50Mb/Sec download, so why is Apple's servers dishing it up at Dial-up speeds?
Really annoying!!
Download speed is incredibly slow....
I am on a fast and stable connection and it will be many hours if not days before it downloads.
C'mon apple, you're a multi-billion dollar company.
Why don't you have the infrastructure to support this kind of thing?
Absolutely no problems here, upgrade to El Capitan ran perfectly and my iMac is running as smooth as .... well done Apple

row.Title: The Best Upgrade Since Snow Leopard

row.Sentences: OS X hasn't been performing that well recently, but with OS X El Capitan, things are much better.
First off, I love the new font.
And second, the performance is so much better.
Things are snappy, even on my Retina MacBook Pro from late 2013.
Finally, the Mail app is now usuable with Gmail.
Before I had so much trouble getting Gmail working in Mail, now it works like a charm and is fast.
As for the new features, I don't really care.
But Spotlight is nice I guess.

row.Title: i cannot use any of my hard drives!!!

row.Sentences: I just plugged in my hard drive for the first time and it does not allow me to modify any of the files or transfer any files to or from it!!
Please fix this issue URGENTLY as i need them for work can cannot get any of my work off my computer!
its much much faster now and Guys Microsoft works i opened all of them together they all work so you can update.

row.Title: Good but not fantastic and Mail exchange account not working after upgrade

row.Sentences: Upgrade smooth and everything seems to be working except for mail where my exchange accounts (my work mail) is no longer syncing.
Have tried fix suggested but to no avail.
Performance enhancement but not a leap into the future.
Windows 10 is probably much more of a game changer than the Captain.
I'm running last years Macbook Air 2014 with Yosemite and it said its gonna take 2 weeks and 23 hours to download, i've got ADSL+2 FAST Broadband but only 50GB a month on a $149 per month plan.
It's slower than my apple watch OS2 update to download via WiFi!!!
Its crashed a couple of times and i did the pause/resume to download and it seems to have shaved 2 weeks off my download time but i guess everyone is downloading as its the long weekend :).
Can't wait to try the split view as i'm a UNI student and currently use Duet on my iPad as an additional screen at present and this is long overdue this feature.
It's great on the iPad so hopefully its just as awesome on the Macbook Air.
Downloaded and installed without any problems.
I have slow internet too but it seemed to just chug away.
So far everything seems stable and if anything a bti 'snapier'.
Nice work!
OS X El Capitan is working so smoothly on my MacBook Pro 15 inch with retina display!
I couldn't be more happier.
Upgraded and see very little changes in usability.... however, one major difference.
Everything runs more slowly now.
I have both a macbook pro and an IMac, both systems are noticibly slower.
UPDATE if you must, but expect your system to run slower.

row.Title: bad experience with install
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I have just spent the past 2 days rebuilding my iMac.
Thanks Apple - its 2 two days I won't get back.
After downloading El Capitano my iMac went into white screen, over and over again.
It has taken me over 2 days to sort it out.
Had to dowload the new OS to a flash drive and reboot.
Apple you need to make downloading operating systems much easier, faster and more reliable.
I will think twice before upgrading the OS again.
On performance I have not noticed anything better than the previous OS.
My iMac is still very clunky and very slow.

row.Title: Failed to extract a .pkg file?! Kill existing OS X along with it.

row.Sentences: Download took 14+ hours to complete.
During installation it failed to extract Essentials.pkg file and asked for a reboot.
After rebooting the system my existing OS X was missing files and was spewing errors, followed by a rolling reboot cycle.4 hours of restoration I'm back on Yosemite.
Gonna give this one a miss.
Thanks Apple!
Finally have mail that works.
But one program I use most, Photos is getting worse with every update.
After editing photos I no longer can upload to Flickr of Facebook, there isn't any explanation on how to do it.
Some of the simplest actions are the most overlooked with almost every upgrade from iphotos to photos.
When will a stable reliable Photos exist?
The new update is great, but the only thing I want back is the old volume responder sound back :/

row.Title: Thank God i had backed up with Time Capsule

row.Sentences: After installing, I was unable to access iCloud, Mail, Safari, Chrome or iTunes.
My wifi connection was up and running and could acess all these on other devices, but not my Pro once El capitan installed.
Check out Apple support as others are having same issue.
The only solution offered is to retsore from Time Capsule backup to Yosemite.
I am in Australia and after downloaded about 2GB the download was finished and it said ready to install, but obviously it could not work.
I do not have unlimited internet, I (have to) pay per GB and here, in Australia, is so expensive (10$/GB).
So I would to request a better download system, with a great resume of it.
You have to think about everybody, who does not have unlimited internet as well.
I like a direct link to use with my favourite download manager.
So, I have a pretty decent internet connection (100mbit HFC cable), but this thing has taken over 2 days to download!
What the hell apple!
Updated fast and without fault.
Not much difference to Yosemite in terms of performance, split screen is welcome
It runs super smooth on my Mac.
I have been trying to download this update for more than 24 hrs and now it is still sitting at less than 20% complete and "paused and wont restart".
Not at all what I would call a good start to an upgrade of this magnitude and Apple hype.

this has to be the worse way to get a new OS - 7 times i have have to restart the download each time burning more data to get the dreaded "failed to download"i hope when it finally downloads its worth the wait
I have same problem as Pls Help review below.
The update has gone into pause mode and is waiting to download and will not go any further.
I have shutdown, restarted etc and I cannot get it to resume the download.
i also have had very few freezing problems, also my ram filled up to the point a warning box to close apps poped up.
never had this happen before in thee 2 years ive had this macbook.other than that, love it :) great new little features and changes everywhere.
autoCAD doesnt work!!
All I can say is nice work apple.
Some great improvements as usual.
My only problem is it has taken over two days to download this.
My Imac is clean and running well with no connection problems.
Apple you need to have solutions for downloads etc when releasing new software.
For the life of me I just did not understand why it took so long, even after changing the DNS it still took for ever.
Apple needs to have a check list in place and problem solver for each new OS X You only have to look at the past releases to see the same problems again and again.
Have had computer running now for 2 days waiting for download to just start.
All it says is "waiting.... 0 bytes of 6 gig remaining".
This does not seam to be reversible nor can I stop or delete the said begun download.
Its just stuck.
Since updating, my hard drive wont allow me to add or delete from my imac to hard drive anymore.

row.Title: If you own a mid 2010 iMac, don't upgrade

row.Sentences: Since upgrading to this operating system, Safari has bricked.
it will not launch, CPU usage goes through the roof and my iMac overheats.
You can't shut down extensions in preferences because Safari will not load.
Wiping the preference files wont work either.
This is the worst upgrade yet.

row.Title: OS X El Cap really is Yosemite, just better

row.Sentences: Before I begin, I should tell those of you who are wondering that El Capitan is a rock foundation in the Yosemite National Park.
Its name is Spanish for "The Capitan.
"Aesthetically, it's the exact same as OS X Yosemite with the exception of the new San Fransisco font.
This font looks great on Retina Displays but is also much better than Helvetica Neue (the default font of Yosemite), although I still miss Lucida Grande (10.0-10.9.5).
Performance-wise, it really is better than Yosemite.
I'm still using a MacBook (you know, those 13" white polycarbonate ones that they used to have before the new 12" ridiculously thin ones?)
from late 2009, maxed out to 8GB of RAM and a Crucial SSD--and it runs way better than Yosemite.
Still not as good as the Snow Leopard (10.6) it came with, but still MUCH better than Yosemite.
Overall: El Cap takes the strenghts of Yosemite and makes them stronger, while also tightening the loose screws Yosemite had here-and-there.
I came from pc 2 apple in the maverick stage and was happy not to update when yoesmite came along, everything worked fine, but with the capitan was keen to see what was.
So after a few hours of downloading (don't have the fastest internet speed) it was downloaded, then another 40 to 50 minutes to install.

I love the new interface & everything is running very smoothly so far, if anything a little slower than on mavericks, logic Pro X works fine with all my plugins, photos still is a bit glitchy when plugging in my muvi K2,(like imports are dated 2014???????

I am running mac mini 2.3 ghz i7 late 2012 ( got it in 2014 last of the self upgradable ram units) I'm glad I made the switch, little details I love, bigger digital clock in bold, happier red orange green dots, bigger happier rainbow spinning ball, white on black start up screen, looking through more frosted glass, new folders, its the little things and its free.thumbs up for mecheers

row.Title: Big improvement over Yosemite - despite the installation issues

row.Sentences: I have rarely had as many issues maintaining a stable download or installation process.
Clearly, Apple servers were struggling and the installation process was not perfectly refined.
However, my 27 inch iMac (which sits in a so-so area for our wifi) has noticeably improved performance once the update was installed.
Browsing seems to be the most significant improvement.
While there may be slight improvements in other areas, this seems to be the most obvious improvement on my Mac.
I am yet to fully explore the benefits of El Kapitan with apps, but this alone is enough to make the installation struggle worthwhile.
I have had more issues with this upgrade especially in the Beta testing than I have with any other system.
It crashes a lot, it's clunky and I honestly don't find it that great.
I'd like to review, but it has been downloading all day - with another 17 hours to go!
Usually is a snappy download - not a good day to download in Australia?
Also, the App store is slow (I'e checked that other online services are speedy as normal on my cable connection).
Looks like Apple can't handle their demand?

after downloading 2.6GB it stoped and stated an error has occurred.....after several restarts and even a deletion of the partially downloaded application it refuses to download....i am very glad i only use this for doing DSLR stuff and reading the ex CEO of Ashley Madison's emails
its too slow to download.its says that i need two days to download it.i got mcbook pro 2015.please fix it.

row.Title: Outside Perspective
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance

row.Sentences: Running on a Macbook A1342 7,1 with 4Gb Ram, 120Gb SSD.
Download time: 14 hours.
Install time: 40 minutes.
No problems encountered during install.
Issues noticed: Greater battery drain when compared to Yosemite.
Top panel takes a while to appear after logging in to desktop.
Thoughts: I was getting much better performance running Linux.
Battery life in Linux was approximately 10 hours, El Capitan gives me roughly 3 hours.
Boot up in Linux was about 3 seconds, now it's about 8-10 seconds.
Considering OS X has commonality with Linux, I expected better from Apple however Linux is not a solution for the masses who can't invest time into setting up a system.
For what it's worth, El Capitan is much much better than Windows.
Its great i love it but it took 12 hours to download :) but the wait was worth it.
I lost the emails from my inbox.
That was a huge minus, but apart from that, I loved it.
It was also very slow to download.
I can recover my emails from my backup, but I should not have to.
It took me a while to download it but overall it is a great new software :) Cant wait until the next update
Its Great,some issues with downloading it,there was a problem with my provider,but this is Awesome.
Apple Stores,with appointment to get help, a great place to download,or get install,if home internet slow.

row.Title: after 1 night it is still waiting to download - what a joke!

row.Sentences: After smoothely downloading and upgrading my office iMac, I went to do the same with my personal MacBook Pro (mid 2012).
It stop downloading and as I go to restart the process it says "waiting" forever!
Worst part, I do not see how this is going to be fixed!
Come On Apple!
I-was-downloading-it-last0night-and-now-this-morning-whne-i-clicked-on-resume-it-won't-download
found really good and much more faster than previous version.
Hi!i'm still downloading El Capitan onto my MacBook Pro.
Maybe for future updates maybe do a gradual upgrade?
Each week is a 1gb upgrade of certain features?
Maybe im being too judgmental as I dont have the product and im sure it works great once you have it.
From the current reviews it seems to be loads better then yosemite in terms of performance.
However after trying for 2 days already i cannot get past 10mb in terms of downloading.
I have great internet speed and the most recent MBP Retina.
This is disappointing, can't see me getting it for another week or so until things die down.
It's now my second day waiting for this update to download.
Only 1GB so far?
Canceling download and staying with Yosemite lol.
A better version of Yosemite.
I think El Capitan should be the real Yosemite.

row.Title: Couldn't boot pass apple logo! Panic Kernel(CPU 8 caller)

row.Sentences: Horrible, it crashed badly when using Apple Thunderbolt Display or USB Audio.
After few restarts, it would stuck at apple logo.
Now I'm doing restoring from Time Machine 28hours to go!
Day 1: Can't comment yet, as the download has been going for 6 hours and only 1.5Gb downloaded so far .
Day 2: Still downloading!
At this rate, the next update will be ready to downlaod before I am able to install this version.

row.Title: Do not upgrade if you're using Microsoft Office for OS X

row.Sentences: Extraordinarily, El Capitan is not compatible with Microsoft Office for OS X - specifically Microsoft Outlook.
A fix date has not yet been announced.
Stick with Yosemite until this has been addressed.
The download was really slow for me, but that was the same for Yosemite because of my internet speed problems.
That aside, the download I only got about 2 hours ago has already been great, I'm loving the neat split view feature, really handy for all kind of things.
New safari is really good too with the new pin tabs feature.
I really like that.
Although, apart from the goods there is only one bad thing that I have experienced so far, which is the San Franciso font.
I quite like it on my iPhone, easy to read and looks great but on OS X it doesnt look as good as I thought it would be.
I will get used to it, but just a quick thought.
Even though every OS X has its ups and downs I highly recommend people update to OS X El Capitan.
So, so far it's saying 1day 9hours.
I'm on a 105Mbps a sec and I'm only seeing 100-200kbps.
Are you strangling countries outside the USA?
Early days, but despite a few small hiccups, it runs better and is more stable than Yosemite.
I loved Yosemite but it definetly had issues, and El Capitan seems to smooth them out plus adding a few useful features itself.
It does help that I'm running an SSD in my 2012 Macbook Pro, but overall I'm pleasntly suprised by the stablilty of this update :)
Been waiting for this but for some unknown reason it does not seem to want to download 1.96GB out of 6.08GB over 14 hours (REALLY)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
and I have a 30MBps speed.........
I've tried restarting and signing in again and again.
It won't download.
Please fix ASAP

row.Title: lol. it was out of my expect

row.Sentences: I expected the split view could more easily perform as i really need to split the window in more than 2 sides.
However, El Capitan needs to creat a new destop and full screen, not really my taste.
This update is truely better than Yosemite, because of the fact that Yosemite has some issues with the power draining in the most recent updates.
Fo example 10.10.5 drained 50% of my battery in just a hour and 20 minutes.
But the bad thing is that it take for ever to download.
its been 8 hours and i havent finished downloading.

After attempting to download this over the latest ADSL high speed NBN broadband for 10 hours during which download speed spluttered from zero to about 200kbps it finally fell over and now refuses to download.

row.Title: Takes ages to install- also, for the next update...

row.Sentences: Pleeaaasseeee add Siri in the next update!!!!!!!!!!

row.Title: Just as advertised in the keynote

row.Sentences: Thank you Apple for fixing the mess in Yosemite, this is a great update and is recommended to all users running Yosemite, the best thing i like is the faster animations and especially on YouTube videos when putting videos in full screen mode.. the animations are more than twice as fast and the OS is really stable and more reliable
El Capitan brings greater features than Yosemite but there are more bugs now.
If you accidentally went to split screen when you only had one window, you can't just go back to it.
It is also slightly prone to freezing if you have a bit too many things running at once.
Hope this is fixed.
Hopeless and I can't see why Apple expect me to pay for a support call,

row.Title: Imac and Macbook Air - flawless upgrade!! thanks Apple.

row.Sentences: SPRINT dont run to El Capitan - flawless upgrade on 2015 Macbook Air and a 2014 21" Imac with Yosemite - no need for a clean install unless you are having major issues.
Finally have current model hardware that PERFORMS like it should.
Its a subtle change but a welcome change, especially the performance improvements.
Honestly I was worried about the performance improvements being exagerrated, but no its not.

row.Title: Smooth download and installation, and works great.

row.Sentences: El Capitan proved easy to download and install.
It's immediately apparent that the OS X is smoother and faster.
The long awaited split view is fantastic, and safari is more satisfying to use.
However - and this applies to the new iOS, too - I do not like the new font.
I preferred the simpler and cleaner font of the previous OS X and iOS.
The new font appears gimmicky and tacky when bold, and quite difficult to read when regular.
When these two things are mixed together, it's a messy viewing experience.
It may seem pathetic in the grand scheme of things, but the changed font is the single thing that has really brought down the overall impressions of both the new OS X and the new iOS for me.
Otherwise, I'm quite pleased with El Capitan.
It's refreshing to download a new OS X that's noticeably faster and more useful.
What happened to the e-mailsi in my inbox?
They have completely disappeared.
This creates a major problem for me.
If you have Yosemite don't hesitate, the calendar sync with IOS is amazing, in Notes you can do almost as a Page document!
IOS 9 and El Capitan perfect combination!
OS X 10.11 has to be the best OS i have ever used on my macbook pro, all its glitches lag and bugs have been fixed which is why i love this update 10/10 BEST!!
OS X Yosemite last year was a welcome update as it refreshed the whole appearance of my computer, however I found that it slightly slowed down my Mac.
OS X El Capitan builds on the foundation of Yosemite and is what Yosemite should have been last year as it is essentially the same but much snappier.
The new split screen view is a great addition but there should be more efficient method to access this feature.
Only just updated so can't really comment on performance yet but aesthetically I haven't really noticed any difference.
That said, my MacBook has all visuals turned way down to increase performance.
It's a 2010 model - with Apple devices old hardware plus new software seems to equal poor(er) performance.
Probably runs brilliantly on a 2015 model.
To be honest I just like having the newest version in case the update features happen to include "500% performance increase".
Still better than Windows 10.
I love all Yosmite and iOS updates.
I get so excited when their are major changes to the technology.
Apple have never disappointed me and this has just made my apple computer even better!
I love the multitasking feature.
It helps when I am trying to look at two documents at a time!
The performance of OS X El Capitan is amazing.
It has made my Retina MacBook Pro 2015, much faster.
Got the OS today.
Its pretty good.
A bit faster than Yosemite especially when opening .pdf's.
Mail and Calender integration is nifty.
I FIRST GOT YOSEMITE.
BUT I ENDED UP DOWNLOADING CAPITAN.
BECACAUSE IT IS FASTER.
The new features introduced with El Capitan are insignificant and very minor, but the major performance upgrade over Yosemite make this a must install if your running Yosemite.
Just watch out for all the app incompatibilites if your an early adopter.

row.Title: Good work apple- took forever to install

row.Sentences: Good work apple- would love to see siri integrated into macs in the future- other then that not much has changed apart from some performance upgrades

If your mac can support OS X El Capitan Get It, This Operating System is a solid upgrade to your mac, this operating system is very advanced and especially the performance is great, It speeds up your mac making it like a brand new mac that just came out of the box, Apple did a perfect job on this beautiful operating system to really make the most out of it.
Pros:~ The Performance~ Layout~ Everything It's too good!
Thank you Apple for this beautiful operating system!
Works as advertised, worth the upgrade.
I legit dont care
it says its going to take 3 days to download and ive only had my mac for one week with virtually nothing on it.
It's all good, when it comes easy multitasking/ handling.
Feautures just added as needed!
awesome and easy to navigate
If you are on Yosemite do not hesitate to install El Capitan.
The Captan has brought, Increased performance, Spit and Polish that Yosemite was missing, stability and additional security.
Very fresh and spooky11/10

I was so surprise with people's comment, I installed this Operating System without no problem, Users should be reading first before they jumping into in conclusionsome comment made other people confuse, those users that they dont update there PC's regularly, are firsts one to get into problem, then blame it into Manufacturer, or software developer.
Seems like a great upgrade I have had no issues solar everything is working smoothly.
Thanks Appel!
I have an 2011 27" iMac that have been working very well.... until El Capitain.
I loved to use the shortcut Comand+space to open applications, now even this so-basic-feature has been spoiled.
It is SLOW, and thus inefficient.
There are many other disappointments but I use that feature so much that I feel I have a wagon for a computer.
To buy RAM because the operational system is worse then the one before?!
I fell like I have a PC again.
It could slow down using other features, like using "photoshop' and keynote and vlc at the same time.
Seriously guys, please reflect on this.
has slowed my system very badly , although my computer is new and has 4 gb ram and high processor
Only been using Apple Mac's for the past 2 years and I was in AWE how well thaught the updates usually are, there was no issue and no major porblem when updating my MacPro until El Capitan .
This seems to be Microsoft Vista ispired and a total wreck.

After the update which was fast an easy I start noticing issues with my VPN software , first taught was the software but turned out the keychain was somehow corrupted by El Capitan so all my applications using that function were freezing.

Next day I noticed that Adobe reader DC was slow to open file and if file was large it just crashed , next day the Apple Tv Airplay was not working anymore, after some tinkering it will do show image but sound is gone forever so presentatios with sound will no longer play on ATV3 and the list goes on and on.
Benefits of El Capitan ....
I am still to find any , some people say is beautiful , I honestly don't see any big difference vs Yosemite which worked FLAWLESSLY.
Now you might understand my comparision with the MS Vista Flop when a good OS was replaced by a POS like Vista and all users are still shy to upgade to anyhting new fearing the dreaded Vista effect.
Apple PLEASE come up with a tool to downgrade the sstem back to teh bliss of Yosemite....
Only "upgraded" because I was forced to with my purchase of an iphone 6s.
Wished I hadn't bought the phone.
Endless issues, especially with iTunes, which is essentially non-functional with anything but small libraries.

row.Title: Don't Bother! AWFUL OS!!!
row.Topic: Compatibility, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update, Windows

row.Sentences: If you like to watch the beachball spinning, or having Safari do odd things, then you will love this new operating system.
Apps will hang (needing a Force Quit), and things are running more slowly than with the previous OS.
But that's what I get for installing something new on the day it's released.
Really, wait for a while before even thinking of installing this.
Even with the patch that came out a week after the release, there are still too many problems.
And, several of my App Store apps have become corrupt and had to be deleted and downloaded again.
What a waste of time!!
Right now, Windoze is looking pretty good.
At the beginning, everything was good.
But since yesterday (and something I didn't understand) Mail stopped working and made my computer crash.
The screen is freezing, apps are freezing, everything is just saying: unhappy!

row.Title: very unstable worst os i've used

row.Sentences: I have recently upgraded to El Capitan and it is the most unstable os i have ever used been using apple products since 1984.
My apple apps are crashing like crazy.
I can not count the number of times my mail has quit since upgrading.
Im getting all kinds of conflicts and hangups.
I would really like apple to build a stable os before trying to add gimicky features.
I find the see through feature to be more of a distraction than anything.
How about getting back to basics, solid stability and functional design!!
Then through in a few interesting features.
My notes have not synced in 4 months, mail quits constantly, several other apps are hanging up cant tell you which ones because too many are unstable.
Few crashes after updating to 10.11, but since 10.11.1 El Capitan has been rock solid, and a pleasure to use.
Once you use El Capitan, you could never use Windows again, especially Windows 10.
Highly recommend buying a Mac and use OSX 10.11.1 El Capitan.
I am very regretful that I upgraded to El Capitan.
I have had problems with all my programs failing to run.
In particular, my microsoft programs (word, powerpoint, excel), which are all running on the most recent update, crash repeatedly, especially when I try to save my work.
This update has made my school year a nightmare!
Save yourself the full day it took me to download this program, don't do it!
This is the worst thing apple has ever brought out.
I have been unable to get my mail operating right since I installed it on two iMacs.
I have been working with apple support since Oct. 4th and they still haven't solved the problem as of Dec 2.

Ever since I upgraded Safari crashes regularly, I receive server error notices on every third web page I attempt to load and when using other applications if I try to move from one to another everything freezes.
It also does not allow me to use a crucial program that I need for work.
To make matters worse my backup apparently didnt save properly so I am stuck with this until a new one is released.
All in all it has made my Mac useless.
Unless you have a machine that's BRAND NEW, don't bother.
I use a late 2013, 27" iMac, 3.2Ghz i5 with 8GB ram at work.
Switching Finder windows is laggy.
Connecting to server folders is slow.
You'll get modern styling, but you won't get seamless performance.
This review is after several months of use, giving them a chance to deploy fixes.
Thank you for releasing a grotesque operating system that truncated all basic functions on my previously pristine and wonderfully functional Macbook Pro.
The battery loses ten percent every 10 minutes and overheats the casing so drastically that the keys on my keyboard are now hot to the touch after 40 minutes of use!
My bluetooth is totally bonked and won't connect to any devices or dongles (previously recognized or new), wifi has slowed significantly and my mail can't seem to manage syncing.
My 1st gen iPad now works better than my Macbook Pro.
For the love of your computer, HOLD OFF on this OS and stick to Yosemite.
Has made my computer crazzzzzy slow.
I constantly have to restart my laptop.
I have a 3 year old macbook pro, that needs to be restarted atleast twice a day.
I get the spinning wheel of death, every time I open an app, and everything always crashes!
unexpected restarts/lockups/and shut downs........always during videos or dvd's........some serious problems.
I always run a mem check programn after .....always no problems.....must be a software issue with graphics.
Did they hire someone from windows 8 to write this new operating system...........disapointed .....mid 2011 macbook pro....16gb memory

row.Title: Things to be improved, but still great!

row.Sentences: Thanks to Apple for making OS X El Capitan, but I simply belive there are still more things to be taken into consideration to impove the user quality; such as being able to CHNAGE THE FONT SIZE IN SETTINGS; you may even change the font size in some applications now, but then you have to go to PREFRENCES and change it for each application seperately.
