It would be better in my mind to do it generally and then it affects all the applications.
Take care Apple Geniuses,Amir

row.Title: Looks Pretty so does a classic car with no engine..

row.Sentences: I'VE JUST HAD TO WAIT 8 TIMES WHILE THE COMPUTER FROZE WITH THE SPINING DEATH WHEEL JUST TO WRITE THIS STUPID SENTENCE (UPDATE: 14 BY THE END).
Obligated to update to el capitan because of conflicting updates with my phone and itunes, but this blasted update is turning my mac into a 2000$ useless brick.
Thanks a bundle apple for making sure this would actually function before forcing it on the public.
This 4 sentence review has taken me 10 minutes and over 20 freezes.
after reading the negitive reviews on this update!, thank god it failed to update!
got blessed today!.
After the update my macbook would freeze indefinitely at the loading screening, had to reformat HD and leave Yosemite installed.
Com'on apple this is some bs

I have a 2011 Macbook Pro after updating at first it worked great quick shutdown and start up times, after a week my screen started having graphical issues blotches would appear and at times it looked like the pixels were dead it was strange, the battery also started saying it needed to be replaced?

funny i Just had the battery replaced in the last two years and I'm not even over 300 cycles, I took the computer to an Apple store and they told me I needed to replace the battery and logic board, I said no to the idea of spending more on the computer then it's actual worth, I went home and decided I would try downgrading so i downloaded disk maker x made a usb copy of yosimite and installed it, voila all the issues with the computer are now gone my battery is reading as being in good condition and I no longer have any graphical issues at all.
Really Apple I expect alot better then this garbage.
I have never had so many problems with an Apple OS until now.

I have a Mac Mini and a Mabook Pro 2014, and since I've installed El Capitan, my computer keeps planting, frequent disconnections with WIFI, compatibility problem with other applications such as FireFox, Flash Player (fullscreen problem, freeze, etc.).
I think after Mountain Lion Apple has not managed to provide a stable OS.
Thank you Apple.
I installed it on a 6 years old laptop, a 2009 MacBook Pro with 4GB of RAM, and it runs just fine.
I am questioning some of the bad ratings on here, if El Capitan runs this smooth on my old hardware.
I have use it since beta and current version, still buggy.
I found this to be the most irratating OS that I have experienced.
Printer drivers, email issues, weird occasional issues.
Using current MacBookPro and other less than two years old.
Not a hardware issue, nor do I use third party apps, mods.
For an OS that suppose to squash bugs, it is worse.
Sorry, I'm an Apple Fan, but have to be truthful here.
I have recommended to my clients, to wait still, not to upgrade.
It breaks too many things.
I get the feeling, the developers aren't keeping up or checking/testing well their apps.
Upgraded 27" iMac (late 2013) and 11" MacBook Air (mid 2012) without incident.
Effortless upgrade / productive improvements.
As always, make sure you have a complete bootable backup in case a roll-back is required (i.e.
don't be an idiot).
I got a brand new macbook air in September 2014.
It worked perfectly for me until I updated to El Capitan.
Now SO many things dont work and it freezes all the time.
Don't make my mistake and gamble with this update.

row.Title: Well it's gratis but half of older software don't work anymore.

row.Sentences: We having old fils in FCP7 for clients, with motion thats have to be redone.
Now, 1 week after we instalt el capitan, motion donn't work with this version.
No warning by installation.. bravo.
So OS is gratis but you have to buy again new version by apple.
Same with all Adobe softwar unter CS5.
Well don apple.
Way to make money with a gratis OS version.
Stop buying at the moment new apple products.
It's nice to have faster computer, but when after 3 years you have to replace them because you kill them with software.
Why buying good build macs.
Sorry, so only 1 star
I don't know why the lot of you people are having glitches with the update.
I upgraded from Yosemite to El Capitan on my Macbook Pro Mid 2009 and it runs very smooth and with no problems at all.
Im very happy with the new upgrade.
Changing my rating to a two star.
Now that I've spent a little time with this OS I've found it to be very buggy and glitchy.
Firefox crashes constantly on it I watch videos on full screen where as I had never had this problem on Yosemite.
It did improve performance a little bit but with all the errors I kept getting and with the computer randomly shutting off here and there, I can no longer give this OS the 5 star rating I did before.
HI, Since Yosemite, my computer is pretty much useless.
Now, everything is EXTREMELY SLOW, and i have to keep moving my mouse to make things moving on my computer.
Internet is very slow, everything is slow and beach ball too, or not always respeonding right away, it's like my computer is going to die, but, my computer is fairly new.

Please apple, if you see the comments, please help with it, because from what i see, im not the only one having issues, please, ASPA, im getting really desperate, i dont want to have to buy another computer when i dont need too.
When I originally decided to download this OS it worked flawlessly, everything ran better and my battery on my 2012 15" Macbook Pro Retina lasted longer as advertised.
But after a month the honeymoon stage ended and it started having issues.
Initially the outgoing mail server wouldn't work, then preview began closing.
Recently the internet has not been able to hold a connection, most applications now freeze and I've had to restart everything as force quit does nothing.
Friends have had similar problems with this system, would not recommend this OS yet, the idea works but there are lots of bugs that need to be sorted out.
It is the end of November, Finale 2014.5 is a mess, Alesis products still unsupported, Mail opened hundreds of windows all by itself just by turning on the computer.
This must be Mac's Windows Vista moment.
The update has been fine, everything works as it should like in Yosemite.
The only glitch I have found is that the menu bar does take a few seconds to load after the desktop has loaded following login.
For newer computers the update should run perfectly fine but I'd recommend waiting a tad bit before getting it on slightly older computers.
Terrible, nothing works anymore

row.Title: Angry That I Had To Give It Any Stars!

row.Sentences: It's an absolute mess.
Shame on Apple for delivering such trash.
Steve Jobs is turning in his grave ......

row.Title: Seems like the cats climbed up and now its all downhill on the mountains

row.Sentences: Where the **** is the old Disc Utility !!!!

And for Pit's sake why do you turn a usefull, working utility, one could rely on into this piece of garbage?These days avery new "update" from Apple makes me extremely nervous - what's gonna stop working now?I switched to Mac years ago because everything was just working, remember those days?...
When opening microsoft office, it seems as though office tries to open every file ever created on it.
Disappointed to say the least.

row.Title: long start up time; browser freezes; microsoft logs out without warning

row.Sentences: Computer became extremely slow.
Takes a long time to start up, even longer to open an application.
Word will not open properly, crashes every single time.
All of these glitch starts to happen after the update.
Not sure if it is a compatibility issue
My MacBook Pro keychain and iCloud are a mess.
Can't use iMessage system on my computer, have to access my home wifi manually.
Huge disappointment.
I have a 2009 iMac and El Capitan works great!
It took a good hour to install.
All my existing apps work fine.
While it installed apparently well on a 2007 MacBook Pro, it broke the audio on my 2009 iMac.
Repairing permissions and reinstalling did not fix it, so I had to revert to Yosemite to get my audio working correctly again.
Too buggy to risk trying again.
Slowed everything down, constant freezing and lcosing down of applications with this version.
Also drains my battery more than previous.
Avoid if possible!!!
my mac stopped loading pass the grey screen.
i had to format it and lost everything i had on it.
This is the worst apple has to offer.
Everything is useless on my Macbook Pro now.
This OS is the worst yet.
Some of my apps simply stopped working, bug reports constantly, and glitches often.
I wish I had never installed this.

row.Title: So many Compatiblity issues just awful

row.Sentences: I must concur with other users: this is THE WORST OS update that Mac has ever offered.
This is what I have noticed so far:- Adobe CS4: Major compatiblility issues.
File size reduction in Adobe Acrobat won't work any more.
Problems with signature verificaitons.
- Keynote 5.3: color swatch has a nwe appearance that works very poorly.

Exports from Keynote to Images do no longer work (you have to go through PDF for that).- Aperture: can't see external devices- Nikon: none of the Nikon Applications that I am using are still working, most notably Camera Control Pro 2 (granted, I am not sure who is to blame for that).
Right now, I have no way of using my compters for remote photography any more.
#NAME?
Some of them (EPSON DS 50000) no longer work, even with software update through Epson.
If only I had stayed away from this update-I was fine with Yosemite.

row.Title: Capitan vs. Windows 10
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: When I compare the upgrades' processes for both of these systems, hands-down Capitan is the clear winner.
It took me about an hour to tweak my email accounts on the iMac ( yes .... nothing is perfect) after completing the download process ( about 3hrs.).
Installation was a breeze and seamless.
Boot up time is a tad faster and applications load time is about the same from what I've seen so far.
I'm still learning about the new features and options.

I can't say the same things about my upgrade from Windows 7 to Windows 10 .... after checking about compatibility before the process, Microsoft tells me I had no upgrading issues in sight .... that I had 0 (zero) incompatible programs and the whole thing would be lightning fast .... so they said!
After the upgrade .... about half my programs didn't load ( no free upgrades available .... had to purchase newer versions).
System configuration was a nightmare and boot up time definitely slower.
Total time spent so far : about 10 hrs and quite a few $$$ for software.
Still don't know about load time for applications .... some I haven't purchased yet.
Download time for Windows 10 upgrade was over 5hrs.
Draw your own conclusions.

I'm perplexed at the number of negative reviews for Capitan; I've listened to quite a few complaints from friends' and acquaintances requesting my help for their upgrade woes .... only to discover their computers full of pirated software, downloaded torrent files and the likes.
(not to mention piggy back logging on unknown networks....) .... no wonder they're having problems.

I only have one advice for them : get rid of the garbage, spend a few $$$ for legitimate applications even though we all appreciate a "freebie" once in a while and stop leeching from other users' networks without permission.

row.Title: Apples new crash everything app has arrived

row.Sentences: Have been running this update for a few weeks and am reminded daily of what complete garbage it is.
Microsoft Word crashes when I use certain other apps (Lightshot, Google Chrome) and I have lost pages of work in the past couple weeks because of this.
My non-apple apps run incredibly slow, and will often crash without me even operating (i.e.
will crash when running in the background).
I feel like all of these positive reviewers either 1) recently bought their laptop, 2) use their laptops/desktops as $1500 facebook machines or 3) work for Apple.
It's just such garbage!
Reminds me of the iPhone updates.
Someone remind me why I support this company?
If you are a musician El Capitan will break a lot of your music production software.
Native Instruments, Arturia, Elektron Hardware/software.
None of it works properly in El Capitan as of right now.
I am sitting on thousands of dollars of unusable hardware because of this update.

row.Title: Stay with Yosemite
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Speed, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I switched to Apple products from Windows about two years ago.
Love the integration of my desktop, laptop Ipad and iPhone.
All worked seamlessly.
Fast on start up and no delays.
At least that was the case before I upgraded to El Capitan.
Total disaster.
I reset my laptop back to yosemite as it became useless with el capitan.
On my desktop I've been trouble shooting for the last month.
It's gotten to the point where applications take upwards of 5 minutes (Yes you read that right -MINUTES) to open.
And when they open they are unstable and do not work properly.
A lot of the Apple apps themselves are the worst ones, Safari, System Preferences to name the worst ones.
Now my desktop no longer recognizes my headset so I get no sound and system preferences will not work to help me fix the problem.
Until Apple gets this one working right stay away!!!!

row.Title: Everything went right with this one
row.Topic: El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Update, Windows, Yosemite

row.Sentences: Somehow Apple has fixed all the annoyances that used to plague Yosemite and Maverick, for me at least.
Background blurring of Mission Control was causing all the GUI animation stutter.
Now its back to what it used to be a while ago.
Why did you "fix" something that wasn't broken broke Apple?
And the roll back takes 2 solid years.
Now windows even remember their posision AND size on multiple monitors!
Never expected Apple to go that far.
It was by far the worst annoying thing I was dealing with every day.
I had to hold off on upgrading though, until now, because Arturia and Native Instrument sent me emails saying El Capitan broke everything.
They recently announced 10.11.1 has fixed the issues.
My 15" Macbook Pro is May 2015 highest spec model.
And it's finally running as smoothly as I expected it to run.
It did not on Yosemite.
I guess this is what will keep happening from now on.
There's only so much streamlining you can do to a code, that right now OS X is probably at it's limit.
Only way to create the illusion of improvement is to break things first then fix them 2 years later.

row.Title: Some efficiency improvements and some big glitches
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Speed, Support, Update

row.Sentences: Reports of 10.11 speed and efficiency improvements are definitely the case for me.
I also like the upgrades to calendar and email functionality and some of the improvements to the interface.
The reconnection to wireless networks has been significantly sped up and improved.
The 10.11.1 upgrade has fixed most of the issues with the new MS Office (together with an update from Microsoft).
I have had some instances of instability (computer restarting) and some MS Office crashes that did not occur before.
However, the interaction with IOS 9 and personal hotspots has been poorly done and is a big step back for "road warriors" like me who rely on wireless tethering for my laptop.

I have to continuously stop and start my personal hotspot to get it to show up and have wasted hours combing through support pages and tried everything (resetting network connections on the iphone etc etc).
Please fix as this basic functionality is pretty broken.
I have rated this update as a 2-star due to some instability and the big step back in personal hotspot functionality.

row.Title: Smells like Microsoft
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Update

row.Sentences: The sound for my Skype program does not work with this OS.
Some Mac Mail functions have failed.
I lost usaged of the $ 500.00 Bose USB speakers that I bought from Apple, plus the enjoyment of listening to the $ 2000.00 plus worth of iTunes.
It has been over a month with no fix or update.
Why did it take 2 days to download this thing?
I trusted Apple with downloading this OS.
That trust is gone, along with the trust that they will be able to fix it.
The reason I went to Mac from a PC was that I was looking for stability and functionality.
What is disappointing is that I see no noticable improvement with El Capitan.
I updated my mid 2011 iMac and early 2014 MacBook Air easily, without any problems and they both work fine.
That was a month ago and all is well!
On imac, tried 10.11.1 a few times, seemed to be ok, THEN when working with photoshop CS5 kept crashing.
Had to do a restore to previous system 10.11 which it appears doesn't cause any problems.
Going to skip the 10.11.1 update for now.
Anyhow since I had time machine back up on another drive it was an effortless restore.
Apple tech phone guy really helped with the restore.
Unbelievably slow, runs like garbage now
I upgraded from Snow Leopard in order to get Steam working again.
At first, I was skeptical due to all the negative reviews, but I was convinced to give it a try.
Other than the download and install taking awhile, and Mail unexpectedly quitting once, I haven't had any issues.
So far, I've liked most of the new features I've found, and I expect to be pleasantly surprised as I discover more.
I was nervous about upgrading.
If you're reading these reviews, you probably are, too.

If you have half a clue about how to maintain your computer (it seems many of the negative reveiwers don't), and if you know the difference between your OS being buggy and problems actually caused by programs you have installed yourself (this seems to be a big problem for a lot of negative reviewers as well), go ahead and install El Capitan.
I have a mid-2012 13" non-Retina MacBook Pro (500GB HDD, 16GB RAM).
I upgraded all my critical apps to the latest versions.
I got rid of files and apps I don't need or use.
I backed everything up with Time Machine.
I downloaded El Capitan through the App Store.
After a somewhat lenghty download (it's 6GB people, let's be realistic), I started the install.
It went fine.
That was a couple of days after El Capitan came out.
I've had El Capitan running non-stop since then, and I've had one problem.
And it was the fault of a non-Apple software developer.
El Capitan has been solid, stable, fast and responsive.
I don't understand what all the hate is about.
Like a few other reviewers here, I wonder if the people having problems with upgrading are properly maintaining their Macs.
I don't know.
All I know is, El Capitan works for me.

row.Title: Good if you like the spinning rainbow wheel

row.Sentences: If I wanted a computer this slow and glitchy I'd have stuck with windows.
I sure hope they fix it soon.
I have minimal knowledge of computers and their use.
I have just updated Mavericks to El Capitan on my desktop and Yosemite to El Capitan on my notebook computer.
The process was dead easy and reasonably quick with no problems at all.
And everything works fine.
The updated OS is fast, responsive, pleasant in appearance, and easy to use.
I'm very happy indeed with this update!
I had no major trouble updating my mid 2012 mac mini or my 2014 macbook air.
One small glitch was that call forwarding stopped working on my mini but I haven't had time to troubleshoot it - it may be because it's an older computer.

row.Title: I think Apple is losing focus...

row.Sentences: What split screen feature is good for if the system is sluggish?
What emojis are good for if the system is freezing?
Really, emojis?
Everything "just worked" and all we missed for a perfect experience were smiley faces!
I formatted and installed El Capitan from scratch.
I thought my machine had a problem with the old Yosemitee, since for a year refused to shut down or restart properly.
So a fresh start should solve some problems.
Old good apps working perfectly with Bonjour, now became unusable.
I have a 2009 iMac with i7, 16GB of RAM and a SSD.
Is that machine really too "old" to accept El Capitan?
It supposed to improve performance!
And what the sync of the nice checkmarks lists on Notes is good for if my iPhone 5 with iOS 9 refuses to respond to my swipe in order to unlock the screen?
I have an iPod 2nd generation with iOS 4.
Yes, that old.
It responds like a charm.
Yes, old apps, old OS, but it really "just works".
That's why I was buying Apple products.
Why new Apple products do not work like in the old days?I think Apple lost some of its values while focusing on watches, pens, cars and mother ships.
Having read the reviews I held off downloading this update thinking that they would resolve the issues, in typical fashion they have not been addressed.
I downloaded this update last night and am very disappointed.
The one thing I know that I would have used a lot is the split screen as I am always working from web pages and transferring information, this does not work on my 2013 MB Pro.
If I knew the bugs were not fixed I would not have downloaded it, my advice to you is do not download, the amount we pay for hardware we deserve better.

row.Title: The Best OS X for me so far!

row.Sentences: Awesome Mac OS X, AT LONG LAST.... All I can say it that since having updated to El Capitan, my good' ol iMac (24-inch, Early 2009 w/ 3.06 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo & 8 GB 1067 MHz DDR3 & NVIDIA GeForce GT 130 512 MB) has been running almost flawlessly; also, it is now MUCH MUCH FASTER than before OVERALL!!!
The only remaining irritant is Safari still unable to play most videos within the CNN web pages.

As a reminder, however, Apple Inc. as a multinational meant to generate revenue should definitely be more specific regarding PTO (or "Planned Technological Obsolescence" - have I just invented a new acronym!?)

If by, "Improved Performance" and "Refined Experience" Apple means, "Your apps are going to crash, and hang up and your MacBook Pro is going to start to feel like that old PC you dumped three years ago", then yeah, it lives up to it's own hype.
My machine is now way slower than before and I am completely frustrated by the experience.
This "Upgrade" is not yet ready for prime-time.
I am regretting having downloaded and installed it.
I read the reviews a little too late and now am living with my choice :( I sincerely hope an upgrade to the upgrade is in the works and ready to distribute a.s.a.p.
otherwise I may be forced to uninstall and go back to Yosemite.
If I was confident that it was easy to do that I would likely have already done so by now.

row.Title: for this early 2008 iMac (Intel /w 4G ram) this upgrade slows it down

row.Sentences: Now trying to figure out how to revert back to Yosemite at least until bugs are fixed.
Bugs are spinning beach ball can go on "forever' - force quit isn't something I had to use much before but now it has become routine.
Also "waking' after a couple hours of inactivity takes at least 5-10 minutes.
I changed the settings for my hardware and display to "never" go to sleep .... but it still does .... and damn groggy for too long.
So I've found that it is easier to "restart' or shut down and then start up again - faster than trying to allow it to wake on its own.
My temp seems to be running hotter as well - 48 to 50 C (SMC Fan Control).. Now how come I can't find, on this same site, how to uninstall and revert back to Yosemite.
I admit that I had doubts about owning an iMac when I first bought this back in 2008 and Apple has done nothing to win my favour....same with my 1 Gen iPad (landfill item).

Apple still remains secretive/obtuse and access to running processes remains difficult and far from "intuitive" (what a joke that word/idea is ....) Maybe it is time to just turn this thing into a PC.... Apple products remain overpriced; and pander to "label' w..... consumers.
Just my opinion.

row.Title: Should have spent time fixing exisitng issues, not creating new ones...
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: Oh, how I would love for Apple to release an OS in the similar vein to 10.6 Snow Leopard where they actually spent a year fixing all the issues in 10.5 and making the OS far better.
El Capitan isn't refinement, as they put it.
It is still a race to put out new features with their bugs and try to squeeze it all into an annual deadline.
I've been around since 10.5, and I can safely say this is the worst OS update of the lot.
Yes, 10.6 set the bar really high, and successive releases have each lowered that bar.
This is the first OS upgrade where I actually get frustrated at Finder because it spends so much time spinning -- doing what?
All I did was right click on a file, and it takes more than 5 seconds to generate a menu?
The new "split screen" feature?
Only useful if you use full screen, which I can't stand personally.
How about a way to do that with regular windows on the desktop they are on?
Too Windows 7?I can't think of anything redeeming about El Capitan over Yosemite -- oh yeah.
Mail did easier setup with all my mailboxes.
When Mail works, anyhow.
Look at the other reviews - there is only pain.
Stay with Mavericks or Yosemite.
And hope that Apple wakes up one day and realizes their "it just works" mantra they have been saying for years stopped working about 3 years ago.
After updating my photos and contacts were gone.
took it in to computer repairs and photo are there but my contacts are still gone.
Wish I had never done the update.

row.Title: pity there no chance to rate with 0' stars

row.Sentences: I am an Apple devotee for many years with 5 Macs, 3 iPnones and an iPad.
First time it is desappointing to get new OS and roll back to the older one.
Is Apple a new Microsoft now?I immagine Steve sees it ...
Downloaded and installed El Capitan on both my Macbook Pro and Desktop.
Absolutely no issues.
Runs great, doesn't hang.

row.Title: Its not bad.. but needs improvements
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Spotlight, Update

row.Sentences: Currently running El Capitain for a few weeks now on a Macbook Pro 15" Mid 2010 Intel Core i5 2.4ghz with 8gb RAM.
This machine is being used daily for design and publishing/printing running the Adobe CS6 Suite and some other demanding programs.
So far its holding its own, I see the "spinning beachball" more than I would like but it still does the job.
Until I upgrade in January.
It runs my existing programs without a hitch, all my drivers for older printers and peripherals worked with no problems.
Spotlight Search is slow.. painfully slow!
Non responsive sometimes as well2.
My desktop background for my external monitor NEVER stays..
I change it to something other than the standard El Capitain wallpaper and it after a restart the next day, it goes back.
I change it again and today, there is no wallpaper at all!
Its minor, but annoying.
Other than the computer slowing down due to age, the El Capitain update is working.
All my notes, calendar, reminders and contacts sync with my iPhone 6s so there is no issue there.
ok....so I hate the new look.
Some apps are fancier, I love the messaging app and the new iPhoto version.
WTF is up with the mail???
So I hear lots of complaints that mail doesn't work properly....well on my MacBook Pro it won't even OPEN.
It pops up for one second, then automatically shuts off and an apple reporting window pops up with the option to send an error report to Apple (which is useless as far as I'm concerned).

I use my email to work and it is vital that I can access all my accounts simultaneously (which I was doing fine through the Mac Mail app up until this update) so this is actually detrimental to my work and my profit.
Please work diligently to fix these issues immediately Apple.
I see my first review got deleted.... nice apple, really nice!
ANYWAYS, EL CAPITAN HAS COMPLETELY MESSED UP MY MAC, NOTHING WORKS ANYMORE GOING BACK TO YOSEMITE!
I'm extremely surprised and disappointed at how sloppy an upgrade El Capitan was for comparatively few new features that I would ever use or appreciate.
I would revert back to Yosemite but I'm afraid of making my system even more unstable than it already is.
Applications crash for apparently random reasons and Microsoft Office apps are especially bad (which is alarming given how critical they are to a large number of users' desktops).
The instability has affected my work habits - before this OS, I was often lazy and relied on autosaves to safeguard my data.
Since I loaded El Capitan, I've twice now lost hours of work and been unable to retrieve anything but scraps from obscure locations on the disk.
I assumed (foolishly) that this upgrade would probably be a little glitchy but at least stable, so I loaded it without reading any reviews.
That's a mistake I will never make again.

row.Title: No change in speed, but great features.

row.Sentences: When I installed OSX El Capitan, it was slugish at first, but the quality increased.
Browsing was glitchy, but after a couple hours, speed is back to normal.
There is no real difference in speed, but new upgrades to Notes, Safari, and other applications makes this a decent upgrade.
This update just remove all my permission, you dont have the entier controle of your computer anymore!
The permission are restraint!
Yes the fluidity is better, but, only when there is not app running!
I'm a student in college and I was thinking that will, maybe, change something, add some new features....but I was wrong!
It just give me trouble!
You can download this updates but.
I really don't recommande it if you dont really need it.
This is a BIG WASTE OF TIME!!
horrible I have to force quit almost everyday because of the spinning wheel...

row.Title: Breaks WIFI connection when HDMI Cable connected

row.Sentences: When I connect the HDMI cable, plug in my laptop, and close the lid, so I only have one monitor up and running, the wifi connection breaks.
Painless update.
Nice features.
Looks great.
After over twenty-five years of using Apple Macs I have finally become extremely disappointed.
I weathered System 6 to System 7, then to OS X, then PowerPC to Intel.
All transitions were pretty flawless.
El Capitan has turned out to be quite unstable and a huge disruption to my work.
I have to keep the Activity Monitor up at all times to determine which applications are no longer responding leaving me to Force Quit more often than I have ever experienced.
I'll keep sending the report in and hope someone reads them and take some sort of action.
Because of applications becoming unresponsive, my workflow sometimes slows to a snails pace until I discover the culprit.
The two worst results of this upgrade are that the application I required to do my work suddenly would no work any longer.
I had to search for an alternative and purchase it.
Even worse, hundreds of my E-mails disappeared.
It happened during the main upgrade and then again when I installed the update, which I hoped would resolve issues not repeat them or continue them.
I have experienced other minor peculiarities, however I want to keep this short, so I have said enough.
This is unacceptable Apple.
Very unstable version.
Forced to restart my computer constantly.
Please continue to use the older version until Apple fixes this!

row.Title: Great features but still a tiny bit buggy

row.Sentences: The first thing I noticed after installing the update was that every app that launched worked way faster than it had before but the is only what launched immediately after install.
Some of the apps would not launch so I did a quick restart and booted up disk utility to make sure nothing went wrong on my disk.
I found that I had more free space than before and without any files that seemed to have been lost it must have optimized something to do with that as well.
After the restart everything worked and when it worked it worked more smoothly and with seemingly less impact on my cpu and ram.
Overall I've had a couple small and hard to describe bugs but nothing major enough to complain over.
Either way the update improved more than it wrecked for me so I'd say it's a good update and once all the bugs are weeded out it should be one of the best optimization updates so far.
keeps freezing!
Ever since I upgraded to El Capitan, I've been having issues with it.
First it freezes sometimes after I open it from sleep, it would just freeze at the login screen.
Then I couldn't switch between different windows; either that or I couldn't click on anything in the current window.
Next it would sometimes crash by itself when it's asleep.
I have had to restart my Mac way more times in the past week than the last 3 years since I got this Mac!
What kind of upgrade does that?!
It also got rid of the dashboard - which I've found to be VERY useful for me, so there were plenty of frustrations when I realized that nothing happens when I swipe left!
I regret getting this update.
Learn from my lesson, save yourselves and don't get this upgrade yet!
I just bought my first Mac this year, and it was great until this update.
Unfortunately, my App Store hung up and froze every time I opened it, and I ended up resorting to some crazy command stuff in Terminal to try and fix it.
Thankfully it worked, but for the average user like me who just started using Mac, it was difficult to figure out and really stupid to have to do this just to get a program to work.
I have also experienced slow, laggy times and lots of pinwheels.
Now that it's updated properly, I am hoping to not have to deal with that again.
I was hesitating to upgrade from Snow Leopard, reading all the negative reviews here.
But I have to say it was quick, easy, and my computer is SO much more responsive now.
Plus I can use the Spotify app now (it needed at least OS X 10.7).
I have a feeling that Apple smoothed out the bugs, and the app developers fixed any problems that appeared when people were first using it.
Plus it was free!
What's not to love?I don't know if anything will surface, but so far, I have had no problems at all and am pleasantly surprised.
I think that you guys are funny.
Because most of you don't even know how your computer works.
That being said, you don't even know if you use your computer properly and if you make mistakes that produce bugs.
Do you even know what is RAM?
Yeah, messy desktops, full dashboards, big docks, multiple tabs, too much apps openened, etc.
These are all simple examples of what might slow down your computer.
Also, did you know that some problems that you didn't correct before El Capitan may persist?
So, for the people who just enumerate bugs and don't even know why they are there, you should probably inform yourself because you can easily solve most of these problems with a few clicks.
Just be curious!

As for myself, you don't need to be advanced in technologies to be sure of what you say on that : I am a 15 year-old french from Quebec city and I made a project to know all about a MacBook Pro hardware.
Now, I know how it works and I don't criticize El Capitan because I do everything to make my Mac faster.
For those who wonder if the fact that their computer is old makes it slow, obviously, yes, it has a small link!
Because the new updates are optimized and can make more things and old versions of computers sometimes have difficulties to follow.
But there are multiple ways to upgrade them for like the 1/20 of the price (like SSD,or RAM).

Additionally, most people tend to forget that you should always wait before the second update before the big updates (sometimes, apps are not compatible, some bugs stay) and at the second update, usually everything is fine!
I work everyday with every Apple's apps (such as Keynote, Pages, Calender, Final Cut Pro, etc.)

I'm not saying I am an expert at all, but for those who, like me, do really care about the health of their computer (mine is a MacBook Pro mid-2012 by the way, not even Retina), I think this update it really great : it's a perfect match of the design of Yosemite but with greater performances and all the new details make it a wonderful update (notes, split screen, etc.).
In conclusion, I hope that, I helped the ones who thought it was slow and helped those who thought there was too much negativity!
Great update.
Fixed all the crashes I was having on the previous version.
Compalints about the pinwheel are majorly exagerated.
Mail app is buggy, sometimes doesn't show message content and has trouble sending attachments, has to be restarted.
My unit is iMac,3.06 GhZ core two duo 2008, 4 megs ram, 500 gig hd dr. Loading and installation was good, not a hitch although I had very few apps, and very little data present.
Everything seems to be working just fine, graphics are great but he's finicky about whom he'll work with.
I ended up kicking out a couple of apps because of hanging, just not worth the fight.
MS Office 2008 seems to give El Capitan a little bit of heartburn though; mostly Outlook, I suspect they're competing for memory.
I'm going to try loading a couple more gigs ram and hope that helps.
El Capitan doesn't seem to like my app Alfred very much, too bad because I really like Alfred, hope he doesn't make me choose.
The system functions well and my production hasn't suffered, but overall it's slowed down for me, especially boot up.
Still better than PC...

For years I have used an online photo editing tool for work - since upgrading to El Capitan, every time I try to save my edited photo (using any ONLINE editing tool), once I indicate where on my mac I want to save the edited file, the Finder window locks and my Safari becomes useless.
Everything worked great until I moved to this OS X version.

row.Title: What a Feelin'! Running El Cpaitan Beta 3 10.11.2

row.Sentences: Well, Apple you finally did so many Betas that you finally got it right.
While Yosimite was a good update, El Capitan is oh much better in a thousand ways.
I have been Beta testing El Capitan since it was offered in July and at first it didn't function as I had thought.
I have a Mac Laptop (2009) which needed a memory update to 8 Gigs.
Once I did that, everything fell into place.
No endlessly circling wheels and most all my apps worked perfectly.
Every app opens quickly with no crashes.
I am thoroughly pleased that I have taken a part in the betas for both Mac OSx and iOS 9.
I have taken the time to report to Apple all the times I had problems using El Capitan.
This is a no-brainer with no regrets!
Congratulations, apple!
I have read countless negative comments on major issues with El Capitan OSX, but frankly, I have not encounter any major issues.
Perhaps, the Beta versions are somewhat superior to the new released version.
The only one issue I have is sometimes my e-mail will lose connection and have to be closed and reopened.
But, again, that problem is not consistent and happens rarely.

row.Title: Seriously Apple - What is Going On?

row.Sentences: So upgraded my MacBook Air to El Capitain, and every (damn) app that I bought on the App Store was corrupted and required download and reinstall, and iCloud re-setup.
Apps included 1Password (a worry), Dashlane (another worry) Scrivener, MacJournal, Final Draft, Tweetbot, NoteSuite, Coda, DaisyDisk, Skitch, Notesuite, DayOne, and many, many more.
Apple's claim used to be "it just works."
I do not believe that tag line anymore.

Spent over four hours last night just updating Xcode (on another Mac)- it would hang at the 1 minute left mark and then linger for a hour until I killed it and rebooted - to clean out any App Store history - and started again.
After four hours, I got an Xcode install - with zero final excitement at that point.

I converted to Apple because it was a UNIX family OS (great for UNIX-family dev) with a cool, hip, and simple user UI - it was vastly superior to any Windows or Linux OS (from a naive or uninterested-tech user perspective) and had a great device sync and security ecology.
I no longer know.
If Apple intends to sell me on on IWatch bling (Beyonce & Herme) I've lost interest.
I want what Apple promised and delivered back when: "it just works."
Well, it no longer just works.
And I don't have the pocketbook for a Beyonce or Herme "keeping up with the Jones" effort and I am only looking at quality for money in anything Apple that I buy.
So Apple: stop breaking stuff; stop the bling, make it work like it did, make it work solid like Steve Jobs made sure it did: and I'll remain a continued Apple consumer.
Continue on this path that you seem to be on and I'll convert back to Linux - even if I have to do SysAdmin at home.
Seriously: I just want it (Apple products) to work.
I'll buy bling as an addon if I care and can afford later.
But sell your core product on quality, if you can, because that is my only current interest.
As an long time Apple advocate, I am in serious defensive mode with Apple critics, whom I am now in increasing agreement with.
So: Seriously Apple - What is going On?
Can you just get back to "it just works?"
And you are going to have to go far far further in selling my interest in Apple with "showcase" artists like Drake or Beyonce; try an artist of quality - Aimee Mann, say?
Such an artist choice might validate the sophistication you seek to claim.

I don't know if anyone will (get to) read this review, but hey, if anyone does: buy Apple when it sells quality .... when and if..... And I say this as one who really wants to buy Apple, .. when and if.... right now, I am waiting on (an unexpected) when ...

row.Title: Fix me!
row.Topic: El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I love my macbook and I use it all the time for working and gaming.
But ever since I updated to the new update of El Capitan things have been acting a bit weird.1.
Everything is running Slow!
I usualy shut down my macbook at night and then it turns on within seconds of booting.
But since the new update its been acting really slow.
It used to take maybe 10-45 seconds to boot up but now it takes up an average of 3 minutes!
On top of that the spinning color wheel will always pop up and take about minute to open up an application.
I really don't think simple apps like Terminal and TextEdit take that long to load!2.
Where are available NetworksThis never happens at home since when I'm at home I use a twisted pair Ethernet Cord to connect to my laptop.
But when i'm out it can't find any network you have to be really really close to connect.
I checked if this was a hardware issue so I swaped network adapters but still the same problem!3.
Gaming IssuesNow I swear I was able to play Metro Last Light and some Bioshock from time to time but now its just keeps lagging!
I tried to fiddle arround with the graphics options but still it lags.
I even put it to the lowest setting as possible but still no perfect gameplay!

Now I woulnd't say that these issues were all because of my laptop because I have a Macbook pro 15 inch 2013 model with 2.3 ghz intel core i7 16 GB DDR3 RAM and an Intel Iris Pro with a Nvidia GEforce GT 750 M. Switching back to OSX Yosemite fixed all the issues I had before.
So looks like I got to wait a couple of months for them to release an update fixing all these bugs or wait for the next big OSX release.
After reviewing plenty of good and bad reviews I finally took the plunge to find out what I was in for with the most recent software upgrade to El Capitan.
After downloading and installing the software there were a few bugs and applications freezing up.
But, once I upgraded everything (including the apps), everything worked perfectly.
I'm not sure why there are more bad reviews (1 star) than great reviews (5 stars).
At first, I was dreading what would happen to my computer after the upgrade, but after it was all said and done, I was impressed.
I would recommend this upgrade.
The search window usually doesn't appear.
When click Command+F, nothing appear at the top of the window.
When you type the searching keyword, it is still working, but nothing appear at the top of the window.
Sometimes it appears, but usually it doesn't.
I don't know if it is a bug or a weird feature, but it totally makes no sense.
One more thing, all my iCloud notes disappeared, and I did nothing wrong.
It's officially been one entire month, while your representative first promise that things will be done in 48 hours.
I never updated since Snow Leopard because it was running just fine and I was always reading bad reviews on every new Apple's OS X for mac.
But today I was reading more good reviews than bad about El Capitan so I just downloaded and installed it.
The whole process took about an hour.
It works great!
My iMac's responses are faster than before and so far no problems with anything.
Every now and again, my macbook will stop responding.
By not responding i mean it will take a few years for the mouse to move a few inches.
The lag is very very bad.
I wish i hadnt updated to this El capitan software, absolutely horrible.

Upraded to El Capo yesterday and had no access to the internet - well, not until I went into the system preferences, Network, diagnose connection problems, allow keychain access....then the page loaded properly.
Try another web page and had to do the whole process over again - for each page load.
Don't even care if there is a fix for it - don't care - call me when it's bug free - I don't have the time, or the inclination to fight with a new OS.
Yosemite works flawlessly so I went back to that.

row.Title: OS X 10.11 works awesome on many models.

row.Sentences: OS X 10.11 works great on all my Macs (2009 xserve, 2011,2012,2014 Mac mini, 2009, 2010,2012 21.5", 2012 27", and 2011 Macbook Air) If youre having issues I suggest you backup your data and reinstall OS X.
There are bugs guranteed with new OS but not that i can't live with.
One bug in particualr is that my LCD colour changes constantly for no particualr reason.

row.Title: Worst OS in over a decade. By far

row.Sentences: Wow, listen, I don't know where to start so I won't say much but after reading all the negative and (the rare positive) reviews on here and online I felt like I had to just try it out for myself and hope for the best.

After all, negative reception has been frequent on recent OS X launch (they were mainly aesthetic related and I personnally like the different look and so I though people exagerated with the glitches and such).
Unfortunately, they were exagerating.
This is by far the most ->unstable<- OS I have used in over a decade.

(it's not bad enough to make go to windows like some others barked, however, at the time I am writing this review, I have already made a Yosemite install Disk and am about to revert having backed up everything - which wasn't that hard considering I had kept everything on external drives to make a clean wipe of the SSD before installing EL Capitain ( you know, thinking it would make it smooth - wrong) )So afyer 1 weeks of usage, I can say that programmes: photoshop cc, lightroom cc, lightroom 5, lightroom 4, photoshop 6, steam (as well as related games).
Then the worst bit is the computer crashes every day (usually 1-3 times and sometimes can take up to 5 minutes to reopen afterwards, something I have never seen on a mac EVER).
App expose makes the screen bug up and show weird patterns in the windows displayed.

So anyway, I do suggest backing everything up prior to installing, give yourself the extra by formatting prior to install just to put the best luck on your side and don't get too organized because you're probably gonna revert in a week or so and you can't actually revert, you're gonna have to format it again, sorry.
It's worth seeing for yourself.
Just soooooooo bad!
Please @apple I'm a longtime fan and I'm slowly loosing hope that you guys actually care.
We normally accept all the upgrades suggested by Apple, but El Capitan it's impossible to download it.
Too slow, too many errors and when you try to download it again its syas it's been done already.

row.Title: I have a MBP mid 2012 with an i7, 10gb ram and 500gb ssd

row.Sentences: The system freezes more often than you want it to,overall slowness is observed in my initial testing, startups are slower by 10-20 seconds.
System ram usage has doubled as compared to Mavericks.
I use Vmware and osx at the same time and I can say that the computer performed much better on osx mavericks as it had a faster respons time and smoother graphocs.
The only reason I updated was to get hand-off, which by the way, doesnt work !
Plugged in hard drives are not shown anywhere in the system.
Lots and lots of incompaitbilites.
System wide animations are slower, contrary to Apples claims.
Preview cant simply focus on a pdf file.... again on Mavericks, it was much faster at rendering.
Do not update until this os is stable enough.
Bootcamp also failed installing windows 8.1.
Summary: Its a mess !
At first I was skeptical because the email on my MacBook became a problem after I installed El Capitan.
The problem came from my lack of experience in "SMTP" installation from pop to imap.
Once I solved that problem Mac-Air worked like a glider in the sky, letting the winds take me to where I wanted.
Then I installed El Capitan on my MacMini Server.
Now I am glad to work with EL Capitan John B, a Canuck from Toronto:)

row.Title: our 2009 iMac is screaming fast now!

row.Sentences: Thanks Apple!
Suppose the 12GB of RAM, and the Samsung 512GB EVO SSD doesn't hurt :-PApplications launch faster than with Yosemite, and, Yosemite was fast!
I will check boot times, although, it was under 30 seconds from hitting the power button with Yosemite!
Don't know it could be actually faster than that!
MS OFFICE is not working.
Your update has killed my machine!!!
Apple dropped the ball on this one.
Don't install!
Just too too many problems.
Apple needs to fix this mess in a hurry if they don't want to lose the trust thay they have built over the years.
I regret upgrading to the latest OS too soon.

Sure the split screen functionality is super helpful, but I also encountered quite a few bugs (openEmu controller problem, adobe premeiere pro playback problem) that seriously undermined my experience with my experience with El Capitan.

row.Title: If your not ready to buy a new computer,don't download

row.Sentences: I decided to download OS X Yosemite on my perfectly good 2011 MacBook all because it did not speak the same language as my new printer.
Well let me tell you I thought I was back on a Windoze based machine at some internet cafe even though Apple stated it was like "getting a new computer for free'.
My poor MB now suffers from lags,crashes,endless spinning beach balls and unprecidented battery drain.
I was planning onbuying a new computer in the spring to make five years and selling this one but now I just want to make it to Black Friday so I can toss this now worthless piece of junk.
You got me once with this Apple,you won't get me again and I hope that by posting this other people thinking of updating thier OS will think twice!
I very much enjoy the new software and its ability to make split screening possible.
I although would like to state that it would be nice if microsft office 2011 for mac would become compatible for the split screen.
I like to split screen when it comes to writing papers for school and it would be perfect for zero distractions.
dual core iMac with 16 gigs of ram.
I am a retired Graphic Designer so I seldom use many of my graphic programs like Quark, InDesign or Illustrator.
I have not experienced any of the problems many seem to have had.
My iMac has been running smoothly and have had no crashes.
Lately I have been using Keynote to create memorial slide presentations for families I know who have lost a loved one.
The only problem I have had started with Yosemite.
Every so often my WiFi turns off.
Never when I am on my Mac but when I am watching movies and Tv shows I put in iTunes to watch on my Apple Tv.
It only seems to turn off when I am downstairs.
I had hoped it would be corrected with El Capitan but it still happens from time to time.
By the way I did a clean install of El Capitan and migrated all my programs from one of my external back up drives.
All in all I am happy with El Capitan.
I contanly do preventative maintenance with Tech Tool Pro 8, MacBooster 3 and Clean My Mac 3.
I also have Virus manner Plus and Malwarebytes Anti-Malware.
This update has destroyed my computer and ruined my life.
I am a student, this is not a joke.
If you want to use Office 2016, I advise you not to download this OS X update.
Way too many bugs, and my computer has become far slower.
I'm switching back to Yosemite.
Don't upgrade if you have a Windows phone !
With no warning tthe Windows Phone app has been removed.
After updating, my computer has never been slower.
Also, apps keep crashing, even if they're just opened and doing nothing.
For example, I opened my textbook on Preview, like I did with Yosemite, and unlike Yosemite, it kept on crashing.

Working awesome on my mid-2010 MacBook Pro (i5/8 gigs ram/SSD) and so far not one hiccup to speak of, everything seems to be on par with Yosemite if not slightly better performance wise, I'm sure the upgrades to my machine done many moons ago attributed to its success as well.
For the first hour my late 2011 MBP was extremely slowed down and I wrote a scathing review based on the lag.
It must have been doing some work in the background because it's seemingly speedier now.
I will revisit this review after I have had more time to work with it.
FIX THE EMAIL CONNECTING PROBLEM !
ever since the update my wifi connection have been very bad as in very very bad.
try to watch video on youtube the video would lag or the connection would even disconnect and im watch the video in 360p.

I know it isnt my wifi problem cuz my phone,tablet and even my ps4 running smoothly when goin on online, like seriuosly if my ps4 is running smoothly when playing online than there is definitely something wrong with my macbook.
El Capitan serves up all the features it claims to, but slows things down alot.
Most apps seem to be affected, but Apple apps-Mail, Safari, Preview-are especially so.
Sixty seconds for Safari to show a home page on opening?!
Your new companion will be the spinning beach ball.
My machine falls well within the quoted system requirements, but I'm finding El Capitan frustrating.
This is NOT, for me, an improvement on Yosemite, but a considerable step backward.
Download in one hour and installation in one hour.
I have a late 2008 aluminum Macbook upgraded to 4 GB of RAM.
I use it mainly for Gmail, Mail, and web browsing and Slack; and light Word and Excel stuff.
El Capitan works fine for me.
I may have even seen speed boost but didn't run any benchmarks.
Also the new font is a bit easier on the eyes especially on vintage pre-Retina screens.
Upgraded Notes is nice.
None of the other features really jump out at me as I don't use Photos or anything else really.
The split screen functionality isn't as intuitive as Windows but at least it's there.
Not sure why they still haven't changed the Mail app icon.
This release needed more work before it was released.
There are problems with wifi, Safari, Mail and battery life.
We have 2 different Macs and both experience these problems.
Wish we had waited to move away from Yosemite.
I click the download button and nothing happens please fix this.
The OX EL Captain, it's good in general.
But, they some modication it has to be done espacilly for the public transportation of Montreal
If it does't support my m-audio fast track pro.....its useless to me.
I know many people are having issues with external audio interfaces that the latest update supposeldy fixed....but it didn't in my situation.
They brought Metal API to OSX, now my 12 inch Macbook is running much more smoother than in Yosemite.

Those people who claim they have problems are probably some uninformed ones that already installed lots of junkwares back in Yosemite that slow down their machine or are using machines that are more than 3-4 years old.
My experience is much greater than before, smoother, faster, no more UI laggyness and apps are consuming less energy, plus Safari is so much better.
The only minor problem I have there needs some more improvements to the stock Mail app, it's just not great yet and has bugs here and there.
I have a macbook air 13 inch Late 2010, and i thought for sure it was time to get a new mac book.
I thought as a last resort give this new update a try, or restore it back to the orginal.
I am very impressed to say the least.
I do not have any more slow downs, beach balls.. Just happy overall.
Great job on this new update.
Its been 12 hours and already encountering bugs.
I can't open Mac mail or even Outlook.
Hold off on updating until things get sorted out.
I'm indifferent not impressed not dissappointed overall it feels the same.
My mid-2010 MacBook Pro was starting to act up to the point where I was considering a new computer.
I hadn't upgraded to Yosemite after reading some not very positive reviews but decided that I didn't have much to lose and did the El Capitan upgrade.
Download and installation went well with no problems.
My computer ran a little slow initially but after a couple of hours it was zipping along like new.
Most notable is my computer running cooler now and less battery drainage.
Pre-update, the computer battery would run down from 100 to 90% daily - even when plugged in.
Now it is only losing 1 to 2% per week.
All my programs run well with the exception of Safari that developed some conflict with Google.
I have found a fix for it but don't use Safari so haven't tried it.
I believe it is a known issue and I'm not sure it is an El Capitan conflict.
Sorry to hear others are having problems but on my experience I would highly recommend El Capitan.
The swirly beach ball appears every minute, for no apparent reasona nd locks everything up.. for about 20-30 seconds.... absolute rubbish.
I now have to decide whether it is worth going back to Yosemite or waiting for a fix.
The biggest disappointment so far in MacOS since 2005.
Preview is messed up after upgrade, very unstable.

row.Title: So far downloading El Capitan was a huge mistake

row.Sentences: I have been trying to use Safari and everytime I try it freezes.
If I try to use support it freezes.
I've never had a download with more problems.
Will probably go back to previous OS system on my computer until the bugs are worked out.
Nevermind that I couldn't figure out how to get Hotmail to work in the old mail app.
I finally started using INKY (free mail app) and once I installed El Capitan, INKY no longer worked....go figure.
Also trying to test if the default mail app worked in this version, NOPE.
Not only does it not work, I can't even add an account.
Back to reading emails through the browser like a caveman.
I can't begin to describe my frustration with both OS X El Capitan, and Apple as whole.
Starting with the iOS - it's an awful mess.
The entire OS is glitchy, slow, and not compatible with most software suites I use; namely Adobe CC, and Microsoft 365).
My programs are constantly crashing and, in general, are far less responsive than they were in previous versions.
One would think the latest version of an OS would be more streamlined and agile, but this is not the case El Capitan " this is reminiscent of a 1995 Microsoft problem.
Of course, I didn't lose hope, thinking I could simply downgrade to Yosemite, avoiding this upgrade like the bubonic plague, but nothing is that simple in the Apple Ecosystem.
You can't even download Yosemite if you have El Catastrophe on your system.
Apparently, Apple in their great wisdom, decided this wasn't a very wide idea.
Head the warnings regarding OS 10.11....they are all true.
worst apple product ever
El Capitan is faster all round, previewing large Photoshop files in preview is much improved and was kinda puzzled by some folks negative reviews.
All my software works even Capture One.
I do miss the dissapearing smoke cloud when you delete something from the launcher.
After reading many many negative reviews for OS X El Capitan, and researching further online I decided to take the plunge....
I have a new MacBook Pro 15" Retina purchased a few months ago as well as a MacBook Pro 13" late 2011 model.
The new MBPro installed in record time.
So I gritted my teeth and took the plunge with my old faithful.
I am happy to say that both installed successfully and I have been working on both machines equally without glitches.
I did, as one reviewer suggested, clean off my older MBPro before the install-only OS Mavericks was on it, and I made sure all was updated before continuing.
Everything works, even Mail.
Yes, I will have to reinstall previous programs, but I am thinking positively and look forward to all of my Apple devices integrating seamlessly!
Thank you Apple :)

row.Title: it crashed TWICE my NEW Mac Yosemite, I won't recommend it until they fix this bug.

row.Sentences: I want to stop it from showing "to be downloaded" but it clings on for "dear life" .....it crashed twice my Mac Yosemite..........
Ever since upgrading to 10.11, a number of software appliations are simply just crashing when I try to use them.
This is very painful as I cant use this OSX version to do my work.
I need to look for a way to revert to a backup.

row.Title: This is not Apple This is a Crap

row.Sentences: My Imac shut down and restart with no reason and when it work, is ssssssslllllllllloooooooooooooooowwwwwwwww
I was a little apprehensive because of the other reviews but everything went pretty smooth for me.
It took about 2 1/2 hours and was very simple to do.
To me it's not really different than Yosemite but I do like a couple of the neat features that have been added.

The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because I had to wait for the dot one release as I have some third party plugins that weren't compatable with the first release, and a few other minor upgrade annoyances.
I agree with some of the other reviews that Apple doesn't seem to care as much these days.
Still, beats the heck out of Windows 10!

Just completed an upgrade to El Capitan and it worked flawlessly.....pages open in a flash is the first thing one notices, so will have to work at it for a week to see if it all took.....this is my second uprade to El Capitan for 2 Mac pros 2014 2,2......did my backups and copied all my files to a USB drive, but didbn't need them.....but all said I do operate a basic simple computer....all apple aps, no games, word or editing software....on my computers I went into disk utility and did a scan of the hard drive and scanned and repaired anything that was needed before the upgrade....maybe helped maybe not....but all is good
El Capitan isnt allowing me to smoothly update my applications and even the itunes isnt working properly as soon as el capitan was installed.
Yosemite was way better and efficient.
Absolutely disappointed with apple's El Capitan !

row.Title: Don't face major challenges that others face

row.Sentences: After reading all the other reviews, I was very hesitant to upgrade, but now that I have done it on both a Macbook (2015) and Macbook Pro (mid-2012), I have not faced any of the problems people talk about.
For the most part, things are smooth.
Run into some strange graphics renderings from time to time, and Flash is kind of wonky once in a while, but these are things I anticipate will be worked out.
Office seems to work fine with the 11.11.1 version.
Personally, I learned my lesson with Yosemite.
Never install the first version of a new OS.
Just not worth it.
I think after things have been sorted out a bit, most peoples' computers should be fine.
I guess it's the same with this version.
Apple: everybody loves upgrades, but why go through the stress of a new OS version every year?
Actually, I suspect it's more trouble than it's worth...
Ever since update to 10.11.1 Safari has been extremely crashy.
When closing a tab it will freeze enitre computer (2014 retina macbook pro 13 inch) for 30 seconds, and after this happens whole system slows down to become unusable.
Will no longer register clicks, all apps become unresponsive.
Please fix this..... Safari is unusable, system breaking bug, tried clean install and did not help.
I can not even download it no clue why but just nope cant download cant even attempt.
Everything is much faster on my MacBook Pro (2013).
I was very hesitant to download with all the negative comments but took a chance and everything went without a hitch.
I have a 2011 MacBook Pro and I've had no issues with speed and loving all the new features.

I dont ever review apps but i thought i should defend this one, because all those negative reviews made me skeptical but im two days in and my 3 year old 13 inch macbook pro is running way smoother and faster then it did before the update.
This update completely messed up iTunes.
After installing this OS, iTunes became messed up in all kinda ways.
Just installed El Capitain on my 2011 2.7GHz iMac a few days ago and it works fine.
I'm quite happy with it.
It's faster and so far I don't have the glitches I found in Yosemite.
A bit of a glitch with my Logitech mouse but that was fixed in seconds.
Updated my Macbook Pro 15" Retina (late 2013) to OS X El Capitan and it's great, applications open almost twice as fast now.
I work mostly with Adobe CC and everything runs smoothly.
Haven't had any problems.
I updated two of my machines, a MacBook Pro (mid 2009) and a Mini quad core.
I was really impressed with the overall improvement.
It was especially noticeable on my Mac Mini.
I use Logic Pro X and iMovie quite often and that is where I really noticed the performance increase.
For me this was a step up in performance.
You redesigned the beachball because you knew it's all we will be looking at?!
All open apps regularly freeze at once stating it is paused, then stop altogether with restart as the only recourse.
Wifi takes 10x longer to reconnect after sleep, in Yosemite it was almost immediate.
Macbook Air keeps overheating while draining battery.
I had no issues in Yosemite, next time let us know its a downgrade!
Update: I did a fresh new installation of El Capitan on a Mac Mini and everything so far is working well.

row.Title: Slower than molasses in January in the Arctic.

row.Sentences: Can't believe how slow this OS has made my Macbook Pro.
Everything takes 10x longer to open/load.
If I try to open multiple apps at the same time, its seems as if there is an overload and the system just freezes.
Please update soon Apple.
Before I throw my computer out of a window.
I upgraded all of our Macs at home with El Capitan , but it was a mistake.
It crashes about three to four times per day while using safari.

Installed in less than 30 minutes as an upgrade straight from Mavericks.
Runs smoothly.

Apps take forever to open, and when they finally do they constantly freeze and need to be force quit.

Really regret this download...

Then I attempted to open a google doc.
Even after resetting, I found that majority of google programs just didn't work in Safari, forcing me to install Chrome.
This wouldn't be that much of a less except that Chrome runs extremely slow on this version.

I was making song in Garageband, as I so often do and when I exported it, I found that there was random white noise where there shouldn't be, as well as dead silence in spots where there should've been music.
I reopened the Garageband file to find that more than half the song was randomly deleted and/or replaced with messed up midi fragments.
This is a serious problem, as I have made music in Garageband quite seriously for nearly 3 years now and I'm used to how it normally runs.
To suddenly go and through random method breaking bugs such as these in an otherwise harmless update is extremely shameful.
I don't even want to use this piece of junk anymore now that this has happened.
I wish I could go back to the previous version, but I can't because this is Apple and they hate their consumers, living purely on a sequence of planned obsolescence.
Bugs like these have just been getting worse with each update, and I always feel like maybe, just maybe they'll fix something with the new update but they NEVER DO.
Whatever trust relation was between Apple and myself ther was before, it has completely 100% diminished as of today.
I'm never buying anything that runs on the iOS again unless they step it up in a serious bug fixing way.
Just downloaded onto my 27" Desktop i7 in less than an hour.
I really like this new update.
Much faster performance for me all round.
Don't understand the negative comments that I see listed.....

row.Title: Excellent update, no noticeable issues
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Speed, Support, Update

row.Sentences: I also don't understand the reports of all the glitches here.
I updated both my late 2013 iMac and my mid 2009 iMac and both upgraded without any problems.
The 2013 iMac has a fusion drive, so that naturally made everything really speedy to download and install.

However, while the 2009 iMac with a regular hard drive took a lot longer to complete the installation and get up and running again, it had no issues at all and in fact runs a little bit faster and better than it used to on Yosemite.
El Capitan has focused on performance improvements and it shows, even on an older machine - granted it's not exactly a night and day difference, just an overall bit of improvement.
It boots up faster and programs start faster than before.

Based on my experience I would say that most of the people complaining of issues with the upgrade are likely experiencing them due to something specific about their computer or it's setup and installed software.

That being said, I think there have definitely been optimisations for solid state and fusion drives and other newer hardware, because the older machine with the regular hard drive does run significantly slower than it used to on much older versions of OS X (i.e.
Leopard or Lion).
But then that is always the way of things - new versions, while they might get performance improvements, will never run as well on older hardware as the older versions.
The one thing that was a minor annoyance is as a web developer I have development software, such as PHP, installed using the home brew package manager.

Due to El Capitan's new "rootless" feature, which prevents access to certain system-level files even if you provide your administrator password using the sudo command, I had to install some additional packages to replace ones that came with the system so that I had permission to do other related installations and updates and ensure that my development environment had access to what it needed.
Ruby, for example, resides in one of the rootless protected areas, so no matter what I did I was not able to install any Ruby gems.

I therefore had to install a separate copy of Ruby in order to have it live in a place that was not in a rootless protected folder so that I could then install all the gems I need for my development environment.
That, however, would not impact the average user and any power users and developers can easily find appropriate work-arounds.
I would also like to say that if anyone does have issues, I suggest contacting Apple support to get help with it.
Complaining about it here does not help them solve your problem or find and fix any bugs.

Apple tests their products very thoroughly before release and they run a beta program that provides anyone who wants to join it with early release versions so they can test installing it on their computers and provide Apple with feedback.

If you want to actually get your glitches resolved and help Apple improve, you can join the beta program, or at the very least when you're having trouble after an upgrade go through the appropriate support channels to report your issues and get help resolving them.
Biggest mistake ever!
everything is so slow, and I work with fonts a lot, well my fontbook keeps crashing, as does my ultracharactor map ( a paid app) I am unable to do my work!!!
If I had only know the trouble this update would cause me, busiest time of the year for me, I do not have time for this crap!
By far the worst update, it made my computer 10x slower and downgraded my experience by 100%.
Hope this problem is fixed soon
I've been using Mac computers since 1992 and I have never seen an update as aweful as this one.
Come on Apple, you can do way better than this.
This reminds me of the horror stories my Windows friends would tell me back in the 90's.
Steve must be rolling over right now.

row.Title: Ugh
row.Topic: Backup, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: Ever since I downloaded this demon update my wifi connection just hasn't been the same.
Now maybe it's my internet, I don't know but I literally cannot load a damn thing.
Everything takes forever to access.
I'm attempting to load flies to MediaFire & it STILL hasn't loaded from last night.
None of the pages I attempt to access on my Mac are working, the internet is still connected & everything it just doesn't load fast enough.
I didn't backup my computer like I should have so I'm attempting to re-download OS X Yosemite but even that is not even half way downloaded & it's been 24 hours.
I've tried rebooting my modem etc etc & nothing is helping.
This never happened with Yosemite, but now all of a sudden nothing works, & the worst part is, I can't even get Yosemite back quick enough because it isn't downloading properly.
I tried using my time machine but for some reason it looks as if everything has been whiped out.
I can't seem to go back in time further than yesterday.
So basically I have to start from scratch.
I have to re-download Yosemite (as mentioned before, OR attempt too), put it on a USB drive & try to restart my computer with the hopes of putting Yosemite back & eliminating El Capitan.
This is the first time I've ever had a problem with my MacBook Air, & now it's pretty much useless if nothing loads properly or fast enough.
A couple minor problems, but overall it's great.
No idea why the poor reviews about glitches.
I never had a crash, until I did this upgrade.
Two crashes a day now.
Worst performance ever from my 2010 Imac.
Just don't do it.

(At least the ones that I own) - Yamaha and M-Audio included.
Issues with crashing as well.

I've never had an issue with any software up until this update, where external audio interfaces dont work, third party mouse software stopped being recognized and amazingly will not let me downgrade to my version of Mountain Lion.
Avoid update and consider a PC
Greatly enhanced the proccessing power of my Macbook Pro, I was worried it would ruin my laptop with all the bad reviews but I haven't found a problem yet!

Mac Pro Late 2013I'm a professional editor on FCPX, After Effects.

Opening photos the first time after restart with Yosemite 22 sec.
with El Capitan 9 sec.
Safari with Yosemite after restart 10 sec.
with El Capitan 4 sec.
2.5 times faster opening.
I checked applications reopening after closing and that speed increased much.

faster it still took 1 min.
All in all, it is a good upgrade, not much change but significant faster.
The only small problem I encountered was that at one time I dropped out of Apple TV which never happened before.
I highly recommend the upgrade.
I may have to go back to an older version of OSX.

So many problems with the Main/Calendar/Reminder programs and iCloud that I had to use Time Machine backup to restore my whole MacBook Pro.
Do not proceed unless you have an up to date, reliable backup (as you always should!)
and some time to waste.
EVERYTIME I OPEN A JPG I GET A GREEN IMAGE IN PREVIEW AND NO WAY TO REMOVE IT !!!
WE NEED AN UPDATE TO FIX THIS EVEN IN 10.11.1 IT ISNT FIXED!!
