Good thing I had made a backup of the previous OS to revert to.
Total garbage and a let down.
You've done better Apple.
If you have any encryted files be sure to unencryt your data before switching over to el capitan.
Also backup always backup.
If you are working on major projects and use your computer for daily activites you are better off waiting until a 3rd or 4th release of the system.
I have no succesfully switched back to Yosemite.
It's probably a great update, but like any update there are always bugs that need to be squashed.

row.Title: Just works, faster, more responsive, no crash untill now

row.Sentences: Updated my MacBook Pro mid 2012 Retina, and works like a charm.
Way better than Yosemite (was a real Apple's Windows Vista ....).
Highly recoomended to update, no more wifi problems, no more iPhoto problems.
One problem still : AirDrop not working correctly.... PROS:FasterMore responsiveWifi Works (compared to Yosemite)CORNS:AirDrop not working like it should
great update!
crisp and clean look!
like everything about it except the new battery life.
went from 100% to 67% in about 1 hour after unplugging.
only apps running were three tabs in safari and calendar.
please send out an update to rectify this, thanks.mac detailsMacBook Pro (13-inch, Mid 2012)2.9 GHz Intel Core i78 GB 1600 MHz DDR3Intel HD Graphics 4000 1536 MB
Fixed all my issues.
Incredibly fast and my internet does not disconnect now.
Apps open with lightening speed.
Best decision I made this year.
You wont regret it.
Way to go Apple.
frustrating to see that Outlook crashes and will not function.

OS X El Capitan has finally delivered the computer I paid for: a late 2014 5k iMac which finally loads facebook and launches mission control without lag, and no longer experiences continual sleep wake failures.
Two big thumbs up.
Good os but i lost all my mailbox's in mail.
They all still exist on my iphone and iPad but have dissapeared on iMac.
Please fix this soon!

row.Title: Serious compatibility issues with preexisting software

row.Sentences: There is no performance boost, is very glitchy, and again not back compatible with apps from Yosemite.
Garbage again from Apple.

row.Title: Initial release partially broke MS Office 2016

row.Sentences: My Macs are running very nicely under El Capitan - except MS Office 2016.
Don't upgrade unitl that problem is fixed if you rely on MS Office.
I can get work done, but I have had some odd crashes, as have many others.
For people who use audio based software such as Adobe Audition, DO NOT download this update as it will not all you to use the software fully and result in crashing.
It won't let you use certain plug-ins for some stupid reason............thanks apple.
late 2014 macbook air loves this update i wonder if i have to reboot this year lol!!!!
I'm so mad at myself for suffering through windows from 3.1 to 8 :P
I just cant say what is bad.
Best update so far!
I update Oct 2 2015, When everything install finished, run EI.
Looks niceBut there is a big problem, the temperature reach 70C degree(not F).
I close all the running app, the temperature still up to 65C degreeand the fan keep running, cause noise.
Former OS X (Yosemite) only run at 41C-45C.
anybody has idea about that?
Hey Guys, I like this upgrate alot, but if you are running office 2011 its slow and outlook will open and will freeze and not work, have to force quite it then reopen and if hope it will work.
Apple please fix this.

row.Title: Update OK but what happened to IPhotos

row.Sentences: Since uploading El Capitan, my IPhoto has been replaced with an icon call"Photos".
I cannot share to Facebook as the app apears to not sync properly with Facebook since tyhe upload.
Then a message pops up saying my version of Photos needs to be updated to work with El Capitan.

I opened the App Stote and it tells me that the updated IPhoto app is not available in the Canadian app store.....other programs seem to be working OK....its just the IPhoto app whoch seems to have a bug (in Canada at least)...
Has anybody else been having issues with the mail application?
Every time I open it, it lags my computer a lot, it takes a lot of time to process simple tasks.
It may be an issue in general, or for some reason it is only for me.
The operating system itself appears to be running smoothly.
Hoping there is a compatibality fix soon for ESET security.
It has changed my Share so now I can;t send a file to email (big issue).
I can't access WD MyCloud where my Time Machine backups are so I can revert back to 10.10Too bad Steve Jobs was not here......
Mouse has a noticable delay when playing Minecraft in fullscreen than in Mavericks, but it seems that this OS is ok otherwise.
I found a few features a little laggy but full screening seemed to happen very fast.
I didn't try any other apps to the MAX like video editing but I will wait for when Minecraft and Apple optimizes their respective performance.
I restarted my Mac and held Command R at the tone to restore back to Mavericks.
I'm running Mavericks right now and it seems to perform better for now.
Mac Mini Early 20098GB RAMOver 400GB free on HD2.0Ghz intel Core 2 Duo processor
The new feature is cool, like the split screen.
But why the computer restarts itself when display is automatically off after few minutes?

row.Title: Waiting to be excited the way all you enjoying.

row.Sentences: I am downloading and waiting.
I am reading all your reviews and waiting for see all those fun part.
I will like that split view.
I wish Siri can come with EI Capitan on my Mac Book Pro.
Update took me around a week to download.....

Its so sleek and mordern looking I love it, The whole setup on your mac looks so different and I know its weird but I cant stop typing because the imessage fonts look different- Ok yes i'm weird but i LOVE this update.
It installs quickly, only takes 30-60 minutes.
I just installed mine.
Very fast with mail, google, safari and all that.
I recommend you download google chrome and use that as your main browser instead of safari because google is faster for whatever laptop company you are using.

I also recommend to download CleanMyMac3 for free because it cleans out your mac really easily and in a couple of minutes and scans through your junk and all your applications to look for trash, space takers, viruses and all that.
I think this is my favourite Software update by mac yet and I am pretty happy I installed this.
100% recommended to install.

row.Title: only able to boot in safe mode

row.Sentences: I wish I had not upgraded to this new vesion on OS X right now I might have to wipe my HD and start from scratch it look like a good load but on the final boot I get a kernel Panic error over and over again.
the only way I can use my computer is to boot in safe mode.
I spent 2 hour with apple customer servece although they were trying to be helpfull they were not able to fix the problem and indicated that a HD wipe was very likely the only solution.
I wish yosemeti was still available in the app stope so I can reload it to get my computer back

row.Title: One of the best update yet

row.Sentences: This version of OS X is more stable.
Before you start installing this version, make sure do a BACKUP of your system.
I didnt encountered any problems during the install process.
Make sure you have enough disk space though as it will act really slow ( i guess its a basic problem of every OS).
I only had 120~ GB left on my hard drive, so i bought a new one with 2 TB capacity.
Run an update of all your applications after the install as i had issues some of my apps.
Overall performance is great so far..... 5 stars!

row.Title: Thought there would be more to it.

row.Sentences: Not really sure what has changed since Yosemite.
Took almost 2 and a half days to download cause Apples servers were too busy.
Installed it on a brand new 27" iMac 5k retina right out of the box.
The computer wouldn't restart after loading El Capitan.
Seems to be slower than Yosemite and glitchy.
This update is so cool!
There are cool new featues that fit in the ios9 update.
i like the call cursor function and the multitask

row.Title: Solid performance boost, and useful refinements

row.Sentences: El Capitan brings a good performance boost, and I really like the faster transition to full screen apps.
Safari has some great improvements, and many other apps have solid improvements.
This is a good solid update.
Adobe Lightroom, Photoshop and Final Cut Pro X had zero issues after the update.
Capture One users should hold off for a bit.
Otherwise it was installed on a Macbook Air and Mac Pro system and ran flawlessy with exception of my Mail app which has no lost it's outgoing server information.
I don't notice much of a performance difference on the Mac Pro but the Air definitely feels a little snappier!

row.Title: Bootchamp Does Not Work With El Capitan

row.Sentences: If you use Bootchamp at all, don't upgrade yet.
Comes up with an error, "Bless Failed".
Super frustrating.... hope a fix comes very soon!
more crisp, yes!
but it made my battery die alot quicker aswell as made my macbook air heat up.
The fan became super noisy.
i never encountered this with Yosemite 10.10.5. i now restored from backup in timemachine.
i did not like this update for those reasons!
but if you are curious, make sure to backup be4 you update to El Capitan
Overall, exactly what I was expecting.
A smooth and easy upgrade from Yosemite with very little in the way of issues, other than a few older applications that needed or still need to be updated for the new system.
The available features and new functionality is obviously and mostly under the hood.
There is not a lot of visible change in the interface and applications from the previous system, so if you are looking for a lot of glitz and glam, then be prepared to be disappointed.
The interface enhancements are subtle and not obtrusive.
After the initial upgrade, things were a little slow at first: windows took a while to redraw their contents and a few of the base programs took a long to launch or present their windows.
This was expected and by the second day of use, most of this slow performance went away.
Some of the new interface features are a little hard to find and invoke... definitely not intuitive.
Apple needs to roll a lot more of the interface configuration into the System Preferences, where configuration of the operating system belongs.
Still exploring the overall changes, but I give it a generally high mark overall after three days of use.
This may change as I explore further; I may find a few things that are disappointing resulting in a lower rating, but so far so good.
While everything is running a lot faster than before the update, there are still a couple issues that I have found so far:1.
Preview is running at a snail's pace.
It works fine for small documents, but upwards of 1000 pages, you will wait forever to save any changes you make.
I've had to close the program multliple times.2.
Split view only works with certain applications.
I will be sticking to my BetterSnapTool app until further notice.
Installed on on two systems, on the third system it bricked it (recovery mode showed the disk as fine, but the system wouldn't boot), had to restore from time machine.
Love all the improvements but apple forgot one part, picture in picture for videos like on the ipad.
Would love to see an update including this feature.

After installing the this new OS, here are the issues that I'm coming across:- Java pop up message (I'm not sure if my java is working properly)- My dock is frozen after a few minutes of turning on the computer- Chrome is lagging- None of my trackpad guestures are working- My laptop is louder than normal; with no programs running, it says that it's using up over 90% of it's memoryAre these issues happening with anyone else?
I am actually thoroughly impressed by this update.
When I read that El Capitan was supposed to improve speed performance, I was slightly skeptical.
Most updates that I've done in the past either slowed down my MacBook Pro, or no changes occurred.
The first couple times I started up my MacBook after downloading El Capitan, it was a bit slower.
But after using it more often, it sped up and there are no problems anymore now.
I've truly noticed significant speed changes in El Capitan, especially when using Safari.
I'm really impressed, I love the new sleek fonts, the split-screen feature, and the new features in Safari (muting a tab, for example).

row.Title: Flawless upgrade on my MacBook Pro early 2011

row.Sentences: After some trepidation arising from the age of my MacBook Pro, I went ahead.
The upgrade went flawlessly.
I was previously running the latest OSX before the upgrade and did complete housecleaning recently.
Noticeable performance boost and some improvements over previous OS software imho.

row.Title: Computer won't boot after EL Captan version 10.11

row.Sentences: Major problem.
EL Captain won't boot after installation.
Need help Apple ??
The El Cap update has slowed down the performance of my 27" 3.5 GHz Intel Core i7 32 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 iMac.
This is for basic operation such as mail, photo and iTunes.
Also the startup takes longer and the machine often becomes "non-responsive".
The split screen feature is buggy and not intuitive.
In general, I don't see any improvements.
The iMovie theatre no longer works (this has been reported and seems to be a common issue)
Yosemite had mix feelings for me, I liked the new redesign but I hated the lag and bugs that came along with it.
I was happy to hear that this OS El Capitan was released finally, the wait was worth it!
Apple really nailed it with everything, I have had no problems with this so far and everything is FAST!
This is on a 2011 MacbookPro who knows what itll do on a newer Mac!
Thanks Apple :)
Yosemite was perfectly fine.
Updated to El Capitan and preview is not working.
If it does work it shows my pictures as a green screen.

row.Title: Possibly the best point-zero OS X release ever

row.Sentences: My late 2013 retina MacBook Pro no longer feels like a 10 year old machine; things like switching apps, swiping between desktops, and using Mission Control are all fast and smooth again (after a year of constant aggravation).
The Japanese input mode (Kotoeri) was also badly broken in Yosemite (and never entirely fixed); now it's all working again, and the new live conversion works very well.
Honestly I think Yosemite should never have been released at all (worst OS X release since Tiger).
Since none of the new features (such as Handoff) ever worked properly or reliably anyway, I don't know why they didn't just spend an extra year getting it right.
It's taking my laptop 2 days to update
The upgrade took 45 min, its fast , beautiful and best upgrade I did with apple so far.

row.Title: A Minor But Effective Upgrade from Yosemite

row.Sentences: I installed this on day 1 when it was released and it was worth while.
No negatives so far (4 days later).
It basically is a minor OS update, but the additions might be useful.
It is claimed to be faster and more stable and so far I think I agree, with faster app switching and faster application launch times.
Using a late 2013 iMac.
Basically if you have a modern Mac there is no reason not to upgrade if it is a home computer.
I tried to update yesterday before sleep, then I paused it.
I opened it up today, but it was like pausing all day!
Does any one know how to continue the updating??
I have been trying to down load OS X Maverick for a week and was even using internet cable instead of wifi to make it faster and it was downloading 300mb an hour!
Then after getting to 2 gigs it decides to switch to downloading El Capitan and going just as slow and a gig more

row.Title: BEWARE: Lot of apps will stop working.

row.Sentences: While I've always consider myself someone that tries new apps (even in beta) and support in general new technologies/softwares.
OSX 10.11 "El Capitan" really dissapointed me.

The improves are really minors and minor is actually exaggerated, on the other hand, the problems caused by the adoption of something called System Integrity Protection (SIP) which is a new security feature introduced by Apple.

That's good, don't get me wrong, but unfortunately it prevents several reliable softwares (that I've bought) from working on this version.... and actually a few companies stopped developing their software because this "feature".
Yes, you could turn this feature off, but why?
is not the purpose of all this, having new cool experiences as user?.

Another little thing, disk utility was redesigned and now is pretty much useless.... really hard to just copy an iso into a usb (for example if you want to create a bootable OS X installation USB)....about the new additions....
The split screen is good, but still clumsy .
Notes delivers more and richer way to take your personal notes, but nothing wow.
In terms of performance I don't see a big change.
Too much troubles for just the split screen and notes in steroids, dont you think?

row.Title: Doesn't work with MS Outlook - Read before you Upgrade

row.Sentences: Check mail problems online before you upgrade.
It appears to have broken all versions of Outlook and I had some problems with Mac Mail as well.
All the other features of El Capitan seem to work as advertised.
Haven't noticed any performance improvement,but noticed only that apps began to crash more frequently and everything became verry buggy,though new wallpaper is really nice
Its actly great I recomend everyone to update to this version of os x its very stable.
It does not have a lot of new features its like a mini update from yosemity.
It makes my imac 2010 seem like I baught it just yesterday.

i downloaded el cap just now when it restarted it froze it wasn't moving .... so i restarted manually with the power button i don't know if i have the full version there no transit information for Vancouver Canada and cursor does not enlarge ...
I bought a Macbook Pro Retina in 2012 and was not satisfied at all due to lagging in the system animation and other performance issues.
I was thinking of switching back to PC because I felt the user experience was not great as what other people say and not as advertised.
After upgrading to this version of OS, it changed everything.
Buttery smooth, fast performance, much better work flow with split view.
Great job Apple
Split View + New Mission Control - The best multitasking experience that a Mac has ever delivered.
:DPreformance - My mid-2010 iMac works better than ever now :oImproved Apps - Specifically the Notes app and the Photos app.
Overall - El Capitan isn't big like Yosemite was, but it makes Mac so much better and so much more powerful when it comes to multitasking.
I can't think of a SINGLE reason somebody would not want to upgrade.
After updating my computer is now significantly slower.
The best operating system just keeps getting better.
It just needs Siri.

Fantastic OS, downloaded on my MB air (late 2013) and iMac- Speed boost is the most noticeable, notes is on track to kill evernote and pinned/mute tabs are so needed.. We asked for alot of these updates and got them.. but its even better to get features that you didnt even know you needed.
Tried to upgrade on my Mac Mini (Mid 2011) last night and it can completed, crashed et the end.
Have to restore from Time machine and it took few hours!!!
After I updated my MacBook Air star restaring sudenlly witout having any application running.
His doing that at list two times a day.
It's drive my crazy.
So, I have an old Macbook Pro.
Like old old.
Mid 2006 old, the first Macbook pro there was.
So you can imagine how laggy it can be on Mavericks!
Now I'm on El Capitan.
And I cant belive how much more fast it is!
The only time it lags a bit is when I use all the shaders I can find in a game.
And it lags to 20-8 fps.
Depending on the visual lag.
Well, if you are looking to upgrade.
I love apples products and the software they develop for the products.
This is the best OS by far and like always I never have any issues.
Perfect Perfect Perfect.
Thank you for the free OS :)
Hi, why I cannot download the El Capitan.
My iMac is Mavericks.
It says Go to previous purchase.
Do I need to purchase the El Capitan?
or it is not compatible to iMac?
Need some advice guys.
So far so good.
I love Yosemite and this new upgrade is great and contains things that actually nenefit and improve the user experience of Apple users.
Haven't experienced any bugs yet or problems and the update process was optional, easy and non instrusive.

I mention these things as important to me because I tried Windows 10 and it was bug filled, hardly runs anything properly, has built in spyware, is laggy, and is just a poorly made, terrible operating system for users with automatic broken updates to boot, unless your a business pro user, then your updates are optional until tey have been tested on the jome users.
Anyways just makes me a hapier OS X/Apple user.
Great OS, easy upgrade process, lots of actually useful new fueatures.
I always trust Apple updates.

row.Title: El Capitan, the first OS X update that actually works

row.Sentences: I downloaded it, installed it and not one issue.. a first.
My 2011 MBP appears a little snappier and I like the new features.
So far I'm really impressed...
They absolutely nailed it with this OS.
I have a MacBook Air early 2014 and it runs smoothly.
I also have windows 7 running on Parallels, so far no problems whatsoever (knock on the wood).
It's identical to OS Yosemite however much faster, smoother and reliable.
So far so good, except one thing.
I can't get google earth to work and use it a lot!

row.Title: A Forest hidden with CHOPPY TRANSITION.

row.Sentences: My specs for Macbook air 13'' 2015 ; 2.2 Ghz i7 Core w/ 8 gb RAM.
I downloaded the new iOS this morning.
After being installed and played with, I noticed an increase in TRANSITION LAG.
Every time I switched between windows it lags ( a little).
Also bringing up the dock (when hidden), lags a little.
The transition when starting or bringing up applications, again, little lag.
All the "little lags" add up to a very annoyed experience with the new IOS " EL CAPITAN".
PLEASE FIX THIS BS* issue.
This shoudnt be happening with a Macbook Air with max spec upgrades.
I honestly preferred using yosemite compared with the "a little laggy" iOS el capitan.
Runs very smooth, but that limitations for old mac older than 2011 is completelly artificial.
I hve MacBook Pro 2011 with very good video card, but I don't have METAL :( Also Spotlight doesn't work as new, jsut as regular spotlight.
This is a great update, but beware if you have the new Microsoft set of programs (Word, PPT, Excel, Outlook, etc.).
With the new update these programs are constantly crashing, sometimes to the point where they are not functional.
I stayed with Mavericks and skipped Yosemite, but when I saw the reviews for El Capitan, I couldn't resist.
This is a HUGE improvement for me and I've noticed it both in smoothness of apps + battery.
My MBP 2012 retina seems more optimized now and I would recommend anyone that is hesitant in upgrading to do so.
The update itself took a long time, but well worth the wait.
installed on 2 macbook pros.
El Capitan works flawlessly on the 2007 and adds a much needed performance boost.... but the 2012 macbook pro is a buggy mess.
Mail won't accept any of my passwords, and the whole system is laggy and full of visual glitches.
Also, apps that have never crashed before are crashing on the 2012.
Same apps work fine on the 2007.
The update was installed the exact same way on both laptops, and both run the exact same software (the 2007 is my backup machine).
Going back to my old faithful 2007 pro until an update is released for my 2012.

row.Title: New life in the old MacBook

row.Sentences: Aside from some annoying Mail issues and having to reset my accounts, El Capitan has been great so far (day 2).
Don't despair about the slowness at first - OSX has a ton of stuff to catch up on.
For example, my IMAP accounts have taken a long time to load in.
BUT - everything is faster; a lot faster - loading apps, fetching web sites, connecting to the network, etc, etcFor now, I'm back to Safari and Mail after dumping them a couple of years ago.
My Wi-Fi network automatically reconnects after sleep!
Looks good except for my MS Outlook.
Not sure if it's Apple's or Microsoft's but just an FYI that my Outlook keeps on freezing.
Have to force quit and restart and after awhile - it's not responding again.
15 minutes into the new OS: looks great, however i cannot send an email without Mail crashing...
GUI is a lot more smoother than Yosemite

row.Title: Don't bother, at least not yet

row.Sentences: There are some useful and nice features in this update, however, the kernel now uses a lot more resources (you are going to notice).

Google chrome is now unusable (it runs as fast as if you were using a dial up connection), even though both apple and google say chrome is fully compatible with el capitan (they still have to patch it up or even say something).
If you use safari, it's a similar story, the load times in safari 9 are eternal.
There performance issues all over the place even doing only routine tasks.
Avoid this update until they actually fix these issues, because there are a lot of them.
I have a Mid-2010 Macbook Pro.
and this update was a significant performance boost for me.
Yosemite was a bit laggy in some UI effects and also in browsing the web, specially in Facebook.
But everything is fast and smooth after this update.

row.Title: Don't really notice a difference, except...

row.Sentences: MY WIDGETS ARE GONE!
ive tried too download twice now but it keeps saying there is an error
Subtle additions to the most-used applications like Notes, makes this OS the very reason I stay with the Mac OS.
Keep it up to date, and listen to your user base for needed fixes, and you have a long-term winner.
Very happy with this OS so far.
No problem with the download/install.
MBP was very fast, smooth until I tried to write a file to my external HD, I found that El C. would only allow me to "read it".
On closer examination i discovered that the HD was formatted for Windows.
In Yosemite this was never a problem.
I could read,write etc.
The solution was to go back to Yosemite, store all the info off my HD, and reformat it to use on a mac.
Am now re-installing EC and hope this works......will let the community know
Wow, this actually suprised me.
I love how fast this is now.
can't open iBooks!iBooks can't access your library.
Make sure the disk containing your library is connected, then click Try Again.
Library Location: (null)You can also reset your library, then sign in to view and re-download your purchased books.
"reset" didn't work at all.
Great operating system.
Many new features that are very useful.
There are definately a few bugs that need to be worked out though.
I am still very happy with this OS!
Outlook freezes up with this new os.

row.Title: Fantastic Update to a Great OS

row.Sentences: Instead of listing all the novelties and how well they blend in, I will only say this.
This OS flies on a 2011 MacBook Air (naturally, gaming excluded).
Love it; finally, a well polished (Metal!)
OS with very few, if any, downsides.
Great job, Apple!
Overall, this is an solid upgrade.
However the multitasking (splitview) is half-baked.
When in split view, I can not change the window.
I cannot change the view from A+B to A+C.
It requries me to exit splitview of one window then replace it with another.
Big step up from yosemite, fast, reliable, and feels smooth, they tightened the security a bit, so had to shuffle few configuration arounds, but other than that it's just great
Was really keen on upgrading given the new features (especially Split Screen) so downloaded it right away.... everything is a lot snappier!
I've been having trouble with the previous OS withsome annoying lagging and what not but everything seems to be fluid and working great!
I'll update if I encounter any issues but loving it now!
As usual, very practical update, easy to install - It Just Works!
A burst of speed

row.Title: This is the update I was waiting for since Mavericks.

row.Sentences: I didn't upgrade to Yosemite because I found it a bit sketchy, using it on my GF's Macbook Pro.
On the other, El Capitan is smooth, fast and beautiful.
I confirmed the perfomance boost.
Spotlight is an amazing tool but now, it's just perfect.
Also, the install was really fast compared to the last systems.

row.Title: Loved it for a day but...

row.Sentences: I've had a few minor glitches:- will not highlight passages when I use certain applications - preview, safari- wont let me move my applications around on desktop - BIGGEST PROBLEM -> Keeps freezing me when I try to log in to my mac after having it on sleep - I have to to forcefuly shut my computer down to get it working again!
I know it definitly has nothing to do with my hardware (I check it out at the Apple sore the other week after a HD failure, invested in a SSD since so everything is in pretty good shape).
I'm sure as updates come along these little things will be fixed.
On the plus side I'm really liking split screen.
Makes it so much easier to write my papers when I'm working off information from safari or another application.
There is a bunch of other cool features that you can read about online.
Overall: Worth the update but you could encounter problems (i know not a surprise).
Will give this OS a 5 start rating once it stops buggin around.
The split screen is really great addition.
Downside is that it seems that the split screen somehow doesn't manage the graphics well.
When I use FB split-screened with some other program, the text and images seems a little bit blurred compared to non-split screen view.
I really liked the pinned tabs as well since I have opened tabs that are always open and takes up a lot of space.
The performance speed is much better than before.
I usually would have to wait for my mac to be able to enter my password when I boot it up from sleep.
Another winner from Apple, It Just Works!
I am having a problem with Facebook after installing this upgrade.
Is anyone else having a problem?

row.Title: Its great, much better than yosemite

row.Sentences: The update is good HOWEVER, you will be unable to drag and drop anything.....very annoying.
I have yet to do an extremely deep dive on OS X 10.11 (El-Cap.
), but these are my initial impressions.

Positives----------- Great update stability- Not too many new features, but there are many key refinements- Increased speed of animations- Expose clearer by default- Notes overall greatly improved- Maps is heading in right direction (no pun intended)- etc.

Negatives----------- Safari should show Favicons for each tabbed website *** So much easier to see what websites are open at a glance- Safari bookmarks bar - should be able to click a folder on bar then hover to other folders on left and right (instead of clicking each individual folder)- Notes is making progress but needs to get rid of Paper background... come on guys Scott Forstall is gone- Cannot enter splitscreen view from fullscreen view (must first exit full screen then enter split screen)- If two apps are not open split screen is not currently allowed, Instead Other frequent apps should be suggested and splitview still allowedGeneral Complaints---------------------- iTunes is a mess right now.
Apple should consider splitting music off into its own app.

- iTunes match is still causes library issues.- The Dock is getting stale, needs to do more helpful things and show more information- Spotlight should be able to access complete Siri- Maps still doesn't compare to google wrt building information and local
Everything works perfectly except for USB Audio devices.
Knowing Avid, it will be months before my Mbox is working again.
Backwards compatibility should be Apple's issue to resolve.
Just gave me another reason to love my macbook pro.
This OS is FAST and SMOOTH.
Thank you for taking the time to refine instead of adding useless features.
Everything went smoothly for this update.
There is definitely a noticeable performance gain after updating, and I have not encountered any bugs so far.
This is exactly what Apple promised: a rock-solid performance enhancing update with some added features like better window management.
Really enjoying El Capitan so far.
So bloody wonderful.
An Older mac is reborn a new.
After 3 years of weirdness slowness and da bugginess.
Feeling Fresh.!
Thank you / Merci.

row.Title: Great First Experience With OS X El Capitan!

row.Sentences: After a short install, I finally entered the new version of OS X which I have expected for a long time.
The looks did not change too much, it looks just like the old version of OS X Yosemite.
But there are several brand new and effective features added onto this update.
Here are my favourite new features:- You can easily find you cursor by moving your finger on the trackpad really quick so the cursor will be turned bigger and easily identifiable.
- You can now using the split view in fullscreen mode!

Entering the mission control, simply drag the appliation which you want to use with the application that is in fullscreen mode together, you will get a splitview UI immediately.- The new designed Safari now allow you to pin webpages/tabs that you do not need right away to the left of the tab bar, so even if you closed the whole browser including all of the tabs you opened, next time you open it the pined pages will still be there on the left of the tab bar.
Thank you for the great update Apple!
The performance improvement is stunning; I am getting more battery life.
i tested on my air mac and the performce is so great
Made quite the positive difference on my 2013 iMac.
I also found that Metal made a *huge* difference in gaming performance, even ones not specifically optimized for it.
I feel like this is the new Snow Leopard.
A rock-solid update that doesn't bring a completely new experience, but that instead takes something already good and made it near perfect.
Thank's for exploiting well our hardware with nice feature like the split screen and the safari auto update web site.
I'm verry excited to install it to my mother with the new fonctionality of Photo and the new spotlite features.

row.Title: Been testing it out since July

row.Sentences: This is what OS X, this is why I love Apple, this is what OS X needed.
Great release, and I am looking forward to 10.11.1 and so forth, I dont know how you can make a system more stable than this.
I found all of my apps opening very quick !
Amazing increase in the performace of the overall system.
Splitview is good while working with PDF's in preview and other local apps, but hope it supports few other useful apps like MS Office package, sooner.
Metal has done its job very well and overall, El Capitan beats its predecessors !!
waited for this for a long time!
This is a solid, well developed update for Mac OS X.
You'll be doing good for your Apple Computer if you choose to install it.
Very fast, great new improvements to many applications, great new features built into some of our favorite applications such as Safari, and more.
Only a few hours in and I am tickled pink with this upgrade.
Thanks Apple.
El Capitan is El Perfecto!
And, most stable than any other OS in the world .... even better than previous versions of OS X!
The BEST - PERIOD!
El Capitan has taken over your ship will you take it back lets see who will win this battle my Brothers and also you are Le Capitan of your Crue
Very superior update over the os x yosemite.
Applicaitons, programs, and all other items open up very quickly (about 2-3 times faster).
Laptop heats up less, and many more useful features added.
If you have os ox yosemite, then you should upgrade to this os!
I love the new features of this new OS .... keep it up apple :)
i love this it is still supported by 2007 macbook pro
The new update takes alot of space up but its fantastic.
Maybe the first or second person to download this, and I've gotta say, this OS X runs like a dream on my Macbook (Late 2008) APPLE YOU HAVE DONE AN AMAZING JOB DEVELOPING THIS
Great OS Apple!
Now my Mac runs much faster than it did before, and I really like some of the redesigns you made.
Also, the new features(Especially the spotlight search) are really cool!
No where near a complete review but so far it has not crashed :)Will update this review when I find out how it works with Logic 9, Pages, Photo, etc.

row.Title: Delivers on its promises for the most part

row.Sentences: OS X El Capitan delivers on its promise as mainly a perfomance and stability upgrade on the previous OS.
No complaints, everything from opening apps to the system animations is quicker.
Great upgrade.
new os x update

row.Title: Apple is just doing it right!

row.Sentences: To consistently offer free OSX upgrades for my Macs is just impresive on its own.
The OS just gets better and better it is so well integrated with IOS now, a lot of thought has gone into making the UI "up front simple" yet extremely powerful (if you don't mind digging a bit).
Solid OS, solid company thank you for putting your customers first!
By far the best version of OSX yet, Apple has done an incredible job with this update.
Great new features, better performance and stability, and more refined.
Subscribe to iOS 5.1.1 on youtube.
I like it so far....
The split screen is cool
I love what apple has been doing recently
By far the best OS X yet.
when first downloaded i though it was pretty good but then i found a few bugs that is why i rate it 4 out of 5

row.Title: I dont notice a huge difference.

row.Sentences: ....but at least there's more, newer desktop backgrounds of mountains, which is nice.
El Capitan is a good update.
My favorite feature is the pinned tabs in Safari.
When you pin a tab, it minimizes to just the favicon and then refreshes itself periodically in the background.

row.Title: A Review - The Eyes of the Industrial System.

row.Sentences: Donkey Kong told me that this is greatest thing since Super Mario Sunshine.
Just installed on my Macbook Air.
El Capitan is super great, everything is running well so far.
Hands down Apple's best OS, Rock solid, buttery smooth, crisp and a true joy to use everyday!!!
The standard by which all other OS will be judged.
A true game changer!
Operating Systems are cool and stuff.
New nonroot security addon is a good idea!
Loving this update.
Yosemite had some issues which were mostly resolved in 10.10.5.
El Capitain continues on with that rock solidness and adds some nice workflow and visual enhancements.
i have a retina macbook pro 15 inch late 2014 with maxed out specs.
this thing should be pretty beastly in everday use.safari has already frozen up on me twice today, itunes had to force quit the other day.
Preview is a joke - any editing at all leads to a freeze.before the update i've never had to force shut down my computer.
since the update, i had to do it - the entire system was unresponsive for 2 mins before i helt the off button.i've also noticed glitchy user interface graphics.
swapping between windows is not fluid.
i have transparancy off and sidebar on - and this still hasnt helped.also, side note - safari now has this (useful?
little side bar that pops out in full screen mode if your mouse is anywhere near the left side of the screen.
disabling this would be a nice option apple!
UPDATE - PREVIEW KEEPS F****** FREEZING!
I CANT EDIT ANY FILE.
THIS IS CRAZY apple need to get their s*** together

row.Title: Wrought with bugs and errors
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Spotlight, Update

row.Sentences: I immensely regret updating to El Capitan.
I've never had any problems with the OS on my 2 macs over the last 7 years.. until now.
Finder constantly freezes and crashes.2.
Spotlight freezes every time I use it and stays stuck in the middle of the screen for ~10minutes blocking the view of other programs and windows.3.
Preview just doesn't work at all anymore.
Its crashes within seconds of opening any pdf.4.
The VRAM needs to be reset everytime I want to use my external hard-drive since the update; otherwise it isnt recognised by my mac when I plug it in.5.
The bluetooth randomly becomes "not available' and I have to close all my programs and to a full restart.
This is really inconvenient if I have neumerous programs and webpages open.
These problems are interfering with my work.
SImple tasks have now become a pain due to the instability of key elements in El Capitan.
I advise others not to update until issues such as the ones I've outlined above have been resolved.
After updating my Wifi is completely messed up.
My macbook pro retina was working fabulously on Yosemite, but now it drops the connection to every wifi network so I have to disconnect and reconnect every 5 minutes.
Really infuriating- don't download until they sort out the issues!
First of all frequent Java pop-up, which couldn't be turned off for a couple of weeks.
After finding instructions, with commands to write into terminal and install the recommended Apple Java.
Everything is running a slightly bit faster, but not more stable.
Safari let me down multiple times; closed down or wouldn't scope when using as an interface to webdesign with browser access.
Also my Traktor pro Audio SW frooze twice at a live gig, mixing for about 300 people, which I never had before.
Which leads me to the conclusion that RAM is not used as sufficient as before.
I choose Mac Pro over PC for sufficientcy, which apple has lost since Yosemite onward.
I would be able to get a tailor-made PC at least twice as powerful for the same investment.
El Capitan has wasted hours of my life , I upgraded on a Mac Pro and IMAC and each time I turned them of the Operating System disappeared and had to be loaded again .
I contacted Apple and the technicians were more than helpful but after two weeks and lots of downloads and wasted time I had to return to Yosemite on the IMAC .
I have El Capitan on Mac Pro and I cannot shut it down completely lest the OS dissappears .
It has failed to open some Apps and some .docx documents cannot be opened now .
I had an App for Invoices and it would not run it but luckily I contacted the creators of it and they suggested a solution which works .
If I never see El Capitan again it will be too soon .
I hope Apple sorts it out I have seen lots of complaints about it - and I have to wonder as to the veracity of the glowing reports - some are different as chalk and cheese

row.Title: MBA Freezing - my First ever system freezing

row.Sentences: On OS X since Panther - second last gen of MBA 11" - this system freezes solid while higlighting items Finder.
Constantly being prompted for AppStore password.
Really unstable!
Hot corners and Hide/Unhide Dock issue - like hot corners or bottom edge of screen never existed.
Much faster and more relible then Yoshmite.
Pure disappointment - Copmuter works really slow , freezes , Safari unexpectedly quits , iPhoto is imposible to use and edit - too slow !
Graphically look bad !
Feel Like Crying !
I must say after nearly a month of using 10.11 I can't fault much.
It's stable, fast and reliable.
As a SME user, I can highly recommend it.
All is forgiven re Yosemite.+ + +'sSpeed - very fast and as I said reliableSMB - is now working without fault, once a share is mounted, it stays mounted.
Spell checking - a good deal less annoying, it now seems to respect UK/ Irish English dictionary.

Notes - huge improvement with syncing accross devices a great featureHand off - starting to get used to this, handy so far if you need to dash halfway through a taskPages - my quest to live MS free is getting there, with the Pages update it's starting to get back some of what it lost when it went all iOS.- - -'sMail - a big improvement, BUT still some strangeness, e.g.
when you delete a mail, it pops back a few seconds later, sometimes taking focus.
If like me you delete a lot of junk at the same time, this can sometimes lead you to mistakingly delete a valuable message.
Solution I found that works is to go to the bottom (first in message) and delete from there, then as you work towards the latest mails, if a deleted mail reappears it's below and out of harms way.

row.Title: I would advise waiting.
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed

row.Sentences: Installing this caused my wifi to slaw to almost a halt, simple fix.
It also caused my audio to cut out, simple fix.
The SplitView (only reason I updated) rarely works, or just works on certain programs and not others, rendering it completely useless, simple fix.
(re installing Better Touch Tool)My 2015 MBP with 16GB of RAM never froze up until iinstalling El Capitan, it has since frozen 3-4 times.
Always for a short time but enough to be distracting and frustrating.
I stream things to my playstation using a media server on the mac, never lagged before, lags a lot now.
More problems than benefits by a long shot, and of course down grading is an absolute chore.
Loved Yosemite, El Capitan just feels like it intruded and broke everything a little without bringing anything to the table.
The performance improvements are noticable, but the tradeoff for the actual freezing of my machine alone makes it not worth it.

row.Title: Very good, no problems so far.

row.Sentences: I havent updated my OS since Mavericks so my Mac was due an upgrade.
Didnt upgrade to Yosemite cuase of bad reviews and it was the same for this one too but decided to upgrade anyway.
Glad I did, Looks really nice and runs alot faster.
As I work in television production I got the lastest update for Final Cut Pro x too since upgrading which benefits me a lot.
Im very pleased with the new OS.
Loads of complaints from people but cant understand why.
Standard ram has to be 8 or over and it runs perfectly.
Ive got 12gb of ram and ive no problems with it.

row.Title: I wish I never installed El Capitan

row.Sentences: I have an early 2015 13" Macbook pro.
Prior to installing El Capitan I had on average 8 hours of battery life and not a single complaint.
After installing El Capitan I get 4-5 hours battery.
Also I have noticed a lot of WiFi problems, when I connect to a network I get a few minutes of usage before the connection drops.
Then I have to turn my WiFi off and on again, and I get another few minutes of WiFi - before the problem repeats.
This happens on every network I connect to, and I didnt ever have this problem before the move to El Capitan.
If these issues aren't addressed soon through updates I'm going straight back to Yosemite.
Avoid El Capitan, I wish I hadnt made the "upgrade"!
Installed the update to 10.11.1 and now Photoshop no longer works.
Worst than that - simply starting it up kills my mac completely and I need to do a Hard Boot very time.
2Hours on the phone with Adobe and repeated retro-installs and I still don't have Photoshop.
Deadlines shot - job lost.
Thank You Apple for losing me a job.
Irish user, Macbook Pro Mid 2012, SSD and 8GB of RAM, this update has definitely made the system even snappier.
I would certainly recommend
I quite like what El Capitan brings, but I have one issue, my usb port doesn't seem to run as smoothly as it used to.
I often have problems ejecting my usb key, which didn't occur befoe I updated to El Capitan.
Would still encourage people to download it, but this is an annoyance.

row.Title: Works fine. No issues with installation

row.Sentences: Irish user here.
Works fine with no issues in installation.
Takes a while to download, big file.

row.Title: In response to those who look for a download progress bar ...

row.Sentences: To the right of the mountain in the El Capitan cover photo(I would post a screenshot to show it ....)After a month since the upgrade, my 2009 MacBook Pro is now faster than Yosemite, totally recommend the update.

row.Title: Every major OS X release should learn from this one.

row.Sentences: Just enough new features where they count.
Leave the gimmicks to the other guys.
The best OS X release in years.
This balance of new features with core speed, stability and security improvements should be the new norm for Apple going forward.
The same goes for iOS: more releases like this year's iOS 9 please Apple.
I can no longer use my iTunes and have to force quit out of the app each time I try to het it to work, very disappointed overall with the update.

row.Title: Make sure you have a good backup, and time on your hands to downgrade

row.Sentences: I'm running a 2014 MacBook Pro retina.
After installation of the upgrade, everything was unstable for a couple of hours with regular spinning beachballs.
Eventually the system crashed completely and wouldn't boot at all - coupldn't get past the Apple logo.
System recovery wasn't even available, I had to use internet recovery to revert to my time machine backup.
So I wouldn't "upgrade" if I were you, I certainly won't make this mistake again.
It's made my mid-2010 MacBook Pro faster and improved battery life.
The design updates are subtle and elegant.
Very nice operating system that just works.
Evertime I try to download the new os I get this message beside the download "error has occurred"
everything works as advertised.
Don't see what everyone seems to be complaining about.
Everythings working a little bit faster than it used to for me.
Multitasking tools are fantastic for report writing etc.
Recently installed it on friends macs too and they all really enjoy it.
If you don't like all the small little twerks I don't think you'll even notice the difference.
I'm trying to install this 10.11.1 just to be able to get office 2016 working.
I've tried at least 10 times now (and spent the best part of a busy workind day trying to do it) and have given up.
My PC just won't restart.... and run through the install process.
And now my computer has slowed to a virtual crawl.
And dont' suggest looking at the El Capitain Support pages - I did and everyone is just complaining about the same issues (with no support from apple around what the issues are!)
And I thought Yosemite was bad.... Do not even install it on your macbook.
Installed El Capitan and wifi is now a total crap-shoot as to whether it works or not.
Constant restarting and DNS flushing; it's a tragedy.
Just look at the ratings.
This wifi issue is just one of many fundamental problems this OS has.
I have no doubt Apple will correct these issues - eventually - but until then stay well away.
I wouldn't worry about noise.
I upgraded to El Capitain, and since then my MacBook Air is crashing randomly.
One would think it has to do with apps not being ready, but when Messages crashes the OS something is very wrong.
This new version of OS is the worst upgrate ever.
There are too many errors after upgraded.1.
cant find my Time Capsule.2.
cant install Airport Utility.3.
cant Split ViewThis version made a big different, but not in a good way.
i can't even instail it on my macbook air

row.Sentences: Installed the El Capitan 10.11.1 update, and still no fix.
Mac hangs on restart, and won't Safe Boot.
Requires a Recovery reboot, and reinstallation of the OS.
This update is not the solution.
Wait for 10.11.2 or just don't bother and stick with Yosemite.
I'll probably go back to Yosemite until they get this sorted out.... if I ever manage to get my Mac to boot up properly again, that is.
I am very dissapointed with El Capitan, because for some reason my MacBook Air suddenly has started to make unbearable noise all them, even if there is no application running!
Happy to use the system now.
Few bits an pisses to fix but overall - Awesome.
well thank you apple, what a waste of time.
absolute garbage.
wouldn't install stuck on loading screen.
all i could do was revert back to a time machine.
and even with that i lost data as i didnt make a back up right before going for el captain.
i installed the previous 4-5 OS X systems all with no problem so assumed this would be the same.
my bad for not backing up.
TIME TO MOVE TO LINUX.
see ya apple $$$

row.Title: I Can't update my MacBook Pro 13 (Mid 2012)

row.Sentences: I Can't update my MacBook Pro 13 (Mid 2012)Does anyone know why?
El Capitan is more stable than Yosemite.
No problems so far, wheres with Yosemite I had some issues with Nvidia graphic card.
I have MacBookPro 17" mid 2010.
I have to say this is the worst update from apple yet.
its after taking me 3 days just to get my macbook back on!!!!!

Before, everytime i put in my password to log in it would only load half way through then go grey and say there was a problem restarting my computer press any key to start, then when i done so a black screen showed with errors on it.
i contacted apple n spent hours goin through things they told me to do and in the end they told me to bring it to an apple store to get it fixed.
Anyway i kept trying to fix it and finally i did!!!!
Come on Apple updates shouldnt do this stuff to our computers :/

row.Title: Not a good experience
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Speed, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: After upgrading to this new OS, system is becoming very slow esp.
when interacting with Finder.99.9% of the time when right-click on the finder window, the colorful ball will show up and keep spinning for a few seconds, and then the context menu shows up.
The same happens when selecting items in Finder, it takes a few seconds to have the folder/file highlighted.
I'm using Macbook Pro late 2013 model (15.4 inch model, the semi ultimate powerful one of this size), so don't tell me it is because of the slow hardware.
The experience of previous upgrade to Yosemite was much much better, no performance degradation at all.
Another issue is when using Audirvana Plus, Airplay often get disappeared in the output devices.
Sometimes it became even worse that there is only one output device listed there, where the Display Audio speaker of my Apple Thunderbolt Retina Display is also missing.

These have never been an issue on the previous Max OS X version.====It finally turns out the slow performance issue is caused by Paragon NTFS for Mac 14, which is the most up-to-date version supports EI Capitan.
After uninstalling it, the response time is back to normal.
But the Audirvana issue is still not fixed.
I cant download the update when i try to click download nothing happens plz help

row.Title: Outlook 2011 for Mac has stopped working with El Capitan release

row.Sentences: The company I work for still uses MS Ofiice 2011 for Mac & since I upgraded to El Capitan it doesn't work.
When I open Outlook email will not sync with server and I get the spinning coloured wheel & have to force quit.
Office 2016 for Mac does exist but it has not been approved for our use yet.
Macs are just about tolerated by our IT department and this gives them another excuse to prevent them being fully supported.

I have now moved my outlook email to Apple Mail & my Outlook calendar to the Apple Calendar connecting to our Exchange server but the inconsistent integration of Mail & Calendar and the flaky interaction with Join-me has left me with a poor overall experience of El Capitan even though some of the new features are cool.
Update Ovtober 10th - Microsoft have issued a fix which is available on their website - Microsoft Office 2011 14.5.6 Update

row.Title: Amazing Upgrade but one kinda big ish problem

row.Sentences: So I downloaded OS X El Captian and its amazing and Ill keep using it expresslly Split View but I found ont problem with Steam is when I launch a Game like Counter Strike Global Offensive it works but Steam have a feature called Steam Overlay and I found that it wasn't working so I went to the Steam Forums and saw I wasn't the only one, I know Apple can't really fix it its just Valve will have to update Steam so that it works with the new update.
But other than that this update is amazing and game me a massive FPS boost in lots of my games and launching apps :)Edit: So i have found that a glitch with internet sharing crashes my computer.
I turned off Internet sharing and it never crashed (atm), but I hope this gets fixed cause I share my internet a lot.

row.Title: Had to wipe my hard disk to get macbook to reboot

row.Sentences: Had to wipe my hard disk to get macbook to reboot.
Can't thank Apple enough for their attention to profit.
downloaded but not it will not install for me and when i view it in my download or purchased list , it still wont install very disappointed !

row.Title: Don't upgrade if you use Outlook 2011

row.Sentences: I downloaded and upgraded to El Capitan and Outlook 2011 hangs when trying to sync email.
I raised it with Apple Support and they acknowledged was an issue.
Thankfully I had a backup prior to upgrade to restore to but still lost half a day in the process.
Disappointing that Apple would encourage users to upgrade without warning of this known issue.
Surprising that Microsoft and Apple would release El Capitan knowing these issues exist in Outlook 2011 and Office 2016 which surely must affect significant numbers of users.
Since downloading El Capitan I have had so many problems with my macbook.
I wish I had never downloaded it.
My macbook is virtually useless now.
I can't use it for work anymore because all the appls keep on crashing.
I wish I could throw my macbook air at them!

row.Title: Well not bad after sluggish previous OS

row.Sentences: Smooth and stable.
Like it so far but some tiny errors like lack of battery indicator on keyboard settings.
Tiny error fix will be soon available or so I guess so.
Recommended to those who still use previous OS.
El Capitan guys!
Feels quite solid and more responsive, snappier compared to Yosemite.
No compatibility issues so far, except for the third-party notification bar icons are not draggable anymore.
Split View looks good and all but somehow it makes you feel that you're out of space, even on a 27" monitor.
Definitely worth the upgrade though, great work Apple!
I have found El Capitan to be a far quicker and seemingly more stable OS than Yosemite.
SO far,so good.

However, the blue instalation bar which has become standard over the last few systems is, in bright light and more importantly for those with impaired eyesight, extremely difficult to make out what is happening.
Much more contrast is needed or, better still, bring back the system whereby we could choose the highlight colour.
Please consider replacing that stadard blue.
Recently updated but rolled back after 2 hours.
Some apps does not work and incompatible.
Is it so hard to implement ???

row.Title: No Progress Bar on DOWNLOAD - could be minutes, Hours or Days remaining!

row.Sentences: Must leave your MAC to instal this, as you have no clue how long it will take to download!
Surely a progress Bar would let people use their MACs while downloading, without risk of lost data on shutdown & restart!
So far I like everything new about it and the way it works.
It seems that it only changed my Color Calibrations but nothing to die for.
Great job to everyone!

row.Title: hoping like hell this works for me

row.Sentences: I've had no choice but to upgrade as I want to install Windows which won't work without the latest IOS upgrade.
Given these comments I'm a bit worried now.
Only half an hour into the upgrade and seems like it will take all night.
I'll change number of stars if this works ok.
Airdrop used to working between my Macbook Pro and iPhone 6 (IOS 9.1) but now it doesn't after updating to El Capitan.
I downloaded El Capitan several weeks ago, & I thought things were going swimmingly.
I went to use my trusty Canon MP240 scanner & discovered it wouldn't work.
Printing had been fine, but the scanner would not connect.
Then I attached my Samsung camera &, again, no recognition from El Capitan.
I have no intention of buying new technology, when my old stuff works well enough.
I wnt online & checked out how to go back to Yosemite, & was able to do this last night.
I'm so glad I back up my stuff onto an external drive, as I was able to find the last backup I did on 10.10.
Welcome back, Yosemite!

Awful, the worst upgrade for years, (from a programing point of view)Ive had nothing but problems with it since upgrading, and needed intensive tech support to help rebuild iTunes and other apps/settingsThe hurridly released upgrade patch fixed a few things, but I still experience log outs for no reason!

Im sure it looks great etc, but I get the feeling from my experience, and others, that it is full of unwnated bugsMy system is an early 2009 Mac Pro with three screensI would have preferred to wait for a few months, then upgraded as my older OSX worked perfectly, and then upgraded once the issues had been fixed !!!
I think the overall look and graphics is great!
But ever since I downloaded it (I'm still in the process of downloading it fully ): ) My iTunes player won't play any music, and quicktime won't work.
I have no idea how to fix it and would like my iTunes working now!
I'm looking at having to go and get it fixed at this point.
What a relief, a great upgrade and the whole of my computer is working much better.
My only concern is that in finder all my files have been lost and the documents, spreadsheets ets are all now listed randomly into an all files list.
Can somebody please advise me how to fix this.
I was having weird crashing problems.
Upgraded to El Cap.
Everything ios fixed and working faster than before.
I nearly believed all the eggs in this forum that were baggin' the new OS.
Glad I went ahead anyway.
Cheers (late 2011 MacBook Pro )

row.Title: Really regret to upgrade to El Captain.

row.Sentences: I just wan to say the whole experience is " heavy" and " stiff"

row.Title: What a nightmare
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I am sincerely regretting that I ever decided to install 10.11.
I never ever had that many problems with any of the previous versions of OS X.
Since I stalled 10.11, my system is crashing constantly.
It even crashes regularly when I connect my thunderbolt docking station.
Programs that never crashed before are now crashing constantly.
With 10.10 it was running very smoothly for many months without a single crash or reboot (except for some updates of course).
And that is not a resource problem, as I am using a Retina 13-inch late 2013 MacBook Pro with 16GB Ram.
The fact that OSX is "rootless" now might be completely unimportant for many users but it is certainly important for everyone who uses the underlying Unix/BSD system actively.
The SIP system can be disabled and that is fine and absolutely necessary.
I am using a lot of scientific software packages, which are mostly adopted from Linux versions and they tend to write in the directories, which are now blocked for root.
After the installation of 10.11 all the directories previously installed in these directories were just gone and I had to reinstall everything after disabling of SIP.
Preview gives me green screens for high-resolution jpg pictures.
After changing the presentation mode to "Size on screen equals size on printout" it works most of the time, but now some of the figures in my Word documents are not shown anymore!
Names of contact lists in Contacts got deleted and had to be renamed.
I have always been praising Apple for how stable and reliable OSX was, but this version turned out to be an absolute nightmare (at least for me).
I hope Apple get this all fixed VERY soon.
I would downgrade to 10.10 in a flash if I could, but I am not using Time Machine for backups, so I am stuck with 10.11 unfortunately.
Using a 4K monitor with 13" MacBook Pro Retina.
Previously under OSX Yosemite, graphics were rather slow and some apps struggled coping with 4K screen.
Now under OSX El Capitan, it's all a lot smoother and responsive.
Those apps that struggled previously are a lot more responsive.
Definitely a performance boost, and the new font looks great!

row.Title: Is this still the Apple OS that I love???

row.Sentences: 2012 Macbook AirI've love loved the previous few OS, they've always ran smooth for me.
El Capitan is, however, shocking to say the least.
I can run Safari for two hours and it can repeatedly freeze on me.
Seriously Apple?
Seriously?I hope the new update will solve the problems but it seems like the prediction that I so hate to believe is coming true.
Without Steve Jobs Apple is going downhill.
If this keeps on happening I would be forced to go for Windows, which btw, I hate using.
So don't do this to me Apple, don't do this to us.
Slowed everything down on my late 2014 macbook pro retina.
I take very good care of it to ensure it runs smoothly but this update has done so much harm.
Looks cool but so slow.
This release is good, however I would recommend installing as a fresh install rather than upgrading, paricularly on old machines as it really runs a lot faster.

row.Title: OS X El Capitan is a sign of the future

row.Sentences: OS X El Capitan furthers the radical refinements and redesign of Yosemite.
Front-facing changes, such as the San Fransisco system font, further pushes the UI deisgn; whereas huge backend changes, such as metal integration, ensures best possible performance.
El Capitan is refinement release, much like Snow Leopard, with a focus on quality and clarity.
New features are rather few and far between, but El Capitan lays the groundwork for the future of OS X.

row.Title: With the office fix by both apple and microsoft, its smooth sailing.

row.Sentences: A major compatibility issue with microsoft office seems to have been resolved.
now my machine is working better than ever.
I am glad this doesn't feel like another step towards google as was done with the iOS and it maintains a standard that shames all competition.
the split screen feature is very useful and for me its the best feature.
the photo app can be made much better, a simpler way organizing photos must be invented.
can't say anyone cracked it yet.
I'd like to see my timecapsule work as a home server and the ability to password protect folders.
also the ability sync folders both on the mac and on other storgae units like an external drive or the time machine drive.
so good job folks !
I am unable to download this.
I've hit the download button and it switches from "downloading' to "download' then doesn't let me click it
I waited 18+ hours for this to download so that I could finally use two applications side by side, only to find out that 99% of the apps aren't even compatible with that feature?!
Waste of time.
A really nice and sleek update.
It's sad that it absolutely destroys the speed of my MacBook.
I'm going to have to flipping downgrade a 4th time back to OS X Yosemite to this.
But like I said, the features they added are really awesome.
Serious problem for Autocad Mac user, entire program crashing............please do something!!!!!
Split screen is amazing - great for student who nereds to be using safari to google stuff and pages to jot stuff down at the same time....
Highly recommended (also safari is now amazing and so are all the native apps, there's so many feature I can't cover).
Also, don't know if this was in Yosemite, but you can do the sam ething as force touch (if you don't have it) by triple finger clicking!

row.Title: Had to delete everything & go back to previous system. Too many things no longer work

row.Sentences: Watching Apple OSX updates is like watching the Titanic sink.
Mail doesn't work, Photo's app is rediculous, iTunes too.
Expensive software no longer works.
My partners outboard devices are no longer supported.
We had to delete this OS & return to the previous one so we could continue to use what we bought the computer for.
Unless I sit right next to my router I can't connect to the internet.
Was working fine on Yosemite.
3rd party incompatibility has reached a new high.
In the music industry, you can go to the shop & look at brand new audio devices that are current models from the best known manufacturers and they're already obsolete before you purchase them.
[An excercise I just did] That means, whether I like this OS update or not I simply can't use it.
Then there's 3rd party software that doesn't work anymore.
Then there's App store purchases that have disappeared from my library even though I've paid for them.
Then there's hardware limitations.
The list goes on.
Team that with the ever decreasing quality of app's such as Mail, Safari, but even more so Photo's & iTunes & there's very little here that's useful anymore.
As a long time Apple supporter it's sad to say it's time to start looking at my options.
This is unsatisfactory on more levels than I care to discuss.
i like the new note and the speed is a lit bit faster but still not for gaming with metal.
Pity did not wait on the verge of going away from apple getting worse with every up grade.
This upgrade has affected several of my Apps in a bad way.
Worst of all is my accounting system no longer connects to Mail.
What a serious waste of time.
DONT DOWN LOAD THIS UPDATE

row.Title: Not many improvements, Mail SMTP settings bug

row.Sentences: For a year's worth of waiting there's just too few improvements.
It does seem Apple has shifted its attention to iOS-like systems and OS X is suffering because of that.

The user interface improvements (Mission Control) are also not really noticable and windows management in general is still inconsistend and well below compared to the offerings of other operating systems.
Given this should be a stability polished release of OS X I also wasn't expecting Mail to completely break down and my SMTP settings for sending email being wiped out.
Also the release doesn't seem as polished and stable as Yosemite last year - I've had to do a few reboots now and then.
This made for a very frustrating upgrade.
Running on MacBook Pro Retina late 2013.
Upgraded home machine to El Captain.
Great, loved it!
Upgraded work machine to El Captain.... Microsoft Office doesn't work!!!
No emails, No word docs!!!
& No fixes insight either!!!

row.Title: Unable to view certain JPG on preview

row.Sentences: Cant seem to open large JPG files on preview ever since update.
Using a MBP (Late 2013).
JPG files turn green or grey on opening.
Upgrade was simple enough but was most upset to find all my emails had disappeared.
Had to set up mail boxes again and download what I could from my internet server but have lost a lot of important email records.
I read the comments posted and was worried about updating because I have to use MS Office for work.
The delay others talk about is only on the FIRST time you start Office again after upgrading.
Thats because Office is updating itself and installing new fonts that are compatible with the new OS.
After that its business as usual.
Have definitely noticed a faster Mac and am very happy I took the plunge.
After installing El Capitan my MBP wont restart!
It just stays on the grey screen with the Apple logo.
Even after rebooting and reinstalling it stays the same.
Yosemite worked perfectly well and now I have to let my Mac Book run all the time because it wont restart.
Very disappointed especially as there seems to be no support from Apple on this matter.

row.Title: What happened to my mail programme

row.Sentences: Yea Launchpad is great - but the spinning wheel of do-nothing is all too prevalent and unnerving!

More inportantly what happened to MY MAIL programme - I seem to only have one inbox where before there were 2 AND what happened to all my emails - nothing - nada - zip all gone except for the last three days - not even the archived ones!!!
Not happy am I with this new OS

row.Title: A backwards step in perfomace for the imac 2011.
row.Topic: Feature, Installation, Outlook, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: no issues in the installation package it worked well.
unfortunately I didn't wait a few days before upgrading to see the outlook 2011 issues, I can't use use it on the imac any more and no solution for several weeks at least.
the whole computer is extremely slow now its like someone has but the brakes on full time and I am continually waiting for the spinning wheel of death to finish.
I am constantly force quitting applications (when it lets me).
All apps etc are updated.
Preview just doesn't work and I cant repair it as its part of the os, it takes on average 135 seconds to open and display a photo, it takes nearly 4.5 minutes to load even a small video.
I have given up and downloaded a thirdparty app that loads it all instantly..of all the previous upgrades this one definately took things backwards by a long shot.
I will be reverting back to yosemity until the issues in OS and outlook are fixed.
I have an SSD hybrib hard drive installed that was perfect before this upgrade.

row.Title: Easily the best OS X update in a while

row.Sentences: It's good to see Apple taking the time to make refinements instead of rushing to keep making new features.
This is the "Snow Leopard" we've been waiting for.
This is the best OS X since Snow Leopard.
Fine tuned and optimised, gives my Mac a new lease of life.
Good work guys, I have been waiting for an OS X like this for some time now.
this upgrade has made my mac run faster.. but what is all bout office applications.. they take ages to open up....
If your thinking about upgrading - DON'TThe improvements are cosmetic and the third party incompatibility is extreme

row.Title: Tired of Bad reviews of OS X by people who are not savvy

row.Sentences: I have had no problems with any of the OS X installs since snow leopard - ON A 2008 macbook used daily !
But - I have 8 gb of ram and I do clean installs and since Yosemite I installed a SSD as well as that I install new OS on various Macs from 2008 up on a weekly basis .
If people would just do a little research maybe , just maybe they would not install over old crud and maybe consider their hardware requirements as suggested on somany sites.

Ive had no Beachballs at all running yosemite and El Capitan intensively on my olllllld macbook - photoshop , illustrator , office etc If your going to criticise a new OS please take the time to try it on some different machines after fresh install with decent Ram atleast - otherwise you just look stoopid
Excellent OS.
Clean, easy to use and very quick.
This update made my mac so much faster, and so much smoother.
It feels like I've brought a brand new mac, thank you Apple for putting so much work to bring us some of the best software ever.
Please continue to conect iPhone with Mac, via iCloud.
I love handoff, thanks again for another amazing update.

row.Title: Nice update, but a few bugs

row.Sentences: Initially the update was pretty good, the user interface looks very clean with the new font, and small things like opening apps and going into mission control were pretty snappy.
However, after a bit of usage things started to lag a wee bit, and I saw a lot more of the "spinning wheel of death' than I did whilst using OS X Yosemite.
Also things just tend to freeze a whole lot more and my laptop fan is also dramatically more noticeable.
The new features seem to work well most of the time and battery life seems to be the same as before.
If you're on an older firmware, I would hold out updating until a smaller update gets released to patch a few things up.
I do like the upgrade, split screen is excellent in particular and love the updated Notes app.

However, still some issues:- still issues with wifi dropping out and I have to turn off and back on to reconnect- some apps still slow to open, particularly Microsoft office apps- still get the spinning beach ball too often :(Overall an inprovement but I was hoping for more.
My Mac is not old, only bought if a few months ago, being a 13inch non-retina.
Having read all the reports about Metal making things quicker I can say that at best overall speed is only marginally quicker.
I am having a few Problems With the Up Date it has been six hours and I am worried will my Mac work properly
Definitely worth the upgrade.
If you're doubting upgrading, don't.
It's perfect, and I haven't experienced any bugs.
I love the new font (San Francisco).

row.Title: OS X 10.11 puts the Mac back on track

row.Sentences: 10.10 was a rocky ride but 10.11 has been buttery smooth right off the bat - no major show stopper bugs, networking is as solid as a rock not to mention the huge amount of testing and feedback that Apple has taken on board with the public betas before the big launch.

I'm generally cautious about jumping straight into a x.0 release but with 10.11 the release is solid - everything just works; Drobo 5D drivers work without a hitch, Pages/Keynote/Numbers working smoothly, iCloud very reliable.
What a superb end user experience!
we have 5 macs at home - thin and fat 27, Mac mini, macbook pro and the 12" macbook - all just worked!
fantastic, and very slick indeed - loving the El Capitan experience :)
Was sluggish at first, but then my Macbook Pro mid 2012 13 inch started to get a bit faster in tasks.
The boot up time for my Macbook Pro was 11 seconds faster than Yosemite.
Awesome, worth the upgrade!
Good Job!
Clean , fast, user friendly interface....
Better upgrade .... highly recommended

row.Title: Tottaly love that Best OS X ever

row.Sentences: Tottaly love that Best OS X ever

row.Title: A good update, but still minor issues

row.Sentences: My last OS was Lion so upgrading Macbook and OS was expecting good things and for the most part not disappointed.
Smooth set-up, only issue was one or two older bits of software refused to install.
Others say they have it working.
Obviously a few bugs and issues but on whole nice and smooth.
Everything is much slower that Snow Leopard.2.
Mail seems not to work.3.
Most importantly, iPhoto version will not work with El Capitan.
Error message say download new version of iPhoto from the App Store.
The App Store says the version requested not available in my country (UK).
Can I have Snow Leopard back, please?
Totally screwed Mail.

From zero problems in all the years I've been a Mac user to half a dozen crashes a day, reorganise my folder systems, deleted then put back pop accounts, now , out of the blue, asking to verify password and not accepting it when correct password entered.
And generally, system much slower.
Sort it out Apple!
After upgrading to El Capitan the App Store, Safari, Skype and a few other programs could not access the internet.
Once I disabled my VPN the problem was solved.
I think this problem was caused because my Apple ID is linked to the UK store but I live in Ethiopia.
I did not have this problem with Yoshemite.
However, it is definitely faster.
I don't regret the upgrade.

row.Title: None of my IOS devices will sync following the upgrade

row.Sentences: Upgraded my 3 year old Mac to El Capitan a week ago.
The upgrade itself was quick and easy to install.
None of my IOS devices will sync with itunes anymore.
After 12 hours of syncing each device just gives up, or I get an error message saying the device cannot be sync as the library is unavailable.
I've trying reinstalling iTunes as suggested on the Apple Forum, but it didn't make a difference.
The Mac is much slower to start up following the upgrade and the windmill keeps appearing whenever I open mail or photos.
Everything is running sooooooo slowly now.
Proceed with care!

row.Title: Fixed wifi dropout issue that I had with Yosemite

row.Sentences: I have a mid-2015 Macbook retina pro.
It was great except wifi would randomly drop out.
Since upgrading from Yosemite to El Capitan the wifi has not dropped out any more.
