row.Sentences: A few weeks ago i updated my desktop 2011 iMac, update was seamless and saved about 2G of disk space.
No problems and Safari is a lot more stable.
Overnight I downloaded the update for my 11" Macbook Air, download was not perfect and when it finished had a problem running the install.
Contacted apple support, got a call back from Rebecca nr Newcastle in less than 2 mins !!
who helped me finish without a glitch - why cannot other big companies give this level of service and if this is where Apple spend their dosh then thats fine by me.
Was very soon running El Capitan and again have an extra 2G of disk space which on the baby Air is a big deal .. all looking good.
If you're running an old Mac Pro Desktop (2008) along with CS6, for God's sake don't upgrade, unless you want several sleepless nights and a whole bunch of trouble.
My Mac is a workhorse now classed as "vintage' by Apple and unsupported - the Apple Store simply weren't interested when I phoned them and said I had a reboot loop and no video.
I finally got the old girl up and running again, but it seems that all Apple are interested in now are shiny little laptops and iPads and iPhones for people to play with not work on.
I admittedly have an older Mac, 2011 but still, for the last two years I have had nothing but one niggling problem after another.
It takes me forever to do anything on El Capitan now so I am giving up and going back to Wndows.
I am sure Windows is not much better but at least I can buy a machine for the fraction of the price.
All I can say is if you are thinking of investing in a Mac, don`t.
It just is not worth it now.
Not often a new OS version speeds up existing machines.
Especially older ones.
I run a late 2011 MacBook Pro, a 2008 Mac Pro and a mid 2007 iMac.
Each one runs better and faster on El Capitan than on Yosemite.

row.Title: avoid this mess of an operating system

row.Sentences: What a disaster this upgrade is.
Spending all my time watching a spinning beachball since I downloaded this upgrade or should I say downgrade.
My mac is slower than a pc.
Trying all day to login to several sites and all I get is this annoying spinning beach ball.
Haven't been able to login to my bank all day.
This keeps up I am ditching my mac for something that is reliable.
Come on apple sort this mess out.

row.Title: Works realy well on Macbook Pro 2012 with 1GB SSD

row.Sentences: Works realy well on Macbook Pro 2012 with 1GB SSD.
Haven't found any of my software that doesn't work, love answering phone calls on my laptop with phone in the other room :)
My machine is hanging for minutes at a time on a regular basis.
Mail and pages are crashing at least once a day.
I can't believe you realeased this extremely poor software.

row.Title: Can't see much difference but my Macbook is now much slower:(

row.Sentences: Can't see much difference since install however my Macbook Pro is now much slower in every regard and Safari is almost unusable as its so slow and unresponsive.
Bit disappointed.
Certainly wouldn't recomend it to anyone who has any doubts!

row.Title: Great update but still a few bugs

row.Sentences: this is still a great update but one bug that has appeared is that when sending an email on icloud in mail app is sends from "my mac" and not "iCloud" every thing else syncs but that as you cant see on your iPhone what emails has sent as it creates a differnt folder.
had great service from apple on line that whent thoght it yesterday thought we cured the problem but unfortuneatlly it hasn't definitely a bug in software.
Reluctantly upgraded as partner has iPad Air and we wanted to share via Cloud.
Machine (mid 2007) iMac now very slow, freezes every 15 mins or so!
Have cleaned up my files, discarded lots of duplicates to make space on hard drive, run Disk First Aid but not convinced any of this has helped.
Cloud sharing works which is great but it is so frustrating to be half way through something and have machine freeze.

row.Title: No problems running this at all, on an old mid-2011 Macbook Air

row.Sentences: My old Macbook still runs nice and smooth with this, and I was concerned this would not be the case after the bad reviews shown here.
I believe it is slightly more stable and quicker than its predecessor.
I use my Mac for work and play, and I must say the OS has improved a lot since 2011, though the current update doesnt offer that much in the way of new features.
The split screen feature, for example, is handy to have and useful for productivity.

row.Title: Be careful with this update
row.Topic: Backup, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: Mid 2012 Macbook pro 13", 16GB, 500gb ssdLast year I upgraded to Yosemite fearing that there would be endless problems but actually all went smoothly.
So I was keen to upgrade to El Capitan when it came out, particularly to have the splitscreen function for some apps.
As always I made sure that all apps, both from the app store and 3rd party were upgraded, and I took two bootable backups using Superduper and a Time Machine backup.
And I was glad I did!
The upgrade downloaded without any problems and then installed.
Everything was looking good.
I noticed that safari appeared a lot quicker with the new operating system and the splitscreen function was as expected.
However, I shut down the laptop at one point and found that it would not restart again.
It just showed the apple logo and nothing else, for a long time.
Eventually I had to force the unit to shut down by holding the power button.
Checked the forums via my iPad and tried the various suggestions of starting in safe mode etc.
In the end I had to revert to the Time Machine backup of my Yosemite system.
I Tried the install a second time after checking again that everything was updated and I also removed nearly all applications from start up.
Waited for the next version to be released, this current one of 10.11.1, thinking that maybe a fix had been made, but got exactly the same result.
There are suggestions on the forums that third party memory upgrades may affect the install.
I had upgraded from the factory 8GB to Crucial 16GB.
There are also suggestions that a clean install will resolve the problem but I have so many third party apps that I am not going to waste hours and hours reinstalling apps and accounts.
Anyone else out there with a similar problem and does anyone know of a foolproof solution?I'm not happy with Apple on this upgrade, hence only 1 stars.
It got that because, for the brief time that it did work, it looked really good.
I never used to see the beachball, and now it appears in some areas.
It has made my 3 Macs slow down.
Wish I'd stayed with Yosemite.

row.Title: El Crapitan. Back up and upgrade at you own risk

row.Sentences: After being an Apple user for ten years I have just had my first truly aggravating and unreliable experience.
I downloaded the update and my computer froze at around 80% after logging in for the final stages of installation.
I rebooted and tried again.
I rebooted using Command R in safe mode, went to disk utility and tried again.
At that point I had a completely unuseable MacBook.
All this took a day.
What a waste of time.
My options seemed to be to restore from my Time Machine back up which is, thankfully, up to date.
Or to erase and do a clean install.
I've installed Lion and am now downloading El Crapitan for the fourth time.
Reminds me of my old Windows days.
It took almost 12 months to get Yosemite to a state whereby applications such as CS5 worked in conjunction with my Synology drive.
"Handoff' never really worked properly.
So I thought (hoped) the El Capitan would solve these issues.
CS5 is now broken and its no better than Yosemite.
This was the last stable version of OSX that Apple produced.
The new features of El Capitan or Yosemite for that matter added very little value.
Apple, you really need to sort your act out!
First time in my life I'm dissapointed in Apple.
My Mac keep on freezing, Airplay is not working properly, not compatible with Firefox.
Anyhow I would not suggest this update to anyonePlease do something this is not acceptable.
I've now lost total use of my MS Outlook which I used for both work and personal.
Each time I open the app now I'm stuck in spinning rainbow land.
I have to rely on running Outlook in a browser now which is so frustrating.
The new installation also cleared 2 years worth on Notes i'd kept on the Notes app.

row.Title: Has impacted speed and Spotlight is VERY slow now

row.Sentences: One thing I have learnt since my Apple Mac LCll is that I love Apple.
However, anohter thing I have learnt over the years is system upgrades are pushed out too quick - they never seem sufficiently tested.
We upgrade and then countless of us then bombard Apple's discussion boards with complaints of errors or performance issues.
Then Appple start releasing updates for all the fixes.
Why can Apple not test thoroughly on all their devices of varying ages?
I get the feeling they are only concerned with their newest products.
Anyway, El Captian is no exception to the above and I have once again regretted jumping in too quick (I usually wait at least 6 months after upgrade releases).
My MacBook pro with 8GB RAM is now running noticeably slower, I had to fix audio issues, reinstall software.
Spotlight is now pretty much useless as it takes up to 30 seconds to produce a result despite reindexing (same for all accounts AND all accounts on my iMac).
I have also been getting kernel panics and MacBook does a spontaneous reboot.
Verdict = I wish I had waitd for Apple to release the updates that usually follow in order to fix issues.
useless, i have lost my i photos as no app available in the uk, my email will not work, computer now very slow and unresponsive, i wish i had not.
Just like its predecessor this version of OSX while being amazing to look at and use, it kept crashing my 2009 MacBook Air forcing me to downgrade back to Mavericks.

I have had my mac for 3 years and its been outstaing....................then i installed EI C and its not been working as before slow and keeps trying to down laod EL C even when it is stalled already I have been on to Support 5 times and no joy,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,i am now trying to go back .
DONT DO IT YET Apple need to update this frist.
If it works why change How I understand that...................
Put off updating to El Capitan from Yosemite due to the mixed reviews.
I decided that my Mac was getting slower and slower and that El Capitan promised to speed things up so I thought let's risk it!
Well, I had absolutely no problems with the download which was relatively quick and painless.
Only one third party app has had problems working with the new operating system but the massive upside is a significant improvement in the speed!!
Web pages load instantly and multiple app use does not slow anything down.
All in all a massive thumbs up for this free update.

row.Title: Be very careful if you are using WD MyCloud for backups

row.Sentences: I have had nothing but trouble, it created conflicts with my MyCloud TimeMachine backups ".sparsebundle corrupt" this would not have been such an issue if it hadnt then crashed and would'nt reload.
All of the above issues took days upon days to put right and that was just to my MacBook Pro late 2011 to a useable condition.

all backups were lost permanently though.all in all I dont like, it is slower to load up now, constantly freezes with simple tasks (please dont read this and think its the late 2011 thats causing an issue as both my HDD & RAM have been upgraded and now running Solid State HDD and 8gb of DDR RAM)I must admit i like the interface and look and feel but overall not worth it, alot of fixes need to be done before hand, if i was reading this i would wait maybe a month or 2 and check to see if any updates have been released

row.Title: Avoid at all costs - wish I hadnt started with El Capitan

row.Sentences: Apple have created a monster in El Capitan which gobbles memory and slows down my iMac to such an extent that it is a useless piece of junk now.
I should have read the reviews, there are currently 536 people rating this at 1* and thats a generous rating!
It only works properly if I close Apple Mail.
But thats one app that I use all the time.
I really dont have time for screw ups, Apple, and this is the worst of the lot.

row.Title: The was a reason i bought an apple..

row.Sentences: I made the conversion to an apple imac after losing hours of my life with a very expensive Sony viao and windows which after 5 years was thrown in the bin!
I bought an apple becuase they just worked.
So, to find that I'm writing this is a bizarre state of affairs!
However, the fact is that, against my better judgement, i decided to upload the El Capitan update.
Since then, the imac has slowed down.
iTunes will not work, respond or do anything.
I now find myself going onto the internet to search for "fixes" to try and get the imac to work.
Its like the windows experience all over again.
Why, when running apple products on an apple imac, is there an issue with programmes?
Surely, before releasing an update caliming the world, these issues should have been resolved!
My advice would be to wait until this update is proved to work.

Ever since upgrading to El capitan i've had problems with, mail, files not showing in folders, wifi stopping , Safari crashing and having to reboot to get things working as they shouldon my MacBook Pro retina.
I've been an apple fan for many years but this is without doubt the worst OS X update ever, don't upgrade if you use your mac as a serious work horse.
Beachball....beachball....beachball....beachball.
That's just to open up File Finder.
And my scanner doesn't work any more (Canon LiDE 700F), it wasn't that good under Mavericks, but is now completely useless.
Scanner driver on the Canon website does not work.
Mac on-line support were unable to help.

Just ugraded after NAIVELY building confidence over time of reading the positive and seemingly trouble free reviews - and now upon re-booting I've Lost my ADMINISTRATOR User Account-WT#I AM NOW SPENDING LITTERALY HOURS TRYING TO RESOLVE THIS AND TRY TO RECOVER ALL OF MY LOST ACCOUNT - THANKS FOR NOTHING APPLE - DO YOU NOT TEST THESE THINGS BEFORE RELEASING - V ANNOYED AND YOU ARE RAPIDLY LOOSING THE ONCE UNIVERSAL CONFIDENCE OF APPLE USERS - WHO CAME TO APPLE NOT TO HAVE TO GO THROUGH THIS BS.
Locked out of my own emails.
Looks nice but significantly slower in doing pretty much anything.
Ever since I have upgraded, programs such as Outlook, Excel etc.
repeatedly crash.

row.Title: Keep your software up to date !!!!

row.Sentences: Just don't bother with others reviews, if you want it go for it.
I did and found no problems, easy down load and install, total time 1 hour.
No change to look but MacBook Pro seems faster.
Maybe the secret is to keep your software up to date!
If like me you use Serato DO NOT UPDATE.
Freezes and cuts out.
I learned the hard way not using Time Machine.
I've had to factory restore my Mac and get Yosemite back losing everything I never transferred over to my external hard drive.
Couple other buggy things but I'm sure most will be resolved with a couple updates.

row.Title: Not if you use BT for your email

row.Sentences: I updated to El Capitan, hoping it would fix a very annoying problem with gmail constantly asking me to update my password for emails.
It has but it has also completely messed up my btopenworld email account.
I can now only get my emails by logging in directly to BT because all my apple products cannot download my emails.
I have endlessly changed passwords.
It has wasted huge amounts of my time as I have an iphone, iPad, iPod, Macbook pro and Mac.
I will not be buying any more apple products when I renew items as I can't stand the endless problems with their upgrades.

row.Title: AMAZING for my Macbook Pro 15 Mid 2010!

row.Sentences: When I decided to upgrade to Yosemite, I started having many problems: my computer would just restart every 5 minutes (I am not exagerating) because I installed a crucial SDD (a thrid party component...).
I went to an Apple retailer and they said: "Buy an apple certified SSD or dowgrade to Yosemite and use Trim Enabler'.
Hence, I downgraded to Maverick thinking the problem would disappear.
Unfortunately it did not " it got worse, even with Trim Enabler.
I wrote my PhD thesis with this Macbook Pro shutting down when it could not handle too many softwares (every 15 minutes).
I used Trim Enabler, but it simply did not work in my case because the retailer did not pinpoint the exact problem.
Plus, I just coudn't afford the first option which was to spend 500 to buy an Apple SSD for a second hand Macbook Pro that I bought for 500 on Ebay.
Sorry Apple.
I had my eye on El Capitan and read the reviews online for A1836 MaacBook Pro.
I found out that it works without any major problems.
Hence, I decided to upgrade and let me tell you that I do not regret it for a second!
It is just amazing, I have been using my mac for 4 days without it restating for no earthly reason which is a record in my books.
Please Apple, do not screw this OS up with one of your ridiculous updates.
I was on the verge of getting a PC.

row.Title: Lovely. Pity Mail doesn't work after loading.

row.Sentences: Haven't even got round to finding out how "great' it is before I find out I can't send e-mails anymore.
Update: Mail problem sorted, but clicking on reply crashes the app everytime.
Also, Safari crashes the computer regularly, especially when swiping or scrolling.
I'd recommend not updating until these basic issues are resolved.
just don't.
If you use the following: anything by Adobe; anything by Microsoft; Apple's Mail or iCal, Finder.
If you don't use any of those you'll probably be fine.....
Everyone seems to be complaining of issues, but this has done womders for speed and is a really cool OS.
Definitely recommend.
I had a few issues with the previous update, so thought this would solve those and make the overall performance better.
Absolutely the worst decision.
After waiting patiently for ages during installation, I have found the result being - LAGS, lags lags lags, even typing this I am getting the circle pop up.
The internet takes ages to load a single page, I'm using my iPhone over my Mac right now to save time.
I may take my mac to a store and ask for their help because I literally can't use this device as it is.
I really regret upgrading to El Capitan.
I'm running a Mac Mini (Late 2012) with the standard 4Gb RAM.
When I upgraded to Yosemite from Mavericks, there was a huge drop in performance - the whole system and all apps would take forever to do anything.
Frustrating to the point of nearly throwing the damn thing out the window!
Have just upgraded to El Cap and am pleased to report that everything is back to at least pre-yosemite speeds again (if not better).
So glad I upgraded as my next step was to go out and spend 100+ on maxing out the RAM to 16Gb so have saved big time.
Absolutely love the split screen mode and have not found any bugs thus far.
Great job Apple; you have restored my faith after a frustrating few months with Yosemite.

row.Title: Update has bugs in _WindowServer - Fan is in overdrive.

row.Sentences: _WindowServer process seems to be consuming at least 10% of the CPU at all times.
This macbook was new in March 2015.
But after this update, the fan working overdrive makes it sound like it's 10 years old.
Hoping for an update real soon.
** As a follow up, anyone experiencing this problem needs to try resetting SMC.
Shift - Ctrl - Option - Power at startup.
Seems to fix the problem.

row.Title: NTFS external hard drive is now not able to be written to

row.Sentences: I used to back up my files to an external drive that was a NTFS formatted drive.
This is no longer possible using El Capian.
Now i either have to wait for a fix or buy a new hard drive.
Other users have noted the same problem on forums.
I upgraded to El Capitan from Mavericks (OS X 10.9 - 10.11) on a rMBP Late 2013 model and have found the upgrade to be really positive.
I held off of OS X Yosemite (10.10) due to negative reviews.
I've had no issues with El Capitan apart from having to sign out and back into iCloud to make it work.
Other than that, the upgrade has given me new features such as phone calling via my iPhone, and many more.
It even fixed the lag across the OS while I was running a graphically intensive application such as a game.
Compared to Windows 10, El Capitan is undisputedly the better OS in nearly everything for me.
If you are thinking of upgrading, I'd recommend you to go ahead and do so but ensure you back up, cleanout unused/unneccessary files, etc beforehand.
Since I upgraded my MacBook that I can not write anything without pressing the button fn!
If I don't do that , my keyboard starts to write like this: qiw?~fdkfe~frbksI already went to the definitions of the keyboard but nothing changes it.
And also change the pages on my browser and don't let me see anything.
I already reboot and download it again and it start to work prefectly, but it only lasted two days...
Having made the mistake of loading El capitan far too early from it's launch i then had sooooo many problems with getting my emails.
My website emails came through for one or two rounds then froze........saw the beachball continuously, even having left it over night in the hopes it would sort itself out....it didn't!
Following morning I was greeted with the beachball again!!!.
Finally uninstalled it and reinstalled Yosemite from back ups.....all working perfectly.
Last night, having thought Apple would have had enough time to iron out the bugs I re installed El Capitan.

Yes it's faster in Safari but my emails have again frozen and the only way through is to keep restarting my laptop so the speed gained in safari is lost with all the faffing about rebooting to get my emails.
Living in fast paced lives and buying alledgedly the best by buying Apple one at least expects them to deliver........rather unimpressed so far.
My MacBook Pro is five years old and was great with OS X Yosemite, so why not download El Capitan which is supposed to be even better !
First El Crapitan didn't transfer my email account passwords, so I could receive but not send.
Tech had to re-install my various email accounts for me, I couldn't find the problem.
So having lost around six hours of my life trying, we began our "journey' with the latest system ........ talk about yawn ...... so slow ......... so back on to Tech, to find that there is no answer.
They say all is perfect with available capacity, Installation, line speed and nothing is wrong, my machine is "a great spec and too young for there to be a problem" (their words).
My only answer from them was to perhaps increase memory with a memory upgrade (to pay for), with no guarantee that the speed would improve ?
Tech did offer to transfer me back to Yosemite but that is surely a retrograde step !
I am going to struggle on since I am travelling for a month or so, it seems the only real answer is to buy a new MacBook !
My wife has also downloaded El Crapitan, but having seen my massive drop in speed she will not be installing it !
Looking at the negative reviews I was a little concerned about this update but should not have worried.
I updated from Mavericks on a 2011 iMac, all went well took a couple of hours and had to reset passwords for my mail accounts.
My iMac now runs faster and everything works together well.
Really pleased.
El Capitan appeared to provide better performance as a trade for the fact that nothing changed on the surface.

However, a few days after I upgraded performance mysteriously dropped and now I am at this stage where the simplest actions (open a Finder window, open the preferences, summon Spotlight) bring my MacBook to a complete halt.
The action commonly doesn't even finish.
Only install if you have a MacBook 2015 or later.

row.Title: I'd give it no stars if I could

row.Sentences: This "upgrade' is dreadful.
My iMac 27 in now slow, buggy and basically damn near useable.
Looks like I'll have to format the disk and completeley restart the install, yes ITS THAT BAD.
This release is worse than anthing Microsoft ever relasead which makes me wonder, what the hell has happened to you apple?

row.Title: Worked fine until I had to shut down and restart my Macbook..

row.Sentences: I'm not a techie person so all I can say is that I did a back up and installed El Capitan.
It appeared to be fine until I had a message saying that some of my apps needed to be updated following which my Macbook would restart.
Once it had shut down and restarted, it froze on the Apple logo with a status bar that didn't seem to be going anywhere.
I left it for more than 3 hours and it did absolutely nothing which was when I googled it and found a host of people with the same problem.
I ended up having to reinstall the back up - I think I'm going to wait a long time before I think of upgrading my system again...

row.Title: no problems, has made my 2009 macbook into 215

row.Sentences: quick, slick and fast graphics.was simple to download and took about 45 minutes to instal with no hiccups.

row.Title: Can't even get to download it!!!

row.Sentences: Think it says it all if I'm not able to even download it!

row.Title: Oops! It has totally screwed my iMac !!!

row.Sentences: I wasted a lot of time reporting to the Beta Test Team (and being ignored) the fact that multiple items can no longer be deleted from the Calendar App, they all have to be deleted individually.
Only a small problem to most people, unless, like me, they use Calendar as a checklist for their daily workflow, having to spend half their day deleting Calendar items.
Come on Apple; how difficult can it be to fix this and get a FIVE STAR rating?By the way, I get around the problem by using Microsoft Outlook.
Oh, I hide my head in shame!
In my initial review I praised this version of OS X, apart from a small flaw, and gave it four stars.
Now, after just over one week, one star is all it gets, and it would be zero if possible.
Why the change of heart?
My 3Tb Fusion Drive has been totally destroyed by this abomination!
The 2Tb section now appears as Free Space and, wait for it, I no longer have permission to change it.
Gone are the permissions and repair permissions buttons................ WHY?
What on earth was Apple thinking about allowing this rubbish to be released as an OS.
Windows 95 was a better operating system in that it never arbitrarily deleted all ones data; thank God I've backups that aren't on Time Machine.
Although it has backed up my system, I don't have the necessary permissions to do a restore, or even access my Time Machine data.
I've had enough with this, so I've just ordered a new hard-drive which will be loaded with Linux !

row.Title: A step backwards for blind users

row.Sentences: Users of the VoiceOver screen reader will find that navigating in some aps has become harder as the quick nav function is no longer as useful as it was, the VoiceOver keyboard command to drag and drop items between windows no longer works, it is no longer always possible to read a whole eMail in one go without opening it into a new window, and editing text boxes on web pages can be very difficult as the cursor keeps returning to the start of the text if you start to move through it one word at a time.
In short, if you are a visually impaired user who relies on Voice Over, you will find this version a big step backwards compared to the versions preceding it over the last few years.
I saw all the reviews and I read mainly the bad ones so I was put off downloading it but I downloaded it today and no problems.
I love it so far.
It seems easy to use and I like everything about it.

row.Title: Having trouble after switching to El Capitan

row.Sentences: I've got a Macbook Pro 2012, it had Yosemite when I first got it and never had problem/issues when I installed El Capitan a few weeks ago, after doing a few things with safari and word, the keyboard just randomly puts symbols when I type.
It's not of any language, keyboard is set to British and Language is set to English UK.
Irestarted the laptop hoping i will fix itself but to no avail I could no longer login coz the keyboard is not functioning well.
I used external USb keyboard to log me in.
The macbook keyboard seem to have work properly after I logged in, but then when I start to use Safari, word etc again, it starts to play up again.
I dont know if this is El Capitan's problem.
Dont know what to do coz the MBP's keyboard no longer usable.
So having taken most of a day to download and install, I now dont have access to pages, as it needs an upgrade, but that is not compatible with OS x el capitan!
Now wont open documents from pdf either.
Cant print out some important documents so I suppose a few hours to get this fixed before I can what I need to today..

row.Title: Default Korean Font: Apple SD Gothic Neo

row.Sentences: I think it's a fine system font to use broadly.
It has changed the name and direction.
So I took so long to find the font.
It's fine that it added Apple into its name, but why is it located under Japanese font category?

row.Title: Remember to clear software/ROM cache after upgrade

row.Sentences: Just a little note, that any conflicts encountered its best to clear ALL types of cache and clear old drivers from ROMS.... Ive had MACS for 6 years and the support has been brilliant.
I encountered some serious issues after upgrading to another MAC - crashes stranger glitches etc.

Support went through my system and led me remotely.... i did most what they suggested already but there were three areas i forgot about eg resetting/clearing ROMS (happens to all of us).... and soon after resetting i had a Happy IMAC once again..
EVen after you come after of your guarantee ive found iMac support are still helpful.
Not too sure why everyone is complaining??
Iv'e downloaded and installed it whith no problems.
Ok, it took a while but i havent had any problems.
I would make a back up as you normally would when making major changes to your mac.
So far so good!!
Its working smoothly and its got much faster.

row.Title: A few teething problems but generally much better.
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I did not upgrade to Yosemite, after reading the numerous scathing reviews and when El Capitan was released there appeared to be more for than against.
I took the plunge with my daughters 2009 Macbook and didnt seem to encounter any problems.
It looked good and appeared to give her computer a new lease of life.
I then upgraded my other daughters 2010 Macbook and all went smoothly and again, everything seemed quicker and the performance renewed.
I then upgraded my 2009 iMac, after a short period of time assessing the MacBooks.
Everyting downloading without any blank screens or numerous, sporadic restarts.
There were initially a few teething problems with mail, which would not open and quit unexpectedly.
I followed some advice from an apple forum and worked the issue out.

I now find that my computer has speeded up remarkably, in terms of starting, migrating from program to another and although hesitant on the initial look of the new operating system, I have grown to like it.
For me, it has proven to be the right decision and as yet, I have had no regrets.
at last, I can stream to apple tv without the judders!
Laptop turns off after a kernel panic from time to time.
Wi-fi and bluetooth issues.
Mixed opinion - installed ok but instantly I realised that my VMware wouldn't run......lots of messing about and installing an upgrade, I got it to work.
Not noticed any slowing issues - although if I did, I would be seriously unimpressed as my machine is top spec i7 processor with 32 RAM and only a few months old with over 95% of the hard drive free.
The machine has crashed twice.
I also run Windows 10 via Bootcamp - Apple is still better than Windows.
I am shocked at all the comments - I DEFINATELY would have avoided updating with all the current comments, but I updated in October.
As the title suggest, camera isn't working.
Tired a dozen of fixes.
Sent hours searching for a solution, but NOTHING.
At one point I could see the camra being listed in System Report however soon as I launched Facetime for instance it has dissapeared.
Waiting for a fix.
I read the reviews but thought "it wont happen to me" - sadly it did.
My Mail was completely messed up, and even after reloading my e-mail accounts Mail is still grinding away 4 days later downloading over 2 million e-mails - really?
I can no longer backup - and I use a Time Capsule so no excuses there Apple - took 2 days to backup 6Gb of 34Gb and I had to give up as I had to take my laptop on a trip.
Now trying to do a Backup to an altenative device but stuck now on "preparing"!
Everything was working and synching fine till El Capitan - don't do it till Apple sort out the bugs.
I have an early 2008 iMac.... and it's so much faster with el capitan!
Thanks apple, my computer got a new lease of life
since downloading update, I've had trouble with adobe Illustrator cc
Wait until they fix the bugs.
I should have followed my own advice.
no visible improvement over Yosemite and its completely messed up my mail system
I would like to download the new opperating system.
I'm really trying... but it appears that Apple doesn't want me to.
Clicked "Download" and then everything is greyed out.
Can't install, can't re download.
decided to go for it despite the comments posted previously.
Thankfully like most things Mac related for me it went faultlessly!
I didn't bother with backing up (live life on the edge!)
and just clicked update on my 2008 iMac.
about an hour or so later it was ready to use.
No errors just working as intended.
Not sure about any speed increase - it appears similar to previous so far but like to keep up to date with any updates.
Mail done an upgrade and opened automatically with no problems.
Needed the latest Java update to run some apps but thats it - all working fine for me.

An iMac 5K used for Pixelmator and web development tasks and occasionally having to run Windows under Parallels Desktop to test web apps; a Mac Mini serving numerous clients; 2 x MacBook Pro's (2012 and 2015) all show noticeable performace improvements with El Capitan.
The Mac Mini particularly, and it runs also an Ubuntu web server in a VirtualBox process as well as OS X Server under El Capitan, and it's been very stable.
The integration with our IOS 9 devices is very good.
Again the OS X Server Cacheing Service helps here as well as OS X's Calendar and Mail Services.
We are very pleased with El Capitan.
NOTHING WORK PROPERLY !
SAFARI WORST EVER !
SYSTEM PREFFERENCE WORST EVER !

I wish I had not upgraded to El Capitan, some of my programs that I used to have running successfully no longer run like my file sharing applications such as Bit Torrent and that is just not acceptable I wish I could go back and remove it, is it really quicker for other things I can not say I have noticed much difference to be honest.
Come on Apple make other things compatible with my computer especially if they were running ok before.
I wish I'd left well alone.
My iCloud inbox is now empty - after I downloaded El Capitan this evening.
Don't know what to do now

row.Title: Update just shut down my business

row.Sentences: I am a self emplyed Forex trader and i run Metatrader 4 on my mac, it was working fine until yesterday when i updated to El Capitan.
Now the programme wont run.
So every day i am unable to trade I lose my income.

row.Title: All good in the Hood!
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: I took the route of least resistance with this launch and waited to see the reviews about it before activating the upgrade.
I'm a simple person.
I just want something that works quickly, efficiently and has been road tested before being made available.
This release seems to have been better bench tested than Yosemite.
Yes, the download and install takes a while, it's over 6gb after all.
Be patient and it does what it says on the tin and install with no problems.
The end result for me is that my Mac is noticeably faster, it has cured the crashed Apple Preview App that we couldn't reinstall or repair from Yosemite.
Finally, in my day job the split screen is a real world welcome addition that is simple to use.
All-in-all a good upgrade for me and hopefully will be for you.

row.Title: Not as good as it should be
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Installation, Mail, N/A, Performance, Safari, Support, Windows

row.Sentences: I installed it and it worked fine.
Until I restarted it and then it didnt get any further than the apple logo.
The people providing telephone support were very helpful but failed consistently.
We kept downloading a new OS and it would work; but failed to restart, exactly as before.
Eventually I took it to an apple store and a new OS was loaded.
I found that I was not the only person with exactly this fault: I know of four others, people I have never met before.
El Capitan restarted when the restart was invoked (twice) in the apple store but failed on the next occasion, a few days later.
I downloaded another copy of the OS and it has worked properly since.
So I compute with my fingers crossed.

During this series of downloading copy after copy of OSs, I noticed that the copy of Safari that is downloaded when you attempt remote recovery, which was on the fist occasions prtty ancient, changed.
I do not think the technicians prepared properly for remote recoveries, that the requirment was a surprise to them, but have now got their act together.
Now, iCloud does not work.
All other aspects seem OK. Had I know the trouble I would get, I would have waited a couple of months - like one has to with Windows.
Hence the low rating.

row.Title: Locked me out of my MacBook Pro - Had to buy an new computer

row.Sentences: I started the upgrade, went shopping, came back and it was hung with the Apple logo and a non-progressing progress meter.
Left it half an hour or so - no change.
Switch off, re-boot, no change - didn't recongnise my own computer passwords anymore.
Start up disks that came in the box didn't work.
Tried everything I could think of - still the same.
Bought a new computer.
Tried to recover all of the applications I'd bought and lost.
No way to recover all of my work and notes on my computer.
Back up disk had only done skeletal back ups with WD propriety software so couldn't recover much from there.
Carried on setting up new computer.
About two weeks later - because I'd now got internet access again - looked up if other people had the same problem.
One chap suggested some possible fixes, one of which was "command R' from shutdown restart.
I selcetd the option to re-install OSX from Apple.
It worked, after some bizarre keychain questions - which I have absolutely no idea how to answer.
Eventually my old laptop started working again and gave me access to my hard drive, so doing a time-machine back-up now.
OSX Install is unstable and not populating finder windows with what's in them at the moment, that's why I'm backing up my data now.
Worst Apple experience I've ever had and Apple were no help whatsoever, even their phone helpline now demands 25 just to speak to a human.
I'm only giving it 1 star because I think that's the minimum I can give and enter a review, otherwise it would minus 100 stars.
I suggest you make sure you've got everything that matters to you well backed-up before even thinking about this upgrade.
Worst Apple experience of my life - without doubt.

row.Title: Don't upgrade if you have M-audio firewire device!

row.Sentences: I'm rolling back to Yosemite, my firewire m-audio soundcard does not work with El Capitan.
Also, never had problems before however the El Capitan install hung after rebooting and took several hours to sort itself out.
Granted my imac is 2007, however performace seems to have taken a nose dive, not improved by this osx version.
New lay-out of disk utility looks like something out of windows 8 -abandon ship!

row.Title: Overrated so far
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Speed, Update, Windows

row.Sentences: Downloaded and installed yesterday.
i'd had mavericks and had to revert to lion as the graphics and dock look more grown up.
EL- CAPITAN is not really any better, i assume all those ranting how good it is are over enthusiastic youngsters who are obsessed with tech.
The other thing I've noticed is its no faster than previous, but memory usage at start up has gone up from 19% to 29% at 12mb of ram.
Also the "details" option to remove cookies manuallt has disappeared.
Have to admit I'm not overly impressed so far, but no doubt lion support will come to an end soon, just like my i-pod 4 and bbc i-player app wont work any more, and wont work on i-cloud exchange.
WHY CANT UK UPDATE IPHOTO YOU APPLE IDIOTS.
DONT RELEASE UPDATES TILL YOU'VE BENCH TESTED.
AND PEOPLE COMPLAIN ABOUT WINDOWS???????
The amount of negative reviews should be a strong hint to apple somethingis wrong.
Is it arrogance they never comment?
or are they completely geeked out?
As per usual the OS platform is bullet-proof.
Been using Mac's daily for more than 16 years now - never ever experienced a crash.
Not experienced any of the issues reported by some others with this update.
Did wait a month though before upgrading from Yosemite.
There does seem to be a speed improvment and like the subtle improvements to the OS as well as a liitle more disk space since the upgrade.
Updated my 2014 Macbook air - flawless.
Mac mini - flawless.
Even my 2009 MBP udpated without a hitch.
I like the new cartwheel design but shouldn't be seeing it!
I occasionally get a pause and see the cartwheel when using itunes and switching tracks.
That is the only thing preventing me from giving the full 5 stars.
Otherwise another first class OS from Apple...
I was one of those hopefulls that this update will improve my mac.
Instead I had to clear everything to the manufacturers start up point.
I've lost a lot of data, not sure how to get my MS Office and Outlook back as these things I use for work.
I have a basic Lion software now and really not sure what to do next.
I am not a techy person and the whole over the phone help is not suitable.
They really try to stop you coming to the shop for support!
This is the first time I have problems with Mac and to be fare really disappointed.... Do not update your Mac!
Since my upgrade my mac mini has been experiencing large flashing blocks of colour within windows ans sometimes the whole screen.
They seem to be most prominent in finder when i have a few applications open.
My mac book was running perfectly before but this update has made it feel much slower and more sluggish.
Also unless I close all openeded applications the computer doesnt shut down it merely goes onto standby wasting the battery, this was also not a problem before I did the update.
Just sits permanently "waiting"....
Every time I used iTunes and had another App open everything slowed down!
(Late 2012 iMac 2.9GHz Processor) Scrolling became stepping and even opening Apps became an issue, Safari and Facetime just bounced in the dock for about 2 minutes before slowly starting up.
Reverted back to Yosemite and will probably keep it that way!
Not good, Apple!
mac pro 3.1 was working perfectly before now keeps crashing also macbook pro is very slow i would avoid

row.Title: What they won't tell you! Keychain Password problems on AppleMail after El Capitan upgrade

row.Sentences: Watch out with your Apple Mail!

If you are a power user who uses heavy duty IMAP Servers replicated on your machine you may find that suddenly your passwords start bouncing back and that you can not access your Internet Accounts in System Preferences....
It will start rejecting your receiving and sending of mails to the point that your accounts need entire rebuilds.

The issue is in Keychain - and the suggestion from Apple help intially was to delete all the Keychain which would have meant that for the 900 websites where I use a particular email account I would then have to enter the passwords again.... Not an option I wanted to go for..
I got passed through to the special team at Apple and we spent 5.5 hours trying to sort matters out.
Got there in the end ....
But what's the benefit I am enjoying with El Capitan.... so far not seen anything to shout about.. just a world of pain.
But they did agree to send me a Data storage unit as compensation.
Think twice about the upgrade.
Make sure there is something in there that you really need.
I wonder what Apple is getting in return for us upgrading to this os.....
Happy to be corrected but, what turned out to be, a serious waste of my time!
Updated to 10.11 - fuck3d up the computer so had to go back and wast time restoring backups.
Updated to 10.11.1 as issues were supposed to be dealth with - hors3sh1t!

:- email accounts disappeared so only can use phone to deal with my emails at the moment - USB3 hub not working anymore- spelling in different languages doesnt work anymore so makes almost impossible to type as it converts everything into english words- not getting notoications from internet accounts- wasted hours on the phone with apple support and waiting in the queue and it is getting so fuck1ng annoying!
Not sure what all the fuss has been all about, took 40 mins to download, 30 to install and started up good as gold (on a Macbook Air mid 2014)
....although, to be fair, it won't download anyway.
Another example of poor Apple customer experience.
If you are going to offer a download, can you at least make sure that the download will actually download?
Good upgrade, running well on my 2011 Macbook Pro (4GB).
No downside so far.
But installation time was well over two hours for me, with long worrying periods associated with messages such as " 1 minute remaining", or progress bar stuck at near completion.
If progress indications were more reliable, I think there would be fewer negative ratings
Upgrade went smoothly.
So far so good (been two weeks now).
Mac mini (Late 2012)2.6 GHz Intel Core i716 GB 1600 MHz DDR3
I changed and it changed some of the programs I worked with so I restored back to the older version.
I was getting lots of error messages which had never happened before.
I think they are missing Steve Jobs.
Perfection is art that has to worked at!

row.Title: Worked for me but not for my wife

row.Sentences: Hit or miss upgrade.
My wife has just had a disaster upgrading her iMac.
The upgrade just hung and then trying to reinstall from scratch (because it would not boot) kept getting a NO ENTRY logo on the screen - very bloody helpful, Apple.
Had to restore from backup and the second attempt at an upgrade seems to have worked but some issues with Microsoft Office persist.
Have had to resort to the help of an IT expert for the first time on Apple.
Worried this is a slippy slope towards a Microsoft type experience for any future upgrades.
Will certainly not upgrade withing the first month of a release in future.

row.Title: El Capitan - Blackberry - not syncing - why?

row.Sentences: So I installed El Capitan and leaving aside other issues I now cannot sync my Blackberry!
When I question Apple they tell me this is not their issue but as other reviewers comment it really is not right for Apple to pump out upgrades etc ignoring their customers who use other products.
I cannot back up my phone and Apple have no concern for me whatsoeve.
They must have known pre release that El Capitan did not sync with Blackberry.
I would love someone from Apple to come forward and explain.
I've been trying to download this for days.
When i first pressed download it started moving, and then stopped in the same place for hours.
I then stopped it, and restarted my computer and pressed resume.. nothing.
My launch pad has a little download bar underneath and has done so for days, my computer is so slow and sometimes just doesnt load a page.

At first i thought it could be my internet, but its working fine on all other devices (iphone and iPad) .. so now i have no idea how to fix this but it wont download, and my computer starts acting up when i dont update the software so yeaa.... great.
I installed this on my Mid 2012 Macbook Air and have been astounded by the results.
The speed from boot up and speed from sleep is vastly increased.
The upgrade to Yosemite had really slowed my macbook down - I felt it had become clunky and was thinking about upgrading to a new Macbook Pro.
I'm not bothered about the new features - it was worth it for the speed alone.
I'm yet to upgrade on my mid 2009 iMac or my 2015 iMac.
the 2009 upgrade will be interesting though ...

row.Title: what has happened to Apple - they are nearly as good as Windows..but have some improving to do.

row.Sentences: i would like to qualify that i have had macs for 20+ years, i have in principle sold them to everyone i met, how good they are etc, and its a running joke that i am very biased towards Apple and how excellent they "have' been.

i am a muscisian and depend on them greatly, and in the first 18 years i can remember only having to press the power button off due to the machaine freezing may be a few times, you could count it on one hand.

In the last 1 to 2 years it is now a daily part of my life to turn off by the power button, if not that then the programs are quitting, or generally taking forever to do anything, i always send reports to Apple, they must have a profile of all the reports that are sent into them, i would love to see the profile of how many they get now over even 2 years ago.
since Steve departed they have gone down thre pan in a very very big way.
Can anyone remember the amount of updates you have to do now, its almost weekly, in the good old days I used to look forward to updates in a perverted may, as they were rare.

I have a mac air, a mac book pro, two power macs and an iMac,and this last update has turned them in the main into chunks of metal, safari - i get a blank white page up and a spinning wheel, mail - i could hand deliver the message before it opens, dont want to even start on iTunes, bascially Apple are now only interested in supplying phones and ipads to teenagers, they have lost there way and i cannot see them coming back.
So to the point, i will not be buying any more apple products.
don't upgrade!!
Apple Mail has crashed repeatedly ever since and one of my Mail accounts have disappeared.
This dowlnlaod has to be the worst thing EVER.
If anu product will drive you back into the hansds of a competitor it is this.
All of a sudden windows looks fantastic.
My MacBook Pro now runs very slowly.
Taen me 6 minutes to open App Store.
Web pages open as slowly as if I am using dial up rather than superfast broadband.
I use my Mac for work purposes and sat in front of a client this morning and 10 minutes later it still hadn't opened Safari.

row.Title: Problems with OS X El Capitan

row.Sentences: Loaded El Capitan this morning, lost all email inbox folders, lost contacts, lost all iphoto images - unable to load iphoto update, what a disaster!
I have had literally nothing but problems with this update.
The update process itself went smoothly, but since then my computer has been incredibly slow.
As in, almost unusably slow.
The "spinning wheel of death" is an almost constant feature and applications take almost a minute to load.
I'm also one of those people who needs windows to complete my work tasks, so I had a lovely Windows 10 boot camp partition (which runs incredibly fast compared to even OSX Yosemite).
Unfortunately, this update wiped the entire partition and reprogrammed it to Mac OSX Extended instead.
I now have to go through the entire partitioning and installation process again.
This is a real pain for me.
Finally, the update has also caused my computer to not recognise it's own internal speakers, so I can no longer play music or watch films.
All in all, this update has been a disaster.
Model: Apple Macbook Pro (Early 2011).
I do not recommend this update until the issues with e mail have been rectified, I am constantly getting requests for password required, every few seconds.
Apple have not lived up to there usual high standard they have let themselves down big time.
When are we going to get an update to stop constantly being requested to enter e mail Passwords.
This is unacceptable, come on apple put it right now.
No update button on I tunes as there used to be to done load updates?
Like other reviews, I have been very disappointed with this OS X upgrade.
I have been a Mac user since the early 1990's and this is the first time I am experiencing what most colleagues at work suffered with their PC/Microsoft computers.
I used to be amused as I never experienced crashes or gremlins.
Since downloading El Capitan I have experienced gremlins with Safari and Mail not to mention the occasional crash and restart for no reason at all.
And as for the beachball (pretty as it is) it appears to be a permanent feature no matter what I do.
This household runs two iMacs and the above features are present on both so it must be poor software!
Please Apple, bring out an upgrade that restores my faith in the Apple product.
El capitan has completely messed my keychains.
No amount of troubleshooting individual keychains does not make the problem come back after a while.... now having to work with a computer which gets lost and freezes askinf for passwords constantly.
Wish I had not upgraded.
After loading EL Capitan start up of the computer now take twice as lone, time enough to mak a cup of tea a bit like the old windows start up very slow?

row.Title: Safari is broken in the new El Capitan

row.Sentences: I have a 13-inch, Early 2011 MBP and often as I load safari and click on the address bar, it freezes for a few seconds which renders it unusable compared to other web browsers like Chrome or Firefox.
I did like the energy saving aspect of safari as well as being optimised for the hardware but at the moment I am not a happy customer, before the upgrade I was.
Was apprehensive due to the number of poor reviews.
In the end bit the bullett and just downloaded without a hitch.
Will update in a few days after i've tried it out.
Even from the start this was a teerible application.
It took about 2 days for the software to be completely installed on my macbook pro.
Following this I have had nothing but problems.
Slow to load, even when listening to iTunes it sounds glitchy at times.
When I type it takes ages to catch up with what I am writing.
Before downloading this my macbook worked fine.
Now it is hard work to do the simplest of task.
I feel like I am working on a 10 year old windows laptop!
The only positive thing is that I think the interface looks nice but it doesn't make up for all of the other issues I have encountered.
Sort it out Apple!
Theres not many features that are worth half the software not working.
Also my Macbook Pro has not shutdown correctly since upgrading!

row.Title: Not sure what the bad reviews are about

row.Sentences: Installed this, in some wways feared the worse due to the other reviews but never having had a bad experience before I bit the bullet.
It took under an hour to install and all went smoothly.
Since updating, I've had to update one piece of client software I use, which may be worth a try for anyone having issues with other software, and it's been fine since.
MacBook Air and it's not slowed my machine down.
As for use, I haven't really noticed much difference to look and feel or had a go at some of the new features but it's solid so far, unlike my work laptop which runs a different OS!
I was apprehensive about upgrading to El Cap but after having collected my iMac (2010 )from Apple after havng a new graphics card installed I decided to risk it !.
I had already backed everything up on an external hard drive and all my photos on another external drive, I set about the upload.
The whole process took just over an hour and crossing my fingers opened the computer up.
Everything appeared to run normally, I didnt notice anything spectacular in the speed but nothing negative either.
I explored the additional features that I wanted to use and Split View worked superbly., this is something I will find very useful indeed.
Spotlight was much better and Mission Control more organised and intuitive.
Two days later I upgraded El Cap to my Macbook Pro (2011) and although it's early days, but nothing untoward has occurred as yet.
The only added thing I had to do was download the legacy Java SE runtime to enable me to use Photoshop CS5.
That was no problem and when downloaded the program ran as normal.
So far so good !!

row.Title: Couldn't get it to install - hopeless!

row.Sentences: Tried to download (it took hours) and at the final step it wouldn't instal and seemed to go into a circular loop, never finishing the process.
The only option was to re-instal from Time Machine and go back to Yosemite, which fortunately worked successfully.
After that experience - and the poor reviews - I'm not going to risk it again and will stick with what works.

row.Title: Sleeping macbook won't wake up anymore

row.Sentences: So I only have my Macbook for about a month and I installed the newest version of OS X Capitan about a week ago.
I haven't noticed any major differences, except one really crappy one: if I close my Macbook to let it "sleep" for several hours, it will not wake up when I open it again.
If it's just 5 minutes, sure, that's fine.
But much longer than that and I will have to push the "start" button for a prolonged period of time to close it down and then start back up again.
I mean.... That's so bad for my laptop?!?!?!
Really bad update!!

row.Title: Dont intall this on a MacBook Pro

row.Sentences: Made the mistake of upgrading to El Capitan on my 6 month old Mac Book Pro, just about every package crashes frequently, Safari isn't relaiable any more, it about 10-15% slower with the rainbow twirl icon being on screen more than its off.
In short it terrible, this is a Alpha Release at best.
Apple use to be a decent reliable company for software updates and cared about the users, these days they just want the money and the after sales service has been thrown out the window.

row.Title: Hope they bring a new update soon

row.Sentences: Not a fan of the El Capitan.
My mac ran as smooth as anything before and I never had problems but since the new download the rainbow wheel pops up a lot.
Safari is a lot slower and a lot more glitchy with tabs doing weird things and pages loading slowly if they load at all.
I haven't had any software incompatibility issues thankfully though.
The update has added a few asthetic differences but nothing significant and this latest update has so not been worth it.
I hope there's an update coming soon to fix these problems.

row.Title: Saw all the doom and gloom, but had no problems whatsoever

row.Sentences: I read all the doomsday El Capitan scenarios but curiosity got the better of me.
I like to know that everything is up-to-date.
My 27inch late 2009 iMac, Time Machines to an external drive, so no danger I thought.
My experience of the upgrade was good and computer performance since is fine.
Recommend you keep up with the swim...

row.Title: If your apps stop working it is your own fault!

row.Sentences: Ok ok, so yes many third party applications and plugins may not work on with El Capitan, but all these developers have been given so long to get their products ready, that its isn't Apple's or this OS's fault they don't work.

Software incompability is nothing new for OS updates, so i can't believe all these daft people bad mouthing apple and el capitan, statements like "apple don't care about the end user/professional' are just madness.unltimately if you are a proffesional and need your current set up to make yourself a living then YOU DON'T HAVE TO UPDATE and CHECK FOR COMPATIBILITY with your the developers of your crucial applications.
Stop apple bashing and enjoy a great OS
How can Apple release an OS that messes up email so badly?
It is such a basic need of every user I simply cannot understand why to date there is still no fix, I honestly though a fix would be released within hours of the OS release.
El Capitain is also so painfully slow on my 1 year old iMac.
This is Triple A software - Avoid, Aviod, AVOID

row.Title: Excellent but as usual wise to do a clean install

row.Sentences: I have clean installed on my iMac and everything is better.
Machine is faster than under Yosemite and everything works as it should with none of the glitches reported.
The interface is a matter of personal taste - I like it.
My only proviso is that I take the time to do a clean install beacause so many previous OS updates have been problematic - I have no doubt El Capitan is the same.

For me a thorough clean install involves 2 back ups; Creating a bootable OS installer; Wipe hard drive; Install OS from the bootable installer; and importantly, re-install data manually and start with fresh system settings so you don't carry across bugs from previous version, and also take the opportunity to not install stuff you don't use.
It takes a few hours and you should dedicate the time without interruptions but the results are worth it.
I'm convinced most OS issues arise from legacy installation conflicts with the update- particularly at system settings level .

If you're interested, the apps I use most are: Office 2016 including Outlook, Apple Mail, Pixelmator 3, Rapiweaver 6, Aperture 3, Filemaker 14, Swift Publisher 4, Garageband 10, MainStage 3, Algorridim DJay 4 - and they all work very well (except Garageband needs an update for it's Alchemy plug ins - but that's not El Capitan related)
Like most users here I was very nervous about upgrading to El Capitan.
I had read various reviews especially the earlier ones where the end users were having trouble with email or their printer or other Apps.
I spoke to a couple of friends of mine at the weekend, one of whom had upgraded his laptop, his desktop and his daughters laptop with no problems.
Another friend had some issues but he upgraded when the upgrade first appeared but all his problems have now been sorted.
I downloaded the upgrade on Sunday and kept my fingers crossed.
The download took just over one hour and then a further 30 minutes to load, at the end it was painless, everything worked.
I have noticed a marginal improvement in speed but the additional options like split view etc are worth it alone.
Come on you Guys get the upgrade, you will not be disappointed.

row.Title: Safari & Mail freezing after El Capitan upgrade

row.Sentences: I'm running a one year old iMac which, until the last upgrade to El Capitan, was working great through all applications.
My internet download speed is about 5 mbps, and it is hardwired using ethernet.
After the upgrade, Safari was intermittently freezing as was Mail, and iTunes.
When they did work they were very slow.
I ran a system diagnostic check which didn't find any problems, so I spoke with Apple support who talked me through cleaning out the cache.
There wasn't much to clean out, and as it hadn't caused problems in the past year, I couldn't see that being the problem.
It didn't seem to fix the problem.
When I opened my Network Preferences, I noticed that the order of connections had been altered.
Instead of having Ethernet as the first preference for internet, it was set to an extension hub for my router which is in another room.
Hence the very weak internet reception on the iMac.
Since changing it back to Ethernet, the speed and connectivity is back up to where it was, and, touch wood, everything seems to be back to normal.
Saw a lot of negative views about this and was concerned.
Took the plunge and everything works fine.

I have installed El Capitan this morning - and immediately hit upon a problem: I have been told that not only is my version of iPhoto not compatible with El Capitan, but that the latest version isn't available in the UK.
So at a stroke I no longer have access to my photo library, which I use for work.
Apple, what ARE you doing?
Surely you need to ensure that all the core programmes work, before you launch a new operating system?
Please remedy immediately, or I will have to uninstall
Initially, having read all the negative reviews, I was hesitant about downloading El Capitan.
However, I have encountered no problems with the installation and my iMac is working absolutely fine; if anything, I would say it is running much faster and more smoothly.
I can only assume that, where people encounter difficulties, the problem must lie with their device rather than with the application.
I installed this on a 2009 iMac I have experienced a number of instances of system crashes whilst using SafariI'm so pleased I did a full system backup prior to carrying out the update
its a bit slow which does effect the performance i hope this would be fixed with a update soon

row.Title: Terrible update, my Imac has never ran so poorly

row.Sentences: Absolutely Shocking.
2012 imac running like a PC.
Never before have i ever wanted to damage my imac.
Everything i do i get the bloody beach ball up.
I have the i3 processor and 6GB of ram.
Im struggling to open two applications and have Safari on the go.
I normally hang fire a few months too before i update.... Let them iron out the bugs.
Well i won't be making that mistake again !
Get it sorted Apple !!

its slowed down my mac considerably, face time doesnt work, nas connection is terrible, safari freezes and crashes, finder freezes and needs restarting oftern, printers wont connect properly, oftern wont even restart!
do not download until they have fixed it!
or atleast back up before so that you can revert back to yosimete once you realise how terrible el capitan is.
to say the least not impressed!
Bought a brand new iMac 5K earlier this year.
Now I want to send it back!
I am used to having to nurse my PC and fiddle with it continuously to get it to work right, but Macs used just to work.
I deliberately waited before sending this Review to see whether things settled down and Apple did some quick work with updates and fixes but.
Since upgrading to ElCapitan - Trackpad stops keyboard and mouse from workinge-Mail iCloud account unstable - takes forever to delete e-mails as they cannot be moved to trash on iCloud.
I have had to use my elderly MacBook to delete old e-mails or they keep coming back!
Keep getting told that iCloud account needs resetting when it doesn't!

Canon wirless printer has had to revert to wired as wireless keeps dropping out randomlyIt is no faster, and if anything slower, certainly when you account for time wastedUnexplained crashes - something I don't think I have ever had before since moving to Macs 10 years agoIt is as if Apple did not properly assess this software before sending it out.
Maybe they need to stop rushing out new things and concentrate on making the ones they have work like they should.
I was very happy with the previous OS.
No sooner is the new this or that sent to market than the next one is being announced!
I think they are trying too hard to keep the innovators and shareholders happy!
I am used to having Apple Products that just work brilliantly.
Recently things have started to wobble!
Shareholders will leave you, not because you are not innovative, but because you have forgotten you need us - the Customers - to be happy and come back, again and again.
I have now had 4 Macs and the three old ones still work - this one doesn't at present.
Get the fixes out, let the system settle and be what it should be - a joy to use!
Just look at the reviews and ratings Apple!!
I know those who are not happy are more likely to send one in, but surely a 500 to 200 ratio of less than happy to happy customers should be ringing some big alarm bells!

row.Title: Much better than the OS from 7 years ago...

row.Sentences: I MEAN SERIOUSLY WHO USES A MAC?
AN ACTUAL MAC......, I ...., UHHHHHHH(Seriously though, I just got this Mac to find it hadn't even been turned on for like 6 years.
I'm no avid Apple user but anything is better than that OS.
Iv'e never used Yosemite so I'm no expert but El Captain has performed great for me in the short time Iv'e used it.
Recommended)((PC still Master Race))(((OTIO)))

row.Title: Make Sure You Have A Back Up

row.Sentences: I tried updating my Macbook Retina (2013), the update downloaded okay but during the install the laptop kept rebooting, tried recovery mode and re-installing and did the same, so i ended up restoring from a backup to where i was before the attempted update.
If you decide to do the update make sure you have a timemachine backup otherwise you will be stuffed ......

row.Title: Fears were not founded
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: I have refrained from upgrading to El Capiitan for months and months having read all the stories of doom!
I have now finally had to bite the bullet as I am testing a new piece of software, that will not run on earlier versions of the mac OS!
It took my about 1.5 hours to download El Capitan and about 35 minutes to install it on my 3 year old 15in Retina Macbook Pro.
All my worries and fears were absolutely in vain.
Everything worked brilliantly and faster than before.
(The only slight hiccup was having to resubmit passwords to my two different email accounts, which took all of 2 minutes.
)I would thoroughly recommend upgrading with a machine of similar age!!
I wish that I had not waited so long, or worried so much about the upgrade.
The integration with my iPhone and iPad is superb.
Mon 2 Nov 2015: having spent about THREE!
hours "installing' El Capitan, it failed at the Password stage!
Boxes said: UserName(?)
Aardverx; below this Password ......................
So, am I never to get the El C,or is it truly Kaput?
This update is quite simply, a nightmare.
Nothing works, it's so much slower.
To anyone thinking of updating, please don't!
Upgraded from Yosemite and again a perfect operating system.
I have experienced no problems at all on my mid 2014 Macbook Pro with all applications running smoothly.
The installation was easy, the outcome a fiasco.
The computer slows down dramatically, programs repeatedly freeze.
Email, printers, scanners, iTunes - everything needs to be manually readjusted.
Having changed from a Microsoft based operating system to Apple to improve the user experience I seem to have moved back many steps.
In other words: A true downgrade

row.Title: Good update apart from the crashing...

row.Sentences: Generally I'm pleased with the El Capitan update.
However, it is regularly crashing Mail.app (at least 3 or 4 times a day) on clicking reply/forward or sometimes randomly when opening mails.
It also seems to crash my MacBook Air (2015 model) at least twice per day.
When it is running it is very smooth which makes these crashes all the more bewildering and frustrating.
Not noticed problems with any other programs - it's only (!!!)
Mail.app...

row.Title: So far so good
row.Topic: Backup, Compatibility, Installation, N/A, Performance, Windows

row.Sentences: I held off upgrading as there is one program i use that gets affected on every upgrade and is normally a week or two behind in making it fully compatible.
Ive not found any problems as yet.
After reading the other reviews it looks like i made the right decision to hold off.
I always have a backup so its not a issue to roll back if need be.
I like the new changes and I would still never consider going back to Windows.
The only downside I have experienced to upgrading was the install time, not sure how long it took because after waiting 3 hours i went to bed and by the morning it was done.

Im still having to run a fan control program when running a certain program as it gets very hot, I was hoping that somewhere along the updates/upgrades etc that this would be resolved to stop the processor running so hot that the computer stops responding or hanging, it needs either Apple to introduce a low temp for when the fans kick in or the program devs solve the issue.
Having the same problem as in Yosemite, to which I upgraded only recently, namely that the dock doesn't retain my personalisation.
On restart it reverts to default.
I thought that upgrading to EL Capitan might resolve this rather than doing what Apple recommended which was to reinstall OSX, but to no avail.
I would like an answer this problem.
I updated an early 2009 IMac Duo core from Yosemite and had no problems and the computer seemed to run faster after the update.
I also updated my Macbook Air without any issues.

row.Title: No problems for me - just works fine

row.Sentences: Having read a lot of adverse/negative reviews I approached this with trepidation, I am an IT professional.
However, apart from the time it took to download it did exactly what it said on the tin.
Just in case I did a full time machine backup just in case, but it wasn't needed in the end.
Worst decision I've made for my Mac !
Just don't do it .
Pretty pathetic!
Office 2011 doesn't work anymore after OS X update.
Can't scroll past like 20 pages in a document.
Had to install office in a windows VM!
OS X crashes pretty much everyday and I have to hold power button and reset.
Apps hang.
I'm thinking of going back to windows after being with OS X for 6 years.
WIth B$100 in the bank, is this the best they can do?

row.Title: DONT UPGRADE IF YOU OWN A MACBOOK 2015

row.Sentences: Don't upgrade to el captain, it doesnt play well with the new macbook 2015.
Lag, software glitches and the system will freeze randomly every 15-20mins, all but the trackpad work whilst it crashes.
Forget being productive and doing work!.
APPLE FIX THIS.
Spent days emailing back and forth, chatting with Apple support and the last solution was to downgrade to OS X Yosemite.

Be ware I did upgrade from Yosemite and then after the issues I made a bootable USB and formatted the hard drive, installed el captain and didnt use any backups.... still the freezes and lag continued!
I tried El Capitan after reading mostly good reviews.
I have four Macs in the house, a 2014 iMac, a 2012 Mac Mini, an old 2010 Macbook Pro and a new 2015 Macbook Air.
The only computer El Capitan installed correctly on was the 2014 iMac.
El Capitan caused substantial problems on the PowerBook to the extent that I rolled it back to Yosemite.
I had very similar problems with the Mac Mini.
The roll-back on the Powerbook took two days to acheive as the first few attempts were unstable and for a time I thought I had lost some key applications.
There is obviously a substantial drop in testing and quality control at Apple at the moment.
I will not upgrade the Air untill these problems are resolved as the Air belongs to my wife and contains the manuscript of her latest book.
Just in case there is any doubt in your mnd this was an extremely dissapointing and stressful experience and I strongly suggest you skip this "upgrade'.
I've owned Macs since about 1995 when they were Pizza box shaped and people thought it odd to own them.
We all know why they are brilliant, I hope, and everyone needs to know that it is vital to update the OS.
Sometimes things seem slower for a time, but, in this case, using an "old" 2007 iMac I find everything quicker and better.
It took some time to download but it was free and I am pleased I have done so.
Be patient when carrying out the operation and give the computer time to sort itself out.
Did a clean install of El Capitan 10.11.1 on both my 2009 Macbook Pro 13" and my 2011 MacAir 11".
Boot up time seems to be slower, but the Macbook feels faster (than when it was running on Yosemite), and the MacAir definitely is speedier.
Despite having installed 11.1, problems persist.
Safari hangs (I've had to switch to Chrome), and Outlook in Office 2016 crashes occasionally on the MacAir.
I first installed Office 2016 on the Macbook, but it slowed the computer so much that I had to deinstall it, and go instead for Office 2011.
I have had more success with Office 2016 on the MacAir, though the programmes are slow.
I'm not convinced that El Capitan is such an advance over Yosemite as to make the listurbance worthwhile.

row.Title: Holding Back - Until Now
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: Painfully I've been holding back on recent Apple OSx updates, due to the poor reviews.
As a result many of my progrgrams such as Final Cut Pro, Motion, Compressor, and many others, were lagging behind because of incompatibility.

Thank goodness for this OSx update .... EI Captain is running very well on both my 27" iMac (2012) and recent Macbook Pro (2014 retina) I wasnt sure about the graphics to start with - a very simplistic 2D look, but its growing on me.
It has little to do with performance, which has improved.
To date; I've noticed no incompatablitity issues with most programs running better (smoother) or at least as good as before.
Once system optimisation was complete, boot-ups seem faster, and a few issues with deletions (trash) are now solved.
Programs that I rely on for work such as FCPX, run smooth and glitch free.
Overall, a good OSX update - thank you Apple!
UPDATE:I think I've discovered why issues develop ....
I cleaned out old incompatable programs off my system, or updated if possible.
We tend to hold on to old programs - I discovered loads, and most I just don't use anymore.
Once I had cleaned my Computer of all junk, EI Captain started to work beautifully.
Boot up seem a little slow, but generally, everything works well, amd in some cases, better.
My gently ageing Mac Pro tower is collapsing under the weight of this new OS.
It was taking a long time to action simple commands in Word and elsewhere, with the return of the spinning pizza of death that I hoped had disappeared from the Mac forever.
Now, it has started abruptly restarting.

Today, I implemented the latest release of El Capitan in the hope that it would fix the bugs, but the restarts are now coming one after the other until the Pro stops altogether with a flashing light on the power button.
I've been a happy OSX customer for several years, but this latest release is a catastrophe for me.
As ever, I hung back and let a few others make the switch to El Capitan....after all, I was not having any issues with Yosemite, so no rush to upgrade.
Read the mixture of reviews (both good and bad) and had a moments hesitation before plugging into the ethernet connection (my wireless often drops out) and hitting the "get it" button.
Did my bit and left my macbook pro (2009 vintage) to get on with it.
It sat there for a while telling me that there was 30 minute remaining, but soon clock started counting down and that was it - install complete, no drama.
No problems whatsoever - all applications in my docking bar remained the same and all appear to be fully functional and load with minimal beachballing.
Had to reset my wallpaper back to my own photos rather than the (impressive looking lump of mountain picture).
Yet to see whether the upgrade has any effect on preventing wireless dropouts, but so far so good.
Would have given 5 stars, but still not quite sure what benefits it has brought me one the previous version (too busy to run the tutorial when it popped up for me).

row.Title: When will they do something good

row.Sentences: I'm not attempting to download it until they manage to get it to work for all.
