I'm using the last of the badass 17" MPB's (a late 2011 machine), 2.5 GHz Intel Core i7 with maxed RAM and I'd just like to say thanks for ruining everything!
Installing El Capitan was my biggest regret of 2015 and we aren't even through November or December yet.
I've been using it from almost day one and it just gets more and more painful to use every day.

After taking well over 2 hours to install when the count down clock said 27mins, you've managed to completely destroy everything that worked perfectly and ran super smooth, and left me with a machine that's taken me back to the old days of owning a dogs-do-do Window machine.
I now have constant problems with pretty much every application I use.
Adobe CS crashes randomly, as too did MS Outlook 2011 which I had to remove completely and replace with 2016 (which also crashes 3 times a day).
Even Macaw, Axure RP, Balsamiq and iTunes can't be used without crashing at least once a day.
I've tried removing all app and doing a complete re-install of them and it's no better.

And to make matters worse my backup drive was recently stolen out of my bag whilst using public transport on the way home from work so I have no way of rolling back, unless I lose a shed load of work.
Many thanks Apple for really royally ruining my once great machine.
I'll no longer be an innovator or early adopter of anything Apple anymore.
I am so depressed by my recent experiences with OSX, it's making me think about buying a PC!
El Capitan has not improved on the disaster that was Yosemite at all.
Since installing Yosemite, my Macbook has been almost unusable - so slow!
It's no good saying"Just do a fresh install".
That means all the years of software and files need to be started & installed again.
Imagine if you bought a car and following a service it would only reach 10MPH?
Then the garage says, have you tried rebuilding the car?It's also no good saying "it works for some people".
This is dedicated software, written for a known hardware platform, by the people who built the hardware - it should work for everyone!
I remember persuading many friends away from PCs to Macs.
Steve Jobs was an innovative thinker and a great man.
Apple has lost much since his tragic death.
So far all I have noticed is that I can't open Mail....

row.Title: Apple getting worse every upgrade - El Capitan worst yet

row.Sentences: Against my normal practice decided to upgrae early in the cycle and was not too hopeful of success - but you have to positive sometime.
Tried for 3days to download and it kept pausing all on its own - should have been enough warning but I carried on.
Thanks to apple support finally got it downloaded and off we went - seemed fine except finished with no email accounts, contacts or calendar.

Back to apple support and went back to Yosemite pre upgrade from time machine, however Photo library would not work then as it had obviuosly been alterd so back to apple support where I had two options reinstall El Capitan or transfer all photos but without any albums, event or faces, or any labels - now that last option represents an shedload of time & effort lost so it was back to reinstate El Capirtan.
Luckily this time I had the sense to remove all emails I wanted onto my Mac (just in case) & you know what when upgrade done all email accounts wewre lost except for the on my mac stuff.

everything else seems to work - yes even the photos app/files so I just have the pain of setting up my 4 email accounts again - thansk Apple you are definitely getting worse you only lost all my email passowrds last time when I upgraed to Yosemite.

Seems to me such a basic expectation to think your email accounts would work - did nobody do any testing on this?Pity I still like Apple compared to the competion - but you are pushing it - MUST DO BETTER!!

row.Title: Not faster (about the same) and Mail is worse

row.Sentences: Took a couple of hours to install.
No issues during installation other than the initial download was a bit slow.
After installation it felt pretty much the same as before, not faster, not really slower either, just the same.
Email accounts were all still there but could only receive mail and not sent.
SMTP list was empty.
Tried the trick of disabling and reenabling icloud mail and two SMTP servers came back but no others.
In the end I had to delete and reinstall every one of my email accounts, which was a massive pain considering the UI isn't any different.
Overall this feels like something rushed out without enough testing and even then the "improvments' are largely pointless.
I'm not one for writing these kind of reviews and can live with one or bugs BUT this install is broken.
Seems to be ok on my newer MacBook but VERY sketchy o my older iMac to the point its pretty unusable.
Apple pls update asap!
Since upgrading, I am having major problems with accessing https// websites regardless of the browser used.
It really looks like OS X goes from bad to worse.

row.Title: Better than I anticipated
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: Initially, the download always stopped at 1.79GB.
Many entries in the forums about this, but no solutions.
So I took my 2013 iMac to the Genius Bar at my local Apple Store and installed El Capitan there.
Even with Apple support people helping the installation took nearly 3 hours.
Only one upgrade needed and that was to an HP printer driver.
All my other applications work fine even though I was coming from 10.7.
My iMac does appear to be running marginally faster.
My only comment would be that I don't like the way OS X and iOS apps have been merged to the same look & feel - especially the new version of Numbers.
I upgraded to El Capitan because my business applications were no longer supported on 10.7.
I still haven't found anything in El Capitan that would have persuaded me to upgrade just to get the new stuff.
It works, no bugs, slightly faster - so all OK !
I downloaded this recently to my 18 months old iMac.
Apart from regular freezing, it regularly reboots itself.
I never switch my machine off unless I'm away from home as I'm back and forth on the computer and want the convenience of just logging back in when I need to without a total restart.
I also have a tendency to leave web pages open for use later.
So it's a total ball-ache when you return to the machine, sometimes as little as 20 mins later (after a phone call, etc) and it's clearly rebooted itself and asks for all passwords again.
I thought it was due to a power outage in the house but nothing else is affected so it must be due to the upgrade in OS.
Now, anyone know how to roll back to previous OS?
I will not upgrade my macbook until all stated issues are resolved.
really wish i hadnt installed this update!
has made my mac unusable.
even writing this review is near on Impossible.
will have to format my mac just to get it back to normal.
(has made my mac ridiculously slow with loading icon appearing every few seconds.
Attemped to install 4 days ago on a 2014 IMac.
It caused the Hard Drive to fail cataclysmically.

I hadn't done a back up in a while, so had a long and convoluted process to go through of recovering data, running the operating system off an external hard drive then reformatting the computers Hard Drive.
Thank you to the Support Team for your clear guidance in rescuing my data, but I would have prefered not to have 6+ hours on a telephone and even more hours fretting all because of an update.
Still have not successfully updated to El Capitan, but with a clear hard drive I am hopeful it will work this time.

row.Title: Causing constant lag and lower battery

row.Sentences: It seems people have had mixed experiences with this update.
But quickly, here are my specs: Macbook Air mid-2013, 1.7Ghz i7 (4th gen), 8GB memory.
I develop and design websites in my spare time so have a lot of apps running simultaneously, like Photoshop, Sketch 3, Mamp, three browsers, text editors, Grunt tasks etc.
In my two years of owning this machine I've never had problems - it has previously run beautifully.
I'm usually using just below 6GB memory, have 40-70% idle CPU (depending) and from a full charge got a good eight hours of solid usage.

Since downloading El Capitan I've had nothing but problems: *constant* lag from the most basic tasks, like changing brower tabs, switching apps, and sometimes even just scrolling my inbox, or, in the worst cases, simply moving my cursor.
Looking at activity monitor during these tasks, my CPU is being chewed up.
My battery has also dropped to the level of my old Windows machine.
Having turned my mac on from full charge before typing this, It's dropped 10% in 10 minutes.
Last night it dropped nearly 50% in an hour.
Again, it seems there's a real mixed bag of experiences, but for me this update has and continues to be serverely disruptive, to the point of deeming this mac inoperable at times.
If you're running any older audio interfaces especially firewire and everything works on your older operating system don't bother with El Capitan.
I have an M-Audio NRV 10 which El Capitan wouldn't regognize, I tried a few work arounds but wasn't having any of them so in the end had to do a backwards install to Yosemite.
So those issues and my mail not deleting yeah nice one guys..............
Installed El Capitan on my Mac on 15 October and had no problems although detected very little performance improvement and have made little use of the extra functionality.
Then upgraded to 10.11.1 on 22 October which purported to sort out a range of bugs including reported problems with Mail.
Since then I have had repeated problems with my emails.
I have been through to Apple Support twice and, whilst they were very friendly and attentive, they have been unable to resolve my problem.
Basically, Mail will only hold my email server password for an hour or so then drops it so cannot remain logged on to the server.
Although I can re-input the password it takes an age for the connection with the server to be re-established.
Very disappointed with Apple - I am now having to rely on my Windows laptop which operates Outlook for my business emails - a far superior email application.

i tried to download cheat engine but every time i open it it passes out for 10 seconds and turns offalso there is no screen to place down a calculator or stickies which was also the page that took away lag from the computerCan you plz make it so i can re-dowload my computer back to yosmite as it has much more tweeks and is twice as better
1)Computer runs more slowly in general2)Computer keeps switching off suddenly3)This Mail error only came up instantly after upgrading to El Capitan.
"ErrorThis message could not be sent.
It will remain in your Outbox until it can be sent.
This message could not be sent because your account does not have a preferred outgoing mail server.
Select an outgoing mail server from the list below.
"THERE IS NO LIST given below!
Mind you I CAN send the email from Mail from iPhone within the same home wi-fi.
"A refined experience and improved performance...." not too sure at the moment.
Until now I have been very happy with the OS upgrades.
I hope I can soon be much happier with El Capitan too!
I installed El Capitan on my trusty 2011 MacBook Pro 2 GHz Intel Core i7, as soon as it was released.
My MacBook has had a memory upgrade and I fitted an SD drive a couple of years ago so it is not as purchased and the SD drive certainly transformed it's performance.
I have noticed no issues at all with El Capitan, in fact my battery life seems better and the system is noticeably faster.
That said there must be some issues out there as there seem to have been a number of updates recently.
Certainly over the last couple of years new Apple software releases seem to have been less reliable with more bugs.
However, as far as this release goes I have no complaints so far!

row.Title: Guess I was one of the lucky ones

row.Sentences: After upgrading to Yosemite I had nothing but problems: random freezing, wifi issues, graphics glitches.... things were so bad I genuinely thought I had hardware problems although I never had the time to go to the apple store to check.
Anyway, I did this update and my machine has completed changed.
It now runs smooth as butter.
I have no idea whether I screwed up my Yosmite install but for me this has cleared up all the problems I was having....for that alone I have to give it 5 stars.
I guess its just a shame that for others the experience has been the complete opposite.
I have never had any trouble with previous upgrades.
The jump to El Capitan simply won't work.
I have even tried a clean install from USB - says it can't unpack Essentials.
I have tried downloading from Recovery and the download fails every time.
I can reload Mavericks from a Time Machine back-up and everything works fine.

row.Title: Hey Apple maybe next time wait with the release?

row.Sentences: So I waited for about a month for everyone to sort problems with their software and El Capitan compatibility.
I should wait bit longer.
I'm a photographer and I do video editing plus I compose music - I got problems with some of my software which makes me unable to work.
Why Apple needs to upgrade system every year?
Do it once in 2 years and it will be fine with me - even more for all the software makers.
If you use Capture One for RAW editing - wait with the upgrade.
I downloaded El capitan on my 6 year old mac (model a1181) from 2009 because i thought it might be faster than snow leopard.
boy was i right, it works as good as it did when it was brand new, if not better.
i am very please with el capitan as it looks better and has more customisations to it than any previous versions.
well done to apple and keep up the good work.

row.Title: Where have my mailbox folders gone?

row.Sentences: Usually very impressed with Apple and it's software.
Unfortunately this update lost all of my "saved" emails (moved to seperate mail folders) meaning that I have to copy each folder back from the Time Capsule backup (at least that still works).
One of the best things that Apple has over Windows is that it all "just works" .
not this time I'm afraid guys.

row.Title: Worked well iniially but then crashed destroying PowerPoints.

row.Sentences: The upgrade of my 2011 Mac seemed to progress smoothly despite me having some aprehension having watched the prvious review.
My impression was that the computer was running faster.
Then distaster struck!
I opened large and inportant PowerPoints (2011) and found them all coming up with error messages and unique phots had been "deleted".
A large red X with the message that my computer had not enough memory!!
I had been running these PowerPoints for years.
Thankfully after shutting down my computer and restarting with all programmes closed they have now reappeared.
I have always had the unmost respect for all Apple products and would never have written a review like this before.
Indeed Apple were my heros.
I now have written a damming review.
I expect Apple do to better than this.
Advice: if your computer is running well on a previous platform do not consider changing to OS xEL Capitan despite all the attractive pictures!
Listen seriously to fellow users.
And if you are from Apple, get this de-bugged and a new vwerson out in days or years of Steve Job's life and reputation in excellent will have been lost by lesser mortals.
I have just downloaded OSX El Capitan and so far find it really good.
My MacBook Air now loads up straight away instead of taking a minute or so to load up.
Not much more I can say except thank you.
Any issues I will update this review.

row.Title: Slower than Yosemite, with added bugginess.

row.Sentences: My mac has become less enjoyable to use since installing this update - as for new features, these are minor enough, that if you can avoid updating, I would wait for Apple to release a more stable version of the OS.
Macbook pro went very very slow and if I tried to open anything it took 5 minutes plus.
As for start up i went for lunch while it booted up.
I will keep as far away from this update as possible now.
Had to use time machine to reset to previous version.
Apple should be fully accountable for putting Operating systems update out there that cause issues.
Thats a BAD APPLE...

Beeing afraid after very unpleasant experience with Yosemite I can say now that this is what I have been expecting from an OS - problemloss instalation, smooth, fast working, very low memory usage, better on my Mac Mini then originally installed Maverick.
Very small bugs, but I hope they will be fixed with next updates.
Only four stars because Metal incompatibility with some programs.
But this is apps' developers fault as well.
I have a late 2012 MacBook Pro.
It took several attempts to get this update to work.
It downloaded fine and installed (standard update install) fine, however my mac refused to restart, always sticking on the startup screen and the bar not progressing, safe boot failed to work also.
Having been very good and doing a SuperDuper backup before starting I returned to my previous system which worked fine.
Have installed again a month later and the same thing happened, the only option remaining was to boot into rescue mode, wipe the drive and do a fresh install, migrating the data from my backup.
This has worked perfectly (so far) and appears to be alot faster and only took several hours!
Don't bother.
I did (without reading the reviews).
Wreaked absolute havoc with my e-mails.
Will never trust an Operating System update again.
Come on Apple - we always knew you to be the best Why let us down now?Cannot see that the computer is any faster.
Yes there are a few gimmicks but a system that worked as well as Snow Leopard or the final version of Yosemite would have been far more appreciated.
Will certainly read all the reviews and wait six months before venturing to "upgrade" again.
I normally wait at least 3 months before upgrading an Apple OS, and I've been using Macs since 1987.
I took the risk on my maxed out 2009 Mac Mini and paid the price.

Although overall it looks great immediatly I had problems with my speakers (I googled and had to reset sound inputs etc in system prefs); iTunes (completly useless now as it loads really slowly then I get the spinning wheel on any selection or in fact any attempt of an operation.
I mean simple things like selecting a song, or clicking fast forward.... spinning wheel); Safari (long load up and spinning wheel).
I've spent a long time searching solutions to my issues and as yet have not found the iTunes or Safari problem solver.
I believe my issue lies with the way ICloud communicates under El Capitan, but I can't be sure.
Not a happy bunny

row.Title: Not compatible with third party apps

row.Sentences: I regreted downloaling this app upgrade, Most of my apps seized to work and it took me a long time to discover that it was this El Capitan.
All my work on Windows through Parallel was lost.
In the end I I had to clean my hard drive and restore Yosemite .
I am generous in giving one star.
Simply rubbish.
Since upgrading to El Capitan from Yosemite and Mavericks I've been plagued by reboots 2-3 time a day.
Recovers my documents but i'm losing so much time.
I thought Mavericks was bad, but at least the whirly "hour-glass" is pretty.

row.Title: Simple easy install and subsequent smooth operation!

row.Sentences: Downloaded and installed on the first day (sad I know) with no problem.
Everything works and no issues.
A major change from OSX Yosemite, not really, but a development.
I especially like the split screen facility.
Runs perfectly on mid 2011 2.5ghz quad core 21.5" iMac with 8GB memory.

row.Title: some issues sorted but still many lingering

row.Sentences: still so buggy with 'cmd q' still not working on loads of application, and just generally slow and rubbish (on a 1 year old macbook pro).
I know apple like to do it this way so I will buy a new machine every year but come on!

row.Title: Caused me a week of Stress - Hopeless

row.Sentences: Disasterous, spent all week reloading backups and reverting first to Mavericks and then Yosemite.
Why do Apple force upgrades through untested, unstable and unreliable.
Will sooner be better to revert to windows with their new touch screen computers which Apple seem to have just ignored.
Fed up with constant upgrades for my Apple products most of which add nothing to my user experience.
Was worried after reading all the negative reviews, but it downloaded in 20 mins and booted up again perfectly.

row.Title: Done properley and it all works :)

row.Sentences: Read all poor reviews and obviously cautious on updating.
However not wanting to miss out on latest operating system decided to go ahead.
Backed everything up in time machine etc etc.... then did the following;-Firstly erased the MBR on hdd, then did a full wipe of the hdd and erasing PRAM before installing El Capitan.
Installation went flawlessly, then installed backup from previous time machine and up to now i have a macbook pro actualy running quicker than previous Yosemite.

I downloaded this thinking it would be a refreshing update which makes OS slicker and better to use (which is exactly what you should get from an update) but in reality all it has done is reduce my iMac to a snails pace!
A real backward step in my opinion.

row.Title: Think carefully and make sure to back up first!
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Support, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I updated OSX 10.11 to 10.11.1 when it became available and straight away noticed problems.
My iPhone 5 was no longer recognised, Dictation dialogue boxes started popping up for no reason whilst using FaceTime.
Mail, Numbers and Pages started quitting unexpectedly at the most annoying moments.

Because my machine is relatively new, I still had telephone support available and they advised me to use the recovery utility to reinstall OSX (I discovered that this actually upgrades you to 10.11.2(!)).

This had exactly the same problems, so in the end I recovered my system to 10.11 and have had to spend quite a bit of time dragging my files back from Time Machine, but at least everything works again!
Just as well I use Time Machine, or the whole thing could have been a disaster!
I've used Mac for a very long time now and have never encountered such big problems.
Everything used to just work.
I really hope Mac is not going the way of Microsoft - the reason I changed to Mac in the first place!
Think carefully before upgrading and if you do, make sure you use Time Machine!
I have treid to download this 4 times and now every time it has failed.
I am not impressed by this and feel that it should work first time instead of wasting my time!
Ridiculously slow, completely deleted some of my applications and now no longer have the ability to turn off or put to sleep through the on/off button on the mac.
So this is the first review i've felt I had to write.
Despite it being reported a number of weeks ago, there are still major dramas with Mail.
This isn't just in El Capitan, it includes IOS9.
You don't have to go far on Google to see how bad this issue is.
Remedies so far include advice of, you "could' try this or "could' try that.
This has to be the worst for OSX for me.
Ironically, Outlook for MS Office 16 works completely fine on my Imac and MBP.
Sort it Apple.
I honestly do not know what the fuss is all about.
I have been running the public beta of El Capitan for around 3 weeks and have just downloaded the final.
The release works fantastically and runs smoothly on my 2012 i7 Macbook Pro.
As with every new download you'll make - Yes there are a few teething problems.
I can name another operating system which is much much worse!
Conclusion - I use my fair share of Adobe products, iTunes and Safari.
This release works fine!
The main issue I'm having with El Capitan is slow wifi, sometimes it struggles to even connect....
Looking forward to an update which will fix this, but don't really want to go back to Yosemite as I love the split screen feature.
I've been using Apple computers since 1989 and this OS must be the worst.
Applications keep hanging, I see too much of the spinning wheel of death.
I am currently trying to work out where 500GB of "Other' files have come from to fill my hard disk.
I wish I had stuck with Yosemite but there is no easy way back.
Thanks a lot Apple!
Runs solid and does all that it promises.
Can't understand the negative ratings.
I've an iMac 27 late 2011 model.
Basically won't boot after the update.
Have had to restore my system back to Yosemite.
Free update..... really..... what about the time (and money for some) spent debugging/restoring the system.
Happens every iteration!
The tagline, "just works' ..... no longer works!
And i'm not the only only one..... google "El Capitan won't boot' ...... you'll see the evidence!

My recommendation ..... dont update until Apple have finished counting their quarterly billions and finally get to grips with what "just works' really means and get a decent update out there to fix this mess!
Update: El Capitan is still a mess ...... be warned your Mac may not restart after installation.
So you have two options .... never restart your Mac or don't "upgrade' to El Capitan!
Even before i restarted my iMac ..... i had issues (too numerous to mention here .... check out the forums) that never occurred with Yosemite.
Have spent many hours trouble-shooting (googling)..... in the end .... restored back to Yosemite!
If you're still on Mountain Lion / Mavericks ..... don't budge.

row.Title: apple made windows 95 for the macs - Yay!!!

row.Sentences: after using this for some time now, it becomes apparent that there are a number of serious bugs.
Feels like a Beta version that was never quite ready for release.1.
my mac pro - spontaniously logged out and or crashes?
usually when multi tasking or writing to my SSD, i loose work because of this - happens more than it should.

i use two monitors for work purposes on a mac pro 2009 - on investigation i noticed that lots of users with the 2009 mac pro encounter issues when two mointors are used with two graphics cards - how, why?
this is not an ancient mac.
however now i purchased a single graphics card with two DVI, it works like a dream now - what a hassle
Don't install this version it destroyed my 2010 15inch MacBook Pro.
I've reinstalled El Capitan 4 times after it wouldn't reboot.
It took 22 hours to restore back to Yosimite.
I've alsways been an Apple fan but from a customer experience point of view something is going seriously wrong.
Terrible version, terrible software and terrible support.
Never seen the rainbow cursor so much, start up time is twice as long, and final cut pro X crashes every 2 minutes.
It wasn't like this before!
My Mac has never been as slow as it is now.
No more mails, impossible to open google and don't even expect to actually get a wifi connection because it will go down whenever it feels like it.... thanks for the great job!
If you've been used to 10.6.8 for years and this wonderful OS X comes along for free its amazing, all my documents and pictures and music are here with the latest version of all the Apple apps!
I bought my iMac just over a year ago and was using Yosemite.
It has constantly crashed since purchase and although I have been on to apple support the problem was never resolved even after downloading the operating system 5 times.
I have now run out of guarantee so have had to live with the problem of the crashes.
Very disappointing and nowhere else to go unless I pay lots of money to Apple again as their products are very expensive and the customer is never right.
However have downloaded El capitan and I think there is a slight improvement as it has only crashed about 4 times since downloading about 10 days ago.
It took 5 hours to download and install not sure if that is the norm.
Time will now tell how good it is but my confidence in Apple has gone.

row.Title: Expecting trouble - got none! Happy bunny

row.Sentences: Having read all the negative reviews, I cloned my hard drive to an external HD, swallowed hard and hit the Get button.

Took about an hour to download, another hour to install, frightened me by restarting 3 times without warning and then beachballing for about 10 mins but, suddenly, there was my desktop back again including my own wallpaper.
All icons in place, dock full of the expected apps.

Only difference was a polite notice saying I needed to install legacy Java SE 6 to run some of my older software and one app would no longer work and had been moved to the Incompatible Software folder.
The More Info button didn't work but Google found the required legacy Java stuff, got it installed, restarted and everything appears to work.
The whole installation is a few Gb smaller and application opening time is a little faster - much faster in the case of my Adobe CS5 apps - but generally I've not noticed much difference.
Updated photos, calendar, mail, safari, etc.
and got iCloud synchronised and all is good to go.
My MacBook Pro is the late 2007 one so I"ve yet to find out what features are not available to me.
Somebody said Disk Utility isn't there.
It's a little different but it's there.
My other make SSD is trim enabled :) So far, so good.... Shall keep the clone for a little while just in case but I don't expect to need it.
I'll let it settle for a few days and see if I need to update this review.

row.Title: El Capitain has screwed my Keychain and Final Draft 8

row.Sentences: I downloaded El Capitain and wish to hell I hadn't.
Seems to have screwed up my Keychain.
Keeps asking for passwords and just hanging.
Also wrecked Final Draft 8 - changed all the formatting and nothing I did seemed to rectify it.
In the end I was forced to purchase a new programme because I didn't have time to waste trying work this out.

row.Title: Mail issues catastrophic and still unresolved with 10.11.1

row.Sentences: OS X El Capitan has caused the Mail app to crash every time I try to use it.
I have a 27" iMac 5K and a Macbook Pro (2013).
There are well documented issues with Mail and El Capitan littering the internet, with people encountering untold problems with El Capitan and Mail (amongst other issues).
Personally my experience has been that Mail crashes on both my Macs whenever I use Mail.
If the Mac goes to sleep or is shut down, when it reawakes Mail cannot open, and has to be force quit and restarted with limited success.
The Mailboxes are corrupted, messages missing, Mail is unable to sync with servers, check for new mail or send new messages.
I have spent hour after hour trying to fix this problem over the last few weeks, amounting to days of lost work, searching the net for solutions and implementing them painstakingly, none has worked.

I have also spent hours on the phone to Apple tech support, who are well aware of the problems people are experiencing and try to fix the problems with various approaches, but as yet they are solutionless.10.11.1 promised to fix the problems, but totally failed to do so.

El Capitan has completely corrupted my SMTP server list within Mail preferences, and there seems to be a serious issue within iCloud preferences, system preferences, account settings, keychain, Mail syncing with IMAP servers, with no solution on the horizon.
I spend and hour or two a day trying to work around or fix this issue, and my business has seriously suffered as a consequence.
We can now only reliably use Mail on iPhones, which is deeply inconvenient and time consuming.
It is wholly unacceptable that Apple can release such a fundamentally flawed operating system, causing such catastrophic consequences to so many of it's customers.

And it is wholly shamefull that Apple, a company just announcing that "Fiscal 2015 was Apple's most successful year ever, with revenue growing 28% to nearly $234 billion", do not put sufficient resources into writing and testing before release their operating system, and applications as basic and essential as their email application; Mail.
Shame on you Apple.

row.Title: I never experience an OSx so unstable

row.Sentences: This is the third time I try to post my review.
This time I will be very shortIn my experience El Capitan Is a step backword from Yosemite and each new release has been worse.
Safari makes the whole system crash Mail is very slowMy Windows laptop is now more stable that my iMac.
I rest my case
I have loaded El Capitan onto( 2) iMac (1 )macbook air and two Mac mini's.
On the two iMacs and the MacBook Air.
My main concern that I receive emails in Mail but many attachments with these emails are now missing when opening them in."
El Capitan Mail."
I get my emails Via Google which on the whole work using MAIL!
My wife is with AOL on MAIL and unless we open our aol mail via the aol web page the attachments are missing!
Everything was OK. when using Yosemite.
This failure is on 3 computers I have not used the Mini Macs yet to see how they perform.
I recommend leave off loading this software .
until this problem is addressed!

row.Title: Causes problems across all my creative apps

row.Sentences: I was so eager to upgrade , and didn't listen to all the warning bells going off around me .
Unfortunately this OSX has just caused problems across all my creative Apps .
I had to get back to Yosemite to be able to keep working .
In my opinion this should not have been released at this stage .
I come back when they sorted out all the problems .

row.Title: Its has Issues with Google Apps

row.Sentences: I use Google Apps intensely as my Company have adopted this for Email, Docs, Sheets etc.
All was working well in Yosemite and I could switch between working on my Dell Laptop to my IMac with ease.

Now I have upgraded to El Capitan Google has no end of issues, mainly with Display, I could be editing an Email and all of a sudden my screen displays massive and distorted text and I have to scroll away or CMD- to resize, its not good and it does it so frequently that it is now infuriating to use.

It may be Google who knows but given that I would expect many users would also use Google instead of or as well as Safari I would have though that Apple would have tested compatibility wth what is a key business critical system.
My IMac now stays off most of the day as I use the Laptop.
I hope this issue gets sorted soon.
Was going to switch back to Yosemite, but surprise surprise, my Timemachne Backup has failed so I can't unless I do a complete fresh install.
Thank you Apple for slowing down my MacBook, creating conflicts with your own apps and sofware such as pages, and just a generally bad and poorly implemented version of OS X.

Not only that, I have found that five or six pieces of software that are vital for my work as a freelance photographer, sofware that is for certain suppliers that I use regularly, no longer worked after installing El Capitan.
I wasted a whole day trying to sort it out and find fixes for this, as I needed to order items for my clients and was unable to do so as a result of the way El Capitan had been changed.

My suppliers were quite helpful, one having emailed me a link to download an older version of their design software that did work, and they thanked me for not having a go at them and understanding the situation, and informed me that they are workining on a newer version of their software that is fully compatible with the new OS X.

However, this should not have to be the case that Apple disregard their end users in such a way that they change their OS so radically that many apps simply no longer work, not to mention it being slower and quite buggy.

These OS updates need to be better thought out in future, and they need to cause less disruption, else died in the wool Mac users such as myself will migrate to other platforms out of frustration, once upon a time, Mac's and OS X used to just work and were rock solid, don't lose your way Apple.
Computer is now very slow and takes ages to boot up.
I am very disappointed with this update and it is definitely Apples worst.
I was hoping this upgrade would fix a few small problems I had with Yosemite on my 2013 MacBook Pro.
Unfortunately all it has done is introduce major bugs.
Mail is almost unusable now.
It has crashed many times, it is constantly 'downloading messages' - it got to 4 million at one point although I have nothing like that many really.
Appointment notifications in emails no longer display the date and time so you have no idea whether to accept them or not.
Split screen is potentially useful but once I've put an application on one side I often can't find the other one to put on the other side.
This is the worst upgrade I can remember and unfortuanely 'it just works' is not longer true.
10.11.1 made no difference to anything as far as I can see.
Have downloaded this update several ( 20+ ) times with varying results.
initially wouldn't validate.
Then moved to safe mode and downloaded succesfully but will not install.
Getting tired of messing about with stalled screens, reboots and locked files.
This is taking on shades of that other OS!
Can't send mail, and has made my laptop so slow too

row.Title: EL CAPITAN - AS GOOD FOR MAC AS THE GEEZER WHO SANK THE TITANIC

row.Sentences: *WARNING - INSTALL AT YOUR PERIL* Mac is now running 3x slower with various problems that were not there before; programmes failing, apps suddenly closing - drivers corrupted the list goes on!
SO ANNOYED I UPDATED.
I didn't love Yosemite as it caused problems and now this pile of pony - whats next OS MASSACRE?
Still slow, Safari still freezes my computer when it feels like it, not at all impressed.
I do not like being informed that email addresses are not in my address book when I use them all the time.
I do not want anything to do with Cloud storage and do not want it in my face when I do something.
Why can we not have a good fast operating system which works instead of hundreds of gizmo's we don't need.
I came to Apple from MS because I was tired of the frequent pop up adds and virus attacks.
Now I have "Mac cleaner' locking Safari, do Apple not have the ability to write a line of instruction stopping these?
If things do not dramatically improve soon I will be back to MS when this breaks down.
It is not worth the inflated price any more.
I'm not sure what QA Apple are doing these days but it definitely is worse.
"it just works" is now just a distant memory.
Installed El Capitan and laptop completely bricked.
Had to take into the apple store and have yosemite reinstalled.
has definitly improved the speed of my 2013 MacBook Pro
Since writing my comments on the initial version of El Capitan I have discovered problems with USB devices and hope that these may be addressed in due course by Apple.

Meantime readers might like to look at the following extract from the Apple License Agreement D. APPLE DOES NOT WARRANT AGAINST INTERFERENCE WITH YOUR ENJOYMENT OF THE APPLE SOFTWARE AND SERVICES, THAT THE FUNCTIONS CONTAINED IN, OR SERVICES PERFORMED OR PROVIDED BY, THE APPLE SOFTWARE WILL MEET YOUR REQUIREMENTS, THAT THE OPERATION OF THE APPLE SOFTWARE OR SERVICES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE, THAT ANY SERVICES WILL CONTINUE TO BE MADE AVAILABLE, THAT THE APPLE SOFTWARE OR SERVICES WILL BE COMPATIBLE OR WORK WITH ANY THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE, APPLICATIONS OR THIRD PARTY SERVICES, OR THAT DEFECTS IN THE APPLE SOFTWARE OR SERVICES WILL BE CORRECTED.
INSTALLATION OF THIS APPLE SOFTWARE MAY AFFECT THE AVAILABILITY AND USABILITY OF THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE, APPLICATIONS OR THIRD PARTY SERVICES, AS WELL AS APPLE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES.
At first glance many of the "useful" features are only useful if you happen to live in the US.
For example a Spotlight search for the "Weather in Fife" produced weather data for Fife, WA wherever that is, so I tried "weather in Scotland" and instead up came somewhere in Connecticut.
Maps isn't much better either in UK unless you happen to live in London.
These applications would be better if they recognised your location before bring up data or answers to questions.
Is Apple really a global player?I bought my Mac and iPhone back in 2008 so the much vaunted Notes improvement which only works on iOS 9 is of no use either.

All in all not worth the 2 1/2 hours or so that I took to download and install the system (cant be accurate about the time as I fell asleep) AND Photos still doesnt offer Places view of photographs in the same way as iPhoto did.
I downloaded this atrocious version and it completely trashed my Mac and it ended up in a loop where I could not stop the programme trying to install and it just kept failing.
In the end I had to phone Apple support and was on the phone for one hour with them helping me to fix everything.
Thank goodness that I had a full backup on time capsule or I would have lost everything on my Mac.
the whole machine had to be rebuilt.
I am not going to even try to upgrade again as I don't trust this version and am not going through that painful process again.
I wasted hours of my time and suffered a great deal of frustration.
How can this happen these days .. is it not properly tested.
Looking at the number of poor ratings this product should either be withdrawn or given a SERIOUS HEALTH WARNING.
My mac was plagued by viruses that wouldnt leave regardless of the number of clearups.
After installing the upgrade my mac no longer has the virus and runs much more smoothly.
In addition the battery lasts for longer and is not making so much noise implying that it is working not as hard before.
Over all the update so far has not diappointed and has been excellent

row.Title: Be careful - maybe wait - had to reset my Mac
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I've been running El Capitan 10.11 for a while and was quiet happy with it.
This update however stopped my computer from working (Macbook Pro from 2009).
After the restart it got stuck loading.
I left it for several hours (2h), but it wouldnt start up.
Once resetted from TimeMachine computer started working again - but no update.
Since I am a bit of a computer fanatic I've tried again right away.
Then I've tried to do a new install of operating system - which I havent done in 6 years.
The first attempt got me stuck again on loading screen.
A second attempt for new install with a prior disk wipe actually got me a running system again.
I am not worried about my data, since I got thorough backups, but the sheer bricking of my OS with a sub update is rather disappointing.
However the running system now - on my old Macbook Pro 2009 is butter smooth and gives me great battery life and springy action.
As fast as ever - if not even quicker (subjective).
Ever since I updated I have been experiencing serious connectivity issues on Safari.
Never had this before, seems to work much better with Google Chrome but Safari is useless since I updated!

row.Title: Not good - in fact its terrible

row.Sentences: Definately not a fan of this release.
In fact the annual release to me is just pointless, by the time they stabilise the previous version they release a new version, with all new bugs and problems.
Yosemite was fine, very stable (Apart from Wifi), and stupidly I upgraded straight away to El Capitan.
Unfortunattley I had also upgraded my macbook pro.
This has also shown various signs of instability, including icloud drive folders, especially sub folders dissapearing then miraculously in a few hour re-appearing.
Beachball apears more frequently that it had with Yosemite, in various core applications such as mail and calendar etc, not just the 3rd party Office and Adobe.
I am most frustrated by the fact that Apple are both the software and hardware providers, and still they cannot get it right, or even close to an acceptable release.

I used to tell all my friends about the benefits of Apple, including that the software was written for the actual hardware, rather than in the PC arena it can be thousands of differnet components trying trying to work seamlessly with an OS.
Apple are really starting to annoy me with the attitude to updates and major OS releases.
Even 10.11.1 has not addressed the issues I have.
So if you want my advice, be very careful about upgrading to this release, perhaps wait unitil further updates have been out and the issues addressed.
Pathetic I know but somebody from Apple tell me I am wrong.
Also please slow down with the major OS releases.
I am not a fan and dont need a big OS update evey year.
Every 2 years perhaps, but whatever the timescale ensure that its been tested and proven to be stable before releaseing, because this is just unacceptable.
Not everyone uses the Mac for playtime, some of do actually use it in business and this is cuasing major dissruption to my working day/week.

row.Title: you just killed my husbands mac book pro

row.Sentences: he upgraded from el capitan to ox 10.11.1 and now cannot log in - what now, apple?
great os, no problems
Appart from waiting for a couple of updates for some apps it was painless very quick and easy to install even seems a bit quicker than before on my 5 year old macbook pro so very happy
LOST MY MAILBOXES.
THIS UPDATE WAS OBVIOUSLY NOT CHECKED PROPERLY BEFORE ISSUE.
Mail app is the worst on Mac.
And this OS hasn't fix it.
Otherwise it's actually very good.
No problems with anything on MBP 2015.
I'm not sure why it causes problems to others.
There are few problems with Adobe CC apps but that's due to poor Adobe coding, not OSX fault.
I was extremely nervouse about downloading this onto my MacBook Air 2013 due to the number of extremely poor reviews.
I did download and am so glad I did.
The download didn't take that long and the install took 30 minutes.
I did have to re-download the 2016 Office suite but as I susbscribe on line anyway this was only a two minute job.
The best thing by far is that I can now use Spotlight Search again!!!
I got a MacBook Pro late 2012 model.
Having upgraded from Yosemite to El Capitan, I'll say there's not much changes compared to the previous OSX Yosemite.
Multitasking feature is working well but the slower startup is sometimes getting onto my nerve.
Nothing new basically.

row.Title: Slow and littered with issues after 2 days' use

row.Sentences: Looks great, however the upgrade/10.11.1 update has introduced a series of really annoying bugs:- When opening a file with the "open file' dialogue box in an application, the "Favorites' section of the sidebar is missing.
#NAME?
I had to leave the app overnight to validate mailboxes as RAM usage climbed to over 23GB and my machine was rendered unusable.
When restarting, Mail tried to setup new POP and IMAP accounts and attempted to re-download over 30,000 emails unprompted.
-A 2 month old 27" 5K retina iMac now pauses and hangs on the "beachball of death' more than ever compared to Yosemite.- Really disappointed to see iTunes is still a total mess of an app.
Overall then a real disappointment, considering the much-celebrated focus on performance and stability enhancements over Yosemite.
Starting to think that Apple are incapable of delivering a stable update to OSX every 12 months.
So - tried to download - wouldn't download.
Eventually downloaded - seems to have wiped my entire contact data base.
Anyone know ho w I get my contacts back - or are they lost forever ?

row.Title: Final Cut Crashes with El Capitan

row.Sentences: Since installing El Capitan I have found FCPX crashes regularly and appears to work slower than before.
Mail is slower as well.
Having used El Capitan for 2 weeks or so, I can't see any good reason to update to it.
I wish I hadn't.
I struggle to undersatnd how Apple can supply updates that actually make their own software work less well.
I hope further updates will solve this, but they can't come soon enough...
"More to love with every click"?
Try the click that fails to include attachments when you save a mail in RTFD having ticked the box "Include Attachments".
This feature worked brilliantly in Snow Leopard, my favorite Apple OS, then broke.
It's been broken for 4 or 5 years and my productivity impaired accordingly.
I foolishly expect each well-spun update or new OS to heed the many calls to fix it, but no.
What kind of service is this?

row.Title: Expected improvements.but NOnot good = BLOAT = Spinny WHEEL gggrrrrh!

row.Sentences: Its a JOKE, event typing this message.
I get a spinning wheel....arrgggghhhhh !!
APPLE you can shove your crap software where the SUN DON'T SHINE.
8GB RAM.....any other *NIX based system would FEAST and ZOOM along nicely ....in fact my 9 year old Sony Laptop running 3GB of RAM DESTROYS this.
Frankly had enough and can not wait for another company to replace these Pumped up Jumped up minamilst clowns.
If it was not for the excellent software that runs on this platform .
I would have left 6months after purchasing my first MAC.
Developers take note....migrate your APPS to multi platforms....make way for other *NIX based systems.
APPLE has finally really lost the plot!
P. S APPLE I HATE your crappy mail app.
I ditched it for THUNDERBIRD .
I suggest users do the same.
Outlook is totally destroyed on this update....and is causing MAYHEM....in the IT world.
Its about time APPLE and MS grew up and provide software that WORKS!!.
I can not belive I needed to resort to my old faithfull Thunderbird as a result of the built in version being so RUBBISH.
To add insult to injury the new update.
FORCED the MAIL app to load.
--> FORCE QUIT--> annoyed.....and some!
I have been using *NIX based systems for years and this BLOAT needs to go on a diet and get back on track.
Don't know what IDIOT planned this upgrade ....they need to be fired!
Judgeing by the Ratings I am not alone....so far over 3/4 of votes are one star......!
I feel ripped off....pissed off and much lighter in the wallet for frankly a very shiny perfectly edged lovely looking , lovely lovely screen with a PANTS OS!
First time i've ever bothered to write a review for my Mac.
I'm a MASSIVE apple fan.
But of recent the standards are slipping more and more.
This time however, they've really outdone themselves with El-Capitan.
Running Dual monitors on my Mac Pro keep crashing my Mac, It jumps back to the login screen without warning or SAVING any of my work.
The only way to run my business is to unplug one of my monitors.
Serious let down Apple !!!!
Very slow, took a long time to download.

My CD drive seems to have been affected, I can't load any of my Sims 3 games, it just says no disc inserted even when its managed to get to the 2nd loading screen - i've seen on other forums people are having the same problem.
So if you're planning on playing Sims 3, i'd think again before downloading El Capitan, lets hope there is a bug fix soon!

row.Title: Does what it says on the tin

row.Sentences: I use my Mac Pro (late 2013) for my production company.
Now that El Capitain has been out for a bit, and we've had the first big fixes, and other apps have had compatability updates I'd say now is a good time to switch if you haven't already.
Big fan of the split screen feature (use it more than I thought), also appreciate the emoji update so it's compatible for iOS 9.1.
Wanted 17 hours to download on a fast internet connection Tried overnight, Nothing changed by morning.
In applications it says paused and it will not resume..
Given upTried again, two hours to download then message that it could not be verified and may have been corrupted.
It then "installed' but it has not!the remaining reviews show that Apple has failed badly on this one.

my MacBook Pro slowed with Yosemite, I was hoping Apple had sorted and improved with Capitan, but for me my MacBook Pro (18months old) is now slower than my 6 year old Dell which I replaced with Apple hoping for better things.
Its like replacing a useable old second hand car with a brand new from the showroom model which was good for a year but now chugs along in second gear
After speaking to something like five members of the Apple technical support including a senior engineer I have gone back to Yosemite.
Clean installs.... all that time reinstalling files and it still caused problems on my top of the range imac of 20 months.
It installed fine and was working but after rebooting.
Even the latest update has made no difference.
I'm really disappointed at this and I can only sympathise with users with limited experience.
They buy macs because of the hype of trouble free machines then get all this grief.
The technical team were very patience and extremely helpful but there come a point in time when enough is enough.
Not a happy bunny at the moment.
A vast improvement over Yosemite in stability and speed.
Most people wouldn't notice, but the change in system font to San Francisco has really made the interface more legible.
Notes does everything I need from a notes app and syncs wonderfully, so far so that I've dropped Evernote.
Let's hope that Apple continue focusing on the stability/speed of the OS in future releases.

i installed it and my computer started running super slow then it crashed and the hard drive became unreadable i didnt think the two where connected untill in installed it a second time on my computer after i installed my back up from time machine and it did exactly the same thing again.
wont be installing it after this
Just bought a brand new macbook air, installed the new El Capitan....and its as slow as anything.
Apps constantly crashing I'm having for force quiet a load of things, internet so, so, slow and coincidentally my iPhone 6 Plus, after being updated too, is so slow.
APPLE, PLEASE STOP RELEASING SOFTWARE BEFORE ITS READY!
For the first time in a very long time, I want my money back!

I had a perfectly working 5 month old 27" retina iMac running 2 admin accounts on Yosemiteafter updating to10.11.1 I had one account working fine and the other unable or unwilling to connect to icloud or complete setup.my mail app in that account just repeatedly flashed migrating on screen while the icon leapt from one end of the dock to the other.3 calls to Apple resulted in erase, download Yosemite OS through inernet recovery and knife & fork data back into one account from my time machine backup.
Migration assistant failed to connect and it all had to be done through finder!
Also my Apple keyboard has started to lose the plot and deleted the first set of text I had written here.
If you have more than one user account avoid EC like the plague.
I genuinely feel that all is still not well and I now have a second rate machine
Looked at all the reviews and amazed at all the poor ones.
Downloaded in 45 minutes, installed in 30 minutes on my 2008 iMac.
Instant increase in speed.
Not sure why these people have so many problems.
Great update.
A very unsatisfactory upgrade indeed, one of the worst I have ever known and seconded only to the very first OS X release.

Many of my apps purchased from AppStore were destabilised to various degrees by El Captain:* Numerous apps needed reinstalling;* Numerous apps have/had greatly reduced launching success, including App Store (now resolved);* One app finally gave up the ghost which was central to my OS X (slow death); and * Another app died on impact.
With such a mass scale carnage of apps it is hard to find any positive because the "wheels and bells' offered by El Captain are overshadowed by a graveyard of apps it left in its wake.
El Captain was not an alley of the apps and saw them either as collateral damage or hostile targets.
El CAPTAIN is APTLY/APPTLY NAMED!
I'm a music producer/song writer and naturally I was very afraid to upgrade my Macbook pro which I use for recording on the move, but I backed up, upgraded and everything seems to be working fine.
I mostly just use Logic Pro 9 with a Focusrite Scarlet 2i2 to track my guitar and vocals.
These are working fine (no playback or recording errors) and all of my third party AU plug-ins passed validation and are working including Native instruments and Waves.
It's only been 2 days so far and there's been only 1 issue - my computer just hangs up when I tell it to shut down.
It seems the only way to shut down is to do a hard shutdown by holding down the power button.
UPDATE: Shutdown issue fixed.

I went through all of my 3rd party programs and drivers and got rid of the ones that were not rated as compatible with this OS and now everything works well (I believe an out of date audio driver was causing the problem).
And I'll be honest, my mac book is lightning fast now.
Everything seemed to work after installing EL Capitan, however, the computer was slow.
Apple suggests that the "upgrade' improves performance.
I purchased the iMac just 10 months ago so it is not the case that I am using dated hardware.
Don't think I have ever had an upgrade on IOS or OSX that has actually improved performance.
Fortunately reverting back to an old version is easier on the imac than on IOS devices.
I spent a long time on the phone with Apple Support to try to resolve the performance issues, however it did not improve,even after doing everything they asked me to do over the phone.
I have gone back to the old version using time mahcine and will not be updating again.

row.Title: EL CRAPITAIN email bugs and some incopatible software Notes disappears back to YOSEMITE

row.Sentences: many many problems, email not working correctly, nots disappears, an impossible to restore etc.
Thanks GOD I had the Backup, nd after 27 days, passed with this crap, i've decided to go back with Yosemirte.
Now ll is perfect and smooth.
I'll gonna skip this El Crap-itain.
I'll hope next SO gonna be better.
Maybe is the time to go for WIndos10?WAKE Apple.
You gave us an Alpha version?
WHt are you doing?

After 3 hours on the phone to Applecare and a brief period of it shutting down it is now back to square one, IT WONT SHUT DOWN AGAIN AND I AM TOTALLY FED UP WITH IT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This is a truely awful operating system, I basically have a very expensive lump of aluminium that wont work properly.

row.Title: Painful upgrade
row.Topic: Backup, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I waited a few weeks for the dust to clear and hopefully for any issues to be rectified, but alias.
Went through the upgrade process on a 27" iMac.
Initially the mac hung on with a white screen.
I then spent 24 hrs backing up all my data from the hard drive (booting invoking disk manager to do this) fearing the worst.
After many additional attempts to boot, I managed to get the installer to work by pressing Shift on boot up.
All installed now....only my second 27" monitor not refuses to use 2560x1440.
I wish I stuck with Yosemite.
Just lately has anyone else noticed that the Apple software updates are becomming a tad buggy?
Sorry but connecting to the net is intermittent which is obviously really frustrating!
I have the early 2015 rMBP and the machine behaves slowly!
Been trying for ages to download this but wont even download so cant even try it.
But reading through some reviews it sounds like im better off without for now.
Have updated 4 Mac devices from the latest MacBook, iMac to older MacBookPros and each device has had nothing but problems, slowdowns and install errors.
And all for nothing as there are no noticable improvements.
This is what "personal computing" should be - it just works.
There are always problems with software and the more easy it is to use, the more work has gone into the product to make it so.
Probably the best OS release for many years.
Erased every entry in my calendar - many many events going back over a number of years and carried through two or three laptops.
Support had no solutions.
Really not good
After installing Yosemite, my MacBook was so slow in loading and shutting down.
Now with El Capitan, it's instant.
So much better than before, and all of my apps run faster too.

row.Title: Has made my MBP virtually useless

row.Sentences: early 2015 MBP, wont open files from Icloud, god help you if you try to move one.
Constant freezes and crashes.
It has been terrible (even after updates).
Useless with office 2016, and if you use a reference manager do not install this or office 16. looks pretty though
I must admit I was nervous of updating after reading people's woes in the app store.
I waited until version 10.11.1 to upgrade from Yosemite on my Retina 5K 27-inch iMac and, so far, have not run into any issues.
My main prompt to ugrade was that I wished to use one of the new Magic Trackpad 2 and these need El Capitan in order to use all of the gesture control.
I would say that it does take a tiny bit longer to start up, but have not experienced the issues with mail that other users have.
I only use the mail program with iCould and Outlook (Hotmail) mail.
I haven't really noticed many changes.
I am relatively new to using Mac OS (about four months) so maybe I just wasn't quite so fixed on the way it used to be so some of the changes are more transparent to me.
I do like the new type face and Mission Control.
Whatever you do .... DO NOT install this upgrade.
I should have known better!
Major problems with mail crashing every few minutes.
Performance is terribleWorst upgrade ever.
Both Numbers and Pages have problems with cut and paste and many other problems rendering them next to useless!
My BT e-mail account disapeared from mail and won't come back.
I wish that I had never bothered to update.
My advice is to leave well alone!
I was happy with Mavericks prior to installing this, but when I did, that is when things went wrong.

Upon logging in I got the classic Mail app alert (which I don't use Mail anyway) and seeing the new, redesigned beachball was a regular occurence (meaning the computer froze quite a lot)I had updates for new software and could not install them.
The boot time increased significantly and it prompted me to delete this and go back to Mavericks in order to have speed, responsiveness and reliability again.
For this reason I came to Mac.
The latest operating systems have been terrible and seem to be as bloaty as Windows 10.
What I would ask Apple to do is to look back at Snow Leopard and to not make things polished and funky, but for it all to work well and to work as fast as Snow Leopard.
This is why Apple gained its reputation for a person to sit down, switch on and go.
People pay vast sums of money to have a alernative experience that it truly wonderful and that not only work can be done, but it can be done with a creative flair and fast.
However if this is where Apple is heading for an overhyped bloatware styled interface, I may be looking elsewhere.
I tend to upgrade if only for the security issues an upgrade takes care of.
I am disappointed this time in El Capitan (a 6 hour download and half hour install) for all the extra features I do not need or want.
Also the loss of "permissions" in disc utility, a most useful tool when my iMac behaves oddly.
I notice too "Secure erase" has gone from finder menu.
This I use for erased files I want not to be recoverable if the mac is stolen or hacked or whatever.
My solution, which does for now, is to rely on third party software which still provides these functions.
(CleanMyMac 3 and TecTool Pro 8).
Apple Tech support tell me that the removal 'secure erase' is due to their having problems with this feature working on solid state drives, which I don't have.
Its not true what everyone is saying about download time it took me 10 minutes.
well it all depends on your wifi.

row.Title: Beyond Useless
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Update

row.Sentences: I'm an Apple fanboy.
Since moving fully to Mac in 2010, I've lapped up OS X 10.6, 10.7, 10.8, 10.9 and 10.10.
I think iOS 9 is fantastic, and the Watch is genius.
But sadly all this innovation has to come at the expense of something.
Well, dear reader, you're looking at it now - OS X El Capitan.
New features in this release are tedious to say the least.
The main moneygrabber is Split View.
A cinch to activate on my iPad Air 2, it's much more troublesome on OS X. Firstly, it's slim pickings with pairing apps - many simply aren't compatible.
And if you're not keen on separating spaces on different displays - an option I turn off to avoid an unsightly "ghost' menu bar when using second monitors and projectors - nada.
The new Mission Control makes it unbelievably hard to find windows.
Thankfully, it's still possible to switch to the old layout, which grouped by application; but why bother switching to revert countless settings after the upgrade?And then there are the bugs.
Oh so many bugs.
I'm thankful that I don't use Office, and that I can disable Rootless.
But my Mail accounts are ruined.
Utterly ruined.
Even after a month and 10.11.1, my accounts are still not all up and running.
Previously sent messages flash up and send again many hundreds of times in the background - hugely embarrassing when communicating with Directors of Studies.

And then there are times that all my IMAP passwords are forgotten, and I must manually reenter each one in a stutteringly .... slow .... interface .... to .... actually .... read .... incoming .... mail.
The latest funstuff is OS X El Capitan's refusal to load certain Apps at all.
Apps which are known compatible with 10.11 simply keep bouncing in the dock.
I mean, it's a lovely animation, and the new font used systemwide is perfect, but - and this is so un-Mac - this captain doesn't help me get things done.

There are some positives: the much-needed improvements to Notes are excellent, the Notifications Pane and Spotlight seem to work more smoothly than ever before, with customisations and options to suit even the most die-hard legacy Dashboard user, and I've lost count of the number of times I've used Safari's nifty mute audio feature.
But I'm still massively concerned about the long term prospects of OS X - El Cap seems to struggle on the getting stuff done pane, something that was intrinsically OS X from the very start.

Repair Disk Permissions has vanished in this version, so I'll be reinstalling from scratch tonight to try and repair some of the major issues - perhaps tomorrow I'll actually be able to open my python IDE / QLab and get some work done.
We can but hope that this OS will mellow over time - for me, it's currently rather unpalatable.
Installed the update and now the laptop freezes 50% through boot up.
Reinstalling doesn't work and forced to now start in safe mode.
Since downloading I have not been able to use my xerox printer, so not very impressed at all.
And now money + doubles up on every entry I make.

row.Title: an improved experience for your Mac ! !

row.Sentences: Not for me, Hotmail not working, Notes not working, Ace Money not working (but fortunately this one rescued by them).
Mail is now useless to me so I have to use my iPad or iPhone.
The lovely MacBook Pro which has given me so much pleasure in the past is now severely disabled by this inadequate "downgrade'.
On the basis that Apple recover this inadequacy I will not be accepting any further changes, if I could uninstall El Capitan I would in a heartbeat but it doesn't seem to be possible.
Good luck to those who have been lucky enough to be trouble free but I cannot recommend this software.
Update available - yippee - email working ?
Off to PC World for a proper PC.
My almost new iMac has always been a pleasure to use, until I installed El Capitan.
The new OS crippled my computer to the point that it no longer worked, it would take about 30 minutes to open a browser.
I was forced to wipe the system and restore it from a backup.
The failry limited user experience improvements dont really seem to justify this to me....
I hope you have better luck.

row.Title: smooth animations on retina mac book pro

row.Sentences: El Cap' makes system animations smooth on my Retina MacBookPro.
It's a great upgrade.
I have a new macbook pro march 15 and I have now dowloaded el capitan (silly name) but I waited until the first update in case there were bugs.
So far it all seems to be working well.
It has not slowed anything down nor made it faster.
I was scared as there were a lot of unhappy reviews.
So as long as your computor can take it I would go for it, as you dont want to be left behind.
Not sure why there's so many negative reviews here.
I installed 10.11 on my MacBook Pro and everything was working fine and it seemed faster than usual.
I then installed it on my iMac from 2011 and that also works great.
Slightly faster, but not hugely so; the new features are only minor additions.
There's no reason to stay on Yosemite, but this isn't a must-have upgrade either.

row.Title: Don't Upgrade
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Speed

row.Sentences: I upgraded to El capitan.
14 hours install time and after that nearly all of my usb audio interfaces are not regognised by my mac.
So that's no keyboard, no guitar, no external mic, no usb audio output, No guitar rig, etc.
My mac is now prctically useless to me.
No to mention that my MBP is hideously slow.
The usb problems were originally highlighted in June and Apple haven't extactly pulled their collective finger out fixing it.
Wait (and wait and wait) eventually this OS might work properly.
If not in my experience you'll be ok with Mavericks and in most cases Yosemite but really keep clear of El Capitan.
I am contemplating my first ever PC after 25 years of Apple.
It's that bad imho.
Downloaded this finally and I have to admit first impressions are very good.
It was a smooth install and took less time than Yosemite did.
I am running a 2009 Macbook Pro 15" 2.53 with 8GB ram and it works smoothly.
It is faster than Yosemite and a lot more stable, and a lot less spinning beachball this time.
Best improvement is memory usage, i run the same level of apps and notice that i still have more ram available.
It also doesnt run the laptop as hard as before as playing HD videos the fan doesnt need to run as fast and the CPU usage is down as well.
I am guessing the Metal updates to the graphics are making a difference.

Overall so far a very solid update and worth the download, just make sure you have 8gb of ram to ensure a smooth experince if you plan on running a lot of Apps, I wouldnt like to run this on any less.

row.Title: Tonnes of issues. Screwed up my mac!

row.Sentences: Over the last few years it seems that *every* mac OS update causes issues that are a real pain to fix.
This time, I have had the following:- Memory overload.
currently using 5.2GB of memory for about 3 open applicatons.
!- Mac randomly restarts now without any reason, message or warning.- Mail account stopped working.
Won't remember my some advanced account details so I have to re-enter these *every single time* I re-open Mail.- Audio issues.

When playing audio, sometimes I see these weird "frozen' graphics appearing on random parts of the screen with core Apple apps (Finder, preview).- "Mis matches' between multipe screens - sometimes when I open things, they "flash up' on the secondary screen, then open on the primary screen.
Before this OS update there were absolutely no problems.
Nothing like this ever happened.
I turn my mac off regularly.
I'm a developer, I know how to take care of my mac.
I am now actually scared to update my Mac OS.
Will it make things worse?
Break down entirely?
Can I be bothered to spend more hours of my time fixing fundamental issues of a computer?
- just like my iPhone that won't previously won't CHARGE because the ridiculously overpriced leads break.
I guess apple wants me to upgrade my apple hardware, again.
Good way to make money!
Thank you so much Apple.

row.Title: Do backup and validate your disk before the upgrade
row.Topic: Backup, Compatibility, Feature, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: Please backup to Time Machine before upgrade, validate your backup and also backup to another source.
I use Backblaze and Time Machine.
It is possible to use Time Machine with 2 drives.
Please backup and validate your backups!
Also boot from recovery partition and validate your hard drive in Disk Utility.
It is recommended to do it every month if you want your data to not corrupt.
You also can prepare USB stick with bootable system.
You can create bootable drive with the createinstallmedia command (there's an aricle on Macworld).
Don't use any suspicious software.
Install your software from Mac App Store if you can and make sure Gatekeeper is on.
Delete apps that you don't use.
Go to the developers website and make sure your apps are compatible with 10.11 - if not, consider to find an alternative.
All best Mac apps already compatible with 10.11.
I upgraded my work iMac, MacBook Pro and MacBook Air.
All of them work good and there's no new issues.
I noticed performance increase, my iMac awakes faster after sleep.
Animations little bit smoother.
Battery life should be improved too, and I think I noticed it.
I had a few issues so I did a clean reinstall.
Everything works fine!
Great OS.
The best so far!
I-Mac operating fine in advance of attempting to download OS X El Capitan with no success.
Have spent three days and nine calls with Apple Care and issue not resolved despite wiping the HD several times and downloading the OS from the web.
Clearly this product is not ready for market.
This has cost me a considerable amount of time and money in terms of lost opportunity.
El Capitan - the best advert for Windows OS yet !

row.Title: TOTAL AND UTTER CRAP : The app store is USELESS and this os is awful

row.Sentences: After yet another week of frustration , I've given up.
Will wait until the App store starts behaving vaguly normally again , if ever.
If this keeps up I may end up buying a pc - since Steve died apple are all icrap toys and the macs have been neglected.
Just imagine how all the Apple execs got together when Steve passed away and discussed how brilliant it would be now they no longer had to do any testing!
Well that's the way it has appeared in the ensuing years as Apple QA has drifted slowly into Microsoft-land.
The products are total rubbish now, with bugs and problems on every release.
El Capitan has ireperably broken my email.
May the fleas of a thousand camels infest their backsides!!!

El Capitan does not seem to like web browsers, Safari now won't load several bookmarked websites that were fine with Yosemite, Chrome regularly just hangs and has to be force quit (not always easy) and restarted.
Getting thoroughly sick of the spinning ball!!
I've even tried Opera, same problems.
Can't comment on El Capitans other features, but already wishing I hadn't updated.

row.Title: Has serious bugs, such as deleting mail and TM backups
row.Topic: Backup, El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Support, Update

row.Sentences: I read reviews before updating as I did not want to experience the problems I had when I updated to El Capitan (from Yosemite) a few days after it became available.
The problems I had: ALL may Mail folders and contents were deleted, Mail settings were wiped, TM backups started mysteriously disappearing (very alarming).
I spent 8 days trying to recover lost email going back many years, using TM backups (those that had not yet been wiped by EC).
When I read that the new update EC 10.11.1 had a fix for Mail and TM bugs I thought I would update and hopefully resolve previous issues.
Bad idea!
Once Again ALL Mail folders and contents that had been saved over the years disappeared as did my TM backups.
I was apoplectic and extremely stressed.
I tried restoring from my TM backups, but even TM backups were disappearing again and TM wasn't working as normal.

I tried various ways to rescue my data but in the end I contacted Apple who informed me they were already aware of these issues (a number of people had been affected in the same way) and were working on a fix.
I hope the fix comes soon as I have already lost many days of work, as I need access to these files on a daily basis.
My advice is: Wait before updating to see if issues are fixed.
If you update and have ANY serious issues such as those mentioned, that you cannot fix easily, then let Apple know, so that they are aware of persistent bugs that require fixing.
Apple need users to inform them of issues, especially the serious ones, in order that they can be fixed.
Finally...... Good Luck!

row.Title: Whats it doing to my hard drive !

row.Sentences: Managed to update ok until I noticed mail and photos disapeared tho a call to Apple Support quickly sorted that tho I still havent figured out how to my old conect to my Hotmail Account.

The thing that most concerning me is since updating I can hear what I presume to be my internal Hard Drive constantly working sometimes quite noisy and fast, I'm getting worried it's going to develope a fault and the Mac is now running really slow with the spinning wheel of death appearing which is strange as i have 12 GB of ram.
Also some of my Apps seem to have vanished.
Overall not very happy.
So another call to Apple Support is in order.
I am writing this review from a freshly restored backup of Mavericks, says all you need to know really!
I wanted to like El Capitan.
The new interface was much nicer and slicker than previous versions.
Unfortunatly the constant crashes, beachballing and instability since upgrading left my mac unusable.
A newly released update from Apple reportedly fixed intability issues, but this made no difference.
Even in the small periods when it was stable, many applications I rely on for work will not open at all.
Another werid thing is my right speaker cut out in El Capitan.
Was back to normal when I returned to Mavericks.
I thought waiting a few weeks before installing it would mean the bugs have been ironed out, but this is sadly not the case.
My advice is stick to your current version of OSX unitl El Capitan is properly fixed (how ever long that might be....?
Working great on my 2011 MacBook Air, working great on my 2012 iMac.
The new Notes app was a much needed update (Especially that recently deleted folder, I don't need to worry as much about deleting notes).
Looking forward to Adobe updating their apps to work with Metal.
Overall it's working great for me, I hope everyone else has a solid experience too, looks like a lot of people aren't too happy about it.

Initial installation worked although wouldn't boot after I shut it down so re-installed, happened the second time so as I have just backed all my files up to the cloud I wiped the hard drive and did it again as theres nothing but clutter on it and it seems a lot better now.
Much faster and since google chrome has gone it's much quicker, google seems to take over your mac nowadays.
Its not worth installing until they iron out the bugs and if like me you have an older machine (mines 2010) get some more RAM and make sure your hard drive has plenty of room on it.

I updated last week without checking reviews, I must sadly say that I have lost all my data and icing on the cake was the backup time machine did not work neither, so my piece of advice, do not creat any additional headaches for yourselves and stay away from this EL CRAP upgrade, another thing that I noticed was the performance actualy is realy bad, I have now downgraded to Yosemite, will stay what I know, till Apple get their act together and become once again like the good old days of Steve Jobs with passion for their customers and not only cash in the bank!
