It took 3 hours to load and installIt took me another 2 hours to get my emails to open and workanother 3 hours for me to get my printer to workMy computer is definitely running slowerDon't install unless you have backed up everything so you can go back .... and have a day to waste!!
.... and like watching a coloured circle going round and round!
I do a lot of work involving photo editing/manipulation and the photos app severely restricts workflow, with iphoto I could just drag and drop at will ,can I get iphoto back , hate the photos app!
I held off updating to El Capitan until the 10.11.1 release came out to fix the issues with Microsoft Office compatibility.
I have now upgraded my 2011 MacBook Pro and 2008 Mac Pro and am very pleased.
Microsoft Office is stable and (so far) no crashes.
Both computers seem a lot more responsive and application load times are definitely quicker.
I haven't had chance to explore all the new features, but this seems like a solid release with great improvements.
I am so grateful that I have backups of my files.
Did the update that took an age.
Lost my Time Machine.
Shut down and tried to get back in.
Machine would not boot up.
Had to use recovery disk to get back to a working machine.
From my experience, dont do.
A good solid update over Yosemite.
Love the new emoticons.
My Mac is now constantly freezing and crashing, I cannot go full screen on applications without having to hard reboot.
Microsoft Office is completely unstable.
Basically my mac is unusable.
The freezing seems to have been made worse by the latest update to this OS especially in Safari, I cannot scroll down on a webpage without it freezing.
Downloaded, installed and for a few weeks everthing was fine.
Then my macbook pro broke.
After being fixed by PC World and collected today.
I install El Capitan to keep up to date with security and it crashes.
Upon inspection the install is corrupted.
This is the third time my macbook pro has broken.
I dont expect any problems when paying ridiculous amounts of money for a machine that brakes.
Apple need to fix this!
Updated my MacBook Pro 15" with Ret.
Display from Yosemite a couple of days ago.

El Capitan 10.11.1 appeared to install OK but now I can't shutdown normally by going to the Apple menu at top RHS and then selecting "Shut Down' - the menu bar disappears then the screen hangs with the background picture showing and the Mac does not shut down !
I have to FORCE SHUT DOWN by pressing the power button for 5 sec or so.
The Mac seems to start up OK. Has anyone else had this problem ?
Installation process is not straight forward.
Macbook Air stuck at reboot.
Had to reinstall from time machine backup.
Second install also got stuck at reboot, but managed to make it pass after forced reboot.
Command-L did not show logs.
Bit disappointed by limited capabilities of split view in El Capitan...

row.Title: AirDrop not working on macbook air 2013 version

row.Sentences: AirDrop used to work on the said machine on yosemite but with el capitan not at all.
It is not even showing available devices even with see "everyone" turned on.
Apple please do better.

row.Title: El Capitan is slow and is causing problems!

row.Sentences: Before installation, my Macbook Pro ran very smoothly, with no lag.
Turning the laptop on and off was a breeze.
After installation, my laptop is much slower.
Switching the laptop off takes a really long time now.
The colourful spinning disc(loading) would appear just if I right click on a document or folder.
I used to almost never see the colourful disc!
Also, just after installation my laptop screen glitches sometimes.
A realy annoying occurrence.
Overall, I would stay with Yosemite, as El Capitan does not work properly.
10.11 completely mucked up my SMTP settings.
It was taking so long to fix that I stopped after 3 accounts and sat twiddling my thumbs until 10.11.1.
Does it fix the problems?
In fact, the accounts I fixed under 10.11 had to be refixed under 10.11.1.
This has wasted a ridiculous amount of my time.
If I could give this minus 5 stars I would.
Mail repeatedly resets my SMTP settings.
I think I've sent a message and find that it has not gone.
I look in the account settings and discover that authentication has been changed from password to none.
Do I have to reset every account every day?Mail has long been a disaster and Apple seems incapable of makinbg it work properly.

row.Title: Update appears to have gone ok
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: Bought my Macbook Pro in May14, came with OS X Mavericks.
Apart from the addition of Garmin Express client and MS Office for Mac 2011 it is pretty much as it was when I first took it out of the box.
Avoided the upgrade to Yosemite due to reviews but thought best not get too far behind when El Capitan arrived, plus I want to use MS Office for Mac 2016.
So took the plunge yesterday.
Prepped by doing a software update, backup, verify disk and then downloaded El Capitan.
Took about 6-8 hours.
Installation itself was probably about an hour.

Everything appears to be working ok. Did a backup this morning to my LaCie external hard drive, using Time Machine, and laptop was reluctant to eject the drives but I left it for about 20 mins and then it released it, that is the only niggle I have found so far.
But as noted above I have a fairly bog-standard setup, and my main apps are MS Office, Finder and Safari, so that may why I have not found the issues other reviewers have experienced.
Downloaded and installed the update with no problems.
My MBPr (mid 2012) 16 gb ram.
After the update my MBP slowed down somewhat so I took a complete time machine backup and then wiped the hard disk.
I then recovered the from the time machine backup (took about 6 hrs) and everything is now working smoothly again.
The update does not appear to be any faster than Yoesemite but rather around the same.
I like the split screen mode and have started using that lots.
Didn't have any issues with emails, I am using outlook for mac 2011 and it seems to be running fine.

row.Title: Why so much difference in opinion?

row.Sentences: The most striking thing about this & previous system downloads is the hugely differing opinions.
Shouldn't a system update, especially this far down the line, be smooth and efficient??
Frankly Mavericks gave me a headache..and so did El Capitan - great name for what?
A slug slow installation?
A few flashy gizmos?
A squashy remodel of the icons?
Apple need to concentrate on the realy quality issues and, when they have a new update make sure it works first time.

Yep, I know, people have different stuff on their computers and some of that MAY have a bearing on things but this is 2015 and by now you would surely expect, considering the amount of money that Apple products cost, things would be perfect!
Since installing El Capitan, i've had to restore it over 5 times as it refuses to load pass the password screen.
Cheers Apple.
I now have a MacBook fit for the bin!
Guys, honestly this update made a mess of my macbook pro.

As mentioned in other reviews, rainbow ball appears when i wake up my laptop, computer frezzes ( i've waited a while thinking that ball will go but it didn't ), can't log in unless i force turn my mac off.
This is crucial bug which needs sorting asap ( I write this in a hope that somebody from Apple reads these reviews lol ).
Also booting up is longer, sometimes i get a fuuny square in a corner instead of a mouse pointer when i wake the laptop up(anybody else?).
I personally haven't found any more problems YET.
But just as a precaution, i'll read the reviews first and then update as i was hoping Apple doesn't bring updates which improves one thing and make other things worse.
Stay out of this update or you'll be as dissapointed as i am that i updated.
Apple OS is becoming the new Windows, buggy, rubbish and a pain.
Wi-Fi and bluetooth again.
I'm off back to Microsoft with X1 Carbon, they get better OS gets worse and worse.
Jobs would turn in his grave RIP.
My Windows 8 Bootcmap partition now fails to recognise my Apple Wireless Keyboard, since upgrading to El Capitan.
I do most of my work on Windows 8, so now I'm stuck.
FIX NEEDED URGENTLY.
On the surface, the upgrade ran smooth and everything spun up fine.
Nothing actually noteworthy though.
Then the little niggles start.
First, my USB webcam/mic doesn't work anymore: the microphone is just returning gibberish.

Second, my Wacom tablet is now operating on an extreme go-slow (even after the latest Wacom drivers installed)Thirdly, I'm plagued by the same wireless dropouts which took so long to rectify on Yosemite.
Fourth, my printer keeps de-installing.
It all points to some major under-the-hood issues with USB support.
Seriously not worth the upgrade: you don't really get anything worth upgrading for, you get a whole pile of issues which will probably take 6months to rectify, and there isn't a downgrade path.

row.Title: Problems still persist - Please Update more often APPLE!
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Safari, Spotlight, Update

row.Sentences: I've edited below what was my original say, took out the things that i've noticed have been working since the update but left the things that aren't working still.
- Reading the reviews a lot of unhappy people, Apple does seem to be losing itself and I've said that for a long time, since Steve Jobs stepped down infact.

I really think this OS is left out, the obvious priority is iOS - made clear since it got two bug fixes, each one exactly a week after the release of iOS 9 - I thought the Mac would have the same but nope, this is the first update.
I really think Apple need to release more updates for the mac, it's really being left out - and for a 1k+ machine thats not right.

A lot more people have a lot worse I must be lucky:Update 23/10/15 - I've noticed if I close safari (it's still open the dot is below the icon to show it) - if I close it whilest a download is in process, when I come back to my computer (after a long time) I unlock it, and get a notification asking me if I want to quit safari or not because a download is in progress, but it's already quit safari and stopped the download!

I understand the computer shuts off inactive apps when the computer is inactive with the screen off, but it shouldn't be quitting the app when i'm downloading something, I have to restart the download then!
- What im doing at the moment is keeping the safari page open and not closing it, that seems to counteract the problem, which is what I shall do until it's fixed.
ALSO:I cannot seem to eject my external hard drive whatsoever, everytime I try it tells me Finder is using it, and this is evertime i've tried over the past few days.
Happens constantly - I reckon it's something to do with Spotlight since it only happens once i've used it, but if I don't use Spotlight it will eject no problems.
Spotlight:Spotlight has become fairly slow, and I have read up that people are having the same issue and it is known, so hopefully the November update will address this.
- After Update it's still slow.
Moving files:I've re-written this to make more sense of it hopefully; Example - I download a file, it is in Downloads - I drag the file to the sidebar and hover it over my External HDD's name.

Obviously it should then open the contents of the HDD - which it doesn't most of the time, and I have to take it back off the name and put it back on for it to finally recognise what I'm trying to do.
This is the most irritaiting bug i've got, I really hope this gets fixed but it's been happening since the final Update that Yosemite got.

My friend also has the same problem on an older machine - anyone else got this?System Preferences: Very very slow after El Capitan, it will bounce at least 10 - 20 times before it opens, I had an Apple Tech using screenshare for a seperate problem I had (now fixed) and even he mentioned about how slow it was to open, and couldn't find anything slowing my system down to make it happen, so I'll put it down to El Capitan.
- Is still slow after Update, however my dads 2011 iMac loads it a lot faster - how is that possible on an older machine??
My mac is 2013Safari:Something which has bugged me since Yosemite/iOS8 - the icons for bookmarks never work.
As soon as I updated to Safari 9 - I had an icon for Google and YouTube - the two that never had an icon.
As soon as I clicked on them to go to the page, I noticed they then dissapeared.
The same happened on my iPhone.
Messages:iMessages seems to not sync so well anymore, this isn't an El Capitan problem, just something that has gotten worse.
I get a iMessage on my iPhone, I answer it on my Mac, I get a reply and the phone goes off also, I send a message back still on the Mac, and it will go off on my phone again.
- At one point it knew what you was answering on, and woudn't go off on that device again until about 10 seconds went pass if you hadn't replied to it on the device you was using.
It still does work, but takes a long time to work - also it comes through on my iPhone then cuts the notification noise like it only just realises.
Little buggy I think..iTunes:STILL not letting me hide the iCloud songs bar, I keep unticking it and once I restart iTunes it's back yet again!
Doing no harm though, it's just annoying.
Weather in Spotlight:Only good if you live in US.
Hopefully this will be added eventually like the News App was with iOS 9.
I downloaded 10.11.1 this morning to my Mac Pro 2010.
The download was reasonably fast and the installation took about 15 mins.
Everything works beautifully and I have so far had no issues.
Mail - in particular - is much more solid than in my 10.11.0 installation and my suite of Adobe CC applications are also faster and more reliable.
For what it is worth I did the following before installation:1.
Cleaned the user caches with Onyx.
Better not do this unless you know what you are up to.2.
Ran Diskwarrior to make sure the HD was relatively clear of errors.3.
Started in single user mode, which can clear some system errors.4.
Downloaded the full 10.11.1 installer, rather than the update, from the app store.
The above take not more than half an hour and - in my experience - usually lead to a problem free installation.

row.Title: Its OK, but what happened to Disk Utility??

row.Sentences: Downloaded and installed without apparent problems, which is good.
Took 40 minutes (including app updates) on my Macbook Air, best part of a day on my 2007 iMAC.
Can't honestly say I notice much difference from the user point of view unless you're into sharing your work across iPhone, iPad and Mac, but it works.
Until you look in DiskUtility, that is, where "Repair Permissions' has totally disappeared!!!!!!
This is - or was - the closest thing to a universal cure-all to most forms of wierd Mac behaviour, and it's no longer available in any form.
There are going to be a LOT of unhappy users in the nexr few months, Sorry, but BAD move, Mr Apple.ps I didn't get the Mail problems reported by other reviewers, because I use Thunderbird.

row.Title: Audio heads / Producers need to wait for a serious update.

row.Sentences: Initial impressions were good as it was fast and responsive and looked fantastic, however as soon as I tried to use my Audio Interface (M-Audio Firewire 410) it was visible in the audio settings, Logic X or Ableton 9.

Granted, my interface has not officially been supported for the last couple of incarnations of OSX leaving me unable to access the GUI but it has at least functioned as a multi channel in/out interface.
Luckily I had just made a mirror image of my HDD so I was able to go back.

After some further research it appears there are a huge number of Firewire and Thunderbolt interfaces, MIDI controllers and software plug ins that have now been rendered useless since El Capitan has come on the scene.
It is saddening me that this is not the first "creative' device that has been rendered useless by an Apple OSX update, I have a Wacom graphics tablet that was unusable when Mavericks was released.
I have Windows 10 installed on my mac using Bootcamp and guess what?
Both devices are fully functioning (inc GUI).
I know a fair few people who have gone back to using Windows due to issues over the past few years.
I am hoping that this is just a temporary over sight and will be resolved.
PLEASE FIX ASAP!

row.Title: Can't view photos in Preview anymore :(

row.Sentences: Whenever I try and view a photo in Preview the window just turns green.
As a photographer this is a very important feature of OS X that I now can't use.
Please bring out a fix as soon as possible.
When I originally upgraded to El Capitan, most of my email was lost, which took hours to try to recover from archives.
This new update has done the same again and has lost the mailboxes containing copies of very important emails.
It's just obliterated the lot!
Apple, you really need to get your act together before you release updates and test everything.
Yes, it's a nice idea to release updates free of charge, but that is no excuse for causing havoc with your customers' machines.
Like iOS9 in the iPhone/ipad this update has been a bit of a disaster, slow as a week in the jail!
Issues with wifi, app store connectivity, wierd squiggly line on startup and it now takes my 16Gb imac arround 5 minutes to complete its boot.
Not happy Mr Apple!
Its killed my macbook, why o why was this ever sent out to us to use !
Do Apple think they are that big that it is ok to offer sub standard updates, for which people will just put up with ?Shocking Apple, make your fans gain faith and fix this awful update.

after x 3 restores and loads of my life wasted i am keepimg to the old os as this simply is a NIGHTMARE initially initialls okl..... then try restarting the mac book next day..... nothing just the grey screen and the apple logo no time bar.. it just freezes, lost a months worth of quotes and invoices not happy.... i tried deleting and installing a fresh download it still didnt take so fir what little i seemed to gain in the latest update and all the headaches of hours of re installs from back ups i am not bothering, if you do decide to download the El CRAPITAN BACK UP BEFORE!!!
My 2009 MacBook Pro wouldn't boot after installing El Capitan 10.11.1 - it just stopped with the progress bar at about 90%.
Rebooting in verbose mode showed it was "Waiting for DSMOS".
I then had to spend 2 hours restoring Yosemite from a backup.
Running a 15" MacBookPro from June 2015.

The installer never checked I had enough room on my laptop and so halfway through completely failed leaving me unable to recover the hard drive, boot from the old or new OS and it couldn't repair the damage through disk utility.
After formatting my hard drive (the only option), it failed to recognise my iPhone or iPad so I also had to reinstall all of their software to get the devices to talk to each other.
I think installing Windows Vista on a PC created less of a headache.
When I installed the update on my iMac I lost networking through ethernet (I think there was an issuse with the OS trying to use IPv6 instead of IPv4 but I'm not sure).
After a few days of trying all sorts of remedies, I did a clean install and everything's fine, and the computer does seem to be running faster than before.
Many people are complaining about Apple Mail - I"ve been using Thunderbird for years, and it's pretty much hassle free.
I strongly recommend it if you're getting annoyed with the problems of Apple Mail.

row.Title: OK, but still needs a few tweaks...
row.Topic: Download, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: Prior to this installation, I had no problems with my iMac depsite the concerns of some with previous versions of Yosemite, etc....
I read the reviews, of which most of them seemed to be pretty positive (maybe I timed it right or had a filtered response!)
so went ahead with the download.
Download seemed to take a little while, and the install seemed to take forever, but now its in and has been running for a few days, I have run into previously unseen problems.

Beachball (although looks nice) appears much more frequently than before, I don't really notice THAT much of a speed improvement, but there has been a number of crashes especially when running "apparently' high intensity processing applications.
I say apparently as I've tried to scan some documents and update a map on a car GPS.
This seems to slow the system down somewhat and has necessitated in a number of full reboots which I've never needed to do before.
I'd hate to think what happens when I get around to running Photoshop and other applications that actually do require some processing.
Must say I'm a little disappointed in this update.
It's ok, but I'd stick with what you have until this is a bit more stable.
I don't see what people are complaining about, it's now flawless for me

row.Title: Wasted hours to fix my emails

row.Sentences: As soon as it was installed Outlook stopped working.
I have wasted hours investigating and finding out how to fix my emails.
There is your well deserved 1 star.

row.Title: Sorry I downloaded this latest update

row.Sentences: Unless you take pleasure from watching the spinning beach ball please do download the latest update.
On my computer it has slowed everything dramatically and opening apps now takes an age, (not just after the initial opening after downloading and installing the update but every time thereafter).
It also deleted my Mail Account which I had to reinstall to get my emails back.
Overall, I can only hope that Apple get their act together and put another update out asap out to correct the situation.

Well after holding off for a few weeks to let the dust settle on El Capitan, I finally took the plunge and updated the first Mac in the office, it's an early 2008 Mac Pro, which primarily runs FCPX, Compressor, Photoshop and Illustrator.

This was the machine that I thought might cause problems, but it went perfectly, just did a straight forward update, and an hour or so later everything works, the machine runs faster, FCPX is certainly snappier.
So I then updated our 2009 Mac Pro and both of our 2014 iMacs and everything worked perfectly, all software seems to run, no issues whatsoever.
Great update Apple, best operating system ever!

row.Title: Maybe wait till the next version comes out

row.Sentences: I lost a week of my life trying to install this ..
I am operating on a machine which has had to have it drive partionied after hours on the helpline to apple.
The WD back up a thought I had could be read on every appliance in my house exept the affect machine and has to be replaced as a result.
If you want to test the vulnerability of your business .. hit install.

row.Title: Endless instability, security issues and keychain errors

row.Sentences: This new version of OS X is a disgrace.
It took hours to download and install, and then El Capitan made my MacBook Pro Retina completely unstable from the moment it finished installing.

Locked me out when I attempted to change my login password, which it kept rejecting as incorrect (it wasn't), and then I could not reset the password with Apple ID as it kept rejecting that password as incorrect too, so I had to reset Apple ID password from my iPhone before being able to log back in.
Endless keychain errors messages which virtually lock up the machine are still appearing after hours of effort to resolve.
I cannot log in to iCloud without the machine crashing.
Worst of all, I cannot login to Keychain to reset password as it kept rejecting it as incorrect!
My MacBook grinds to a halt every time I open an application that makes use of Apple ID, or any password authorisation, and keeps asking for passwords which it then rejects as incorrect.
iTunes keeps automatically reopening when I quit.
App Store is so slow it is unsuable.
Does Apple not test software before releasing it?
I don't know how they dare release this, and then do their usual trick of denying all knowledge of the problems afflicting tens of thousands of users.
When Apple said they would make OS X upgrades free, I'm not anyone realised it meant they just cannot be bothered any more.
Everything Apple release at the moment has virtually no advancement over the previous generation, despite what they try and convice us, and creates endless problems for the user.
Run out of ideas.
No idea how to innvovate without causing havoc.
The average Customer star rating speaks for itself - AVOID!
Apps freezing, crashing and on the whole much slower than before.
The OS X App store does't work properly, refusing to update apps most of the time.
Wait for a few more updtaes to El Capitan before "upgrading" from Yosemite.
Better still, wait for whatever comes after El Capitan!
Since updating to 10.11.1 (El Capitan with the patch) I've really struggled to log into my mac as I was using icloud authentication.
All my other devices (ipad,iphone) are working fine but not the mac.
Reading the forums there are a lot of people having exactly the same problem and they've tried changing passwords, resetting accounts, etc.

I had to put my mac to local authentication to be able to reliably log into it but I still can't get the app store, keychain and various other things to work properly because authentication is suddenly broken.
Very disappointed that Apple could mess up something so fundamental!!!
Apple - please fix this ASAP!!

After updating and stupidly accepting using my icloud to login to my mac I keep getting problems, it doesnt not recognise my icloud password and i can't even change the setting, cant sign out of iCloud and if i try it crashes.
Would have thought that something like this would have been spotted early on
Mmmm.... seeing a trend here.
I too believe the marketing hype and asumed that Apple MUST have got it right this time after the previous hiccups, but no.
Dreadful upgrade that caused everything to crash.
iMac 27 wouldn't even restart at one point.. Telephone support was poilte but next to useless, and the promised call-back never occurred.
Eventually reinstalled Mavericks via Time Machine and will stick to this until the million plus bugs (there must be at least that many) are fixed.
Come on Apple, our household has all your products apart from the watch and really love what you do.
Just DO IT RIGHT and don't release it and say it's great until that thing actually WORKS.
Really pleased.
Everything runs quicker and smoother.
Well done and thank you, Apple!
I did a clean install on a quite old iMac, went without a hitch and my machine runs so well now, much quicker and responsive.
My advice is to be patient and let the machine do what it has to do.
I had a couple of moments when I thought all had been lost and process had frozen or stopped, but all was well.

Well I downloaded and instelled last week, and was very happy with the performance and features on my MBPR 15"However, when then in the situation of recording using Logic Pro X, with audio interfaces by zoom, no drivers were available, and i can see that Logic has not been updated recently to cope with El Capitan, so I was getting incompatilbilty issues.

Not Apples fault if Third party suppliers do not supply drivers to suit, but surely its essential to have the core Apple programs ready for the change?I have had to restore Yosemite, with a fair bit of time wasted reinstalling Autoicad etc to be able to use the features I had before.
There seems to be a need to let the other developers and suppliers catch up before upgrading again..

row.Title: My Mac hasn't been this fast since OSX Lion! :) :D

row.Sentences: My Mac hasn't been this fast since OSX Lion!
:) :DThank you apple, my 2011 laptop finally performs like new again!
This is how Macs should run.
The first version I installed, 10.11, actually crashed my mac so that it was stuck in a restart loop, never getting past the grey startup screen.
Finally, after a long few days, I get logged on in safe mode and installed this update, 10.11.1, to find that everything is ridiculously slow.
Really wish I hadn't updated.

row.Title: Another dissatisfied Customer - El Capitano 23 Oct 2015

row.Sentences: What a joke - a so called "improved operating system' has proved to be anything but.
Having looked at the majority of reviews on here, we cannot all be wrong.
My issue comes around Aperture - which apparently now requires to be updated to v3.06 - but hey, you cannot get that Update on the UK; US or even the Chilean shops - JUST WHERE CAN YOU GET IT?

I spent over 80 minutes on the phone to Apple Support this afternoon before being told they are the "OnLine App' Support Team - I bought Aperture v3.02 when I bought my iMac in 2010; when I have tried to do the Update through the Apps Store I'm told my App was bought by somebody else - ie I suspect the man or lady in the shop who loaded it up for me used their details - hence I cannot get in.
I now have to lug the iMac and my "Time Machine' back up Drive to the Apple Store in Exeter - oh I cannot get an appointment until a weeks time - so that they can have a look at it.
I have over 20,000 photographs and as for "Photo's' - what a joke that is, great if you want to take pics on your phone, but as for quality editing tools?
Well I suppose they might (eventually) end up in an Update to Photos.
Like lots of others on here, I have spent a lot of hard earned cash to get what I (we) perceived was top notch kit, sadly it seems all Apple is doing is watering things down - most distressing.
Fixed my mail problem, everything running nice an smooth, love it
Stay away.
Substandard product released by apple.
It crashed my Macbook Air after 9 hrs of attempted upgrade....had to restore everything again.
What a waste of time....that too moving from Yosemite 10.10 to supposidley "El Captain"
Downloaded and installed a few days ago, worked great aside from not being able to connect to WiFi.
Came to boot today and my mac refused to load up.
Had to erase everything and install OS X Lion.
Not a happy bunny, but I've learny my lesson!
loads my previous program stoped working, I can using anymore, its much slower.
I wisch never done it, is iw way back to my old system?

After downloading El Capitan I was eager to get started with this latest version only to find that all my emails accounts had been turned off and the passwords removed when I sorted the problem out and got the accounts up and running I could not email anybody as my entire contacts list had been deleted.
It took hours to replace all my contacts info and email addresses.
This was not what I had expected from Apple I would have thought these kind of problems would have been sorted out before the operating system was released.
First download attempt gave an error message.
Second download worked but my location services are no longer working in Maps and other weather features.
Have been looking for answers all week now.
Don't appear to have the problems that others are having, or maybe haven't found them yet.
Disappointing - please fix!

row.Title: Poor QA, shoddy software. Apple slides back into the IT pack

row.Sentences: Since Steve Jobs departed, Apple have started to slip into the typically slipshod performance of the IT pack around software.
This is a bug-ridden and sloppy update.
Apple - this is about EXPERIENCE - which has always differentiated you from the rubbish put out by the other run-of-the-mill IT shops and 10.11 is a BAD EXERIENCE.
It's gettign too fancy - again a slip into the IT world of "if we can, we will" functionality creep.
Too many swipes, gestures and goodness knows what, except, you know what?
I'm fed up of rubbish software: Apple should know better than squirting out some shoddy release with the full expectation that the user will spot, and iron out, the careless bugs.
And now we have some schoolboy (er, no, actually typical IT department) warngle between MS and the new MS (Apple....) about who has made such a clueless mess of Office/The OS.
I don't care, it just needs to work, people!
So, I will never again upgrade to a new Apple OS until at least the point 2.
The 0 release is an alpha, the .1 might be a beta and maybe the .2 will be a grown-ups' one.
I've been a complete evangelist for 25 years, but this has really annoyed me.
Just updated my Mac Mini to El Capitan and now my computer is Sooo Slow - from booting up to running applications.
I purchased a Mac because of its speed over my Windows PC.
Now I find there is not much of difference in operation.
NOT impressed - am now using my PC most of the time.
Paused during the download and now won't resume

row.Title: No more apple for me when my mac gives up. Shocking OS
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: Ive used apple kit for many years and had little trouble considering what I do on them.
I have had a few issues with mavericks but nothing too bad.
Yosemite had a few more quirks but this is a complete mess.
Took hours to update (200meg connection).
numerous errors.
Finally downloaded it and ran out of memory at the login screen.
Keyboard wouldnt connect, you name it, I had it.
Like other users report, its slowed the mac down to a 1990s windows machine.
It is now a chore to use as its so littered with bugs.
Photos works on and off, sometimes photo stream works, soemtimes not.
Mail hangs, keep getting sign in prompts.
sending mail is unreliable, I cant think of a good thing to say about it.
It all stinks of apple trying to sell more kit and products.
Apple music destryoed my library due to another bug, this is killed off my mac and its now going to be used as a music server.
First time ive not been able to recommend apple and its products.
Theyre just too much trouble now.
If you're running an older mac DO NOT DOWNLOAD.
You need at least 8g of ram and even then its not great.
Any less and youll have trouble.
The claims of increased speed are total nonsense.
I can see why they have spent so much time re-designing the wait spinner - you will be seeing a lot of it.
I cannot believe that Apple have released something that is so unfit for general consumption.
DO YOURSELF A MASSIVE FAVOUR AND DO NOT "UPDATE" - even the word is laughable.
I have owned macs for 20 years and this is the worst OS I have seen - it even makes windows look slick.

row.Title: Do not update to El Crapitan

row.Sentences: With Apple running the customary death switch on it's older hardware and software (come on apple just admit it) coincidentally just as another update to it's product line is announced, I suddenly found myself with a perfectly running MBP running Yosemite one minute and a buggy abomination of a computer the next minute - nothing had changed in that time other than the arrival of this OS.---DO NOT UPGRADE--It's as simple as that unless you want a huge headache as nothing works correctly afterwards.
My business partner and I have the same version MBP each and we both have different issues.
He has graphics issues and kernel panics on a regular basis, I have hangs and freezes galore.
Hardily any apps work correctly after this update also.
If you want a slower, less functional OS then El Capitan is for you.
I sincerely which I could revert back to Yosemite but that thing is yesterday's news for apple so good luck to all of you who want a stable Mac.

Since installing this update, my Mac has slowed down, my mouse doesn't work properly (and it's a brand new one) some apps also don't work properly and I've lost a whole bunch of important files, photos are slower than ever.

row.Title: Was it worth it?
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Performance, Speed, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I downloaded this new version at the end of last week and every time I use it some irritating feature pops up.
Today it froze on opening my mail account and I had to restart it.
Yesterday it suddenly flagged up a notice that my RAM was getting severely overloaded and I should quit any apps not currently in use.
The day before I had spent some 20 on downloading CleanMyMac3 - I cannot find any paticular advantages on the new system except that I'm down 20.
Everything is slower and a general sense of slowness is reminding me of the horrors of Windows before I switched to AppleMac.

All in all I fail to see the point of the updated OS X. Yosemite was perfectly fine and worked very well In fact most of the updates were fairly easily assimilated once a few teething problems had been overcome.
The truth is that there is no problem with my RAM - I have 80Gb of free space and have cleaned out an amount of duplication, etc.
I mainly use the computer for digitising music-scores, but I also visit the internet regularly for news items, mail, shopping and BBC iplayer.
What happens if I revert to Yosemite?
And can I do this if El Capitan doesn't behave itself?23/10/2015Just uploaded 1.19G of extra ElCapitan software.
Now I cannot use my printer.
I cannot reinstall it and it is now defunct, dead, deceased, passed over and kicked the bucket.
Can't find any support page for printers.

row.Title: DONT GET IF YOU USE LOGIC / ABLETON ETC

row.Sentences: Ive just formatted my Macbook and returned to mavericks.
If you have any Native instruments plugins, they won't load into Logic on this OS.
Lots of my other plugins stopped working too.
Really bad desicion to upgrade.
took me 20 mins to download, rebooted my 2015 mac and all is good, running much faster and looks good.
Upgraded to El Capitan, what a mistake!!!.
Lost my I Tunes library and the machine is slow and buggy.
When will APPLE START LOOKING AFTER ITS CUSTOMERS AND STOP SENDING OUT THESE UPDATES THAT ARE NOT TESTED FULLY TESTED.
My Mac was my pride and joy and now l have no confidence in it.
It took me a day to reistate my music library and l am not sure that l have got everything back.
Nice one Apple
Even after the recent update, there are still no e-mail sounds, except for the outgoing whoosh.

row.Title: Vey Stable and worth the upgrade.

row.Sentences: Extremly fast!
Handy features.
Seems to have slowed everything takes ages for excel and word documents to load up, plugged my 2TB mac HDD in after the update and it will not mount the drive.
Not a happy bunny please hurry up and sort these problems apple !

row.Title: Do not install till they update the Update!

row.Sentences: The OS has many bugs!
slows down your work!
It's slowing down my Mac Pro.
MS Office related issues somewhat rectified after the recent office update, but still laggy.
For those who use your macs for serious work my advice is to wait till they have an update!
Update:Office apps tend to crash after the update!
This is getting really crazy actually i wish i could have gone back to Yosemite.
The recent office update somewhat rectified the issues that was there earlier , and now the OS X update has brought back the old problems instead of an improvement!
This is not for those who use Office!

row.Title: Do not upgrade yet.
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Update, Windows, Yosemite

row.Sentences: Over the last few upgrades from apple I have noticed that more and more, with each there is more problems caused than solved.
WIth the last it was endless problems with icloud syncing between devices.
But upgrading this has been a nightmare.
I have a imac with fusion dirve and after upgrade I could never restart the mac without having to go into recovery mode and reinstall the software.
Then I would have to keep the mac on the whole time.
After a week of misery and waiting for apple to actually do something about this, I have downgraded back to Yosemite.
This was far from simple as the elcapitan disk utility made my fusion drive disapeer.
It was only thanks to other people posting up the same problem I got this to work.
It will be a long long while until I dare to upgrade to El Capitan again.
To be honest I am also a windows 10 user and the way that Microsoft implemeted that system, I think apple could learn a thing or two from.
I only got the option to upgrade once all the bugs had been ironed out and had no problems.
At the rate of failure in apple upgrades I can easily see myself switching completly, which a few years ago would be unheard of.
What a disaster - after praising my new Retina screen iMac and and even upgrading my iPhone and iPad as I was so happy to have everything working together I have had a series of disasters.
The phone switches itself off and will not recognise the same apple password accepted on the ipad and Mac AND worse this update wiped ALL of my email addresses.
According to Apple care this is new to them!
Not according to the reviews I have read today.

After an hour on the phone setting the six emails up again (as they could not be set up with the original settings) the original messages are still missing on two of the accounts....not a lot of help when I need to keep track of submissions for the journal that I edit...
I am now having to trawl through mountains of paperwork and files to see if I can trace if stuff has been submitted to me or not.
Days of work wasted and as the update does not like Dropbox which is the shared office filing system everything is taking longer than before.
Very dissappointed in Apple

row.Title: Huge Mistake
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Outlook, Performance, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I installed El Capitan on my MacBook Air.
It took ten hours, but OK. First problem I hit was the Outlook failing to work.
A day later MS released a patch, which I installed.
That partially fixed the problem, but left me with my Outlook constantly trying to sync the same messages.
I looked on Google and saw a couple of people suggest I restart my machine and that should fix the issue.
That's when I discovered the another 'feature' of El Capitan.
On restarting, my machine went into a freeze.
More googling with another device revealed that the solution to this is to reinstall El Capitan.
I actually tried that twice as it was the weekend, but finally gave up and reinstalled Yosemite.
I don't know how Apple gets away with releasing something so bad whilst representing it as a great product that we should all download immediately.
I will go back to my usual practice of never downloading a new OS.
Live and learn.

row.Title: Dont Do it!
row.Topic: Compatibility, El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: If you read the forums - printers just stop working, I have two printers one a Dell colour laser and a older HP laser printer I use for producing invoices and now both do not work and unless drivers are updated by Dell and HP (in this case most unlikely - as its an old machine) you will be faced with simple tasks not being able to be completed.
The machine also seems to be working slower and Mail is crashing continually.

I would NOT upgrade and wait for a few months for everyting to catch up, saying that you would have thought that if Apple is upgrading someting that they would as least consider (a small amount) that people want to actually use them.
Just updated again to 10.11.1 and ........ printer still doesn't work and mail crashed again, how many CRASH REPORTS DO YOU WANT APPLE!!

Another thing my machine is a iMac 27" and I use it everyday for working doing everything from Graphics, Internet, Administration the whole thing and now I'm starting to shout at the computer its so slow, if I could kick that beachball spinner for everything it hangs for more than 5 seconds I'm be a very fit man.
I wish I had never downloaded it and upgraded, its painful.

row.Title: Had to restore to a time machine back up

row.Sentences: Do no install this update if you have POP email accounts!
My work email account is POP and after installing El Capitan my username and password were no longer recognised.
Despite every effort to fix this, which took most of the day I then spoke to Apple Support who told me its a common problem and the best thing to do was to use a back up from pre-update.
Thanks to this "upgrade' I lost an entire work day!

everythung seems to be good but the bluetooth pan is not connecting to my other bluetooth devices such as iPhone, before i updated to el capitan my bluetooth pan was working and connecting to my other devices.
needs to fix this issue very disappointing
Had to wait the customary eternity, but you expect that with a major update, and it is free.... so.. well.
It told me that it could not install, I freed-up some space on my disk, it still says it can't install.
Fortunately, looking att he reviews, it seems that I am not missing much.
and wait to see whether reviews improve, otherwise it's rather pointless....
I didn't buy a brand new MacBook Pro to end up with something slower than my old 2009 MacBook!
Ho hum!
I think this update is great, my mac got quicker, i have fewer bugs.
Really enjoying the snap feature and the fact you can now resize pages small so its not stuck on only being able to go down to 3/4 of the screen.
Overall really happy with this update, I now its more of a speed and neating out all the bugs from yosmite so it serves it purposes perfectly and I definitely promate anyone to download it.
Haven't a clue why there's so many bad reviews, my guess is they don't look after their computer enough or are alterating things on the computer which is advisable.

Considering everyone has the same hardware inside, there shouldn't be any problems like what they said occuring to a normally setup macbook Conclusion: Happy and advise everyone to update as you'll appreciate how the your mac becomes even more quicker than it already is.
Not a single complain.
My old IMac 27" just turned into a new computer.... What elese can I say ?
Not a single problem to download and install the new OS X El Capitan .
It runs even faster ( 4GB RAM) .
I read so many reviews and was having doubts about the upgrade.

row.Title: Me too on the email problems!

row.Sentences: Having read quite a few of these reviews, it seems that mail is an issue on El Capitan.

My imap email account stopped working sporadically - unable to trash emails - not downloading until restarting etc - absolute nightmare - i've ended up having to shell out for postbox just so i can get mail reliably - really not good.
It also broke CS6 and suitcase - text now (rather unhelpfully) vanishes in InDesign.
really wished i'd not hit the download button :(

row.Title: Good eventually, but install freezes with Kaspersky AV installed

row.Sentences: Wasted half a day trying to get install to complete - kept freezing, would allow login then freeze 10 seconds in, etc.
After what seemed like hours onto AppleCare we eventually tried uninstalling Kaspersky Anti-virus and this solved the problem.

I have to give credit to AppleCare for their tenacity in resolving the problem, but perhaps the install process should be more robust in pre-flight checks as the consquences is a lot of wasted time for both end user and Apple.
I like the new features and i definitely find it much faster than Yosemite.
that on its own makes it 5 stars in my book.
I am yet to encounter any bugs like others are finding.
possibly no hitches because i did a clean install as most of my stuff is either stored in the cloud or i can reinstall the apps as i have the activation codes.
works best for me when i do clean installs.
everything works perfectly.
P. S. I only clean install the new version of software, not updates to the new version.
so next clean install will be when EL capitan is being replaced

row.Title: What have they done to my mac?

row.Sentences: I have wasted hours and hours and hours since the upgrade to OS X El Capitan, I almost feel I should send Apple an invoice for my time.
I cannot open any application without the spinning wheel spinning for a long time, everything is slow and most applications crash within minutes, I am so frustrated I feel like going back to a PC!
Thanks Apple, feels like Im back in the 1990's
Spinning Wheel of Death - Slow Buggy Pss Take that Runs Nothing Nicely.
Good Bye Faith in OSX!
I use my mac for business, my e-mails, pictures, music - everything is work related.
I had recently installed a brand new 1tb WD HD and decided to upgrade to El Capital.
The worst decision I have made in recent time.
The process was running smoothly until the restart then, BOOM, blank screen, on reset I kept getting the installation bar and after a few minutes it would say "sorry cannot..." blah blah blah.
So I went into recovery mode with my Snow Leopard disk, low and behold disk utility said my disk was corrupt and beyond repair.
Now for your average Joe that would be fine.
But I had 16 online orders to send out, and no means of printing my labels, accessing my e commerce software - NOTHING.

I went to the store and bought a new HD, I am now in the process of installing Snow Leopard again, then ill have to do mountain lion, then mavericks and then I will have to spend the entire night searching for a way to recover my important files off my "corrupt" HD.
The moral of this story is, If it aint broke.... Dont fix it.
I am really starting to go off apple, this has happened previously and I just cant take it.
The amount of stress and expense I have had today is ridiculous.
The reason I paid more for an Apple computer is to avoid situations like these.
Now I am tied in with an iphone, an ipad and a mac.
I am trapped and just where you guys want me.
Thanks apple.
You have literally driven me to the point whereby I want to smash this damn computer.
To hell with EL CAPITAN.

row.Title: Crashed my Macbook Air but now working brilliantly

row.Sentences: I was really looking forward to this update and, initially, I was really angry as I just spent two or more hours having to restore from time machine.
The download worked fine but it just wouldn't install properly and wouldn't boot.
After, long coversations with Apple's Live Chat, I have to say they solved the problem - a couple of stray files that were preventing installation.
After installing it still wasn't working well so I decided start again with my Macbook Air and wiped my system clean, installing El Capitan from scratch.
Now my system really flies.
It seems that El Capitan is not very forgiving.
I also had problems with ElCap not working with Kaspersky Internet Security - had to uninstall this.
and i thought mavericks was bad....this is worse....yosemite was great!....buggy as hell..lets hope the update works.
Updated and immediately noticed my emails had vanished.
Spent time with Apple tech support.
We found the missing "on my mac' folders using TimeMachine but couldn't restore the folders to their orignal positions.
I eventually rolled the OS back (losing some files in the process).
I won't touch El Capitan until they fix the email problem.
Very disappointed in Apple.
I expect this kind of 'mistake' from a Microsoft product, not an Apple product.
I had no issues with Yosemite, nothing ever crashed.
Now that I have upgraded to El Capitan my mail crashes once per day, I get the pinwheel appearing now for the simplest of tasks sometimes.
Microsoft Office is taking an age to open.
Splitview is great, love it.
Doesn't make up for the other issues though.
What a vast improvement over OS X Yosemite!
Memory using the RAM is much more snappier and efficient and the apps seem so much more responsive.... Safari, once again, has become a pleasure to use.
I haven't used the Mail app, simply because I have never liked it - but the integration of my Calendar, Contacts, Notes and Reminders have gone without a flaw.
I have even noticed that Maps is much more accurate - I'm not placed in the middle of a field now!

row.Title: El Capitan? In my view should have been called La Pirata

row.Sentences: Like others here, post upgrade to El Capitan, my Mac Mail was completely wiped out.
It was 9.30 pm on Oct 20th, immediately after the upgrade, that I found my mail accounts obliterated so I thought I try and get hold of Apple Support.
it seems that the earliest appointment they had was 08.15am the next morning and the latest seemed to have been 6.10pm the following day.
I would have thought a company like Apple should have been able to provide 24 hour support x 365.
My job relies on much use of email so I continued to work until the early hours.

I managed to recreate one account but my GMail account was a challenge as despite Mac Mail seemingly having no knowledge of any accounts, each time I tried to recreate the GMail account, Mac Mail told me that it was already using my password for Gmail.
After trawling Google Groups etc, I became aware of the email rebuild command, tried it and after about 20 mins just my GMail account came back.
I wasn't so lucky with the other accounts and even now I'm one account down.
It was difficult to recreate my signatures and in the end I only achieved this by shutting down email and starting it again on each occasion I tried to creat a new signature.
After two days I still only have two of my three email accounts back.
The whole email system still seems to be slightly unstable.
Often trying to open an incomming email with a double mouse click it just sits there ignoring me.
For someone that spends 60% of his working day on email, all of the above makes for really bad news.
Oh woe is me!
A bit dissappointing Apple!
I have mac mini which is 2 years old.
My original osx was Maveriks and now after upgrading to El Capitan can say that upgrading was my biggest mistake.
First my mac became slow I mean very slow.
Second - could not play some games even online ones.

And third - after restating it on my 4th day after upgrade my mac stack on boot screen and no options of recovery were working so been force to boot my machine from recovery USB and revers os back to Maveriks.
Really considering going back to windows as Apple is getting worst and worst.
Tried to download onto iMac - gave up after 3 hours, then read reviews - strongly advise against trying this.
Wasted half a day.

row.Title: Apple seems to be loosing it in The Q dept

row.Sentences: I totally trusted Apple thats why i dumped windows but now it seems apple are geeting in to the Micro soft try it, fix it and apologise later mode.

Mail wouldn't work and i still can't get into my ISP website because they think i'm hacking?I had to wipe the hard drive - what a leap of faith that was - and back up from my time machine - so glad i bought it now.
Really if you haven't got one get one, its a must.
It worked fine from the backup but there are still some idiosyncracies.
My 3year Mac cover finished and can't be renewed so i'm in trouble with no Apple shop in my town.
I'm so dissapointed with Apple, they were rock solid until recently and now its download after download.
My ipad went out of shape with the last update so i'm blocking all updates at the moment as you just can't trust them

row.Title: Doesn't play nicely with others - Kaspersky and Total Finder woes

row.Sentences: After upgrading to El Capitan from Mavericks, Time Machine started taking forever to achieve backups - or rather not achieve them, then my MacBook pro just froze at every login.
It turned out that El Capitan has some kind of conflict with it, so had to uninstall.

The new security features also make Total Finder (a lovely app that does lots of things that Mac OSX should do but doesn't - including restoring the much missed colour icoans to sidebar etc) no longer function without doing some techy security bypass.

The new split views is difficult to use and cumbersome compared with "bettersnaptool" tool, which thankfully, does still work with El C. With all the new third party extensions for Photos its still a poor replacement for Aperture.
Perhaps the "transit" AKA public transport works well in the USA but in UK tends to default, after a good long pause, to "public transport directions are not available between these locations".
Not quite sure what the great leap forward is on this one.

row.Title: Breaks App Store and USB connections

row.Sentences: Installed 10.11 on a MacPro to find "About this Mac" and "System Information" do nothing, App Store's updates page is blank and an key app can't talk to USB ports any more.
Installed 10.11.1 via Recovery mode, turned off firewall and the new SIP protection, still no improvement.
Don't install until Apple have done lots more work on this.

Can only comment on the downloading/installation aspect of this particular update: I've tried several times to download and install El Capitan, and each time it's failed to install, I've had to reboot, reinstall from back-up, verify disks/back-up disks, repair disk permissions, and reconstruct my Office "identities' (whatever they are!)
Having also now tried downloading with an ethernet cable, in case there were problems with my wi-fi signal, I find myself bored with this process and a little disillusioned....
I will not be trying again until Apple release an update that specifically addresses installation problems.
It would be a gross understatement to describe the El Capitan upgrade as disappointing!
After installing the initial download, the effect on Mail on my i Mac 27 was catastophic: all previous mailboxes on my Mac vanished into thin air and all mail accounts had dropped.
After some consutation with Apple support, I was able to re-install my previous accounts, but I was unable to recover any past boxes.
An update to El Capitan was automatically downloaded and installed today.

I was less than thrilled to find that new mailboxes created after the earlier muddle had disappeared, yet a set of recovered e-mails from two mailboxes had appeared from nowhere, leaving me in an even worse situation.
Mail has always been a weak link in the Apple operating suite: El Capitan seems to have made this worse rather than better.
This is getting past a joke.
It appears others are having trouble too: Apple need to sort out the difficulties with Mail promptly.
I have owned a MAC MINI for 2 years and found it amzingly fast compared to Windows 7 i7 HP PC Laptop.
But now I am so dissapointed with the later versions of Mac OS which seem to get progressively s l o w e r .. that coloured beach ball thing seems to go on forever when it starts to roll !
It was spinning for over 25mins yesterday so I just powered the thing off then powered back on.
I only ever did that dreadful procedure with PC's previously.
I have to say that I have loaded windows 10 on my old HP laptop and its amazing!
I never ever thought I would say that!
So my message to Apple ..... WHAT ARE YOU DOING???
10.11 final version installed smoothly - having had no end of trouble with the public betas: I quite liked it after having had to miss Yosemite due to wifi issues, which seemed to have been solved.

Seemed much faster than Mavericks and I liked the new and upgraded features (but hate the visuals - I left the Kindergarten a few years ago) But trying to install the update to 10.11.1 crashed the whole machine (Mac Pro 2010 8-core) - so if it had worthwhile improvements or sorted out bugs, I cannot say: no rescue method worked.
Only solved by using the system HD as an external drive on my MacBook Pro - wiped/reformatted and reinstalled Mavericks then refitted into the Pro - whence it worked smoothly.
Maybe all the issues with the betas had rendered the usual rescue methods unusable.
But if you can get it installed cleanly, it looked a well worthwhile development: it is not quite "free' for some of us when you factor in the time to do so.
In general I haven't had problems with this update, things seem to be running quickly, and everything is working as expected, with the exception of Mail.
It's become kind of useless, a few issues found so far:" Sometimes it sticks and doesn't download emails, then I check my iPad and find I've missed hours of emails coming in."
My iCloud mac account had @icloud, @me, and @mac aliases, but now I'm only left with @me and when I try and change this it basically crashes."

The grouping of emails through conversations has changed so now emails with the same subject don't get grouped which is a nightmare for the emails I get in, I get lots of automated emails for work which have the same subjects.
In general if you don't use Mail you'll probably be fine, but if you do use Mail, I wouldn't update until the forums are saying the Mail issues have been resolved.

row.Title: Utter cack as usual these days!
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Performance, Speed, Spotlight

row.Sentences: As usual for Apple these days the software is utter crap.
Mavericks was a mess, Yosemite was a freaking disaster and all El Crapitan has done is introduce more bugs and not fixed bugs I've had since Mavericks!
A run down of bugs I have are:" Mail has graphical glitches.
If I resize the split window in classic mode the emails get literally scrunched into oblivion at the top of the page?!"
Save As windows grow larger everytime it opens and once it runs off the bottom of the screen you are unable to resize it so you have to run a terminal command to reset it!"
Spotlight is completely screwed.
Running a search with special characters like a comma, a period or hypen brings back no results across the system.
Remove the offending characters and results appear but they're are obivously no longer what you are looking for because youve had to change the search query!"
Mail is missing random emails.
Sometimes they appear sometimes they don't."
App store does not update correctly and clicking an update button does nothing.
Then it turns out the app may or may not actually update but you have no way of knowing the the "update' button in the store still says "update'. "
No noticeable increase in speed of rendering anything.
Infact it seems slower in many more tasks.
This is just a few of the bugs im encountering on 3 fresh installs.
I've been using Macs since System 7, Yosemite was the worst OS version ever, El Crapitan just makjes it worse!

Software from Apple these days is more trouble than its worth, it's like being back on Windows trying to fix stuff than doing any actual work that being said and I'm seriously considering alternatives now.
Still don't understand why only some apps will work in split screen mode.
Safari will push the window to half the screen but as soon as I click on it it will restore to full screen.
Itunes will still take up 3/4 of the screen.
Any non-Apple apps aren't supported.
Windows did it years ago, making it totally simple.

row.Title: Changes Uninspiring And A Bit More Buggy
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Safari, Speed, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I was excited to hear about new stability and performance features and also the split view feature.
Stability is similar to Yoesemite but with a few more issues I never used to have.
Nothing show stopping but niggly things.
For example Safari struggles to display some sites that previously had been no problem.
Switching to another browser solves this.
Performance wise I can't spot any difference - possibly a bit glitchier and slower but not majorly so.
Certainly not zippier on my iMac I bought a few months ago.
Split view I find more challenging to use than the Windows equivelent.
Its not hard to use just not "natural" - I used it for a day or so but not much since then.
Doesn't help that so few apps support it.
Overall El Capatain is ok but knowing what I know now I'd have stuck to Yoesemite.
I've kept my MacBook Pro on Yosemite.
OS X 10.11.1 only took about 9 minutes to download and a few more minutes to install.
Mail seems OK.
Still a few of my most used third party programes not compatible yet, e.g.
QuickBooks Online Mac App, although I can still access QBO in the normal way using Safari.
That elusive fifth star is still pending as I continue to use El Capitan.
AU validation crushes after this update - in my case NI plugins.
Hope this will get fixed soon.
My Mac seems slower since I switched to El Capitain , but far more importantly - Apple seem to be withdrawing their support for Photos.
El Capitain and it's predecessor have removed basic editing software and replaced it with some even more basic.
It's almost as if Apple has this vision that people just use their cameras for point and shoot and faces.
It seems that their offering is more faeces than faces
Cannot login to some of my email accounts and the ones that are connected won't send emails out.
Incredibly frustrating and annoying.
I downloaded El Capitan onto my MacBook Pro - had a slight glitch getting all my mail accounts to work, but the one that wouldn't was not important.
It seemed a tad slower, but nothing major.
So armed with this I then downloaded onto my iMac.

I couldn't get Mail to work on the iMac, it just crashed every time - I don't know how many "reports' I sent to Apple (hundreds) and am even less sure if they take any notice of them.....but it made me feel slightly better!
But then it got worse and the same thing started happening to my MacBook Pro.
I got onto Apple Support, it was a good and fast experience, they talked me through reinstalling El Capitan on both machines.
So I called them again and was advised to do a total hard drive wipe (described by the guy at Apple Support as "flattening the hard drive' - gulp!)
I decided to do this first on my MacBook Pro and then on my iMac if I was happy.
The MacBook Pro has reverted to OSX 10.9.5 - Mavericks, 2 upgrades before - how bizzare, but at least Mail works.
I am waiting until Apple bring out a fix for the buggy El Capitan before I upgrade to it again and have decided not to make any changes to my iMac, just live without Mail on it for now.
Come on Apple, Mail is a major part of the system for most people, this would be like Outlook not working on MS Office - unthinkable.
Great improvements and no problems with original install or with use, split screen is a useful addition.
Downloaded and installed El Capitan before reading all the reviews.
On a MacPro with 16Gb RAM, 6 core Xeon and some 5Tb of HDD my machine is now slower than my Windows 7 laptop.
On startup I get the spinning disc, eventually a progress bar, then the desktop screen with nothing on it for a few minutes.
Then the task bar appears about 25mm up from the bottonm of the screen, it takes another minute before it "settles' to the bottom of the screen and icons appear.
The desktop background keeps defaulting back to the El Capitan picture and when typing sometimes.
the characters are delayed before appearing on the screen.
Have been in touch with support, including screen sharing, removed various bit and pieces that they thought might be affecting performance - no difference.
This machine was my pride and joy, sadly my ageing Windows laptop now out performs it!

spent hours downloading the update, due to slow internet speed, it then said "downloaded' with small red print saying "an error occurred' does not let me re-load, delete and start again, or do anything to fix "the error'.
Seems like a wast of time and effort to me?
I HAVE SUCCESSFULLY RECOVERED MY e-MAILS but it took HOURS.
I found my mailboxes folder on my hard drive and backed it up onto an external drive just in case everything went wrong.
I created new folders within MacMail with a different name - e.g.

Family became Family newI selected the folder called Family on my mailboxes folder and cascaded down to reveal every messages folder within it's structure and opened every messages folderNext I selected every message file - they have the extension .emix using either the shift key to select lots in one folder or the cmd key to pick off the odd fewOnce I had a good few selected (say 50) I double clicked on one of them and they all opened in MacMailThen I went to Message on the menu and selected Copy to and chose my Family new folder to copy the top message on the pile into itAfter that I was able to press alt cmd T to copy the remaining messages one by one into the Family new folder I had selectedOnce I had gone through all the messages folders within the Family new structure I tagged the Family folder in my mailboxes folder with a red dot to remind me it was completed, I went back to MacMail, checked the e-mails had arrived safely and were working properly and then deleted the original Family folder.
If there is an easier way I haven't found it but I rely on electronic filing for all the e-mails I need to keep, I needed them back and couldn't wait for a fix to be issued by Apple.

row.Title: Airdrop doesn't work any more between my Macbook pro and iphone 6 plus

row.Sentences: Airdrop doesn't work any more between my Macbook pro and iphone 6 plus after I downloaded this new IOS.
Apple needs to fix this problem asap.
Fairly new to Mac and was very surprised to have real problems.
ALways thought macs very 100% reliable.
Can't turn off my iMac, or go to finder.
Network drive doesn't work in Windows 10 partition so no wifi.
Even Apple can't help refered to thier engineers in Cupatino!
gone back to Yosemite via time machine!
only given 1 star as i can't give none!
Just upgraded to 10.11.1 - still experiencing the exact same SMTP anomalies, with settings for each mail account not remembered/saved under MAIL prefs/accounts.
Also passwords for non-iCloud mail accounts not being accepted under system prefs/internet accounts.
Yet to test other apps but these were the fixes I was waiting for - been discussed for months in the forums but, unbelievably, still not addressed.
I'm Macbook Pro 2010.
All over the place Apple.

row.Title: Worked perfectly on the second attempt

row.Sentences: There was an error during my first attempt at upgrading from Yosemite on an iMac 27 inch but it's all gone without a hitch on the second attempt.
Photoshop CS5 is up and running.
When I upgraded to Yosemite I struggled to locate the "legacy' Java file that was needed but the link was clearly signposted on the help pages and easy to find this time.
I like what I've seen so far of El Capitan.

row.Title: Still no support for encypted memory sticks!

row.Sentences: The 10.11.1 update still doesn't enable the use of encrypted memory sticks rendering Macs useless for working on sensitive data that needs to be accessible between PCs and Macs.

row.Title: Don't do it! This is the devil!
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, Installation, N/A, Speed, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I downloaded and installed this a few hours ago.
It took about 2 hours to download.
Then after it was installed I realised that everything was super slow.
Like windows 1995 slow.
I didn't last more than 30 mins.
I instantly started looking for ways to go back to Yosemite.
I'm not very techy so it took some time to realise that instead of following complicated advise (since you can't get Yosemite from the apple store) I could just use the time machine.
Now I'm actually regretting all those hours I wasted installing El Capitan and then trying to get back to Yosemite (whish isn't the best, but it's a lot better than El Capitan).
Do not even bother with El Capitan.
Waste of time and resources.
Really not happy.
For the first time in a long time I'm getting the beach ball at start up and often through my sessions.
Just seems to have slowed everything.
Running a serious macbook pro and it's making life difficult.
They should call the next one OS X First World Problems.
Nice Update Love it now.
The only problem i'm having is the iTunes store.
Not displaying on my Mac correctly.

row.Title: Excellent
row.Topic: Backup, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: I have a Macbook Pro Retinal 2013 15" and it was running Mountain Lion.
I had read all the reviews and was really concerned about installing this update.
However I decided to go ahead after I read I could always rever back if it was dire.
I did a complete back up via Time Machine first, but as a belt and braces I manually backed up on a separate Hard drive all my photos, videos, documents and desktop.
I did get very concerend when at about 75% of the install everything seemed to stop.

I went on my Ipad and searched for what could have happened and some poeple were all dooom and gloom saying it meant the install had failed and screwed the laptop, and others said dont do anything,go away and be patient.
About an hour later voila all installed faultessly.
Nothing has failed, photos uploaded fine and all ready for some organising when I have time :-) Microsoft works, Apps work and all in all everything is excellent.
Photos will take some getting used to as Ive been using Iphoto for such a long time.
So be patient with the install.
Mine took about 4+ hours in total.
Make sure you back up, back up and back up just in case you unfortunate to have an issue, because at least you'd have anything saved if the worse thing happened.
I find it strange there are so many bad reviews and equally baffled why people dont back up regularly especially before a big softeare update.
You've set me back here, damned pinwheel buffer every time I click on Pages, or Layers etc.
machine now so slow, cant run more than one app at a time, everything half the speed and streaming is not stuttering and pixellated, yet another awful "upgrade"
what a horrible mess, completly stuck in middle of instal on a late 12 iMac, I've had to wipe clean and reinstall.
lost photos, emails, passwords.. there is so much stuff that needs attention, im thinking of leaving apple.... there making it to difficult and complicated now.

row.Title: Problems with mail made me backdate

row.Sentences: I have been using Macs for 28 years now and am more of a computer person than a mobile user.
I still keep all my most critical information, including emails going back well over 10 years on my Mac Pro which I back up locally.
I do not intend to ever put important information on Cloud storage.

I updated my Mac Pro to El capitain and when it booted up it asked me questions about my mail accounts and when Mail finally came up it -only- showed mail which was still on the remote server of my email account.
None of the mail on my Mac showed at all.
Since I do not keep anything permanently on the mail server but download to my Mac Pro this meant I no longer could see any of my emails at all.
On the Mac support discussion forum others had had the same fault and eventually one of the Apple support people came up with a work round.
Unfortunately this work round was very complex and time consuming and did not actually recover the named folders I had archived the files into.
I have now backdated to Yosemite using a Time Machine backup I made before the update.
It seems to me the last 3 (free) "upgrades" were updates Apple wanted people to make to move OSX further away from being a computer OS and more towards iOS.

I can see the benefits if one's main access is via an iPhone or iPad but I never use my iPhone or iPad for mail and iCloud made a complete pigs ear of both my contacts list and calendar synchronisation which used to work so transparently using iTunes a few updates ago.
Download was ok and everything else seemed fine except for mail which kept crashing and disconnecting.
So I phoned Apple support who took over my screen and it was brilliant even though it took almost an hour and a more experienced technician had to take over.
If you have similar problems I recommend the phone support instead of trying to find the answer on the web.

row.Title: Unstable, not tested enough and bad customer support
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Support

row.Sentences: After myself and 17 other consultants in the business downloaded the new El Capitan software 9 of us have major problems; out of the 9, 4 are using new MacBooks and 5 using Macbook Air's.
When the laptops go into sleep mode they crash and you have to perform a re-start, the notification bar at the side is missing all the apps.
Guys are having issues with Magic Mouse's disconnecting and unable to reconnect.
All us have completed numerous re-installations, that seems to work for a couple of days and then the problems arise again.
Apple Support cant get us of the phone quick enough, as they clearly have no idea what the issue is!
Given the money we invest into these products, we are dissapointed with the poor standard of software and customer assistance in Apple.
I'd be happy if I could just download the thing!
Scared by the reviews of Yosemite I had been waiting for this.
Backed up on an external hard drive in case, but in the event the download proceeded without hitch and my late 2010 Macbook Air is working faster.
I like the fresh appearance.
The split screen is great but doesn't seem to work for two tabs in Safari.

Also the bank security programme Rapport didn't start up automatically after installing El Capitan - I had to reload it, so if you are a Rapport user keep an eye out for that green arrow and don't bank without it.

row.Title: Nothing but problems since the update

row.Sentences: Next time I will wait until I upgrade.
Nothing but problems on office and email since the upgrade.
I am running three email clients hoping one will work when I need it !!
The worst update Apple have released in my view.
A great shame for I am a big apple fan and use my macbook pro all the time so this is a real impact on my work and private life.
Got to get this better next time Apple its not what we expect.
After the death of my old, trusty PC, I bought a pre-owned iMac (early 2008), in order to see of I could cope with the PC - MAC transition.
The aged iMac was running Mavericks with the maximum recommended RAM of just 4Gb, after my initial experiments, and despite various warnings I decided to try El Capitan.
The upgrade process was quick and easy.
To my amazement, I have yet to find anything that does not work.
I have imported all my photos, email files, Microsoft Office files, and all OK.
The messages and face time apps are particularly useful, finally developers are makng computers do things that are useful to us all.
In addition, the help and advice from Apple customer support has been really helpful.
Combined with a couple of workshop sessions at the local Apple store, I am totally sold into the whole Apple experience.
My biggest problem now is that having bough an older iMac as an experiment, it is running so well that I cannot justify ditching it for a new one !
The upgrade lost all my emails and mailboxes.
It took me hours to rebuild my mailboxes but I still can't find my old mails.
It also deleted all my signatures.
DO NOT upgrade until it has been fixed.
I just wish, wish, wish that downloading this was just a nasty dream, but it is reality.
Please don't make the same mistake.
And I feel even worse because I have been expounding the virtues of Apple for years.
Finder freezes, resizes the windows, Tags disappear and sometimes crashes altogether .
Hate this version.
What the h*** Apple, why have you removed all GUI support for RAID setups from Disk Utility???
I realise you can still do it via Terminal but why should your users have to learn commands for Terminal just to ensure their data is backup at home?
Given the poor internet infrastructure in the UK not everyone can backup all their data online, hence why I have been using a 3Tb Raid setup at home - which I can no longer manage after upgrading OS.
Generally people that buy Macs do so for the simplistic UI/OS so that means they don't generally want to learn code in order to carry out task and look after their data!

Please sort it out or I'm going to have to seriously consider going back to having a Windows machine in the house purely to ensure I can manage my backup solutions (something I never thought I would have to consider again!)!!
