How can Apple continue allowing El Capitan to be downloaded when for some of us using Mail it wipes out our stored Emails and negates our accounts?
There are no official solutions I can find just lots of unhappy customers trying to resolve the problem (there should be a link to problems/official solutions on the download page).
To beat it all, it is Apples own Email application, Mail, that has the problem whereas my son using Outlook has no problem.
So many people like me are taking dodgy steps like making the Library available and playing with the Mail V3 files.
For example trying the archived no longer supported Apple advice to remove "Envelope" titled files so that Mail will Reindex the messages - seems to work for a few people.

If like me Mail won't even open because it no longer recognises any Email accounts (I had about 7 set up) then you have to regenerate an account to get Mail to open, but it doesn't Reindex and provide the missing mailboxes & accounts.
So you try the advice again and again, but it doesn't work.
Then you see your original accounts are referenced, but disabled, so you enable them and try again - no success, no Emails.
Playing around you can see the V3 folder titled Mailboxes that probably holds your many previously imported folders of Emails, with no clue how to enable it.
And you see other previously created folders with your account names that have Inbox, Sent etc sub folders, but are not appearing in Mail.
But then you see Mail has created new account folders but with unintelligble Hex names so you can't just put the correct mailboxes in their relevant folders.

This is quite simply a total failure in Acceptance Testing of a new build, and Apple should be ashamed of the problems they have caused people, and are carying on to cause people until they stop El Captain being downloaded awaiting a tested solution.
This is people's livelihood and social lives being put on hold or totally corrupted.
I've had El Capitan around a month now.
Previously Yosemite and before that Snow Leopard - all on a 2011 MBP.
On the plus side, it's taken the Yosemite look and feel and seems somewhat slicker.
On the downside, it's still baffling that it doesn't support UK English in the core OS.
iOS can manage it, Snow Leopard could manage it...but Yosemite and El Capitan cannot?
The odd thing is that you can pick UK English....and yet it ignores it in the core applications.
I've even been into my local Apple Store and all their machines have the same issue.
In Finder, Safari, Mail etc there is "color', "gray', "favorites', etc which of course is great if that's how words are spelt locally but notsomuch if you spell things differently.
I'd like to give it more than 3 stars....but I do wonder if it cannot get something as simple as this right then are there other issues that I've not come across yet?

row.Title: Wiped out my Hotmail ! Still unresolved, One El of a mess!!!

row.Sentences: Words fail me, what a mess!
Day after day with Apple support and still emails totally wiped out.
A disastererous operating system with epic fall-out.
Just how did this come to be?!
Every Mac owner I know in the same pickle.
Any chance we'll be recompensed for the time lost spent trying to resolve the apparently unfixeable?Shockingly bad.
DON'T DOWNLOAD IT!!
Installed this and was expecting wonderful things.
Sadly disappointed as it is very laggy and very slow.
Apps take an age to open which is very time consuming and frustrating.
Have to force quit and re-open quite a few times before the app finally works.
since loading this new system my email has not worked correctly since.
Taking in my Yahoo accounts it needs the outgoing server password everytime mail starts.
even when you give it it is selective on whether it connects or not.very time consuming and annoying.
an apple a day just gives you heartburn!
Spent two days downloading yosemite,yes 48 hours of continual messing about.

Had four calls to apple lasting 6 hours altogether as time zone wouldn't alter to the correct one,so after many attempts of erasing it and reloading had to go into the programs and trash three files to get it to work.!!
Totally unimpressed.
Got the iphone 6 to run with it, lost all of my photos except 2 and had to redownload all my music.
Lost all the files too, iCloud should be iclown.
This whole apple thing is like someone selling you a european VW with bent emissions testing and then selling it to you as a Rolls Royce.
Next upgrade Im getting a normal phone, does exactly what it says on the tin.
Anyone else feelling ripped off?

row.Title: An excellent, solid performing OS
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Office, Performance, Update

row.Sentences: Having tested 10.11 from the beta launch, I can say that pretty much all of the major bugs were addressed before it was rolled out to the general public.
The interface is up to Apple's usual high standard and the usability doesn't affect my work in any way at all.
Microsoft were slow to ensure compatibility in the 2016 Office suite, with hangs and crashes occurring frequently at first, but they seem to have addressed this now.
Some of the other smaller vendors are also rolling out updates daily.
The OS itself can't be blamed in any of the independent testing that I have done since public release, and it continues with further beta testing.
I don't really understand the one star reviews.
I have this now running on both a mid-2010 MacBook Pro in release version and a top spec 2015 iMac 27" 5k in beta, and it runs equally flawlessly on both.
Very happy with this version.

Having upgraded to El Capitan on a new mac mini, I find I've lost my emails, mail boxes, on my mac folders, my printer (epson r800) won't print if the low ink light is flashing (all apple help steps don't help), I can't scroll down the screen in dialogue boxes, double clicking on a folder to open it in the finder to see the contents now opens the entire content of the folder in a launched application, I can't open a lot of my files from Snow Leopard, the "save as' option is now gone and the "export' option just isn't as good and it's a bit hit and miss if my passwords work.
I've had to re-do apple app store password several times as it just wouldn't work and yesterday el capitan refused to accept my master admin password.
Wish I'd stuck with Yosemite.

Downloaded this and the only problem I have found is that I cannot shut down the PC in the normal way as it does not react to the request the only thing it will do is sleep, it will not shut down or restart any idears much appreciated
since the update which took nearly 3 hours !!
on a 2013 mac book pro , it has slowed the machine to a crawl speed .
i have to reinstall the apple mouse every time i turn on - which is a massive annoyance .
mail fails to hold the outgoing server settings and passwords , so they have to be reset evrytime I open the app .
even opening a webpage is traumatic and just hangs before deciding whether it is going to bother responding .
This has totally messed up my mail .
It keeps dumping the password .get it together NOWWWWWWWWWWWW
I started downloading it late at night which was a mistake.
When I went to bed I left it running with an estimated 7 hours something left to download.
When I got up in the morning, it had got stuck.
That was 3 days ago.
It's still stuck, and there is no way to unstuck it.
So I can't rate the OS but I can rate the download, and it's my worst Apple experience since them discontinuing Aperture.
after using it for e few day my mac pro could not restart anymore.and timemachine backup was not working proper.
so far 5 days work to try and recover my data

row.Title: Lacie Cloud box fails to connect

row.Sentences: I use a lacie cloud box connected to my wireless router.
After ungarding to El capitan my computer does not connect to the drives.
Somehow I dont think lacie has a firmware update and I dont think apple is going to fix this issue.
I now have to find a yosemite computer to backup my files.
Thanks apple for the inconvenience!
Updated my macbook pro, my mail accounts have been trashed and can not be accessed, imessages isn't working, there are no gains worth talking about.
Do not do this update if you value the data stored on your mac.
Disappointed that this is what Apple considers acceptable..
Ever since i updated to this new OS.
I can never clean shut down any microsoft application.
Having unistalled and reinstalled Office, I still cannot exit outlook without force quitting.
Until its sorted out 1 star rating!
It really does seem to have slowed things down.
Boot-up seems to take twice as long as it used to.
Can we please go for simple elegance and faster performance with the next update.
And how about calling it Ja-Ja Binks?

row.Title: Slow useless, keyboard now is intermittant

row.Sentences: This is a disaster, I now have to unlpug my keybord dongle every couple minutes as it constantly disconnects, ready to leave and get into windows 10new OSX is slow and lagging, also email never works, also noticed it is slow even entering text.

Had installation problems........turns out I had some incompatible software........but, and here are the 5*****, the Apple Support person (Angela) took me from a grey/black screen and lifeless mac air to a working machine in short time.
Despite many hours of attempts, just doesn't download.
working a treat.
Amazing operating system and great to use i hope updates in the future are like this.

row.Title: Wait for the next update
row.Topic: Download, El_Capitan, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I would strongly advise against downloading the current version (10.11) if you use wifi.
My MacBook Pro is only 2 months old.
On Yosemite it ran like a dream, considering the machine it replaced was an 8 year old MacBook that had an asthma attack every time I opened iTunes.
Since I updated to El Capitan last week, the wifi connection is TERRIBLE.
It drops out, it disconnects, it runs incredibly slowly: I have 156mb/s broadband and I cannot complete a short YouTube video or iPlayer episode without buffering.
It took me 5 attempts to load the El Capitan page in the App Store just to write this review.
I may as well be using my old 8-year-old asthmatic laptop.
The update to solve these issues cannot come fast enough.
Really not impressed!
How I wish I had never opted this update.
Safari is rendered a creaking dinosaur with rainbow coloured circles of death that mock me.
That's when Safari actually chooses to respond - most of the time it doesn't.
You can't even scroll down a page without encountering issues.
Everything is now uber slow - it's MS by any other name.
Thanks for ruining my Mac.

row.Title: Relatively trouble free apart from Photos

row.Sentences: Having used Macs for 25 years, I fear OS updates but realise the necessity.
This one is not that scary, new features are underwhelming but will, hopefully, prove useful in time and the update was relatively painless.
The only thing that really affects me is Photos.. for me, it's dreadfully old fashioned, intrusive and annoying.
Believe me, I've tried to like it but when you compare it to Aperture or iPhoto; that are now crippled and buggy in El Capitan, I just hope there was a good reason for introducing it.
By the way, I use Photos on my iPhone and it sort of makes sense on a mobile device but could be so much better..

row.Title: Airdrop is borked in this version.

row.Sentences: Hopefully they will fix it VERY SHORTLY.

row.Title: Photos doesn't sync any more since ElCaptain

row.Sentences: Since I downloaded ElCaptain, the Photos program stopped synching photos with my iphone and iPad, just showing placeholders that they should be there but however many times I restart it still doesn't load any new photos.
Very bad glitch
My machine is a mid-2010 MBP but last year I switched the hard drive to a 256Mb SSD and upgraded the RAM to 8Gb, giving the machine a new lease of life.
El Capitan has been a direct upgrade from Mavericks and, as others have reported, was pretty quick to install.

From my experience with the Mavericks upgrade (direct from Snow Leopard), I ran Disk Utility First Aid to discover "incorrect number of file hard links" and the disk "was found corrupt and needs to be repaired."
Despite saying that First Aid would repair the disk, this didn't actually happen in "live' mode.
Rebooting into the rescue partition (holding cmd+R at boot) and then running Disk Utility allowed the disk to be repaired and there have been no problems reported since.
Apart from that, I needed to upgrade LibreOffice to the latest 5.0.2.2 and find an alternative media player to MPlayerX but everything else "just works".
The machine seemed to run a bit hotter to begin with (i.e.
the first day or two) but then the OS was "optimising' as I was using it and it's been fine since.
For me, El Capitan is cleaner, faster and snappier than Mavericks and a worthwhile upgrade.
Installed this on my Mid 2010 21" Imac 2TB 12GB, I have to say it's way better than the previous OS, Yosemite.
Everything feels more snappier and that includes Safari.
The install took about 30 minutes and my Mac did restart to a black screen with a 2 second bleep other than that it was all good.
Just installed few hours ago and Im having trouble with safari.
Images are showing broken and incomplete Please fix it
The upgrade broke my development environment.
Xcode doesn't work anymore, nor does Ruby.
Still sifting through the technical rubble to see what else has been nuked by this update.
It looked fine for the few moments I had it, pretty much the same as Yosemite.
It didn't let me open up some apps.
I was told to clear my drive to download Yosemite instead but Yosemite isn't even on the App store so now I both lost everything and I'm stuck with this.
My mac now crashes/restart once every single half an hour!
I cant believe a company such as Apple can release such a dodgy product.
My time Machine no longer works, my Mail is crashing, my safari is at a snails pace.
Hurry up and get these bugs fixed.
My Mac is very limited at the minute as Ive effectively lost total power of my network.
Do not install until they release the latest update when hopefully the many problems will be resolved.
Yosemite was bad enough.... a gimmick filled, over inflated, unreliable operating system.
So much so that we had to ditch our in studio wifi altogether and paid to have an ethernet network installed in order to maintain a reliable internet connection.
We hoped that the El Capitain would address these and other issues, but no!
Just more never-to-be-used, gimmiky features and even more unreliabilty than before.... USB Apple Alphanumeric keyboards now keep disconnecting and require unplugging every few minutes to reset.
Even the machines with Apple wireless keyboards intermittently disconnect.
Just not good enough for a professional digital imaging business.
Whatever happened to the "Apple computers work right out of the box" days?
Long gone!
All our iMacs, Macbook Pros, iPads and iPhones will be on eBay very shortly.
Made my laptop sluggish and can't use the internet as everything takes literally 30 minutes to download.
Don't download it.

row.Title: Lost all email accounts - no resolution from Apple!!!

row.Sentences: I upgraded my MAC in good faith only to find that I had lost all email accounts.

After hours on the line to Apple their only suggestion was to restore the old OS version to enable me to access my email accounts despite me being able to acces them via my iphones and iPads minus the legacy transactions.
I can access iCloud account only which has limiterd value to me.

Had been on the line for over 50minutes waiting to speak to a technical expert when the line went dead without explanation - apparantley the UK call centre had closed for the day and I had to then re-engage through a helpful on-line chat session.
I've a 2009 MacMini (server edition).
I've found of late that updates seem to signify a slowing down in performance.
El Capitan seems to add a bit more zip to it, and I'm well pleased.
At the end of the day I'm running a 6 year old computer (albeit with an SSD loaded into it) - but for value, this is great.
Not sure about the new font yet; the spacing between characters appears a little to much, but it'll grow, I'm sure.
In all, I'm pleased with this update.

row.Title: Very poor, possibly the worst experience in 15 yrs+

row.Sentences: bricked my mbp retina, took to genius bar and they said new logic board and screen!
took it home persevered and got it going with smc, cmd s,r,v etc etc reformatted and installed clean Yosemite, all is well!!

and am using again but i think its the graphics card and energy saving swapping thing, rubbish really but genius bar is the most upsetting, thats 3 bits of bad advice/profiteering i've experienced now.
missing you steve

so dissappointed mac OS X falling behind windows and in particular windows 10 which is so much better i got my 2015 macbook air was looking forward to new and innovative software but got nothing new from my last mac early 2011 apart from lion - capitan mr jobs is dead and so will the mac be if apple don't realise we need so much more.. i paid 900 for a outdated system and to be honest a laptop that had i bought a windows PC would have cost 300 less come on apple get a grip and as for 12 hour battery life !!!!
only if i turn it on and don't use it........... lucky if i can watch a 2hr movie before it dies

row.Title: External Hard Drive and Continuing WiFi Instability

row.Sentences: Following the update from Yosemite to El Capitan, I had hoped the problems with WiFi dropping out would be improved.
Wifi Still requires frequent 'turn off' and 'turn on' most commonly when waking from 'sleep'.
Most frecently, my Macbook Pro 2013, has lost conectability to my Adata 1TB hard drive via USB and I have needed to use my 6 year old Windows laptop to access all of my work and personal data.

Having suffered from poor wifi connections and stability since the original update from Mavericks OS which had worked perfectly (at least as far as I could tell) I had begun to regret buying "Apple' and this latest example with the hard drive has only shaken my confidence in the software to the core.
Overall I would now never consider using the machine professionally and for other situations not without an 'alternative' as a back up.
The upgrade killed off my BT Yahoo Mail IMAP set up that worked like a dream under Mountain Lion.
I had to move out of Apple Mail and set things up on Outlook to be able to receive and send emails from my iMac and, even then, El Capital keeps playing tricks.
There is no way to set up email accounts manually, the system takes over and puts in the wrong settings.
Also, you cannot have the email account open on you iMac and iPhone or iPad at the same time.
It seems to me that Apple has tightened up email setup so much than now anything that is not Google Mail does not work.
The rest of the system is OK but I did not notice any appreciable difference from Mountain Lion.
Apple is more and more becoming like Microsoft: come back Steve Jobs!

row.Title: Failed to install. Left me with a brick for a while.

row.Sentences: Macbook Pro 15" mid 2012 upgrading from OS X 10.8.5My MBP is kept digitally clean and tidy and I am highly computer literate.
I made a bootable clone of my Macintosh HD before commencing the installation just in case, never believing for an instant it would save my machine.
I tried installing/upgrading directly from software update like most people would.
The install process got stuck and left me with a machine that would not boot and would not go into recovery.
After a great number of attempts and swearing I borrowed another MBP and made a bootable installer on a USB drive.
This time my mac would boot into recovery where I erased my HD then started the install process from the USB stick.
Still no joy, still got stuck.
Eventually I restored my erased HD from the backup clone and am back on 10.8.5 where I started.
On our Windows laptop Win10 installed quick and easy.
I might not bother with another Mac in future.
Highly unimpressed.
Poor show Apple, poor show.
Really really impressedI have installed so far on a 2015 MacBookAir and a 2010 MacBookPro.

Both computers boot fasterApps open fasterI dont notice the Safari slowness that others have commented onIssues with CS5 have been fixedIssues with Acrobat Pro 8/9 have been sorted - I think with was a legacy Java compatabiltiy issueMail is now much more stable and opens fasterBattery life is much improvedApple have been doing a really good job of enabling older lower memory hardware to carry on being used.
We had two old MacBookAirs 2009 and 2010 that had 2Gb memory and to be honest before Mavericks came along we were thinking of Ebaying them.
Now they are very useful computers and staff are really happy with them.
Our old MBP 2010's are also really useful machines.
My only gripe in all this is that the older style iMac's are not supported even though the guts of them are virtually identiacal to the 2010 MBP's.
Very annoying retiring good computers that some of our office staff can get good use out of when fitted with an SSD.

row.Title: Do NOT install on Mac Pro

row.Sentences: Since installation on previous generation Mac Pro on day one, massively unreluable with logouts every few minutes and kernel panics.
Problem seems to be directly related to more than one screen and video card.
Moving back to Yosemtie now seems inevitable due to no sign or word of a fix.

row.Title: Wish I had not upgraded so quickly!

row.Sentences: As I use my mac for music and photography the benefits are lost on me as I now have less functionality than before.
My NIk collection software no longer works as a plugin making my work load greater.
Surely its not beyond the wit of man to ensure compatibility with existing applications.
Reinstalling Yosemite looks to be a pain.
Wish I had taken the advice not to rush to upgrade.
If you are thinking of installing this software DO NOT DO IT.
It has completely mangled my email accounts and combined them with my wife's.
We have separate sign-ons and separate email accounts with different companies.
They are now all accessible to us both and many of the emails are appearing in the wrong folders.
For example emails I have in a gmail account are appearing in my wife's googlemail account - the first is IMAP and the second is POP.
There is an old saying - when it's not broken dont fix it - (notice the lack of a apostrophe El Capitan cant fix sloopy typing!!!).
I wonder if Apple actually tests it's OS before foisting it on us?I would give it a zero rating but onr star is the lowest setting.

row.Title: More work needed to fix this now!

row.Sentences: Since downloading El Capitan, typing freezes, apps take ages to load and every time I power down, I have to run the recovery programme and reinstall the OS on start-up - absolute nightmare!
I cannot really see much improvement with this latest update.
Mostly is has caused many apps to become instable, and my macbook crashes fairly regularly after the instillation.
Micosoft office products crash consistently or will not open, and it wiped all my emails and clalander events from exchange survers.
In general I am less than happy with the update.

I have a 2015 macbook pro, running on Yosemite, so I updated to this OS X and within a few hours, I couldnt access 90% of websites, kept getting "safari cannot access this page" and the same with chrome and firefox.
Done some googleing on my phone and found that the update had lots of really back feedback and complaints, the internet issue being one of them.
So I resotred my mac from a previous backup, now running on Yosemite and as good as ever!
This OS X is only a BETA, so its full of bugs, glithces and really slows yor mac down and takes ages for the mac to shutdown and boot up!
Stick with your current osx!
Hours and hours and then cocked-up passwords in MAIL.
Backup failed, re-installation to Yosemite?????
2 hours at 2am, 2 hours Sunday morning - finally El Capitan is on the MacBook (why the iMac works perfectly first time is beyond me??)
So, it's not all plain sailing.

row.Title: Don't know what all the fuss is about

row.Sentences: Didn't adversely affect my iMac one bit - was putting off the update based on so many negative reviews but glad I've updated.
No probs or speed issues here.
I have downloded and installed El Capitan on my macbook pro 13 mid 2010 and the only thing I can say it that is it a disaster.
after installing El capitan it was imposible to reboot my MBP as it was block on white screen with the apple logo.
I had to downgrade back to os 10.9 and just figure out now that my bluetooth is not working any more, and couldnt found any fix for that.
Seriously really disapointed with apple and new CEO, Steve Jobs would never allowed this OS go live.

Gutted with this, I'm no longer able to use I tunes or the app store and the serial number for my mac is now unavailable so im unable to get support very dissapointed !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

row.Title: This is the best version that apple have released.
row.Topic: Backup, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Update

row.Sentences: I think some users comments are unfair.
In most cases, I think you will have excellent results if you follow the common sense approach to upgrading i.e.

1) Back up using time machine, 2) manually back up the folders that are very important to you in the unlikely event time machine does not work, 3) do a fresh install and finally 4) restore time machine back up.
Installing over old stuff is convenient but not always the best.

My only complaint so far for the few weeks that I have been using El Capitan is the fact that the new OS disconnects external hard drives (Something we really need because buying internal memory from Apple is, for some reason always more expensive than buying from other vendors).
For now switching off the power-saving features seems to have worked.

row.Title: Let People Know that they can't use Microsoft Office!

row.Sentences: I cannot properly use my computer because of this update.
Nowhere has it been advertised/ said that I won't be able to use Microsoft Office after the update.
Because of this I have lost a lot of time which I don't have to waste on idiots whom you pay a ton of money for a good laptop and then they screw up the software!
I don't care that it;s microsoft's job to provide an update.
Apple should have let me know about this possibility when I clicked on download.
If I had known, I would have waited.
Do you realise how frustrating it is to use Numbers instead of Excel??
It's impossible to do many things on that stripped down programme.
No problems loading and smooth in use BUT Aperture has started to show all pictures in the viewer far too bright.
They are fine when opened in iPhoto.
I know Aperture is not supported now but I didn't expect this.
Preparation for this update is important methinks.
I followed all the usual recommended best practice prior to installation, given the well documented issues some appear to be having.
I repaired disc permissions, verified the startup disc, did a time machine backup and closed all running apps.
No problems so far and everything is working - wireless printer/scanner, bluetooth, etc.
Download and installation on my early 2010 Macbook Pro with 4Gb RAM did take 2hrs and on occasions I thought it had hung/frozen but in the end it did get there.
Lots of excellent new features and I am delighted with the iOS connectivity.
Thank you Apple.
Sadly this update has ruined my productivity because now I can no longer access my network drive via the Finder and Lightroom, which is where all my photos are!!
Now I have a very expensive pretty paperweight, please fix this ASAP!!!
It is pretty much the same as the last version but there is one problem.
The Itunes store is completely ruined and I can't buy anything off it now.
The text and icons are all over the place and overlap each other so can this be fixed please!
Aside from that, i like the multi-tasking although not as fluid as windows.
You can't drag the window to the side and it splits the screen, would have liked that, but that's only minor.
Really haven't noticed anything different apart form the Itunes store is ruined, App Store is fine!
My macbook is a few years old now, and every time I update my operating system I regret it.
I'm certain Apple are purposely making my macbook run slower after each update, in the hopes that I'll have to buy a new one.
Each update comes with more glitches, and my macbook is reaching the point where even opening a new tab on safari will cause it to freeze.
It will always be running ok, until I update it, then it instantly becomes slower.
Other computers do not have this problem with updates, it is only an Apple thing.

I'm using a mac mini late 2009 4gb of ram 500gb 256 geforce 9400 nvidia, main drive took out the the crappy optical drive and put an internal caddy with a 500gb drive for time machine all integrated took ages to down load 6.6gb of el capitan but the results!!!!
lightening fast shuts down fast>>>gone!
everything works happy little mac man!
and our new 21.5 iMac updated as well equally brilliant!
Riding high!

I hate this upgrade, i've been using snow leopard for a few years and it worked great for me, the only reason i had to upgrade was because i upgraded my iPad to a iPad air and it would not connect to iTunes because it said i needed a newer version of iTunes, and since the upgrade everything runs slow and takes age to open , when it used to be pretty much instant.

sometime typing dosen't even show up for a couple seconds after I've typed it, I used to be able to swipe backwards and forwards through pages but can't do that anymore, It's changed all my programs like numbers which was easy to use which now dosen't even seem to have a save as button, go to screensaver and i can even seem to use my photo's anymore, I plugged in my time machine hard drive to try and go back to how it all was before and it would not do it.

row.Title: some nice changes in theory but...

row.Sentences: i installed this a few days ago and as far as the new changes its a nice upgrade with some promising features, however for me it was a waste of time and quite frustrating as i started to have issues from the get go with applications preforming pooly or simply not opening i tried a full refrsh of the software and still the same.
I think it's purely compatability and need to wait for updates as navigating the mac and sutch things is as fast as you'd expect but for now ive reverted back to yosemite where everything works.
oh and im on an early 2015 macbook pro retina 13"
Beware.....so far a disaster!
Slowed down start up and interupted many applications (no coincidence they were working fine before) but has mostly messed up my iTunes.
Store unusable.
Have reported and three techs unable to restore.
Awaiting update but not impressed.
Personall dont like interface either.

downloaded this and installed , has caused nothing but problems , i can no longer play online bingo , have lost some features that i use everyday , freezes and is constantly buffering , Yosemite wa in my opinion a much better os , i want it gone
Installed El Capitan it has slowed everything down ( I've got ample memory ) and I can't use iMovies , iDVD, IPhoto or my Epson Printer.
I do have the new Photos application but that scarcely compensates for all the negatives.
I have the option to purchase updated versions of the Apple applications but the loss of the printer's driver is a big downside.
I need to be able to scan photographic negatives.
My options are to buy a new and expensive printer/ scanner and a host of costly upgrades or revert to Snow Leopard and go from there.
Not fair I say.

row.Title: Doesn't recognise USB3 external hard drives on MBA v 4.1

row.Sentences: Got El Captian installed on my mid 2012 Mac book Air yesterday.
Started iTunes only to get the message that the iTunes library cannot be found, which is on my external hard drive (usb 3 Segate 1 TB) connected to the laptop.
Checked Finder and the device is not listed under Devices.
USB2 devices are shown but not this one which is USB3.
Checked Disk utility, and the external hard drive is visible and shown as mounted.
Tried unmounting, restarting and a few other combinations but no luck so far.
Seems to be a known issue back from beta days and am trying various options......
From Disk utility, i can right click and view the files in the ext hard drive by using "Show in Finder' and surprisingly it shows the contents of the hard drive.
The device is visible on the desktop and itunes shows the device when i say "Choose Library' but fails to open the show the contents of the hard drive.
Really annoyed.
Cant access my iTunes anymore.
The device works and is tested on other PCs.
Now i will have to use iTunes from my home PC till Apple sorts this out and comes up with a patch.
It will not fully load and is stuck on paues and I am unable to restart download

row.Title: no more please!!!
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Safari, Update

row.Sentences: apple please stop releasing more and more and more operating systems without fixing issues with the current version!!!
its getting worse it feels like each version is in beta constantly' El Capitan is the worse yet!

bugs after bugs freezing safari locking up ,back buttons not working un responsive curser ,highlighted links not responding safari pages freezing , no buttons responding constant locking up , glitches in safari are really bad and are un believably regular the whole operating system is erratic and un predictable just doesnt feel "safe" to use it feels like it has a mind of its own and acts wierdly all the time it does not feel stable like mountain lion or snow leapard.

Mavericks started buggy but was pretty good at the end.i think there should be one operating system and bugs fixed constantly until the system is as stable as ever but no as soon as the OS gets remotly stable and usable theres another new OS with yet another fancy name and yes back to buggy software again' just seems like after 12 month of fixing bugs another release is out and the current operating system is out dated before it becomes stable and reliable.i accept betas have bugs and i do public test them but more often than not i see the same issues after every update??
how about one operating system one name but constantly worked upon!!
new features ?
but no new experience just the same bugs again and again.
i like apple and there software but it always feels rushed.
Read differing reviews so decided to update my MBP late 2011 i7 before starting on my main iMac and the install was seamless.
Half expected issues after reading a few other comments but so far so good.
I upgraded my MBP with a SSD drive for Yosemite anyway, so it's been running quick anyway.
The install process was quick and easy and I suffered no delays or hanging issues.
I can't say I have noticed any particular speed improvements that others have mentioned, but as I say, it was running quick before anyway.
I will monitor for a week before starting on my iMac.
4 out of 5 as so far, can't see any real major improvements but the split screen is a nice touch i will use.
Maybe it is fast on Macbook Pro Retina (thanks to SSD) but on iMac with HDD I think it works worse than Maverics...
I admit I don't use the functions my Macbook offers nearly as much as I should however the basic things such as the abilty to print is fundamental.
Why on the second update in a row does an Apple update not support my printer?!
Really annoying!
Sorry to disappoint, but this has to be the worst upgrade for any operating system ever.
It slowed my whole system down and two of my downloaded programs refused to start.
System crashed, report sent to Apple.
Yosemity 10 10 5 is perfect I'll stick with this.
Shame really, until now Apple have been beyond reproach in my opinion
This update has all but killed my 2012 macbook pro, you cant even use ebay on safari correctly.
Donot download this until all the bugs and glitches are fixed.
like it , better then yosemite with some many problems around Mail.
Very fast, very little issues, and those with complaints are actually talking about third party software not working.
Well check your third party is up to date is all i can say.
However nice the update is, there are a couple of bugs but the one that affects me is the preview of large images, in quick preview it just doesn't render the image if you zoom in.

In preview the screen goes green, i assume it's a memory management issue but as i work with photos it can get annoying when you just want to check focus and bam your screen is green and you can't see the close up you expected.
The only other issue is apple has locked the root of OSX, so you can't change icons in your dock any more.
This should never have been part of the lock and i recommend apple to have options to change these or allow third party apps to interact with osx to allow them to change the icons needed.
I'm all for saftey but the icon are really damn ugly and i prefer to have parity with ios and replace them with ios icons, it saves me 0.2 seconds looking for an app.
Petty i know but it's important to me!
Not faster (at least, not on non-SSD systems).
Not a better experience as they have reduced the control that the user has over the system.
Yes, maybe by doing so you make the OS more stable, but taking control away is the least professional way to do it.
OS 11 will only have one button.
This iteration of OS X is best described as a complete and utter disaster.
I have lost 5 days of work because of it.
It has been slow/buggy/crashy since installation on my 2013 iMac 27".
In short, it is completely unusable.
The UI is constantly crashing/lagging, even typing this there is major lag and the pinwheel appears for 20-30 seconds with sometimes only every 3-4 keystrokes.
If I change applications, it's the same; pinwheel and wait 30 seconds or more!
I have wasted hours upon hours on the support forums trying everything from resetting SMC and PRAM, to disabling Spotlight, nothing works!
It's not as if my machine is one of the older Macs either!
Looking at Activity Monitor it is clear that this is not it is not a resource issue meaning it can only be related to the kernel - i.e.
it has nothing to do with any apps that are potentially incompatible with El Capitan - it is an OS problem!
The whole experience has been nothing but a nightmare and has destroyed my faith in Apple as a company who produce relaible soild products....
I thought I'd never say it in my 20+ years of Macintosh ownership but thankfully I have a PC to fall back on!
Be careful Adobe CS5 costing over 1000 will not work, particually on Exit, error message pops up saying "Application Quit Unexpectedly" please restart.
Also gives problems with eyedropper tool.
Have had to re-install Mavericks, at least my Adobe products work.
NOT GOING over to this stupid rental system with Adobe.
as soon as I installed it .... so quickly I kicked it out from my MacBook Air.
check how "big" privilege you have when removing applications you are not using ,or do not want (apple apps )... you can be very , very surprise .

row.Title: DO NOT DO IT WAIT FOR APPLE TO DE BUG

row.Sentences: installed El capitan last night computer re started ok. come back to it this morning and my top spec Mac Book Pro bought 12 months ago now will not boot and looking at online advise have to reinstall rendering the machine useless for 7 hours at last count......this is my work computer as a self employed marketing consultant costing me money............. DO NOT DO IT WAIT UNTIL APPLE DE BUG.
Very rapidly loosing confidence in apple products
Installed upgrade on macbook pro and it simply refused about 3/4 of the way in, only option offered was to retry.
Thanks Apple.
Can't see much difference after upgrading, but everything is sloooooooow and freezes quite a lot forcing a restart.
It's just like running an old Windows machine.
Can't think it was worth upgrading I'm afraid.
Need a fix soon.

row.Title: So happy I'v done the upgrade
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I have to admit that I was wrong sticking to OSX Mountain Lion for so long.
A lot of negative opinions about OS X Yosemite put me off from upgrading to El capitan.
Six months ago I had to help friend of mine to downgrade from Yosemite back to Mountain lion because his I Mac 2009 with 4gb of ram was literally unusable.
Last week I gave it a tray and I instaled El capitan on the external HDD.
To my surprise I was shocked how stable snappy and smooth the system was on my Mac book pro 2012 2.6 Quad core wit 8gb of ram.
Temperature run very low even watching vides on Youtube or Skype.
I have plenty ram left for my photography postproduction work and the ram seems to run more efficiently then before.

The only problems I had were mail boxes I had to log in with my passwords again and then they were back and running fine, even my wife's Mac book pro 2009 2.9 dual core with 8gb of ram became much vaster, temperature is low I can't hear the cooling fans any more.
The Finder is more accurate when you klick things around.
Now I installed El capitan on my internal flash drive and it is pure joy to use it.
Apple I have back the confidence in the stable and reliable Apple computer product, I had when I bought My first macbook running OS X snow leopard.
Thanks again for the great upgrade!!

row.Title: DISASTER! ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE USING OUTLOOK
row.Topic: El_Capitan, N/A, Outlook, Performance, Support, Windows

row.Sentences: I updated to el capitan, BIGGEST MISTAKE EVER!
Outlook started doing strange things....the multicoloured disk rotating forever.
Everntually my whole MacBook Pro (year 2014) collapsed.
I have lost all my data - it was a work machine, so lots of business stuff.
Now I have a dead machine, and not even Apple Support know how to fix it.
I know that Mac has for some time been trying to challenge Windows' supremacy in the business market.
Here is the reason they are failing to do that.
I'm going back on Windows.
My Yahoo Mail account was corrupted by this installation and I can no longer connect with the BT-Yahoo mail server.
I have tried every avenue within the OS to get it back, but to no avail.
The Mac forums are heaving with mail issues after updating from Yosemite.
Were the beta testers asleep?
at this rate may never be installed.
Couldn/t get much slower.
I don't know what has happened to Apple with its developments but each version of the OSX seems to get more buggy as time goes on.
Safari is just awful now, Notes only works spasmodically, Photos, well just don't get me started, and the rest of the app hasn't really improved.
I'd sooner pay for my upgrades if it meant things worked properly rather than getting cr*p for nothing!

row.Title: My MacBook Pro is now slow and power hungry

row.Sentences: Well Apple, if you were wanting me to go over to Microsoft land you have been incredibly successful!!!
Installed El Capitan expecting great things but all I get is a very power hungry and extremely slow MacBook - what gives?Judging by the ratings I seem to be in the minority so what have I done wrong?

row.Title: Problems, upon problems back to Yosemite

row.Sentences: When i upgraded to El Capitan it was worst mistake ever.
My computer would not work, constantly frozen, spinning beachball, could not open any applications and would get a distorted screen every few minutes.

I took it in for repairs and worked for one day and then went back to being frozen and unresponsive, spent 4-5 hours with Apple Support and they were unable to fix it, so i have just gone back to Yosemite and i will not upgrade until there has been some significants updates.
I have never had issues with upgrading my software until El-Capitan.
When i was able to use El Capitan for an hour or two, it was extremely, extremely slow and it was a struggle to do anything.
I am my own worst enemy, but speaking from experience.
There are some issues with El Capitan, at least with my installation.
The installation works OK, but is not what I would call stable.
It is new release so I expect there to be updates and changes.
My experience is that standard Apple Apps don't start properly, that being they freeze on start up, as an example.
It is hoped that Apple will develop improvements as all issues are reported.
There is a warning, but in my experience Apple will fix the issues and it is hoped with this review that some changes will happen soon.
These are my impressions with my installation.
My experience in the industry is that we are in the right place and in good hands.

row.Title: Nice but one problem interaction with Outlook

row.Sentences: First the installation went fine no dramas- great-most things seeem okThe issue i have is the emailing of images fine is in Mail, Facebook etc but when it comes to Outlook, the box is ticked but it is not enabled, my local Applestore agree and have reported it upwards.
Also on Outlook the when the Sent/Recieve command is given it does not close itself every time and you need to quit the application and re-open it.
I am sure a update will come out shortly

row.Title: What's wrong with OSX updates recently? First Yosemite, now this!

row.Sentences: Preview has stopped working, so I can't view photos any more (I don't use iPhoto).
NTFS external drives which worked fine under all previous versions, even Yosemite, are now "read only'!
These are basic functions that I'd expect a 100 Windows netbook to handle, never mind a 2,000 MacBook Pro!
Also, I haven't been able to update any of the OSX apps.
There are currently two showing updates availabe - iPhoto and iMovie - but whenever I rty to update I get an error message "The items are unavailable'.
Really, Apple?
Installed El Capitan on my MacBook Pro (currently running Yosemite).
The install failed and then my Mac would not boot, even in safe mode.
I tried to do a disk recovery but that also failed so I had to do a full restore from a time machine back up.
Needless to say I am back on Yosemite and too scared to try installing this update again.

row.Title: Serious compatibility issues with the installer

row.Sentences: I have twice attempted installing El Capitan on my Macbook Pro (mid 2012) and on both occasions the install has failed.
The first occasion was simply closing all programmes and letting it do its thing, however it gets stuck in a loop during boot-up giving the error that the Mac cannot start properly.
I left this overnight to see if it would resolve without success.
This forced a rebuild from a time machine backup that I am very lucky I had.
I tried a second time on a clean install of Yosemite and unfortunately I encountered the same problem.
I will not be installing this on any other Mac until Apple get their software working as it should.
Not sure if the issue lies with Apple or Microsoft, but there are some major issues if you use your Mac for work with Office / Outlook.
My system is now majorly unstable and I am having still trying to find a solution.
Beware if you use office - my recomendation is don't upgrade yet.
Office 2016 is a disaster and Office 2011 is not much better.
As a business user, I would be grateful if Apple would check that major software suites like Office work, or issue some kind of warning.
rolling back to Yosemite is not something I really want to work out how to do..

Changing to El Capitan has slowed my macbook down to an almost unusable speed, I cannot believe Apple would release such rubbish without testing it properly , avoid until they have resolved the bugs is my recommendation
I have a brand new 2015 Macbook Pro 13inch Retina - Yosemite was a dream, this is a nightmare.
Mail, Outlook, iTunes, Safari and anything microsoft ceases to function - my copy of Final Draft 9 now refuses to open which is a real problem as this the main tool I use for work.
And when things do work - it's only for a brief sluggish moment.
However, I will say there are minor improvements on the graphics - the notorious beach ball has had a makeover.
I only noticed this because it makes an appearance every time I do anything.
Performance seems much better.
Mail still crashes every other time I try to do something (<sigh>).
"Side by Side' doesn't work for all windows (seriously, you couldn't make it work for all apps?).
Spotlight new functions don't seem to work properly for me.

row.Title: Well it freezes, and never leaves the lockscreen

row.Sentences: I like the new features, feels like iOS on the MacBook Pro, however what's the point if it keeps freezing on my 2014 Macbook pro retina with 16gb Ram, going back to Yosemite, and waiting for a few months until the bugs are ironed out....

So far I had to reinsatall the operating system 3 times, within one day, this is unprofessional Apple please test it out before release, you're wasting evertone's time.... Also for you power hungry users, Stay away heard CS6 applications don't work, and casual gamers a few Steam games maybe?
Just wait and get it in the next quarter December/Jan, unless you have a brand new 2015 system.
Don't normally write reviews but this is an unusable product released into the market, worse yet by Apple!

Keeping it to the point I have noticed a few issues since upgrading1 preview does not show images anymore 2 interefence noise coming from the Cinema display 3 issues connectiing via airdrop apart from that it seems to be another decent OS from apple

row.Title: Microsoft Office is now dead - thanks MS and Apple

row.Sentences: I never upgrade early, for exactly these reasons.
But something made me think this update was only a few minor improvements.
While there may be only a few advantages to see, under the covers something is very broken.
I have a Mid 2012 Macbook Pro, i7, and Yosamite and Office 2016 were fine on it.
I was even quite pleased with the way things were working so well.
Now my Mac often hangs, and needs apps to be force closed.
Office 2016 is as good as useless.
Most of the time, the apps won't start, and when they do start they often hang or crash.
Microsoft just made an update, but things are still broken.
From the forums they don't know what is wrong, so I'm even considering going back to Yosamite.
If you use Office 2016, just beware.
Apple is normally flawless.
This version has crashed almost every 30 minutes (or rather All the microsoft apps have been crashing).
Destroyed productivity for a week of my life.
No updates on when it would be fixed.
This not the Apple we know and love.
How on earth did this get released?

Downloaded and updated the iMac - at first kept noticing that the Mail app activity window kept updating thousands of emails..... left it alone and came back to find my machine locked on grey screen with Apple logo.
Tried many things to get out of this, ended up restoring the whole Mac from a backup.
I think I may wait for a while before I try this again.

row.Title: Yet another machine killer!
row.Topic: Backup, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update, Windows

row.Sentences: Dear AppleThis is the third version of OSX that has managed to totally eliminate one of my machines by being so "well crafted" that the machine becomes incapable of booting!
OSX 10.9 killed my main iMac, 10.10 killed my Macbook Pro and now this version has also managed to terminate my MacBook having upgraded from a clean 10.8 installation that was running well.
No wonder that later upgrades have been given away free - if we were paying you would be in serious trouble with refunds and compensation.
Given that you are working with your own hardware rather than 3rd party stuff as Windows has to usually deal with, I think that this is shocking.
When you pay a premium price for your kit, you expect it to last!
(All the machines noted above are modern enough that the update should, in theory, work).
I am now reduced to running nothing later than OSX 10.8 and have had to effectively lose all the apps that I once used that require a 10.9 or later.
I moved to Mac when you introduced OSX 10.1 in an attempt to escape from the nightmare that was then the Microsoft's Windows Operating System.
I am afraid to say that after your ongoing recent performance, my next machine purchase is going to be running Windows 10.
Anyone wanting to risk attempting this upgrade is highly encouraged to make a backup to external hard drive - reboot using this backup and then try it to see if your machine survives.
At least this way, you don't damage a working installation.
It's incredibly slow but even worse than that, I can no longer access my photos.
When I open Photos, I get a message "Photos must quit because the photo library has become unavailable or its data is corrupt'.
I hadn't backed all of these up though most I can probably reinstall from my cameras, but some are lost forever.
Of course, the time needed now to reinstall............ Not impressed.

I'll start with the stability issues with El Capitan:I have a 6-month old MBP that just crashed by itself while I was away (crash report sent to apple) Sometimes on wakeup the keyboard and trackpad don't work.

Thankfully I have a USB keyboard that I can connect and reboot which fixes the problemThe USB ports seem to work when they feel like it (there are even videos on how to fix the issue online) but I'll wait for an update.
My 5GHz Wifi doesn't work reliably but then the truth is it's as bad as it was on Yosemite - I just use the 2.4Ghz mode and that works fine.
I don't want to be too harsh, the OS has some nice features and mission control works a lot better.
My advice would be to wait before you update.
As far as I can tell this is Beta-quality software.

row.Title: All seemed good at first but now there seems to be a problem with Internet Connection and Mail

row.Sentences: All seemed great after first downloading.
Photos is much better - such a relief to have back the ability to bulk edit the titles and descriptions and add location.

BUT, after my MacBook Air 2013 has a sleep, about half the times when it wakes up the internet connection isn't working and can take several switch off and ons - sometimes a reboot to get it going again.
Now there seems to be a problem with Mail.

Having spent all afternoon composing a long complex email I took a break and when I came back to complete and send I found it had saved about 50 drafts (viewable in the Today folder) of it at the various stages of completion but in the Drafts folder there wasn't a draft of the last version with my final edits - very frustrating.
Other than these 2 issues it does seem much quicker.

So been appling for the past 30 years and yes as a company we are getting much value for the $; however loaded the Capitan which was very impressive until it ran all my core code into disaray ending with a fatale crash and lock out of my systime now back in the land of Yosemite with a now compleat lack of sinagey with all my iOS devices.
So apple you need to do much better as you are affecting my bottom line.... fix up !

row.Title: safari super slow and freezes, general issues and slow boot

row.Sentences: boot time slowerslower in general when open appssafari won't workdone this update a week ago for my iMac (21.5-inch, Late 2012) 2.9 GHz Intel Core i5 on 8 oct 2015 and safari wont work, its so slow and not responsive, so now im using chromatic.
i red the bad reviews but i should have learn from them and not do the same mistake.
i hope soon it will be an update to fix safari.
This is the sort of update you would expect from Microsoft.
Office locks upLync Locks upThe so split screen only works on compatible apps (not many at the moment)Its enough to think why I crossed over to Mac in the first place.
Downloaded El Capitan.
overnight 2 nights ago and installed while I was having my breakfast.
Went to work and used my laptop in my business environment - perfect.
Guys it's the best upgrade yet, and I've done 7 previous OSX upgrades.
If I still lived and worked in the M camp that would have taken days !!!
Maybe those who make very negative comments should check the condition of their machines before they upgrade!
And best of all it was free......... Love Notes and Safari is much better Loads of nice little improvements Well done ffrom the UAE.

row.Title: what is going on with Apple !!!!

row.Sentences: This new software update is just awful, from the second that I've installed on my mac the system has become slow, some times I can't delet or even move in to the bin unnecesary files, interenet pages getting slow to upload , most of the time I have to restart the sistem becouse is taking ages or even get stock when I try to open or create new pages files.
The previews version was much better but I belive this uploads that apple is sending out ( especially for iPhone ) are just ment to let us buy the new product.
When Steve was in charge of apple we didn't have so many problems with our Mac/phone/ipad ecc.. and so manu prodoct coming out in less than 12 month......something to think about!!!

Very pleased with this, not because of the new features but this seems to have cured the sleep wake/kernel panic problems and Safari now loads straight away, no more waiting about for my home page to appear.
Having upgraded to El Capitan, my mail (Apple Mail) refused to recognise any of the passwords on my email accounts.
After getting it to work (briefly), Mail settled into refusing to send emails on my main account.
I contacted Apple Support.
After a few attempts at fixing it, Apple decided it wasn't a problem with El Capitan (although my iPhone and other computer were happily sending and receiving on the same account).
So I downgraded back to Yosemite and - hey presto!
#NAME?
Nothing too serious - except half a day wasted and a day with no computer while it downgraded.
Thanks Apple.
I'm using a 2011 Macbook Air running 2gb ram with a 1.6ghz intel core i5 processor and I've found that the upgrade has had a real positive effect on some of the performance.
The start up and shut down times are noticeably better as are the Safari loading times.
Using two screens side by side is useful and I haven't found any other problems.
If, like me, your machine is a few years old and could do with a little performance increase, then go ahead and upgrade.
Although this new OS is pretty neat it has absolutely destroyed my iMac.
Since installation, I waste a whole hour every morning looking at the spinning wheel of death.
It is horrifically slow.
I had Yosemite before and, immediately after installing, everything was twice as fast and working great and stayed like that until I installed El Captain last week.
Can't even open the most basic of apps and everything takes forever.
Absolutely gutted.

If you use multiple screens and adobe products such as illustrator you will losse the function to right click or ctrl click this being a serious issue for productivity..until this is resolved it makes the OS X EL Capitan a nightmare to work on.. its a shame as I really always liked the apple OS.
but lost a bit of faith in this latest update as its effecting my job..
Seemless update, undisruptive changes, mostly better experience and some productivity improvements for the user.
Seems very stable and no complaints from me.
The changes in the UI are good - some are a joy to behold and work with.
Takes a little getting used to some of the new gesture-related features, as some things kind of jump out at you when you least expect (based on past experiences).
Watch the Apple special event video before installing, if you can, so you know what to expect and what you have to look forward to.
In some ways this update feels like a big leap forward for OS X - which may be, as Apple proclaims, because it's an overhaul more than a feature upgrade.
A little more support for the disabled - particularly vision-impaired - would be a most welcome update in a subsequent release.
Slowed my iMac down considerably, my iMac also now refuses to recognise my external hard drives.
Very poor, glitchy operating system that needed serious refinement prior to an extremely premature release.
My battery life halved after install (2015 13" Macbook Pro).
I run a 3 screen setup (laptop plus 1 thunderbolt plus 1 HDMI) and it couldn't handle it correctly.
Lost my keyboard mapping for direct access keys (brightness, volume etc) and couldn't get it back.
Performance was noticeably slower.
Back to Yosemite until next update

row.Title: A warning to MS Office users

row.Sentences: I have no beef with El Capitain, as an OS it's an improvement on Yosemite and that's saying something BUT if you are running Office 2016 (and from what I've heard 2011) it's a disaster.
Outlook and Word in particular (although I've had issues with Excel too) simply do not work.
They crash within minutes of opening, in fact Outlook seldom opens at all.
Apple and MS know about the issue but so far no fix rendering my main iMAC workstation useless for business use.
Withoiut this issue it would be a five star review but with it, frankly it's a one.

Since updating my Mac Book Pro 2013 to El Capitan from Yosemite one cannot help but notice whats changed in the OS X platform, as i do a lot of on -line viewing instead of watching the TV I would use the built in configurable display and set this to 1.8 gamma, sadly this has now gone and can no longer be configurable, and therefore i'm back to the TV as the display's contrast is not to my liking.
Apple promoted find your cursor easily,this is just an irritating gimmick and thankfully it can be turned off.

iTunes update designed specifically for El Capitan will not transfer purchases from the iPhone and therefore Apps will have to be re-downloaded and then transferred to the iPhone as an update, so' it's a bit more faster then, but did it need to be, Yosemite had some good traits from the previous OS X builds maintaining grass roots standards, and sadly as i don't really like it Apple have made sure that there is no way back.
Since installing this update, none of my apps have worked and my computer (mid 2012 Macbook pro) continously tries to update Xcode and X11, neither of which work any more!
If I knew how, I would uninstall this update!
Really really great OS so far.
It fixed my previous problem where if woken up from the sleep mode, the OS would start, let me log in and then the screen would go dark, for a while.
I then had to press a key again to wake it up and it would not let me type in the passowrd for some time.
It's fast reliable, more user friendly andmore intuitive.
Upgraded from Yosemite last week and have had nothing but problems with memory issues.
Mainly seems to affect the Office Suite, but I have trouble now opening Powerpoint, viewing pictures in Excel documents and generally slowed performance.
I have a 27-inch iMac Retina and this should be running like dream yet I have to keep restarting thr system to regain my lost memory.
Not a hardware problem either, as it was working perfectly before the upgrade.
I would recommend delaying the upgrade until this is fully tested and patches are issued.

row.Title: Have nothing good to say about it

row.Sentences: I'm not a mac obsessive at all, I use it and have used it as a designer for years, this is the first time I've kept uptodate with the latest OS.

It's slowed almost everything down, swirly umbrella thing alot more than usual, the search doesn't always work, everything feels clunky and laborious - the great speed people are talikng about has proved elusive to me - needs alot of improvements - come on mac!
I feel like I've slipped back 10 years.. disappointed...
Took around two hours to download and install (MBP 2011 8gb).
All seems to be as before, but, it is certainly faster than previous versions.
I run a MacBook pro mid 2012 4gb ram and finally my Mac works beautiful.
The biggest issue I had was always the ram memory.
With all the previous OS my ram memory was inexistent and often I was running on 20mb of ram, waiting for ages to load anything.
I have tried different apps to clear the ram, I cleared the ram from the console very often, however nothing worked.
After installing El Capitan I have constantly 1.5 Gb of ram free and all the apps run flawless.
Even Safari only uses a reasonable amount of ram.
Great job!
I have tried three times to download this software update.
Each time it has taken 49 minutes and then nothing happens.
I check my software and it says Yosemite.
I'm not too impressed with Apple at all lately though.
I used to enjoy their products and services, but now their products don't last, I can't use the software, and their customer service is substandard.
I think I might be making a switch back to Microsoft on my next digital tech purchase.

row.Title: Very very unstable and poor release from Apple

row.Sentences: Very unstable on my system, looking to revert back to Yosemite and wait for a patched and corrected buildInstalled 10.11 at beginning of month and I have to say this is the worst Apple OS I have seen and this comes from someone that remembers OS9, constant freezes, random loss of Bluetooth keyboard/mouse, iTunes freezes, Safari freezes, App Store freezes, iTunes store purchases dont download correctly, USB blu-ray not working properly and Office 2016, well this is the worst, Outlook works for about 5 mins and then guess what - it freezes and you have to force quit.
The only thing that is working is Remote Desktop that opens my work Windows PC, this is working fine!
Really disappointed in the QA and testing of El Capitan, seems a rush job to me, Apple really need to get on top of this, as I said worst OS for quality I have seen ever from Apple
Not happy whith El Capitan, Downloaded and installed on two Macs both of my Macs froze on start up would not work at all.
!, come on apple this is not like you bringing out a pile of *****!!
My 27" Late 2013 iMac with 16gb Memory seems to be slower since installing El Capitan, my Dock also goes a bit glitchy sometimes, really annoying.

row.Title: update intercepted in the cloud space queensgate peterborough?

row.Sentences: i was half way through my update using public internet cleared memory as instructed; and now the update has been paused.my update will not go any further than halfway

Since updatg my Mac Book Pro to El Capotan I can no longer use vital software applications as El Capitan is not compatible with them (even though the software companies have done their best to provide upgrades) Luckily I didn't install El Capitan on my main machine (iMac) otherwise I would have been screwed, some however have not been as fortunate as lost days!

row.Title: I don't think it helped much

row.Sentences: When I bought my first mac book (2008 year), it was a balanced solution which was combine: unix-comatiable OS with nice user interface and moderate security and nice aluminium design.

At the moment, there are so many security issues with EFI and OS, user interface become flat like empty table surface with different kind shitty functions which are useless i.e what is the purpose of launchpad if computer does not have touchscreen and can not be transformed to tablet mode?
The same trouble with iPhone.
Still both lacking of optimization and customization.
Another thing is using apple devices become some sort of "mauvais ton.
Recently I realized that I don't want to depend on "apple developers and co" mood and I started moving towards opensoure BSD, Linux.
Apple, you have chosen the wrong path!
Mac Mini Late 2014 - Post upgrade problems have included AirDrop - No longer worksItunes Store - The store view is completely fragemented to the left, cant preview or purchase any content.
(Friend also had this) Escalated both issue via Apple support, no fixes as of yet.....

row.Title: Killed my 1000 laptop another typical apple mess.

row.Sentences: The software is glitchy.
My Macbook "Pro' has shown the coloured beach ball thing so many times whilst simply browsing the internet or working on a word processing file.
This is typical of Apple products now as my iPad is barely usable, all my iphones have suffered due to updates too.
Considering the cost of the hardware they need to work on designing software that does not destroy items less than 5 years of age.
I do not want to spend 1000 every 2 years for somethign to simply run smoothly.
Get it together with this update as my laptop is driving me insane and I have professional work to do!
Upgrading to this is the worse thing i've done to my MacBook.!
The wifi keeps cutting out, The laptop won't load up & I am having to back up everyday so that i have a recent backup to restore to.!
DON'T LOAD THIS UP UNTIL THE PROBLEMS HAVE BEEN SORTED..!!

row.Title: Some issues with this version of OS X

row.Sentences: The Mac App Store always shows "an error has occured" when applications' installation finished.
and those red warning signs stay there forever.
The guest user can't be turned off, even haveI turned it off from the System Preference panel.
I have a late-2013 model Macbook, but the system info shows my mac is late-2012 Macbook, when I am using Chinese as system language.4.

When I am typing this review, I discovered that when I move my cursor to the middle of a sentenced, click the touchpad, tried to input some words into the sentence, the newly inputed character sometimes might appear two spaces forward from the cursor.
Pleas fix those issures, Apple.
Issue 1 and 3 exist since OS X 10.10.5.
But Generally, I am happy with this new OS X El Capitan.
The update is there I have downloaded and theres a message in red "An Error Occurred" but I tried again for days nothing is working.
As long you are not interested in having your Mail app working properly and like to your all emails do not dissapired!
Shame, shame, shame Apple.

row.Title: All working fine, except mail password

row.Sentences: The upgrade went fine except that we lost our mail accounts, which had to be reinstalled.
After that my iCloud account worked fine, but my wile's Yahoo account won't retain its password from one 24 hour period to the next.
Apple support were very helpful, but the problem persists.
I'm guessing that it's a registry error and will be bundled into the next minor release.

row.Title: Can't write to external USB drive

row.Sentences: Since installing El Capitano on my Mac Air it only gives me read access to my external Toshiba USB hard drive with all my media files on.
Very annoying that I can no longer add or remove files to this disk, as I use it to power my media player.
Serious El Capitan compatibility problems with Adobe CS6 Design Standard, causing glitches, crashes, menus disappearing, especially in InDesign.
There could be potential Javascript problems, and there are reports of other Adobe products, as well as Miocrosoft Office 2016 For Mac having major glitches.
Had to revert back to Yosemite in order to continue using Adobe CS6 by using a Time Machine backup.

It is uncertain whether Adobe will continue support for CS6, instead backing Creative Cloud for El Capitan compatibility, so if you are a designer using CS6 then install El Capitan with caution, and make sure you do a Time Machine backup before this, as you will need it.
It looks good, but not worth the risk to disrupting your workflow if you depend on Adobe products for a living.

row.Title: Don't do this with a 2011 iMac

row.Sentences: After turning off my computer it will not relaunch.
Grey screen of death.
Down loaded El Capitan a second time.
Everything works perfectly.
Turned off computer a second time.
Again failed to relaunch.
Currently reloading from backup.
So far two days of non functioning computer.
This is a high end iMac.
Whilst writing this review I'm having to wait for the text to appear in this sentence, on a brand new macbook pro bought this summer.
I can't believe how much this has slowed my laptop down.
Please sort this out Apple, an utter disgrace.

row.Title: Thats another hour of my life I won't get back!

row.Sentences: Looks identicle to OS Yosemite.
I had to click on the apple icon to confirm that the new OS had actually been installed.
Big disappointment.
Did Apple feel the need to release this clone just because there's a new windows OS out?Hmmmmm!
So if you need to use the latest I-Tunes software (which we will all need at some point) you have to install this latest operating system.
However everthing runs slower.
Slower to start up.
slower to shut down, slower to load programmer, slower to load web pages etc etc etc.
OK I am running on a circa 2007 mac book pro, but then dont allow you to load or update to this lastest operating system ..... but still let you update to the latest i-tunes.
Again this is one of Apples MAJOR problems ..... MAKING you do something, even if its a detriment to you !
starting to wish I hadnt bothered .... as I can see no major difference

row.Title: Top Job, great system thnak you :-)

row.Sentences: As with every system update id advise everyone to back up first, apple provide free backup software that is capable of rolling back to the previous system if needed.
you never know what might go wrong, Power failure, hardware failure sudden lack of patience.

Do your reserch, if there is an app that you just could not do without then google it, find out if it will work and if not will it be updated, i did all of the above and No problems downloading no problems installing, couple of minor compatability issues but all sorted at no extra cost.
My mac now runs smoother with more features and seems faster, creadit where its deserved.
I'm loving El Capitan, installs fast, app load fast.
Overall a great OS and would recommend to anyone who is able to meet the minimum specs
The iTunes layout is different, it flows along the left side (downawards) now and its not a user friendly face for iTunes.
Please change the layout of iTunes!
My Mac Mini mid 2011 seemed to spend more time spinning its wheel than being useful following an upgrade to Yosemite.
I upgraded El Capitan and it is working smoothly, quickly and apparently reliably.
This update has slowed down my Macbook Pro to the point where typing this is painful due to the loading circle appearing every 5 seconds and the text I have just typed not loading.
I have looked around to find ways to solve this but each way requires modifying, deleting or moving system files, which I did not pay a stupid amount of money for this computer, to do!
Kernel_Task is using over 200% of my CPU....
I use this computer for work, so, as you can imagine, I am less than pleased.
Can someone give me a link to re-install Yosemite?
I had no issues using that whatsoever.

row.Title: Ok Overall, Except video is awful

row.Sentences: The update generally does not make itself noticed, so if there are improvements, they must be mostly behind the scenesHOWEVER!
One terrible change has been the video playback in any player looks horrible now for some reason.
It looks incredibly pixelated.
I have compared old films I've watched before without problems, new films, and different players (MPlayerX, VLC, Quick Time, DVDPlayer) - none of them work.
Please fix this, it is unbearable and a huge error!
This upgrade slows down my Mac.
I have to wait longer time for opening almost EVERY app (on a mid 2014 MB Air, 4gb memory) Now I am trying to uninstall it.
Very regret for upgrade.
As I was on 10.10 already, I thought I'd just let the App store install El Cap.
It all went quite quickly, the setup wasn't tortuous.
Then I started Mail.
How does that happen?
Apple, you mustn't let stuff like this occur, it puts people off.
Tried "import mailboxes' from the File menu; can't see ~/Library, even after setting Finder defaults at the command line, so can't select my "old' mailboxes.
Now trying a clean install with Migration Assistant.

row.Title: Now Microsoft has solved it DO NOT UPDATE IF YOU NEED TO USE OUTLOOK

row.Sentences: They have now solved the problem and it is all working as it should be!
Until Apple and Microsoft release a fix do not update!
#NAME?
Dell don't appear to be in any tearing hurry to produce a driver that's compatible with El Capitan.
Apple told me it could be a couple of days before Dell release a compatible driver, Dell themselves told me it could be a couple of months.
I was going to give it 4 stars, but the issue isn't Apple's fault, so I'll give it the 5.
I'm a hobbyist programmer too, and everything seems to be going OK there (Xcode).
Sometimes a bit slow, other times no problem, but the same was true with Yosemite.
Wow wow wow.
So much big talk about this wonderful update have you no shame?
I dont even know where to begin.
My most used plugins in logic x don't work in my studio and as you can see this is bad for business for me, postponing work with clients all because of a dodgy update directly from the source.
Along with a bright pretty spinning rainbow while the whole system crashes, And I have no backup of my previous system with recent work from the past few weeks with I can't lose!
Please come with and update to fix all this no more nicey promoted software that you haven't fully put the time into FULLY testing people are trying to do good things in life FIX IT!
MacBook Pro (13-inch, Mid 2012)Processor:2.9 GHz Intel Core i7Memory: 8 GB 1600 MHz DDR3Hard Drive: SSD 256GBEnough said?

row.Title: broke my computer
row.Topic: Backup, Download, El_Capitan, Installation, N/A, Update

row.Sentences: I have never written a review on the App Store before but I thought it worth alerting people in this case.
I have never had any software upgrade problems in the past.
I have (or rather had) a mid-2011 iMac in perfect condition, which was running OSX 10.9.5 (Mavericks).
I had read that El Capitan was proving good for speed especially for computers a few years old, so decided to upgrade.
It seemed to download fine but when I ran it, it crashed when about 80% complete and spooled out an error message.
I tried downloading again, same thing.
So I tried a system restore from my Time Machine back up disk.
So now the HD has been deleted.
I have tried reinstalling a fresh Mavericks OS from an external drive, but it doesn't recognize it.
I have even tried installing from on old Snow Leopard disk.
I now have a blank computer with no operating system.
Thanks El Capitan!
At least I have my files backed up.
But I would really think hard about whether updating your OS is worth the risk.
I'm using my MAC for graphic designing and my apps are working as cool as they used to.
Not a big difference from its ancestor - maybe a little bit faster and smoother!
The only cool thing I've ever noticed is the new feature: Split View which some times comes very handy espescially for me working with different apps at a same time.
This completely killed my macbook.
I thought it would be like every other Macbook update I've had before and downloaded it straight away, expecting my mid-2013 Macbook Air to restart as new.
But after downloading and setting up, it went to a black screen with white apple logo and the progress bar never got to the end.
After two hours on the phone to Apple support I've managed to get the progress bar to the end but then my Macbook Air won't switch on.
The only screen I can now get working is the recovery screen on start up.
I've tried everything I can think of and eventually gave up on getting into my documents on the computer, wiped it and restarted but I still can't get it to log on.
CREATE A BACK UP BEFORE YOU TRY THIS UPGRADE.
Can't stress it enough - I was in a rush and didn't and now everything's gone.
