Have to wait a week to get it booked in with the Apple store to try and fix it.
I have updated to El Capitan on my iMac and Macbook Air and I must say the difference I have noticed is more on the Air and not so much the iMac.
The startup and shutdown on the Air is now much quicker and the overall performance is better.
Unfortunately the iMac does show the same performance improvements.
Is showing as available on my Mac and to up-date but showed an error when i tried to download and even though I have log off, re-boted it wont allow me to download.... very frustrating.....
I don't normally write reviews but I have been thoroughly impressed with the improvement in speed on my 2011 Macbook Air and my 2011 iMac.
Both are booting faster and applications seem to open faster.
Some reports suggest it has slowed down their machines but for me it is the contrary.
Everytime I close my MacBook and then open it again, I have to reset the internet connection on my laptop.
Bugs I have found so far:Finder:1) Windows fail to load folder contents.2) Window scrolls to the very bottom and you have to drag the window down from the top to re-set the view.
Notes:1) No option to sort Notes by Name (can only sort by most recently edited)Pages:1) All of my pages documents have been re-formatted to Bold Text (very annoying)
Yosemite had all of the right ideas but it was a little too buggy for me.
El Capitan is the polished article.
There isnt anything revolutionary here, just a solid operating system that works well.
If like me you have an iPhone, having a Mac is just the perfect experience.
Everything is so seamless between the two devices straight from the box.
Whatever you're working on or reading on your phone, can appear on your screen on your Mac instantly, exactly where you left off.
For me if you have an iPhone or iPad, having a Mac with El Capitan is just an enjoyable computing relationship experience.

row.Title: Had to reload as it caused my system to no longer boot.

row.Sentences: I had to back up and using disk utility recover.
Ive had this system since 2009 and this is the first os to do this.
Update with caution and keep a backup.
Since installing El Capitan my Mackeeper cannot dispose of 750Meg of junk languages as the OS X wont allow it, Help!
I dont need this wasted space on my system
I have been reluctant to update, because of problems in the past.
The install was seamless and all of my programs and mail seem happy.
Not really notice that much change, split screen only works with select programs which was very disappointing.
The warning signs might be on their way, my iMac is just crashed and switched itself off.
My advice would be to hold off and wait for the updates.

At last my mac is fast and responsive again, Yosomite seemed to slow it down, but El Capitan has bought it back to better than I first purchaced my mac in 2013, Well Done Apple People, a well worthwhile wait to get this.
Vey Happy
Mavericks (and previous OSs) was horribly ugly, in my opinion.
Childish skeumorphism, stupid effects, and generally dated designs plagued the system.
When Yosemite was announced, I was excited to see how it would turn out.
The new icons were much improved, resembling their stylish iOS 7 counterparts, but also retaining the character of OS X.
However, the decision to use Helvetica Neue was not a good one, and many parts of the system were slow or annoying, especially Mission Control.
El Capitan fixes every issue I had with Yosemite, and adds a few useful new features too.
San Francisco is a brilliant font, and the fact it matches iOS, watchOS, and tvOS really creates a great continuity.
Thanks to Metal, the system is silky smooth (as it should be), and Mission Control works perfectly.
Notes' new features are great, as I've always preferred it to Evernote's subscription model.
New trackpad swiping functions in apps like Mail and Messages are handy, and the new Safari is finally a complete browser - blisteringly fast, full-featured, and with native content blocking.
Even system apps like Disk Utility have had a lick of paint and are much more intuitively laid out, making it much easier to see what's going on.
While a few more icons in the system have been remade, like the beachball, a lot of the system icons - like discs and utility apps - retain their legacy design.
It'd be great if every icon could have a modern redesign, like in iOS 7.
Overall, El Capitan is everything Yosemite should've been, and I couldn't be happier with it.
OS looks a bit nicer with better font and notes is an improvement.
But constant crashes make me wish I had Yosemite back.
The OS also feels a little bit more sluggish making it extremly frustrating to use
Made outlook unusable with constant crashing, crashed makerbot software,imail accounts didnt work and various other lags and hiccups.
rolled back toy yosemite.

row.Title: Shoddy - Lost all my e-mail folders

row.Sentences: Following upgrade I lost all my e-mail folders, managed to get GMail back following forum search but struggling get my BT Mail folders back where I keep all my important stuff.
This is very shoddy Apple and not happy!!
I have to say I was a little concerned when I read of people having trouble with the update, so I was extreemly please that my download and installation went without a hitch.
Everything works brilliantly and the "mouse wiggle" is a godsend.
Thanks Apple, on the button again.
Don't upgrade unless you have backed up your computer or don't mind losing all your emails !
Like a fool I didn't back up before upgrading and now can't get mail to recognise my email accounts and woerse still have lost all of my emails.
I have tried re adding some of the acocunts but even that hasn't worked.
I can't see much of a difference to be honest other than the upgrade in Notes.
Wish I hadn't bothered upgrading and cant see an easy way to come back to Yosemite without losing everything.

row.Title: Finder doesn't consistently connect to NAS devices
row.Topic: Airdrop, Compatibility, El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Support

row.Sentences: There seems to be an issue with connecting to and keeping a connection to NAS devices.

I have no problems with Os X Yosemite, but El Capitan can "see' the devices, but "Has a problem connecting'; if it does make a connection, the second time I open Finder to browse the device, it fails to connect, so I suspect something is hogging the connection.
Currently my workaround is to restart the Mac each time.
Another problem just disovered - AirDrop doesn't work either between my two Macs sitting less than a metre apart.
The one running OS X Yosemite (ie not yet upgraded) cannot "see' my Mac running El Capitan.
Another problem discovered - Finder can't connect to my NAS device, reporting "There was a problem connecting to the server "WDMyCloud'.
The server may not exist.....".
This can't be true, because Time Machine is currently backing up to this device, and tha's not got a problem connecting.
Also, the button in Finder with the caption "connect as ...." doesn't do anything; I expect it to prompt for a username and password, but it doesn't.
In an attempt to get Apple to address these issues, I tried Apple support, but they want 25.00 for a support call for me to register my dissappointment with their non-working software.
Definitely not happy with that.
Anybody any idea what to do?
When i download the new OS it will not start as it says that the installer is damaged.
It does not give me any options to repair or replace the damaged item and therefore i cannot do anything with it.
This is the first time that an update has caused issues but it didn't work ....
The machine would not boot up .
Now I've had to go into recovery mode and re download El Capitan and try again ~ Still might not work causing hours of grief !
I should have waited a few months to allow all the bugs to be sorted ~ BEST AVOID The Capitan I'd have him Court Martialed very poor work.....
Moved from Mavericks, significant speed up.
Especially Safari which is much faster and seems to improve memory usage which has been an issue for a decade.
The best OS evolves further!

row.Title: Seems fine so far...
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, Mail, N/A, Performance, Safari

row.Sentences: I held off upgrading to Yosemite from Mavericks as I'd heard a few horror stories, though most people I knew using it had no issues, but decided to take the plunge with El Capitan, and so far so good.
From the beginning of the download to getting Plex Connect back up and running through my Apple TV (for example) it took about 90 minutes.

It was a little worrying at times, as the "remaining time" during install didn't seem to be going down, only for it to drop several minutes in one hit (I didn't sit and watch it like, I did some hoovering and popped back in from time to time).

After completion and for a short time - again worryingly - it was painfully slow, it then flashed up with a message that said "optimising your Mac, performance may be affected" or words to that effect, all seems OK now, and it does seem faster between apps, as does Safari.

It looks totally different though, which I'm not too worried about, I know a lot of people have complained about this but I was expecting it - haven't really played with any of the new features yet, but I will do.
Safari is significantly different compared to Mavericks, but I'll get used to it.
Only real issue I had was it wouldn't connect to my incoming mail server (TalkTalk) - a quick Google and I deleted the accounts and re added them and all tickety boo.
No biggie, just a minor inconvenience.
I was worried I may have problems with the printer drivers (HP wireless all in one affair), as I had issues with Maverick at the beginning, but all good.
So far so good, quite impressed to be honest, let's see how it goes.
I'm absolutely certain the wife will hate it, she's still smarting about moving on from Windows XP.
My machine is a late 2013 i5 (2.7Gghz) 21.5" iMac.
8 GB of memory.
Since updating my Macbook Pro early 2011 it has been a lot faster in opening apps and logging into it, however there seems to be a problem with iCloud sign-in.
If I go to send an email from mail via my gmail account it asks for my iCloud password every time and says there is a problem as not signed into iCloud.
When I open iCloud in system preferences it shows that I am signed in then it logs me out so I have to keep on signing back in.
Very glitchy since this update :-(
Overall I have not noticed much difference but very much appreciate the split screen ability which is extremely useful.
I have however noted one adverse reaction.
I run a Tenvis IP camera which I am now unable to monitor using both my Macbook and IMac.
It reports a failure with the "missing plug-in" so far I have not been able to fix it.
So if anyone can provide a fix your advice would be most welcome.

row.Title: great if you dont turn off your iMac

row.Sentences: Download and install with out a problen.looks and feels great split screen works like a dream!
BUT......imac will not reboot after shutdown!!
!faced with apple logo on white screen, need to command+R when startup and reinstall El crapitan.its not just me the forums are full of the same issue.
Come on apple fix this!!

row.Title: Macbook Air doesnt startup after restart

row.Sentences: Installation of Elcap went fine.
Used it for a couple of days.
Didn't really notice any differences.
Then shut down my computer one night - I do a complete shut down at least once a week.
Turned it on the following morning and put in my password and the screen just stuck on the login grey screen.
Restarted 20 times, same thing.
did all the usual, disk utility, reset nvram, etc.
Had to download and install Elcap again in recovery mode (I'm in Nigeria - data here is ludicrously expensive).
All working again now - until I restart - I've read several threads showing that this is a common problem for users - they cannot restart their macs.
Obviously not properly tested before release.
I will likely downgrade back to Yosemite.
This update has all but killed Skype for me.
iTunes takes a millenia to open and any app that needs to open has to go through a process of not responding at least 4 times before it actually sort of works.
Do not touch this until all the bugs are worked out - it will destroy your system.
I have had my Macbook now for just over a year and I love it.
For years I have always used Windows and didn't realise how good the interface of Macbooks are and they continuously improve.
I must admit, I somewhat get a little excited when Apple launches a new operating system as it changes the dynamics of how the Macbook is used, no matter how small it is.

I was somewhat dissapointed intially when I bought it that there wasn't a multitask feature like split screen (running on Mavericks once first purchased), which you get with windows as I somewhat took this feature for granted.
But after waiting patiently and writing to apple to ask if they would entertain such a feature, it's nice that they have listerned to the customer.
This version makes not only the system much faster but makes me able to work as I normally would do.
In fact this way of split screening is much more affective as it secures each window to the desktop, rather than it be easy to move around like Windows.
Apple I'm a little curious as to why itunes isn't compatible with split screen mode?
Or is there another trick up your sleeve which you are working on to intergrate this feature?
Take precuations of backing up files before upgrading, otherwise it they be deleted.

I'd been putting it off for months, but, when El Capitan was lauched I decided to bite the bullet and with great trepidation download the new softwareAfter reading all the reviews for Yosemite I was expecting ArmageddonWell , the download took about two hours and seemed to go OK. Everything appeared to be working great, so happy days.
The last thing I needed to do was sort my emails out, unfortunately Mail would not open.
Here we go I thought, I'd seen so many reviewsbemoaning Apple.

I felt even worse when I went on line and saw numerous reports of Email ProblemsI tried a couple of things recommended on the internet to no avail, I thought I'd give Apple a go and booked a Support Engineer to call me the next dayat 13.00 hours At 13.00 hours and 30 seconds the phone rang, Apples support engineer remotely logged on to my system and procedded to diagnose and fix the fault.
I cannot speak highly enough of their Engineer and the Apple support system.
The repair took approximately an hour, it appears to have been a corrupt mail file on my system, the engineer asked if I had any other queries which we talked through.
System now working perfectly.
Happy DaysAlthough my iMac is 5 years old the total cost of support was 00.00, (warranty was on El Capitan) and they leave the call log open for 30 days just incase.
When you download new Operating Systems to millions of computers you're going to have the odd problemWell done Apple, great support

row.Title: Hung install - now kernel panics on boot.

row.Sentences: It installed on my wife's MBA without a hitch so I just tried to install on my MBP HD (running target mode as it's Radeon GPU died which replaced the nVidia GPU laptop that died) on the MacMini3,1.
Downloaded, rebooted and had the fabled "30 minutes to complete" hanging for over an hour.
Reset the mini and now when attempting to boot the HD the kernel panics (sent to Apple).
So now I will have to spend my weekend fixing the installation back to Yosemite as the recovery HD and the other bits do not work (PRAM reset etc).
I would advise if you have anything other than the latest machines - wait for the next update or you could be face with the same joyous waste of time I seem to get from Apple nowdays.
I bought my first Mac in 2009 and replaced it with my current one last year.
Every recent OS upgrade has added new glitches and this is no different.
Aside from the screensaver which continues to work in a completely random manner (and often fails to work at all), El Capitan has introduced noticeable lag when opening programs and repeated freezes.
I was really thrilled and impressed by OSX for the first few years but now I am genuinely thinking of moving to Windows 10.
6 hours, over 6Gig, and now I can,t run some of my third party software, which I have actually paid for.
A waste of time for very little difference!
icanteventype.nospacebar,nocapslock.thankstoapple.
I have a late 2009 imac and 2014 macbook pro.
I must admit this update has been a great success especialy for my iMac.
It runs much faster boots up quicker and now shuts down properly which it didn't before, took forever!!!
Everything is much faster windows apps etc and safari is much faster, at last..... Yosemite was ok for my macbook but terrible for the iMac.
Although the only problems I did have was first time opening of my apps especially the Adobe ones but everything is ok now.
The only thing I will probably do now to make it that much better is to max my ram out.
No Root access.
No real Disk Utility or RAID anymore.
Dumbed-Down so you no longer have Control of Your machine!
Designed neither for Eldely Or for Productivity.
OSX El Cpaitan is now only a Toy, for Absolute Idiots.
Am so DISSAPOINTED with Apple.
Steve Jobs departed and Apple went with him.
The Real Apple went with him, that is.
Anyone who says El Capitan is an UPgrade, is a either poorly educated in computer science/IT; and/or quite ignorant of what El Capitan will do to their machine.
I had an Apple II in the mid 70's... S/N 0278And purchase the First Mac in 1984.
Apple's two mistakes back then....
Very Little Software.

Extremely High-priced upgrades after the Mac came out... Can you Imagine paying $1000 to upgrade a Mac from 512K of memory to 1MB of Ram memory (or was it 256 to 512K... oh well) It was Money sucking and not customer satisfaction... beginning around 1985 and onward.
Went back to Apple after frustrations with Windows.... Mountain Lion OSX was OK...
It was similar, behind scenes, to LINUX and one with an IT background still had Control of one's machine.
ELCAPITAN takes everything Away from you.
Locked up root and no digging or modifying of Your machine is allowed anymore.
BIG BROTHER wants your hands and eyes Off of what is happening deep inside Your El Capitan (Police Captain) Controlled kitchen blender.
LINUX is the Only OS left for intelligent non-sheeple to use!
My 2010 iMac was destroyed by Yosemite.
Spent most of the last year gazing at the little blue globe, always had to close Safari down on first attempt to open and restart it to get it to open, and so on.

I had resigned myself to the fact that I was going to have to make a purhcase sometime in 2016 and get a new one beleiveing my processor to be beyond running the upgrades (had already upped the RAM some time ago).
El Capitan has totally turned things around.
My iMac is now as fast as it ever was.
Everything opens in an instant and I have only had the breifest of glimpses of the blue globe's multicoloured replacement.
Thank you Apple for restoring my iMAc and my faith

row.Title: what is going on with Apple updates?

row.Sentences: Apple what has happend?
Why so many updates on all my Apple devices in such short period of time.
In particluar I use my Macbook Air for work and the lastest update has killed Outlook which is a right pain to say the least.
My company tech support have tried a number of things including a complete de-install and reinstall.
Next time please ensure updates have been tested throughly particularly with usage of Microsoft office applications as most enterprise companies use oulook.
The reason why is the outlook calendar and seeing other employees availability with ease and quickness.
By the way I'm still and Apple fan and Apple streaming music serivce is awesome

row.Title: A good update
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Office, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I stuck with Mavericks on my mid-2014 Retina Macbook Pro, having read all the hate there was on the App Store for Yosemite - don't think I've ever seen an OS from Apple receive such a pasting from so many unhappy customers.
I have had a dodgy upgrade experience once before when moving from Snow Leopard to Lion (that lasted an afternoon before my Mac was restored from a backup) and was therefore very cautious.
However, having installed El Capitan painlessly and used it for a week or so now, I am glad I did the upgrade.
The new look is fine and everything seems to be a little quicker than it was with Mavericks.
Haven't experienced any crashes, even with Office 2011.

I don't use Safari, so I can't offer any comment on improvements the update has brought to it and I have avoided Mail for several years now, so haven't had the email problems that lots of people here seem to have had either.
Postbox migrated from Mavericks to El Capitan without a problem.
I don't have an iPhone, so I can't vouch for the iOS integration features.
I'd say that on the whole, this is a good, solid release from Apple.

It has no massive wow factor as far as I'm concerned, but it has made my computer feel a bit faster than it was before, it hasn't broken anything or made anything worse and so far at least it feels as reliable as Snow Leopard used to.
Having a computer that works properly and fast are my main priorities and El Capitan seems to have met this need well.
Thank you Apple!
Not sure what is going on, but since installing, I have had nothing but crashes from all of my MS Office programs.
It has got to the point, that I just cannot use them anymore and have reverted back to mail, pages etc etc.
Ive updated all the office programs too, but they still seem to be crashing.
Of course, they may be unrealted, but it seems to be a pretty big coincidence.
At the time of writing after installing El Capitan, Vectorworks 2015 freezes when I try to change the layher scale and Line 6 Pod Farm now crashes my MacBook Pro when I open the application.
Hope these issues are addressed soon!

downloads from apple have gone perfectly this year, I downloaded iOS 9 and el capitan, usually I have to wait a day or two for downloads to cool down so I can get half decent download speeds, but this time I set it to download the second both were available and I have my upgrades quickly and smoothly.the only reason I give 4 stars is because of my last two updates (Yosemite, el capitan) I get constant Java error messages and I had to fix myself, was a quick update but still annoying enough to give 4 instead of 5 stars.
Boots fast on my mid 2013 macbook pro on a 512gb ssd and bootcamp works perfectly

row.Title: Not much difference, what's the hype?.

row.Sentences: I really hate writing this review and I am hoping my opinion changes overtime.

People have been working hard to release this version of OSX,I am not trying to void anyones personal efforts and hard work - The new features are mainly focused on APPLE apps and the interfaces they share with the machine and a little twick that allows you to split screen.
There are some improvments that no one sees (which looks like a marketing strategy rather than a reality), it is basically a version of OSX10.... (eleven is maybe too many, right!!
)I dont want a machine (PC) to go online or download fotos or play pretty apps.....
I have 3 ipads and 3 iphones to do that!!!
There are very few differences from the previous version guys.

row.Title: Compatibility issues
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, Feature, Installation, Mail, N/A, Safari

row.Sentences: I like the new features and I have found them useful.
However I have been disappointed with the install - took a very long time and the timer stayed on 30mins for an hour....
I understand that there is a lot of data to download but I thought it had gone wrong....
I have also found that some programs are not compatible and crash e.g.
I realise that the software providers need to make updates but this has meant that I have not been able to complete some work scheduled for this week.
I also had to rebuild by mailboxes as only a few emails were shown (a worrying time even though I have a backup).
Finder has lost some of its settings and most programs have lost 'Recent items' It is taking me a long time to sort all these problems out.
On the plus side Safari has not crashed for a while.....
Since installing El Cap, my mail has gone so unstable, it is unusable.
The screen keeps switching, every second or less, between a sent email, and other emails recd.
I now regret being an early adopter!
I have a very elderly Mac which plodded on meeting my needs but since El Capitan was installed it is really slow & there is no going back without wiping your computer completely .
So to other owners of elderly Macs, think carefully before you download it.
Memory management is crap, only start Mail app to have 24gb of ram used on that app.
Next: Xcode goes crazy with adding new tabs.
Bring back tiny thumbnails i want to see what is in the desktop please.
Anyway the memory issue is the worst, please do something as i cant work.
El Capital in highly recommended.
I made a fresh clean install and am loving all aspects of it.
I don't have any issues on a late 2014 MBP.
It is so pleasing that apple provide these updates free of charge, and now that there is a public beta program, it allows apple to flush out any bugs before the general public release.

row.Title: it doesnt slow down the laptop, but drain a lot more battery

row.Sentences: my battery used to last 6~7 hour on yosemite, now only last 3~4 hour on EL capitan with light usage.
got few new features syncs with the IOS9, and dont feel any faster or slower than yosemite, dont recommend it if you need more battery life .hope there is a way to downgrade to yosemite
After the disaster that was Yosemite, El Capitan has breathed new life into my 2013 MacBook Pro.
It's like having a new Mac.
Everything is faster and more responsive.
The UI is super smooth 60fps where Yosemite was giving me jerky 3-5fps animations when activating Mission Control.
Well done Apple, just please don't give us another Yosemite again.
Have downloaded and now can't send any emails spent 2 nights trying to fix also 2 mail boxes have disappeared and I cant find them important information in them so not good.

row.Title: all went well.
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Mail, N/A, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: and i upgraded both imac and macbook.
then after a day, all email stopped.
then gmail started ok, but yahoo not a hope.
i spent a day trying all sort of fixes, help.
nothing worked then keychain started playing up.
in the end I've had to restore from 2 days ago, which thankfully the airport worked a treat, even if it took a few hours.
So imac working on 10.10.5 and staying there.
Noticed that there was a lot of email issues posted on the web.
your call, but i wont touch El Capitan with a bargepole now.

row.Title: Cant see the problem.. Really like it
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I have now installed this update on several mac's now (2 macbook pro's 2012 & 2014, 5 iMacs ranging from 2011 to 2014) ALL have went without a hitch and comparitavely quickly.
I have observed a slight slow down on booting up on the 2012 macbook and the 2011 iMac, but nothing too great, certainly nothing near anything that would cause any "irritation".
The only problem I saw was on an iMac being upgraded (a friends) he did both his macbook and iMac one after the other.
The Macbook wasn't a problem, BUT the imac DID have a problem, but, and maybe am wrong, but just saying just in case it might help - He started upgrade process with a number of programmes open.
After the upgrade and subsequent restart he had to do a lot of password entering - all were in relation to the programs that were open when he started the process.
So maybe, just maybe it is best to make sure everything is closed down before starting.
THat said, once he went through the irritation of entering passwords and a bit of slowness, everything seems to have settled down.
The ONLY problem I have seen so far is in realtion to C-Dock 2.
It doesnt like EL Capitan.
It seems to have a problem with "rootless being enabled".
SO am going ot have to see what that is about and see if I can fix it.
But aside that - No problem.
Not tried out all the new stuff yet, but liking what am seeing so far..... well done Apple.
Smoothest upgrade I have done so far.
After updating to Yosemite and everything working perfect I didnt think anything of this update.
Not only has it made my macbook super slow (especially when shutting down) but now I cant open Ableton live if I have already had it open and closed it.
Horrendous work, maybe slow down the rate you push these things out and we wont have any problems?
we would much prefer working updates than a rushed POS.
I am running an I5 iMac with 8Gb memory and the machine is under a year old.
Upgraded (it should be downgraded) from Yosemite to El Capitan because of promises of speed increases and other small benefits.
I really wish I had not bothered.
There is no apparent increase in speed PLUS :-I lost all my historic emails filed away in folders.
I cannot send emails from my POP3 accounts (still trying to sort that one out but the account prompts in preferences have changed).
MS Office no longer works.
ADOBE Flash and Dreamweaver would not work until I upgraded to Java 6.
I am afraid to try other apps for fear of them failing as well.
If Steve Jobs was still in charge I'm sure this release wouldn't have got out the door.
It was probably released in a rush to compete with Windows 10.
It feels like polished Yosemite.
Golden master!
My Wacom drawing tablet (used with Clip Studio Paint) now responds really slowly meaning that it is difficult to draw.
Shouldn't have downloaded this update.
Upgraded my late 2012 iMac and also my mid 2012 MBP.
Both upgraded no problems and all the software I use works no problem at all.
Very pleased with the upgrade.
This wiped all my emails, all my email accounts, all my email settings, leaving me with nothing.
I aint got time for this nonsense, so I beat a hasty retreat to Time Machine and restored Yosemite, phew!
back in safe territory!.
Internet searches revealed this is a common problem with "El Capitan'.
In short, I'm happy to go with El Capitan, but come on Apple.... sort this out and then "I'll be back!"

row.Title: Pretty goodbut...
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, Mail, N/A, Speed, Support

row.Sentences: Downloaded from Appstore and all appeared fiune until I re-booted.
This left me with Apple logo and empty progress bar which did not move after an hour.
Consulted my local Mac technician and he diagnosed that there was an incompatability with a left-over part of an old Eltima SyncMate programme that had not been deleted fully.
He removed the old file and now all is well.
(I did not realise that Apple will provide telephone support on recent upgrades - I called them to report what had happened and they told me this)Same thing happened to my wife's iMac.
Now we are up and running, it does seem to be faster than Yosemite and I like the split screen for two apps.
Did notice slight changes to accounts that i iuse for Mail.
The upgrade included accounts that I do not usually use for Mail but which are still on my machiine for other reasons

row.Title: brings Life back to tiring old mac book pro

row.Sentences: This update has done wonders for my Mac, I was on the brink of taking to the apple guinss bar but just not got around to going yet.
Very very simple and easy to instal.
Left mine running over night as slow internet connection ( as per normal quite a large file to download 6GB+).

But the best thing about it is How much qicker it has made my MacBook pro mid 2012 its almost like when i first bought it new (all the old applications are all stil there they just seam to load a lot qiucker) even Safari has started to load quicker with a slow internet connetion.
Over all not much diffrent BUT DEFINITELY WORTH THE TIME UPGRADING.
Since my upgrade, outlook crashes on average every ten minutes.
Writing long emails is currently impossible.
Everything else seems fine but if you rely on outlook, you might want to wait for an update.....
Now the spinning beach ball of death looks more like a spinning beach ball!

row.Title: DANGER": It HUNG and BROKE my internal DRIVE

row.Sentences: On a late 2012 iMac (21inch) running Yosemite.... after 27 hours I figured something had gone wrong so I restarted.
It went downhill from there.
I have spent a week recovering data by booting into Ubuntu on a USB stick.
Apple Disk Utility shows the drive as greyed out, as of now, I can't even format the drive or erase it as it fails to unmount.
It *must* be the software in Apple world because Ubuntu mounts the drive, and thanks the Gods that it did otherwise I would have lost everything.
Yes, I use the cloud and have backups but the sheer frustration has made me not want to use another Apple product ever.
I have tried and failed *twice* to install El Capitan onto an external USB 2.0 drive, it just seems to hang unless it is my not waiting long enough.
This has been a very bad week and has knocked my faith in Apple considerably.
this new operating system is a big step up from yosemite, however there are a couple of anoying things though.1) you cant dual screen with xcode if the toolbar is open (which you use a lot!
)2) it takes forever to install.
mine was stuck for about 4 hours when it claimed it had 30 mins remaining.
My mac Mini (late2012 2.5G i5) did not like El Capitan from the outset.
Slow download, problematic install, slow restart, problems with bluetooth (seemed to expect a bluetooth mouse or trackpad) would never wake from sleep.
My opinion - when they named this version they missed the R out of CRAPitan.
Apple have redesigned the colourful wheel of death!
I know this because I KEEP SEEING IT.
This update has made my Final Cut sluggish and it keeps hanging on that wheel.
I have a high spec 2014 iMac.
It's also corrupted one of my external exchange accounts for Mail so I have to keep resetting it (used to work fine) and even struggles to boot sometimes.
But hey, you can swipe left to delete in Mail just like on an iPhone.
And that wheel of death sure is pretty.

row.Title: Mac Pro 5,1 will not reboot after installing El Capttan.

row.Sentences: My Mac Pro Desktop 5,1 (mid 2010) will not reboot after installing El Capitan.
Although Apple support people were great, they were unable to provide a remedy.
Had to completely erase disk and backup from external backup drive - back to Yosemite (which works fine).
Several poeple have been experiencing this problem (see blogs and Apple Support).
It looks ok, unless I miss something, three finger drag doesn't seem available anymore, nothing major though.
I also wish they hadn't blocked 3rd party apps with the new security measures, I can no longer use an app for having grid workspaces instead of linear....
I did a fresh install so everything went smoothly.
BE CAREFUL, some apps will break on this release, make sure that everything you need is compatible before upgrading..

row.Title: ruined my MBP retina *download at your own risk*

row.Sentences: got the upgrade for my MBP retina 15 from Yosemite (great OS, just a little glitchy and unpolished, hoped that El Cap would be the fix for that) once it downloaded the machine would not reboot.
Like many people on the forums having this same problem, we are disappointed that there is no fix for this.

I contacted Apple care who walked me through the steps over the phone, which proceeded to wipe my hard drive (after trying all other options, which we're useless), the support tech told me that unfortuately we had to start afresh with a clean install, but he would be confident that it would restart this time, however he had to get off the line as it would take a while.
It still does not boot, and I feel let down badly.
I have a useless (but otherwise amazing, lovely well built, superb spec) laptop which is basically a door stop.
*download at your own risk*

row.Title: The first time I've seen Apple do something terrible to OSX

row.Sentences: It really is a shame because most of this OS is just beautiful .
but for some reason, they've changed one detail of mission control - and in doing so rendered the whole thing utterly useless.
It's basically just Expose now.
You can't see your desktops unless you're in the process of moving windows from one to another.
This completetely ruines the work flow.

Now it's more a case of "enter MC, remember you can't see your desktops, move curser to top of screen (a long way on iMac 5k), then everything moves and the thumbnails don't match up with where the titles are that you aim for with the curser, so you move again, then all the thumbnails move again to centre on the screen (because when they expanded before, they expanded out from where the curser was).
Now I know how perfect it was before.
This is just the worst piece of interface design I've seen in a long, long time.

row.Title: upgrade is fine apart from resolution problems

row.Sentences: Ok the Upgrade is fine I thought i lost my e mails but they all came back ..
The only problem i can see at the moment is when my machine wakes from sleep mode the resolution is smaller i have to keep re figuring it on a reboot its goes OK jusy after sleep .
I have tried a SMC ,NVRAM and going into safe mode but not corrected it as yet

row.Title: Good but compatibility issues with office for Mac

row.Sentences: The Operating system has some nifty tricks and useful additions, for example, the cover half screen function (but still not as easy as the windows version, where you have to just drag the window to the side to size the window).
The biggest bug for me is the compatibility with office for Mac.
This worked great before now it keeps crashing.

row.Title: For every upple apdate I have a concern!

row.Sentences: I still don't know all the "new" problems related to this update (I had at least one for every one) yet but at least two I already detected!
I am no longer allowed to access both accounts I have!
Even if I quit the program I don't need to sign in again, it goes straight to one of my accounts!
I re-installed the program and the problem persists!
Also I am no longer able to print wirelessly trough the computer!
I have a Dell printer that never caused me problems before!
The MAC I did not install the "nightmare captain" is still working fine!
I do truly regret installing this.
Broke my Hearthstone and a couple of more apps.
Always have to force quit!

row.Title: OK - but deteriorated during the last day or two
row.Topic: Backup, El_Capitan, Installation, N/A, Performance, Windows

row.Sentences: Upgraded to El Capitan and all was well - faster, more stable etc.
Today, however, many of my Apps are unusable; I have to "Force Quit' Safari to use it, all of my saved cookies have disappeared and my saved Notes for the last three years have been lost.
This isn't what I expected when I bought my MacBook Pro - I really thought I was buying into a quality product/system.
At te moment my Mac is more or less unusable!!
Thank heavens I did a system back-up before upgrading.
Trouble is, I don't know how to re-install the back-up!
Does anyone have any knowledge/experience of Windows 10?
this update made my brand new mac so much more useful(macbook pro 15inch, mid2015, 2.5ghz i7, 16ram, amd r9 m370x).
as a student, i often need to write eassays which involve a lot of researching.
now this has been made so much easier with the new split screen.overall, it's great, people say there are a few bugs, but don't hesitate because IT IS SIMPLY AMAZING!!

row.Title: Nice update but a few problems to iron out

row.Sentences: As many have said this is basically a very solid update however some may wish to wait until the first point release.
There are significant problems with Microsoft Office, especially Outlook, and also with some Adobe products such as Elements recognising cameras.
Otherwise it seems slightly faster and has some welcome refinements.
I love my laptop.
I love Apple.
El Capitan works well - except ----1 - My emails were on receive but not send as server details had been wiped.

But annoying as the "triviality' of the problem was - and quickly fixed by an adviser - the frustration it caused was incredible, and unnecessary..2 - On Safari, the Preferences / Privacy 'website cookies data' were set to "allow for websites I visit' and visiting just one site I soon had 156 cookies and caches I had never heard of.
Reported it to Apple and the adviser had never come across the problem before - he looked at his own Safari/Preferences and his privacy/cookies were increasing exponentially as he spoke to me.
Have you checked your cookie settings yet?
Many applications have stopped workingWifi connectivity promblemsBattery on MBpro much worse****DO NOT UPGRADE IF YOU USE MS OFFICE!

row.Title: From Personal Experience
row.Topic: Backup, El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, Mail, N/A, Performance, Speed

row.Sentences: Ok, now my iMac is a late 2012 model with 2.7 GHz Intel Core i5, 8GB 1600 MHz DDR3 and a NVIDIA GeForce GT 640M 512MB graphics chip.
First of all I deactivated softwares and saved out files to a USB stick (I back up on a regular basis so didn't have much to save out).
Second I downloaded and installed the El Capitan upgrade from the App Store.
This process took just under an hour (my internet connection is 40MB).
Third I went through the setup of El Capitan.
I now had El Capitan installed "over" Yosemite.
Now I like a clean install so booted the iMac up in Recovery Mode and deleted the contents of my Mac HD drive and then reinstalled OSX from the internet.
The download and installation took just over half an hour.
Fourth, Again I went through the setup of El Capitan and proceeded to install software I had purchased from the app store.

(Final Cut Pro X, Compressor, Motion, Pages, Keynote, Numbers, Scrivener, Sketchbook Pro 6) and then visited other sites I had purchased software from and downloaded and installed Adobe Photoshop CC, Artrage Pro 4 and then the driver for my Wacom Intuos Pro.
A clean install with the latest versions of the programs.
All my programs function correctly.
My Calendar, Notes and Reminders are all present and correct.
I cannot comment on Mail since I access mine online.
Having said that.
I did look at the Mail App and mail from my iCloud account was still there.
I'm not a technician and I have no idea why some are having problems.
Perhaps they didn't go through the clean install process.
It takes twice as long but hey it worked for me.
I have noticed neither an increase nor decrease in my iMacs speed.
She does take a tad longer to boot up but once she's up she's up and behaves herself.
Hope this helps.
Be careful if you are using MS Occide for Mac.
Outlook crashed about 20 times in the first 24 hours of using El Capitan and from what i read there is no planned fix which means I need to force quite and re start constantly.
Are Apple hinting I should be using mac mail?
You've managed to mess up nearly everything I use on a day to day basis on my computer.

The new features are nice and they work well but now I can't use my Windows partition because the bluetooth has decided to not recognise my keyboard and trackpad, the parallels software I use won't recognise bootcamp and a lot of programs I use on mac now just don't work.

row.Title: How do you uninstall this rubbish?

row.Sentences: After downloading this latest OS my key software In Design CS6 no longer works - Undo and the fit contents to frame options don't work.
Have spent the day trying to work around the issues.
Microsoft Outlook crashes upon opening - have sent crash reports.
Overall, Adobe products aren't preforming well at all.
Has been the kind of disasterous day that makes me want to throw my Mac out of the window and dust off the old Power PC still sitting in my loft.
We have two Apple macs plus a mac Book Air & it's been a disaster on the two Macs.
They won't switch off, they have to be force switched off.
I can't use e-mails because it won't Quit when I've finished, it won't delete them either.
It keeps forgetting some passwords & I have to start logging again from scratch on some sites.
I wishI'd never downloaded the Damn thing!
I only gave it one star because I couldn't give it Zero.
Has so far crashed my photoshop, mail and word apps numerous times and cannot detect my Canon 5d unless via iphoto!
Having real issues keeping the apps open........so not a good start!
I hope for an update soon.

row.Title: Aesthetically better, but needs more testing

row.Sentences: I love my mac and have used apple for years.
However I personally haven't been a fan of any of the updates since snow leopard.
I appreciate that times have changed and the younger generation prefer the app culture, but I feel that apple are under pressure to update their software too quickly.
Having updated, my office suite (which I have to use for work and don't use by choice) lags and regurlarly crashes and my macbook is only a year old.
Hopefully there will be a new update soon that fixes these issues

row.Title: Still some catch up to do by 3rd party developers

row.Sentences: It seems there is more under this bonnet than Apple is telling us.
That's good and bad.

Because my printer drivers don't work anymore it was quite a palava to downgrade my iMac back to 10.10.. That being said my mid 2012 MBP loves it and the REALLY annoying issue with both Mavericks and Yosemite of poor Wi-Fi has completely gone since the Capitan GM download.
So I would advise that you check for drivers on the website of your critical 3rd party suppliers and if OK get El Capitan - if not wait awhile, Capitan is not going away and will only improve.
i download the update and itwont go on my computer.
i have the space and i have been on forums which i have tried and nothing happens

Very slick, much improved and can see the permormance benefits already only issue i have is with "photos" if you in oirt too much at a time is says unable to read photos after a reboot clears the error and can continue to import photos that it said it couldn't , looks like bug somewhere.
My 4 months old MacBook Pro is working much faster then before !

row.Title: A must Download if you have Yosemite

row.Sentences: The update has made my computer useable again.
Yosemite had so many bugs and clitches that i would not turn my computer on for weeks at the time.
This OS is what yosemite should have been.
Photos are working like it should, Itunes is working very fast and the whole feel of the computer is fast and stable.
This OS has given me faith in the imac again.
If your business depends on email don't download this.
Sort it out Apple!!!!!!
All the developers commented on this during Beta but you still released it.
I updated from Yosemite with the first El Capitan release, following a reboot my machine would not get past the login progress bar.
To fix this I had to wipe my mac and do a clean install of El Capitan.
This would then boot fine, however, El Capitan would not recognise my WD external HD so I could not restore my docs etc.
from Time Machine.
As a result had to do another clean install back to Yosemite, upon which my external HD was recognised and I had to wait another 15 hours for that process to complete (I have a 1TB HD in my mac).
24 hours later I was right back where I started!
Be wary of updating until the first 10.11.

row.Title: Many difficulties - wait until the full upgrade
row.Topic: Compatibility, Download, El_Capitan, N/A, Speed, Windows

row.Sentences: My Mac is ten months old and I love /ed it.
El Capitan seemed a great idea.
I down-loaded what was billed as a utilities package.
Unfortunately El CApitan is much more than that.
A number of apps run much slower than they did before and some apps now take much longer to open.
I use Windows at work and MAC at home and for the first time, I prefer to use Windows - hence my extreme sadness with Apple.
Another more serious issue is that El Capitan is not a "utilities package" as it was termed in teh app store but rather an operating system upgrade.
I have found that a number of apps (inclusing Juno Pulse - which I use for work) simply do not work with El Capitan and there will not be an update until there is a full OS update from Apple.
So, to sum up: many apps not working as well as they did before.
Difficulties with EL Capitan not worth the benefits.
Also - Apple should have been much more specific when El Capitan appeared in the App Store with regards utilities / OS upgrade.

row.Title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD IF USING OFFICE

row.Sentences: I am absolutely furious.
After updating to El Capitan I started losing hours of work, auto recovery function somehow not working, and not even being able to even open Outlook to check emails.
Apple, Microsoft - sort it out!
You have cost me hours of my time trying to sort this out - and on top of that my boss is thinking of giving me a PC to use instead.
This is the first IOS update that has not only run smoothly with my 2011 Macbook Pro but has actually improved its performance, speeding up almost every aspect without glitches.
If you have an older Macbook and are worried about installing this, you really shouldn't have any problems.
It's good to see Apple providing software that's compatible with older models; in the past I've been irrrated by the company's implicit assumption that we all have money to spend on the new.

row.Title: Micorosft Outlook users beware - not yet compatible

row.Sentences: Hopefully this is early doors, but any users of Microsoft Outlook for Mac 2011 (I know it is a fairly old version) will find the application fubar'd.
It opens, then after about 30 seconds hangs and becomes totally unresponsive.
This is a right royal PITA as I am a small business user, I need access to those existing emails within my installed application .... and to be able to actually send/receive mail.
No doubt this is a Microsoft issue - either way, be warned don't add El Capitan if you use that version of Outlook.
wish i hadn't bothered.
no discernible improvement in features, and my nearly new imac now takes about twice as long to boot up.
programme performance is noticeably slower.
Gimp is also much more unstable following the update, and that is a programme that i rely on.

row.Title: OK but some issues.
row.Topic: Mail, N/A, Performance, Speed, Spotlight, Support

row.Sentences: The good news:it loaded without a hitch but it did take about two hours.
Bad news: the new mail application is buggy.
First it lost most of my e-mail accounts and then refused to reinstate some of the Yahoo!
Then it doesn't show all of the accounts in the same way it used to.
The OS is very slow to load with lots of disk activity.
I suspect this is the Spotlight function indexing the whole of all the attached disks.
(I've always found Spotlight to be pretty useless and had hoped that it would be better.
Perhaps it may be once I've cracked how to use the new interface.
)As for the rest, to be honest, I haven't noticed any difference, which I take as a good thing.
Unlike a rival product that my firends have, I haven't had to engage any specialist support to make it work.
PS I found solution to the mail issue deep in the settings of Mail.
It defaults to the wrong port for the outgoing mail server.
Change to the correct port, enable password authentication, add the password and it's fixed.
Not at all easy or obvious though.
(Use Apple's mail settings lookup web site to get the right settings.)
I downloaded OS X El Capitan using App store and started the installation.
I understood it had stuck for 30 minutes in signing into iCloud.
I had to force the system to shutdown.
When I restarted my Macbook, it freezed the white background+apple logo page without any progress.
The cooling fan started working very hard and the laptop got very hot.
This situation remained for about an hour.
I force the system to shutdown since I was worried my laptop would burn.
Finally, I understood the installation had a bug and I had to restore my laptop to about 2 months earlier which I had a backup.
I lost all my current information on my laptop (my current projects) and a massive amount of time wasted.
I am really disappointed.
I wonder why the installation can't be reverted and our only choice to revert is to have a backup in the time machine.
Be aware my friends in your installation since I have lost a lot of time and important information.
Thanks,MSA
Really hacked off that the El Capitan upgrade left me with no mail.
When I reset up my accounts I didn't get back my mail history.
what exactly is the point of downloading a new system if that looses you iPhoto and you'll have to do a whole complicated erase and re-install to get it back??
Not sure what it's done but it has reduced my OS X experience to utter misery.
Random slowdowns, CPU and memory usage appear fine, but I am getting nothing out of this.
Clearly not tested on enough macs because this "upgrade' should never have seen the light of day.
I have been through every iteration of OSX and this is a complete bungle.
None of my browsers seem to work properly.
It's like the network stack is in total meltdown.

row.Title: Good start but a few issues to be aware of for some users
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I didn't mind Yosemite, it was stable and worked well from the first version, at least for me.
So when I knew that it's replacement built on that I couldn't wait to download and install it on my compatible systems.
It's on my iMac, but will not be going on my MacBook Pro for a while yet as there are some issues with certain applications.

If you do music and use Propellerheads Reason, no version below 8.3.1 currently work, the installer for the security key says it needs to re-install (Ok, this happened with the upgrade to Yosemite), however the installation fails and Reason quits.
Tried manually re-installing the system, still fails.
Thankfully I have additional systems where Reason runs fine, but as I now have a machine down for music production, I'm not overly pleased.
That's not entirely El-Capitan's fault, Reason 8.3 also failed, but 8.3.1 was released but it does mean either going back to Yoshemite or paying 120 to use my machines with a free OS upgrade!
If you have any software that relies on authorisation software, check first before upgrading, just in case!

My professional sound card system that has been with me since my mobile recording days no longer works in El-Caoitan, but to be fair support for that card in OS X from the manufacturer stopped at 10.7, so I can't really complain too much in regards to that, but does mean El-Capitan will not be staying on my machine for long, and the other one will never get it.
Looks like it's Yoshemite all the way for me then.
As for the OS itself, other than an annoying issue with the app store that will remembver any other account than the one I wish to use, my first 24 hours with El-Capitan have been pretty good.
After a sluggish slow startup, the system optimised itself and now hums along nicely and even on my 2008 iMac, there is a noticable improvement in responce times.
I've checked pretty much everything I can and apart from Reason, everythign seems to be running just fine.
Assuming you have no apps that will be crippled by this update, I really can't see any reason not to update.
Well did the upgrade went to lose mail.
All my fiolders that store emails are gone plus all the passwords fopr all acounts are longer stored so have lost over 16000 stored emails not happy

row.Title: Battery level indicator missing for keyboard

row.Sentences: As of yet I have not used this new system much but as the title states the battery level indicator is missing from keyboard within system preferences, you click keyboard and at the botton like the mouse it tells you how much battery life you have before new batteries or re-charge is required.
May not be much of an issue but it is missing, I am sure we can find more bugs as we look apple maybe you are already writing a new update for the system bugs ?.

row.Title: Lost all of my mailboxes and calendars

row.Sentences: Supposedly a simple and straightforward upgrade.
I have never lost mailboxes and calendars in any previous upgrade but I certainly have done so this time.
Unless you want to spend a few hours sorting this out, I would suggest not upgrading.
Of course, you might not have this problem but why take the risk for modest benefits?

row.Title: Is Apple turning in to Microsoft?

row.Sentences: My once fast Mac has not turned in to a sluggish monster.
I got used to this from my windows machines, they'd run great for a few year and then just update themselves to death.
This has now happend to my Mac, after this update my machine is running like a pig.
I suppose its Apples way of hinting they want another 1000 off me.
No thanks, If im going to get this kind of service I'd rather it from a new 300 PC.
Planned obselesance?
Installed the update on my Mac Pro and appears to be working faster and more refined however, be warned that this upgrade is not compatible with Office for Mac.
Since the upgrade, Outlook doesn't work at all.
Read up on the reviews online and until microsoft/apple resolve it, I wouldn't recommend it.
Haven't upgraded my iMac due to this issue and will wait.
I was one of those who skipped Yosemite in it's entirity after hearing about all the issues people had with it.
I hung onto mavericks for dear life, even before updating to El Capitan I even created a time machine back up and I dont even use time machine!
!....ever, but such was my fear of updating I made a special exception by my apprehensive was misguided.
It is the best updte they could have provided it's quick, it's fast, it's snappy a very very impressive update.
It just wroks!
a massive improvement on my MacBook Pro Retina 512GB, 16GB RAM, Intel Core i7 faultless performance.
This update has ruined my 2 week old macbook pro.
It was excellent when first bought now everything runs slow, even apples own applications.
I would not reccomend this update if you value your macbook.

row.Title: Slows the apps I use, adds very little.

row.Sentences: It's still the most intuitive operating system out there but this feels more like a patch than a true evolution.
Games do run nicer but the important stuff, the third-party productivity apps, all run slower for me.
The tweeks seem to be to make stuff you do on your desktop feel simlar to the workflows and UI on iPhone or iPad.
So if the aim was to make all the most powerful devices conform to the lowest spec devices it's a win.
OSX is still great to use but the changes to the OS have consistently taken OSX away from being the best graphics and music tool on the market to a really big ipad.

I still can't recommend Mac as an educational machine after garagebands' podcasting was removed (it was superb for evaluations, discussions and recording tutorials in any subject) and the powerful iLife apps became too toy-like.
installed el capitan now i cant shut down my mac and my email keeps asking for my passwords, nightmare

row.Title: May as well go back to a PC
row.Topic: El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Performance, Speed, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I've used PC's forever until a couple of years ago when my friends convinced me to get a Mac.
For the past year and a half it worked like a dream, everything my Apple fan friends had said it would, until I downloaded OS X Yosemite and overnight it went downhill.
It used to take 10 seconds to start up, and after downloading Yosemite it took well over a minute.
Now with El Captain it takes nearly two minutes.
All my programmes are constantly crashing to the point where I have to save everything after 2 minutes.
Mail never connects anymore.
It is so slow when it's running I may as well go back to a PC, pay half the price and get the same rubbish slow quality.

this killed office 2016 which was working beautifully.. since jobs died the number of untested updates seems to have grown massively.. apple is the new microsoft.. windows is more stable these days and you dont pay a premium for the tech or the pleasure!

row.Title: Finally! Thank you!
row.Topic: Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: I left a scathing review of 10.10 Yosemite after my experiences of it.
I went back to Mavericks, I came back to Yosemite because I wanted to give iWork a try and it wasn't compatible with Mavericks.
I was quite excited for this update.
Installation was brisk as usual.
Everything was where I left it when I came to my desktop.
I decided to turn all of the visual effects back on, and there was no difference in performance at all.
Everything was still as snappy as it was on 10.10.5 without the transparency.
The new features in Spotlight are really nice; It's nice to not have to go to Weather Channel to get local weather, so thank you.
All of my applications work flawlessly, they mostly adhere to the visual guidelines of El Capitan, apart from MS Office 2011 that was obviously designed for older versions.
That's not your fault, that's a developer issue and I think they've sorted that out in the latest one.
You listened to your customers.
Easy installation over the top of Yosemite.
No user intervention needed, and no software errors or incompatibilities discovered.
Rock solid, good features and most of all...... very, very fast!
My 2012 MacBook Pro now runs better than ever.

row.Title: Fine, unless you use MS Outlook for a your preferred email client...

row.Sentences: Updated a MacBook Pro Retina (2012) and to be honest I'm not noticing the speed increases others have noted.
I am however regretting upgrading because I have lost the facility to use Outlook 2011 as my preferred email client.
Everytime I open Outlook now it hangs - all new and updated spinning ball along with an 'Microsoft Outlook Not Responding' message.

I know this is not necessarily Apple's fault, and if there had been a significant change for the better to Apple Mail, I may not mind so much, but for the time being I haven't found the bells and whistles others have and the loss of my preferred email application makes my decision to upgrade regrettable.
I don't want to use the flawed product that is Photos (what a stupid name for an application).
iPhoto worked just fine on Yosemite but now on El Capitan it's buggy and crashes constantly.
I knew I should have waited to update!
Got a Mid 2010 MBP which was ok before but now it's slowed down with this update.
I'm getting more spinning wheels of doom and programmes are just slower.
I've loads of audio to edit and now my audio editor has become juttery where as before the upgrade it was fine so for that reason alone El Capitan can take a hike.
Normally I don't update OS's much at all because basically they seem to make your machine worse but I had no choice this time sadly (had to try and get into a HDD).
I'd rather go back to my older OS instead so my audio editor woud work fine again but there you go.
Time for a coffee.
El Capitan is a nightmare!!!!
Did the install and now between Apple and Microsift they've managed to making working with Office totally impossible!!!!
Between two of the Worlds largest Compaines they couldn't get the basics right!!!
And split screen?
Microsoft have had this forever!!!!
It's hardly a world changer!
Apple and Microsift...... get yourselves sorted out and get Office fixed ASAP!!!!!

row.Title: El Capitan on MacBook Pro 15 Mid 2015 with AMD GPU

row.Sentences: Tue 6 Oct 2015 - OS is more stable than Yosemite and much faster, haven't had any problems that I had with Yosemite.
Good job Apple.
Hi,I updated my main machine over the week end and have run into a bunch of problems.
That's to be expected with any major update but this one has lost the ability for me to send any emails on my personal account from Mail.
It sees the account until it comes to sending mail, then it just hangs and denies any knowledge.
Plus, I work in the audio industry and everything we use, including Logic, funnily enough, has stopped working or become unstable.
I'm sure Apple will fix it, but I do find the lack of mail support deeply annoying.
I've pulled out my "unupdated' laptop and will be forced to do mail on that for now.
Hope you can can up with a fix soon please Apple.
I've not even gotten around to trying out the wondrous new features.
I'm always keen to download the latest OSX and have never experienced any issues on my macbook pro with any other upgrades all the way back to Snow Leopard.

However after downloading El Capitan I've had problems with Mail, an entire inbox went AWOL and on Outlook for Mac 2011 where I've been able to view the much prettier looking spinning wheel of death in all it's beauty on a regular basis - Outlook is crashing/freezing at very regular intervals which when you're knee deep in urgent work, isn't so clever.
Surely these business critical mail clients would have been tested before release, right?

since updating to el capitan my notebook has become sooooooooo slowwwwwwww, before it was perfectly fine now utter rubbish..... pages load as though on 1990's dial up - and no before all you apple geeks start shouting from the top of your basement armchairs - there is nothing wrong with my wifi speeds its same as before!
also safari menus- boring, icons - boring........just a bit crap

row.Title: If you're going to put out a new version - check it for glitches first!!!!!

row.Sentences: So it does have some new funky features but.
It crashes constantly!
It freezes, Mail quits every other second.
Really - it's very very very annoying!!
Surely this needs sorting before it's put out for public consumption.
So many rave reviews - but so many friends saying they have the same problems as me....are you editing reviews as well as putting out half baked new versions Apple?

row.Title: Pretty buggy - has slowed down a number of applications

row.Sentences: I'm curently about to revert back to Yosemite.
General computer useage seems faster, however loads of applications have become slower.
It hangs quite often with applications like photoshop, lightroom, etc.
It also seems to be affecting some of my external hard drives.
Its just not ready for the public yet.
Give it a couple of weeks.

row.Title: Oh dear.why didn't I just stick with Yosemite? Update
row.Topic: Backup, El_Capitan, Mail, N/A, Outlook, Performance, Update, Yosemite

row.Sentences: UPDATE - I read all the blogs and helpful MacWorld tutorials on how to remove El Capitan, build a Yosemite drive etc etc - I haven't got time for that and possibly screw it up.
I took my MB Pro to my local Mac gurus (iDoctor4U, in Guildford) with my Time Machine drive and two hours later - all done and fixed.
I really highly recommend these guys.
Now running Yosemite again and all working fine.
I had an open ticket with Apple Support and they were helpful, but it seems MS and Apple are blaming each other for this mess and it affects Office 2016 as well apparently - MS advice?
Back install to Yosemite!!!.
Had a follow up from Apple today (in Dutch weirdly....) and I closed the ticket.

All in all, not a good experience and I won't be installing El Capitan until all these issues are resolved by whichever company is responsible for my revenue loss, hassle, worry and ultimately, no fix.
I've been a massive fan of Apple's OS upgrades since Snow Leopard and have religiously downloaded and applied these as they have been released.
Yosemite was no problem, couple of hangs but generally snag-free.

El Capitan was downloaded (2 hours on a 30Mb BT Infinity line) and 6GB+ duly installed (30 minutes) Wow I thought - not that much change in features that I would actually notice and use but overall a good look.
Then I launched my Outlook 2011 to pick up email from Office 365.
Spinning beachball which didnt go away, force quit.
`send report to Apple.
Did this multiple times, rebooted system several times, no better.
Finally downloaded some email (but not all - although it downloaded to my iPhone ok) - clicked to open - spinning beachball again.
I run my business from my laptop and it is crucial I get emails without hassle.
Word, Excel, Powerpoint all work fine so I'm guessing this is an Outlook compatibility issue with El Capitan.
This needs fixing ASAP please Apple/Microsoft.
I've always been an advocate of waiting till the next release/patch,build of s/w before installing, but Mac OSX has always been fine for me.
I will need to restore from Time Machine and redownload/reinstall Yosemite but I don't know what this involves so It'll be a trip to the Apple store guys as I need my MacBook!
People - beware installing this version until this issue is solved.
unable to download at all
I have lost all my email folders within Mail, yet the storage shows they are still on my MacBook Air.
Over 2000+ emails lost - less than happy with you Apple !
This is genuinely the first review I have written about any product, ever.
However, my frustrations with this update have caused so many problems that it would have been morally wrong not to share them.
Since the upgrade my Outlook desktop app doesn't work, it crashes the second it is opened, which means I have to use Office 365's web app, which is one of the worst applications out there.

This has completely disrupted my work day as basic functions such as searching for emails, adding attachements and working off multiple windows are now either exceptionally cumbersome, or completely impossible.
Further to this, since the upgrade (or downgrade to be more realistic) I cannot sign into iCloud.
It gives me an "unknown error" every time I try and enter my password.
This means nothing is syncing across my devices.
Further to this, the upgrade somehow unlinked my Dropbox, which meant I had to re-sync everything which took hours, and again disrupted my work day.
These are the core issues I have encountered so far, but I have no doubt there are more issues that will continue to surface as the days roll by.
My adivce, is wait before upgrading.
Apple clearly need some time to work out all the issues and bugs, and until then I wouldn't touch this upgrade barge poll.
Although, due to the problems it has given me the time to write this review, so I guess to anyone reading this, at least there is a silver lining if help make your decision.
Not even had a chance to see what are the difference between the old OS X and this one but I can't get Mail to work with more than 2 accounts....
Since iOS 9 I'm seriously thinking about getting Samsung hardware as Apple is getting worse with every update....

row.Title: WARNING if you have Office 365 DO NOT Install

row.Sentences: If you are using Office 365 on an Exchange server do NOT under any circumstances install this.
it locks up your email and makes them unusable.
The spinning wheel has been replaced with a spinning beachball (which is slightly more aesthetically pleasing!)
and it will spin forever as it rries to sync emails.
Both Microsoft & Apple are aware of this, it was highlighted 3 months ago!
and yet here is the full release along with this huge gigantic bug.
I am now having to access all my emails, contacts etc via the lumpy web version.
Pretty appalling service
The following applications started to freeze: MS Office for Mac 2016 (Outlook mainly, but also Excel), Evernote, and suprisingly Numbers too.
I am sure there will be fixes coming out, however for now it is the reality for me.
Saying this, I still appreciate the new features like windows place side by side.
Also, it seems that the OS itself is a slightly faster on my one year old Macbook Air.
Hoping to get all apps back to reliable mode by the end of October.
I downloaded the upgrade at the beginning of October.
I am using Office 2016 on a new Mac book Air and since the update all office applications crash on a regular basis.
I mean many times a day.
This is particularly annoying as before the update all office apps (word, outlook, excel etc) worked perfectly.
If you have enjoyed using Yosemite do not download this.
Microsoft office does not work with this update so the money you have spent on office has been a waste.
Once you download Apple remove Yosemite meaning you can only run microsoft if you buy new software.

row.Title: El Capitan, must have loads of Rum...

row.Sentences: I update my system to "El Capitan", since then safari is a nightmare, freeze, keep loading.. at the end always need to reset it.
Then Itunes when I sync my iPad, never finishes, it takes long hours, and still syncing, need to reset it as well.
now trying to fond the solution!!!!!
(I hope that is not like the upgrade of my iphone 4, that i needed to change the phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!
My App Store, Contacts, Safari etc icons are now blank.
Excellent introduction to El Capitan.....
Generally user-friendly, however there are several glitches and slowed down a few apps.
I have now updated my new macbook air and it seems to be working great so far.
Snow leopard has been the best so far for stability, but so far so good with el capitan.
I will be updating my imac in the next few days, as i love the split screen option, this is why i went for the 27" imac for better productivity doing uni work.
Keep up the good work apple
I have a Retina 5K and I recently updated to this operating system.
Since then my mac turns itself off randomly or it freezes and different coloured pixels turn up on the screen.
I have no idea what's going on or what to do!
this thing is eating my battery power.

MBP Retina mid 2012 2.6 GHz Intel Core i7 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M 1024 MB.... it does seem to work a bit faster than previous, which is always good... but by crikey it likes to drink the juice!

So far the update seems better than the old system, however, if you live in the UK and have lots of precious photos in iphoto DON'T UPDATE TO THIS SOFTWARE, I have now lost all of my photos that were stored on here because the app I need to download in order to access my photos isn't currently available in the UK which isn't great.

row.Title: Not perfect, but a worthy Snow Yosemite
row.Topic: Feature, Installation, N/A, Performance, Speed, Update

row.Sentences: I mean, okay, I've noticed a bit of lag when switching screens (especially using the integrated graphics) and the odd bit of disappearing text here and there in Launchpad and such, but these barely even count as teething problems compared to what I was expecting.
Installation was incredibly quick and easy and everything works as before, including Office.

Visual improvements (font, which works well on the Retina display as well as my external non-Retina display; gradient on toolbar items; Mission Control) are welcome and go a large way towards making the Mac user experience feel a little more distinctive again.
Split view also very welcome and a massive help when taking lecture notes or working on any kind of creative project.
There's definitely a speed improvement - not a massive one, but it's definitely there, and the animations (e.g.
full screen) have been tightened up to provide a snappier feel overall.
It'll be nice to get a chance to explore any developer improvements, or to find out what's coming with regards to third-party support for Metal (e.g.
Adobe apps).
Certainly can't say it's done me any harm to upgrade.
Broke my iMac and MacBook Air - can't sign into the App store on the iMac, won't even install on MacBook Air because after it downloaded my administrator access/account disappeared.
Very frustrated that the forum/Apple have no information on a fix.
On the plus side - the bits of El Capitain that do work on the iMac look useful, but it's a very high price to pay for the upgrade as I've spent the last two days trying to sort this out.
In Yosemite the FileVault disk encryption is paused and won't restart.
Can't install El Capitan with the process unfinished and there is no way to finish it.
WAY TO GO APPLE!

row.Title: MS Office users - Warning - do not upgrade - 2011 and 2016 crashes

row.Sentences: What a major disappointment.
Completely destroyed my productivity with all microsoft office applications 2011 and 2016 (which I upgraded to following).
Premature release - bad Apple !

row.Title: Safari's broken leg just got fixed.

row.Sentences: My 2011, I mac originally ran 10.6.8 and I waited until I got a decent internet service before updating to Yosimite last year.
Safari went from walking steadily to limping after Yosemite and no amount of re-configuration would help.
Just loaded el Capitanand it's now galloping.
Seems a really good program and we can now go back to bragging about how Mac's are streets ahead of Windows again.
Not impressed by the silly name though.
I have an 2009 Dell laptop running windows 10 and and a mid 2011 27" iMac now running El Capitan.
My question is, why does my 7 year old Dell work faster and better on windows 10 than my iMac, not just on El capitan but also when it was running Yosemite.
I spent a lot of money on this Mac device and I wish I had stayed with Microsoft, sorry Apple fans.
Can anyone tell me what is better about this new update as I cannot find any!!!
Click on the download button and nothing happens.
Click on the down button and it offers to share on my favourite social media.
Click on the X logo above and it briefly changes the Download button to "Get' before that disappears....any ideas?
Finally a stable OS - Quite sad actually because I would expect the earlier versions to be stable but they were BUGGY!
seriously - This El Capitan is definitely stable.
My batter life is better, my apps are more stable and load faster -The side by side window feature is great but can be improved.
Overall Apple must use this OS as the baseline and nly but improve.
First couple of days and functionality was mostly OK - with the exception of some troubles with log-in.
Three days in though and the mail is now completely unusable and crashes other programmes when its open.
It's only the mail that's the problem - but it is a big problem.
Please fix asap.

row.Title: Horrendous!! El Capitan has declared war on my mac.

row.Sentences: 2011 13inch MacBook Pro with 8GB RAM now lying upside down and twitching.
Barely able to move.
The computer takes forever to start up and then the spinning pizza accompanies every application and spins and spins and spins and spins.
Even Force Quit takes forever to begin.
And when it finally stops spinning every action sets it off again.
I've re-installed it twice.
Plus system prefences on time machine and internet accounts dont work (maybe other functions too) so cant use Mail properly anymore either nor am I certain I'll be able to restore from time machine.
Apple support offered their regrets and suggested I wipe the hard disk - but with time machine on the blink I'm worried to do that.
Some very nice new touches to this, and they work well on my 27inch Retina, so will have to investigate further.
My only whinge is.... it took six hours, thirty three minutes to download.
Apple assume that most of us have superfast broadband, I don't, mine is still operated by lame mice on a rusty trundle wheel!!

row.Title: It's What Makes a Mac a Mac!

row.Sentences: OS X El Capitan has knocked the ball well and truly out of the park.
OS X Yosemite was certainly no slouch on my (late 2014) Mac Mini but El Capitan has improved on both performance and functionality.
The installation process was painless; boot times are quicker as is app-launching.
